Select manual control for the affected outflow valve (MAN L or MAN R ON), and drive affected outflow valve fully closed.
Deselect manual control (MAN L or MAN R OFF).
If manual control is not available:
Remove outflow valve AC motor (AMM 21-31-06/401).

note.para: Caution should be taken so as not to lose AC motor shim plate.

numlitem.para: Close valve by applying torque to actuator output shaft.
Reinstall AC motor.

item.chgdesc: Adds Note in Limitations.
item.title: Automatic Cabin Pressure Controllers (A and B) – Both Inoperative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Flight is conducted in an unpressurized configuration,

Procedures are established and used to verify main deck and lower lobe cargo compartments remains empty or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits,
Extended overwater flight is prohibited, and

Crew rests, crew workstations and passenger business centers with a door and smoke detection system (except the Combi Enlarged Lav/Business Center) are empty, locked closed and placard INOPERATIVE - DO NOT ENTER.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CABIN ALT AUTO ___

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Equipment cooling may be operated in NORM or STBY.

If operation with Equipment Cooling in OVRD mode becomes necessary inflight, an unpressurized configuration yields insufficient equipment cooling. Flight time must therefore be limited to 60 minutes when in OVRD mode.
A minimum of two pack operation is required for unpressurized flight.
Flight will be unpressurized.
Flight is limited to an en route altitude of 10,000 feet with supernumeraries on board.
Main cargo deck and lower cargo holds remain empty, or contain only empty cargo handling equipment.
Flight must be within 60 minutes of a suitable landing airport.
Extended overwater flight is prohibited.

para.revision: Extended Overwater operations is a horizontal distance of more than 50 NM from the nearest shoreline.

numlitem.para: Crew rests area is empty, and secured closed.

placard.para: Placard Cabin Pressurization Controller Selector "MODE A and MODE B INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard the Upper Deck Crew Rest compartment - "COMPARTMENT INOPERATIVE - DO NOT ENTER".

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 21-31-1-2.

item.title: Cabin Pressure Control Systems (Manual L and R)

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated outflow valve is deactivated closed, and
A maximum of two packs are used throughout flight.

note.para: The carriage of animals or perishables is dependent on Pack availability or configuration.

numlitem.para: Packs 2 and 3 provide conditioned air to forward and aft lower lobe cargo compartments.
If pack 2 is not used, the aft lower lobe cargo compartment may still be heated by the aft cargo heating system.
If pack 3 is not used, the forward lower lobe cargo compartment may still be heated to a limited extent by the equipment cooling exhaust air.
A maximum of two packs are used throughout flight.
Carriage of animals and perishables in lower cargo compartments is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard MAN Outflow Valve Switch "MAN L INOP or MAN R INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 21-31-1-1.

item.chgdesc: Adds Note in Limitations.
item.title: Cabin Pressure Control Systems (Manual L and R) – Both Inoperative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Flight is conducted in an unpressurized configuration,

Procedures are established and used to verify main deck and lower lobe cargo compartments remains empty or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits,
Extended overwater flight is prohibited, and

Crew rests, crew workstations and passenger business centers with a door and smoke detection system (except the Combi Enlarged Lav/Business Center) are empty, locked closed and placarded INOPERATIVE - DO NOT ENTER.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
With supernumeraries on board, en route altitude must be limited to 10,000 feet.
Equipment cooling may be operated in NORM or STBY.

If operation with Equipment Cooling in OVRD mode becomes necessary inflight, an unpressurized configuration yields insufficient equipment cooling. Flight time must therefore be limited to 60 minutes when in OVRD mode.
A minimum of two pack operation is required for unpressurized flight.
Flight will be unpressurized.
Flight is limited to an en route altitude of 10,000 feet with supernumeraries on board.
Main cargo deck and lower cargo holds remain empty, or contain only empty cargo handling equipment.
Flight must be within 60 minutes of a suitable landing airport.
Extended overwater flight is prohibited.

para.revision: Extended Overwater operations is a horizontal distance of more than 50 NM from the nearest shoreline.

numlitem.para: Crew rests area is empty, and secured closed.

placard.para: Placard MAN Outflow Valve Switch "MAN L INOP and MAN R INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard the Upper Deck Crew Rest compartment - "COMPARTMENT INOPERATIVE - DO NOT ENTER".

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 21-31-1-2.

item.title: Forward Overboard valve (Lower 41 section) Models Without Auxiliary Fuel Tank Provisions – Deactivated Closed

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated closed provided:

numlitem.para: Procedures are established and used to verify aft lower lobe cargo compartment remains empty, or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits,

For Combi, procedures are established and used to verify main deck cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits, and
If installed, the main cabin exhaust valve(s) is deactivated closed.

note.para: Cabin Exhaust Valve(s) are not installed on UPS aircraft.
UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FWD OVBD VLV

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Aft lower cargo compartment is empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Placard "FWD OVERBOARD VALVE INOP - CLOSED" below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: FORWARD OVERBOARD VALVE (LOWER 41 SECTION) MODELS WITHOUT AUXILIARY FUEL TANK PROVISIONS

numlitem.para: Forward Overboard Valve (lower 41 Section)
Deactivate the forward overboard valve in the closed position. Valve is located on the inside of the fuselage to the left of the nose gear wheel well.
Open and collar the P6 panel FWD OVBD VLV CONT and the P180 panel FWD OVBD VALVE POWER circuit breakers.
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector DV462 from valve.
Manually position the operating lever/position indicator to the closed position.

note.para: The manual operating lever may be lockwired to the actuator mounting screws.

item.chgdesc: Adds Note in Limitations.
item.title: Forward Overboard valve (Lower 41 section) Models Without Auxiliary Fuel Tank Provisions – Deactivated Open

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated open provided:

numlitem.para: Extended overwater flight is prohibited,

Procedures are established and used to verify forward lower lobe cargo compartment remains empty, or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits,

For Freighter, procedures are established and used to verify main deck cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits, and
If installed, the main cabin exhausts valve(s) is deactivated closed.

note.para: Cabin Exhaust Valve(s) are not installed on UPS aircraft.
UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FWD OVBD VLV

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Extended overwater flight is prohibited.

para.revision: Extended Overwater operations is a horizontal distance of more than 50 NM from the nearest shoreline.

numlitem.para: Main cargo deck and lower cargo holds remain empty, or contain only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Placard "FWD OVERBOARD VALVE INOP - OPEN" below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: FORWARD OVERBOARD VALVE (LOWER 41 SECTION) MODELS WITHOUT AUXILIARY FUEL TANK PROVISIONS

numlitem.para: Forward Overboard Valve (lower 41 Section)
Deactivate the forward overboard valve in the open position. Valve is located on the inside of the fuselage to the left of the nose gear wheel well.
Open and collar the P6 panel FWD OVBD VLV CONT and the P180 panel FWD OVBD VALVE POWER circuit breakers.
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector DV462 from valve.
Manually position the operating lever/position indicator to the open position.

note.para: The manual operating lever may be lockwired to the actuator mounting screws.

item.chgdesc: Revises item to Not Applicable per MMEL.

title.revision: NOT APPLICABLE

item.chgdesc: Adds Note in Limitations.
item.title: Positive Pressure Relief Valves

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Flight is conducted in an unpressurized configuration,

Procedures are established and used to verify main deck and lower lobe cargo compartments remain empty, or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits,
Extended overwater flight is prohibited, and

Crew rests, crew workstations and passenger business centers with a door and smoke detection system (except the Combi Enlarged Lav/Business Center) are empty, locked closed and placard INOPERATIVE - DO NOT ENTER.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
___ PRESS RELIEF
PACK ___

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Equipment cooling may be operated in NORM or STBY.

If operation with Equipment Cooling in OVRD mode becomes necessary inflight, an unpressurized configuration yields insufficient equipment cooling. Flight time must therefore be limited to 60 minutes when in OVRD mode.
A minimum of two pack operation is required for unpressurized flight.
Flight will be unpressurized.
Flight is limited to an en route altitude of 10,000 feet with supernumeraries on board.
Main cargo deck and lower cargo holds remain empty, or contain only empty cargo handling equipment.
Flight must be within 60 minutes of a suitable landing airport.
Extended overwater flight is prohibited.

para.revision: Extended Overwater operations is a horizontal distance of more than 50 NM from the nearest shoreline.

numlitem.para: Crew rests area is empty, and secured closed.

placard.para: Placard Cabin Pressurization Controller Selector "POSITIVE PRESSURE RELIEF VALVE(S) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard Manual Outflow Valve Switch "MAN L and MAN R INOP".
Placard the Upper Deck Crew Rest compartment - "COMPARTMENT INOPERATIVE - DO NOT ENTER".

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure . 21-31-1-2

item.chgdesc: Adds new relief per MMEL.

title.revision: LANDING ALTITUDE (LDG ALT) SWITCH

para.revision: May be inoperative in automatic mode.
Ensure all airports Departure, Destination, Alternate and ETPs are in the FMC database. All airports must have a field elevation below 7000 ft. MSL.
Contact Flight Control.
Placard "LDG ALT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided all remaining components and functions of the pressurization system are operative.

numlitem.para: Monitor and operate the pressurization using the other available indications.

placard.para: Placard "CABIN RATE IND INOP" below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.chgdesc: Adds Note in Limitations.

numlitem.para: Flight is conducted in an unpressurized configuration,

Procedures are established and used to verify main deck and lower lobe cargo compartments remain empty, or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded ULDs), or Fly Away Kits,
Extended overwater flight is prohibited, and

Crew rests, crew workstations and passenger business centers with a door and smoke detection system (except the Combi Enlarged Lav/Business Center) are empty, locked closed and placarded INOPERATIVE - DO NOT ENTER.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Equipment cooling may be operated in NORM or STBY.

remarks.para: One primary sensor may be inoperative provided the Cabin Altitude backup Sensor (CPCS BACKUP SENS) system is operative.

placard.para: Placard "ONE CABIN ALT PRIMARY SENSOR - INOP" below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided flight remains at or below 10,000 feet MSL.

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Flight remains at or below 10,000 feet MSL.

placard.para: Placard "CABIN ALT WARNING INOP" below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Cabin Altitude Backup Sensor – (CPCS BACKUP SENS) System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided both automatic cabin pressure controllers are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CPCS BACKUP SENSE

numlitem.para: Verify status message CABIN ALT AUTO A or status message CABIN ALT AUTO B is not displayed.

placard.para: Placard "CPCS BACKUP SENS INOP" below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated.

placard.para: Install placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel "SIDE CARGO DOOR HEAT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open and Collar the P414 panel CARGO HT SIDE DOOR PWR circuit breaker.

item.title: Crew Rest Area Air Supply System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Air supply valve remains in the closed position, and
If CRA is occupied, entrance door and occupied bunk's privacy curtains must remain open.
Crew Rest Area (CRA) entry door and privacy curtains must remain open during flight.
Ensure that the CREW REST RESET switch is not depressed. To do so may cause the air supply valve to open.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to Crew rest area entry "CRA AIR SUPPLY_INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard Crew Rest Reset Switch on the supernumerary attendant panel "DO NOT PRESS RESET SWITCH".

maintenance.para: Deactivate Crew Rest Area (CRA) air supply valve closed:

numlitem.para: Press Self Test Button on any CRA smoke detector (detector's alarm horn will sound).
Observe that Air Supply CREW REST RESET switch on the supernumerary attendant panel is illuminated indicating air supply valve (Crew Rest Shutoff Valve V553) is closed.
For valve not closed, gain access to valve and manually position valve closed (AMM 21-29-02/402).
On ECS Maintenance page, verify CRA Trim Mod Valve is also in a closed position.
Open and collar P6 panel U/D CR MOD VLV circuit breaker.

item.title: Flight Crew Auxiliary heat System – (Foot and Shoulder)

remarks.para: May be inoperative OFF.

placard.para: Placard Flight Crew Auxiliary Heat system switch "AUXILIARY HEAT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Flight Deck Crew Rest Area Heat Control System

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated.

placard.para: Placard Flt Deck Crew Rest Heat Control panel "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open and collar the P415 panel FT DK CREW REST HTR circuit breaker.

item.title: Flight Deck Crew Rest Area Heat Control System – Temperature Control Functions (LOW/MED/HIGH)

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard Flt Deck Crew Rest Temperature Control Functions switch "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Select Flight Deck Temperature Control Functions switch to the "OFF" position.

item.title: Flight Deck Crew Rest Area Heat Control System – Crew Rest Bunk Heaters

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated.

placard.para: Placard Flt Deck Crew Rest Bunk Heat Control switch "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Select Flight Deck Rest Bunk Temperature Control switch to the "OFF" position.

item.title: Flight Deck Crew Rest Area Heat Control System – Crew Rest Seat Heater

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated.

placard.para: Placard Flt Deck Crew Rest Seat Heat Control switch "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Select Flight Deck Rest Seat Heat Control switch to the "OFF" position.

remarks.para: May be inoperative OFF.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CARGO HEAT FWD ___

placard.para: Install placard "FORWARD CARGO COMP HEATING SYS INOP" below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open and collar circuit breaker for inoperative heater(s):
For the Left heater, open and collar the P414 panel CARGO HTR PWR LEFT FWD circuit breaker.
For the Right heater, open and collar the P415 panel CARGO HTR PWR RIGHT FWD circuit breaker.

note.para: Status message(s) CARGO HEAT FWD L and/or CARGO HEAT FWD R may remain displayed.

item.title: Aft Cargo Heating System – Two Valve Installation

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided one valve (control or shutoff) is secured closed.

numlitem.para: Carriage of animals and perishables in associated cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to Aft Cargo Heat "INOP OFF". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Position the Temperature Control panel (P5) AFT CARGO HT switch OFF.
Advise dispatch that aft cargo compartment will be unheated.
Open and collar the P415 panel AFT CARGO HEAT PWR and the P7 panel CARGO HEAT AFT circuit breakers.

note.para: As an alternate method to deactivating circuit breakers, electrical connectors on the valves to be deactivated may be disconnected, capped, and stowed.

numlitem.para: TWO VALVE INSTALLATION: Deactivate control valve or override valve in the closed position.
Access for both valves is in right body landing gear wheel well area, inboard bulkhead. Override valve is against aft bulkhead.
Check that either the control or override valve is closed. Manually position one of the valves in the closed position using the manual operating handle on the valve position indicator.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to Aft Cargo Temp Light "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided AFT CARGO HT remains OFF.

numlitem.para: Carriage of animals and perishables in associated cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to Aft Cargo Heat switch "INOP - OFF". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Aft Cargo Compartment Heat Temperature Control – (Sidewall Switches) Two-Valve Installation

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided operative switch is selected.

placard.para: Placard "SIDEWALL AFT CARGO HEAT TEMP CTRL - INOP" below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Locate the Sidewall Switch selector(s). See following illustration:
Two valve installation: There is one Sidewall Switch selector located immediately forward of the bulk cargo door.

If low temperature Sidewall Switch is inoperative, select the high temperature position on the selector. If high temperature Sidewall Switch is inoperative, select the low temperature position on the selector.

note.para: The low temperature position on the selector will be labeled 40°F (4°C). Depending on modification status, the high temperature position will be labeled either 50°F (10°C) or 65°F (18°C).

item.title: Aft Cargo Compartment Heat Temperature Control – (Sidewall Switches) Two-Valve Installation

remarks.para: Both switches may be inoperative provided AFT CARGO HT remains OFF.

note.para: UPS Aircraft N580UP-N583UP have only one position switch 40° F installed.

numlitem.para: Carriage of animals and perishables in associated cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to Aft Cargo Heat switch "LEAVE OFF". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: On UPS Aircraft N580UP-N583UP, there is one sidewall switch selector located immediately forward of the bulk door. The low temperature sidewall switch is hard wired to the 40° F temperature position (Ref Cargolux EA 747-21-29).

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated pack is selected OFF,
Lower lobe cargo A/C FLOW RATE (if installed) remains OFF, and
Associated Pack Flow Control & Shutoff Valve is secured closed.

note.para: Lower Lobe cargo A/C Flow Rate is installed on UPS aircraft.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
PACK ___

numlitem.para: Carriage of animals and perishables in associated cargo compartment is prohibited.
Increase flight plan fuel by 0.6% due to 2 packs operating in HI FLOW Mode.

placard.para: Placard as instructed in DMP Procedure 21-51-1. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Position the associated Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK selector OFF.
Secure the affected Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve closed:
Access valve through the air conditioning equipment bay access doors.
Manually rotate crank arm on end of butterfly shaft until valve is closed.
Run screw on end of crank into hole in the casting.

Manually select HI FLOW on remaining packs and advise flight crew that HI FLOW must remain selected to ensure that these packs will operate in High Flow Mode. The associated PACK_ advisory message may be displayed.
If the affected Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve has an external maintenance canister installed containing a lockout device (a cap, a spring and a plug):

Remove the existing pack flow control and shutoff valve plug, packing, spring and filter from the inoperative Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve per AMM 21-51-13. Retain all removed parts for later storage in the canister.
Remove the perforated plug from the canister containing the lockout device (the canister is located near the end of the crank screw noted in step E. (1)).
Remove the cap and spring from inside the canister.
Install the cap and spring into the filter cavity: The small end of cap fits into the inside diameter of the spring. Ensure the cap is seated at the bottom of the filter cavity.
Apply anti-seize compound to the threads on the perforated plug obtained from the canister.
Install and tighten the perforated plug that was obtained from the canister: Tighten the plug to 60-70 pound-inches (6.78-7.90 newton-meters).
Install a lockwire on the perforated plug with the hole.
Place the removed plug, packing, spring and filter (from step E. (1)) into the canister for storage and future restoration of the Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve function.
Position the Overhead Maintenance Panel (P461) LOWER CARGO COND FLOW RATE selector to "OFF".

Placard adjacent to associated Pack selector "INOP - OFF" and PACK ___ FLOW CONTROL AND SHUTOFF VALVE INOP CLOSED". Install Placard adjacent to Lower Lobe CARGO COND AIR FLOW RATE selector on Overhead Maintenance panel (P461) INOP OFF. Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valves

remarks.para: One may be inoperative closed provided:

numlitem.para: Associated pack is selected OFF,
Lower lobe cargo A/C FLOW RATE (if installed) remains OFF, and
Associated Pack Flow Control & Shutoff Valve is secured closed.

note.para: Lower Lobe cargo A/C Flow Rate is installed on UPS aircraft.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
PACK ___

numlitem.para: Carriage of animals and perishables in associated cargo compartment is prohibited.
Increase flight plan fuel by 0.6% due to 2 packs operating in HI FLOW Mode.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated Pack selector "INOP - OFF" and ”PACK ___ FLOW CONTROL AND SHUTOFF VALVE INOP CLOSED". Install Placard adjacent to Lower Lobe CARGO COND AIR FLOW RATE selector on Overhead Maintenance panel (P461) INOP OFF. Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 21-51-1.

item.title: Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valves – Normal Flow Mode

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Valve(s) is verified to close when the associated pack is selected OFF, and
For Passenger/Combi, lower lobe cargo A/C FLOW RATE (if installed) remains LO or OFF when associated pack is Pack 3.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
PACK ___

numlitem.para: Increase flight plan fuel by 0.3% for each pack operating in the HI Flow Mode.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated Pack selector "INOP - OFF". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: If Normal Flow Mode(s) is inoperative verify Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve(s) will close when the associated pack is Selected OFF by accomplishing the following procedures:
Pressurize the pneumatic manifold.
Select ECS synoptic display.
Position the associated Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK selector ON and verify that air flow to the pack is indicated on the synoptic display.
Position the associated Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK selector OFF and verify OFF is displayed for the associated pack on the synoptic display.

item.title: Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valves High Flow Mode – Models Without Auxiliary Fuel Tank Provisions

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided two packs are operating.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
PACK ___

placard.para: Placard the HI FLOW switch "PACK - HIGH FLOW MODE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valves High Flow Mode – Models Without Auxiliary Fuel Tank Provisions

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Three packs are operating, and

Procedures are established and used to verify forward and aft lower lobe cargo compartments remain empty, or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or fly Away Kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Forward and Aft lower cargo compartment is empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Placard the HI FLOW switch "PACK - HIGH FLOW MODE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

numlitem.para: If inoperative in HI FLOW mode, increase flight plan fuel by 0.8%.

placard.para: Placard the HI FLOW switch "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated turbine bypass valve is secured open (full heat),
Associated pack overheat protective system is operative,
PACK RST Switch is operative,
Lower lobe cargo A/C FLOW RATE is not selected for the associated pack's zone, and
Lower lobe cargo A/C FLOW RATE is not selected HIGH.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
PACK ___

numlitem.para: A pack with an inoperative ACM will, under some flight conditions, have degraded temperature control. However, cabin pressurization will be operative.
When operations are conducted with a turbine bypass valve secured open:
Do not operate affected pack until airborne and TAT is +10°C or cooler. Select affected Pack Control Selector to NORM, or to A, or to B.
During descent when TAT rises above +10°C, select affected Pack Control Selector OFF.
Based on which pack is affected, the LOWER LOBE CARGO COND AIR FLOW RATE, if required, should be selected as follows:
Pack 1, select LOW FWD or LOW AFT. Conditioned air is unavailable to the Lower Lobe Cargo compartment not selected.
Pack 2, select LOW FWD. Aft Lower Lobe Cargo conditioned air is unavailable.
Pack 3, select LOW AFT. Fwd Lower Lobe Cargo conditioned air is unavailable.
Carriage of animals and perishables in associated cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the affected PACK selector "ACM INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To secure a turbine bypass valve open:
Open the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT – A and PACK TEMP CONT – B circuit breakers.
Access valve through the appropriate A/C equipment bay access door. The valve is on the right side of the related ACM in the turbine bypass line.
Remove the connector from the turbine bypass valve (TBV).
Loosen the strain relief clamp supporting the connector’s wire bundle.
Remove wire from pin 5 of the TBV connector.
Remove wire from pin 7 of the TBV connector.
Sleeve pin 5 and pin 7 wires individually per Boeing Standard Wiring Practice Manual 20-10-15 using sleeve material RT-876. Sleeve must extend a minimum of one half inch beyond end of pin.
Stow wires to bundle per Boeing Standard Wiring Practices Manual 20-10-11.
Tighten the strain relief clamp supporting the connector’s wire bundle.
Install Allen wrench in manual position shaft and rotate wrench to drive valve to open position as indicated on valve’s position indicator.
Reconnect electrical connector to TBV.
Close the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT – A and PACK TEMP CONT – B circuit breakers.
A/C Controller Part Numbers

If P/N S210U130-41 (or later) Pack Temperature Controller is installed, ensure that both Pack Discharge Temperature Sensors for the associated pack are operative. A method to ensure that both pack discharge temperature sensors are operative is to check the CMC to make sure none of the following CMC messages are present:
Status message PACK may remain displayed.

numlitem.para: To dispatch with the associated pack(s) operating, deactivate the affected Overheat switch as follows:
Position the associated Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK selector OFF.
Gain access to the affected pack through the appropriate Air Conditioning Pack Access Door located on the underside of the aircraft.
Disconnect, cap, and stow the affected electrical connector from the Pack Overheat Switch installed in the Pack Discharge Duct. Connector part numbers are:
For dispatch with the affected pack inoperative, use DMP item 21-51-1.

caution.para: IF PACK TEMPERATURE CONTROLLER P/N S210U130-41 (OR LATER) IS NOT INSTALLED, ASSOCIATED PACKS WILL NOT HAVE AUTOMATIC SHUTDOWN PROTECTION WHEN THE PACK OVERHEAT SWITCH IS INOPERATIVE. THEREFORE, DISPATCH MUST BE RESTRICTED TO ONLY ONE ASSOCIATED PACK AND IT MUST BE CONSIDERED INOPERATIVE.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the affected Compressor Discharge Overheat Switch as follows:
Position the associated Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK selector OFF.
Gain access to the affected pack through the appropriate Air Conditioning Pack Access Door located on the underside of the aircraft.
Disconnect, cap, and stow the electrical connector from the inoperative Compressor Discharge Overheat Switch installed in the Compressor Discharge Duct. Connector part numbers are:

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided the compressor overheat discharge switches are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
PACK ___

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the associated Pack switch "COMP TEMP BULB(s) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Ensure compressor discharge overheat switches are operative by accomplishing the following test:
Open PACK TEMP CONTROL A (C10217) and PACK TEMP CONTROL B (C10218) circuit breakers on the P6 Main Power Distribution Panel.
Supply electrical power.
Make sure the applicable (1, 2 or 3) PACKS selector, on the overhead panel, P5, is in the NORM position.
Make sure the EICAS message system operates normally.
Push the ECS switch on the EICAS display select panel.
Open the applicable air conditioning access doors (191A, 191H or 192A).
Disconnect the applicable electrical connector from the compressor discharge overheat switch:
– DS520 for pack 1
– DS517 for pack 2
– DS522 for pack 3
Install a jumper wire between pin 1 and pin 2 of the electrical connector.
Make sure the SYS FAULT light on the applicable PACK RST switch on the P5 panel comes on.
Remove the jumper wire from the electrical connector.
Reconnect the applicable electrical connector to the compressor discharge overheat switch:
– DS520 for pack 1
– DS517 for pack 2
– DS522 for pack 3
Make sure that the SYS FAULT light goes off when you push the PACK RST switch.
Close air conditioning access doors, push in PACK TEMP CONTROL A (C10217) and PACK TEMP CONTROL B (C10218) circuit breakers and restore aircraft back to normal configuration.
