item.title: Equipment Cooling Control System – NORM Mode

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: STBY mode is used, and
For ground operation above 105°F OAT (41°C) at least one pack is operative.
Select STBY mode.
Ensure at least one pack is operating for ground operation above 105°F OAT (41°C).

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector "NORM INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated closed provided:

numlitem.para: Equipment cooling system is operated with one fan deactivated,
Remaining fan is operative, and
For operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C) at least one pack is operating.

note.para: Forward cargo heating will not be available.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EE CLNG EXH FAN
EE CLNG SUP FAN
EE CLNG INBD EXH

numlitem.para: Ensure at least one pack is operating for operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C).
If Supply Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG SUP FAN may remain annunciated.
If Exhaust Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG EXH FAN may remain annunciated.
Carriage of animals and perishables in forward cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector "EQUIP COOLING EXH FAN INOP" or "EQUIP COOLING SUPPLY FAN INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: To deactivate the inboard exhaust valve closed, use either PROCEDURE A (with shorting plug) or PROCEDURE B (without shorting plug):

numlitem.para: PROCEDURE A (Deactivate Exhaust Fan and Close Inboard Exhaust Valve):
Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.

note.para: The shorting wire and plug in the following steps are UPS P/N 747-21-003-101, if available.

numlitem.para: Fabricate a 3 to 4 inch shorting wire from type 6A (BMS 13-60 Type 1 or BMS 13-48 Type 10) wire terminating with a P/N BACC47CN1A 24 AWG pin contact on one end and a 20 AWG pin contact on the other end, per the Standard Wiring Practices Manual.
Obtain shorting plug P/N BACC45FN14-15P and, using fabricated shorting wire, short pin numbers 5 & 6 on the shorting plug. Use the 20 AWG contact on pin 5 and the 24AWG contact on pin 6.
Gain access to inboard exhaust valve (AMM 21-58-23/401).
Disconnect electrical connector from Inboard Exhaust valve, located in the forward cargo floor at STA 560.
Install shorting plug, P/N BACC45N14-15P, with shorting wire attached on the electrical connector and stow.

note.para: The shorting wire is installed so EQUIP COOLING cautionary message and EE CLNG INBD EXH status message will not display due to the disable Inboard Exhaust Valve.

numlitem.para: Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Open and collar the P415 panel EQPT COOLING EXHAUST FAN circuit breaker.
Determine Inboard Exhaust Valve position. If not already closed, manually position valve in the closed position. (AMM 21-58-23/401)

note.para: Status message EE CLNG EXH FAN may remain annunciated.

numlitem.para: PROCEDURE B (Deactivate Supply Fan and Close Inboard Exhaust Valve):
Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Gain access to inboard exhaust valve (AMM 21-58-23/401).
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from Inboard Exhaust Valve located in the forward cargo floor area at STA 560.
Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Open and collar the P414 panel EQPT COOLING SUPPLY FAN circuit breaker.

note.para: EE Cooling System will not provided adequate equipment cooling until the Inboard Exhaust Valve is closed. EICAS caution message EQUIP COOLING will be displayed and the ground crew call horn will sound if the following step is not accomplished within 30 seconds after opening the circuit breaker in step 5 above.

numlitem.para: Determine Inboard Exhaust Valve position. If not already closed, manually position valve in the closed position. (AMM 21-58-23/401)

note.para: Status message EE CLNG SUP FAN and EE CLNG INBD EXH may remain annunciated.
Temperature gradients are to be expected during these inoperative conditions. Predicted cargo compartment temperatures (which may vary) when forward cargo heat is inoperative:

entry.para: Ground operation – steady state temperatures with A/C Packs ON

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated open provided:

numlitem.para: Equipment cooling system is operated in the NORMAL or STBY mode,
Both equipment cooling fans are operative, and

Procedures are established and used to verify main deck and forward lower lobe cargo compartment remains empty, or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EE CLNG INBD EXH

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Main deck cargo compartment and lower forward cargo compartment are empty, or contains only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector "INBD EXH VLV INOP OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: TO DEACTIVATE INBOARD EXHAUST VALVE open:
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5) EQUIP COOLING selector to STBY.
Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Gain access to inoperative inboard exhaust valve (AMM 21-58-23/401).
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from Exhaust Valve.
Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Determine Inboard Exhaust Valve position. If not already open, manually position valve in the OPEN position.

note.para: The status message EE CLNG INBD EXH may remain annunciated.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated closed provided:

numlitem.para: Procedures are established and used to verify main deck cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits, and
Lower lobe cargo A/C FLOW RATE remains OFF.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EE CLNG BYPASS

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Main deck cargo compartment is empty, or contains only empty cargo handling equipment.
Carriage of animals and perishables in associated lower cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector "EQUIP COOLING BYPASS VLV INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To deactivate Equipment Cooling Bypass Valve closed:
Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Access Bypass Valve by removing LH forward cargo sidewall lining at STA 570.
Disconnect, cap and stow electrical connector from Bypass Valve.
Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Determine Bypass Valve position. If not already closed, manually position valve in the close position.
Status message EE CLNG BYPASS V will remain displayed.
Position the Overhead Maintenance panel (P461) LOWER LOBE CARGO CON AIR FLOW RATE selector to OFF.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated closed provided:

numlitem.para: Procedures are established and used to verify main deck cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits, and
Forward lower lobe cargo Temp Selector remains above 50°F (10°C).

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EE CLNG BYPASS

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Main deck cargo compartment is empty, or contains only empty cargo handling equipment.
Carriage of animals and perishables in associated lower cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector "EQUIP COOLING BYPASS VLV INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To deactivate Equipment Cooling Bypass Valve closed:
Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Access Bypass Valve by removing LH forward cargo sidewall lining at STA 570.
Disconnect, cap and stow electrical connector from Bypass Valve.
Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Determine Bypass Valve position. If not already closed, manually position valve in the close position.
Status message EE CLNG BYPASS V will remain displayed.
Position the Overhead Maintenance panel (P461) LOWER LOBE CARGO CON AIR FLOW RATE selector to OFF.
To dispatch with Forward Lower Lobe Cargo Temp Selector remaining at a temperature of 51°F or warmer:
Select the ECS Synoptic page.
Adjust the Temperature Control panel (P5) FWD LOWER LOBE TEMP selector until the desired target temperature is displayed on the Synoptic page.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated provided:

numlitem.para: Supply fan is operative, and
For operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C) at least one pack is operating.

note.para: Forward cargo heating will not be available.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EE CLNG EXH FAN

numlitem.para: Ensure at least one pack is operative for operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C).
Carriage of animals and perishables in associated lower forward cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector "EQUIP COOLING EXH FAN INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open and collar the P415 panel EQPMT COOLING EXHAUST FAN circuit breaker.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated closed provided:

numlitem.para: Equipment cooling system is operated with one fan deactivated,
Remaining fan is operative, and
For operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C) at least one pack is operative.

note.para: Forward cargo heating will not be available.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EE CLNG SUPPLY V

numlitem.para: Ensure at least one pack is operating for operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C).
If Supply Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG SUP FAN and EE CLNG INBD EXH may remain annunciated.
If Exhaust Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG EXH FAN may remain annunciated.
Carriage of animals and perishables in associated lower forward cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector "SUPPLY VLV/INBD EXH FAN INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: TO DEACTIVATE THE INBOARD SUPPLY VALVE CLOSED, USE EITHER PROCEDURE A (DEACTIVATE EXHAUST FAN) OR PROCEDURE B (DEACTIVATE SUPPLY FAN)
PROCEDURE A (Deactivate Exhaust Fan):

numlitem.para: Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from Inboard Supply Valve, located behind the forward cargo lining at STA 580.
Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Open and collar the P415 panel EQPT COOLING EXHAUST FAN circuit breaker.

note.para: EE Cooling System will not provide adequate equipment cooling until the Inboard Supply Valve is closed. EICAS caution message EQUIP COOLING will be displayed and ground crew call horn will sound if the following step is not accomplished within 30 seconds after opening the circuit breaker in step 4 above.

numlitem.para: Determine inboard Supply Valve position. If not already closed, manually position valve in the closed position.

note.para: Status message EE CLNG EXH FAN may remain annunciated.

maintenance.para: PROCEDURE B (Deactivate Supply Fan):

numlitem.para: Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.

note.para: This open circuit breaker removes power from the Inboard Supply, Inboard Exhaust and Bypass Valves. Closed loop mode operation is not available until circuit breaker is again closed.

numlitem.para: Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from inboard Supply Valve located behind the forward cargo lining at STA 580.
Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Open and collar the P414 panel EQPT COOLING SUPPLY FAN circuit breaker.

note.para: EE Cooling System will not provide adequate equipment cooling until the Inboard Supply Valve is closed. EICAS caution message EQUIP COOLING will be displayed and the ground crew call horn will sound if the following step is not accomplished within 30 seconds after opening the circuit breaker in step 4 above.

numlitem.para: Determine Inboard Supply Valve position. If not already closed, manually position valve in the closed position.

note.para: Status message EE CLNG SUP FAN may remain annunciated.
Temperature gradients are to be expected during these inoperative conditions. Predicted cargo compartment temperatures (which may vary) when forward cargo heat is inoperative:

entry.para: Ground Operation – Steady State Temperatures with A/C Packs ON

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated provided:

numlitem.para: Exhaust fan is operative, and
For operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C) at least one pack is operative.

note.para: Forward cargo heating will not be available.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EE CLNG SUP FAN

numlitem.para: Ensure at least one pack is operating for operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C).
Carriage of animals and perishables in associated lower forward cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector "SUPPLY FAN INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open and collar the P414 panel EQPMT COOLING SUPPLY FAN circuit breaker.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated closed provided:

numlitem.para: Equipment cooling is operated in the STBY mode,
Both fans are operative, and
For operation on the ground above 105°F OAT (41°C) at least one pack is operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EE CLNG GND EXH

numlitem.para: Ensure at least one pack is operating for operation on the ground above 105°F OAT (41°C).
Equipment cooling is operated in the STBY mode.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector "GND EXH VLV INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To deactivate Ground Exhaust Valve closed with Equipment Cooling operated in STBY mode:
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5) EQUIP COOLING selector to STBY.
Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV GND circuit breaker.

note.para: The shorting wire and plug in the following steps is UPS p/n 747-21-002-101, if available.

numlitem.para: Fabricate a 3 to 4 inch shorting wire from type 6A (BMS 13-60 Type 1 or BMS 13-48 Type 10) wire terminating with a P/N BACC47CN1 (or P/N BACC47CN1S) 24 AWG pin contact on one end and a 20 AWG pin contact on the other end, per the Standard Wiring Practices Manual.
Obtain shorting plug P/N BACC45FN12-12P and, using fabricated shorting wire, short pin numbers 1 & 2 on the shorting plug. Use the 20 AWG contact on pin 1 and the 24 AWG contact on pin 2.
Disconnect electrical connector from Ground Exhaust Valve located in the forward cargo floor area at STA 550.
Install shorting plug, P/N BACC45FN12-12P, with shorting wire attached, on the electrical connector and stow.

note.para: The shorting wire is installed so EQUIP COOLING caution message and EE CLNG GND EXH status message will not display due to the disabled Ground Exhaust Valve.

numlitem.para: Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV GND circuit breaker.
Determine Ground Exhaust Valve position. If not already closed, manually position the valve in the closed position:
Insert 3/8 inch drive wrench into the ground exhaust valve manual drive collar located on aircraft skin adjacent to valve flapper door.
Push manual drive collar in approximately 3/8 inch and rotate counter-clockwise to close valve.
Ensure valve closed by visual check of flapper position.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated closed provided:

numlitem.para: Equipment cooling is operated with one fan cooling,
Remaining fan is operative, and
For operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C) at least one pack is operative.

note.para: Forward cargo heating will not be available with one fan deactivated.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EE CLNG GND EXH

numlitem.para: Ensure at least one pack is operative for operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C).
If Supply Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG SUP FAN may remain annunciated.
If Exhaust Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG EXH FAN may remain annunciated.
Carriage of animals and perishables in associated lower forward cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Install Placards adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector " GND EXH VLV INOP CLOSED" and "EXH FAN INOP or SUPPLY FAN INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To deactivate Ground Exhaust Valve closed with Supply Fan or Exhaust Fan deactivated:
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5) EQUIP COOLING selector to STBY.
Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV GND circuit breaker.

note.para: The shorting wire and plug in the following steps is UPS P/N 747-21-002-101, if available.

numlitem.para: Fabricate a 3 to 4 inch shorting wire from type 6A (BMS 13-60 Type 1 or BMS 13-48 Type 10) wire and two P/N BACC47CN-1 (or P/N BACC47CN1S) pin contacts.
Obtain shorting plug P/N BACC45FN12-12P and, using fabricated shorting wire, short pin numbers 1 & 2 on the shorting plug.
Disconnect electrical connector from Ground Exhaust Valve located in the forward cargo floor area at STA 550.
Install shorting plug, P/N BACC45FN12-12P with shorting wire attached, on the electrical connector and stow.

note.para: The shorting wire is installed so EQUIP COOLING cautionary message and EE CLNG GND EXH status message will not display due to the disabled Ground Exhaust Valve.

numlitem.para: Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV GND circuit breaker.
Open and collar the P414 panel EQPT COOLING SUPPLY FAN or the P415 panel EQPT COOLING EXHAUST FAN circuit breaker as appropriate.

note.para: Cooling system re-configures to closed-loop mode within 30 seconds.

numlitem.para: Determine Ground Exhaust Valve position. If not already closed, manually position the valve in the closed position:
Insert 3/8 inch drive wrench into the ground exhaust valve manual drive collar located on aircraft skin adjacent to valve flapper door.
Push manual drive collar in approximately 3/8 inch and rotate counter-clockwise to close valve.
Ensure valve closed by visual check of flapper position.

note.para: If Supply Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG SUP FAN may remain annunciated.
If Exhaust Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG EXH FAN may remain annunciated
Temperature gradients are to be expected during these inoperative conditions. Predicted cargo compartment temperatures (which may vary) when forward cargo heat is inoperative:

entry.para: Ground operation – steady state temperatures with A/C Packs ON

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
AFT EE FAN ___

placard.para: Placard "AFT EE FAN INOP" below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated in the port A closed position provided procedures are established and used to verify main deck cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EE 3WAY VLV

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Main deck cargo compartment is empty, or contains only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Placard "EE 3WAY VLV INOP" below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To deactivate the THREE-WAY VALVE (Port A):
Open circuit breaker EQPT COOLING INB VLV CONT (C10237), A14 on the P414 panel.
Gain access to the three-way valve by removing LH forward cargo side wall lining at STA 592.
Disconnect, cap, and stow the valve's electrical connector.
To position the valve in the Port A closed position:
Insert a No. 2 Phillips screwdriver (or equivalent) into the valve's manual override hole and rotate the valve until the indicator is midway between the Port B and Port C indicator arrows.

note.para: With Port A closed, the main deck cargo compartment must remain empty.

numlitem.para: Close the circuit breaker EQPT COOLING INB VLV CONT (C10237), A14 on the P414 panel opened in Step 1 above.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated in the Port C closed position provided two packs are operated continuously while valve is deactivated.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EE 3WAY VLV

numlitem.para: Operate two continuously. Shut down of all packs will deprive the flight instruments of cooling airflow.

placard.para: Placard "EE 3WAY VLV INOP" below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To deactivate the THREE-WAY VALVE (Port C):
Open circuit breaker EQPT COOLING INB VLV CONT (C10237), A14 on the P414 panel.
Gain access to the three-way valve by removing LH forward cargo side wall lining at STA 592.
Disconnect, cap, and stow the valve's electrical connector.
To position the valve in the Port C closed position:
Ensure two or three packs are operating before proceeding to next step.
Insert a No. 2 Phillips screwdriver (or equivalent) into the valve's manual override hole and rotate the valve until the indicator is midway between the Port A and Port B indicator arrows.
Close the circuit breaker EQPT COOLING INB VLV CONT (C10237), A14 on the P414 panel opened in Step 1 above.

item.title: Cabin Temperature Selection System – (In Upper Deck)

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard Cabin Temp selector in Upper Deck Passenger compartment "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative closed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
ZONE TEMP
Flight deck temperature remains controllable by the FLT DECK TEMP selector. Selecting AUTO W or AUTO C will control pack outlet temperature.
Upper Deck Zone, Crew Rest Zone and both Main Deck Cargo Zones receive pack outlet air at the same temperature commanded by the FLT DECK TEMP selector.

placard.para: Placard FLT DECK Selector "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: MASTER TRIM AIR VALVE (TRIM AIR PRSOV)

numlitem.para: To dispatch with Master Trim Air Valve Closed:
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5) TRIM AIR switch OFF.
Gain access to inoperative Master Trim Air Shutoff Valve (AMM 21-61-08/401).
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from the Master Trim Air Valve.
Pressurize pneumatic system using APU or ground air supply.
Select EICAS-ECS-Maintenance page via the CMC.
Position the Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK 1 selector to NORM.
Check the TRIM AIR PRESS is approximately zero. If not, the valve must be manually secured shut by closing the Manual Solenoid override. Again, ensure the TRIM AIR PRESS is approximately zero.
Remove pneumatic supply if no longer required and position the Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK 1 selector 1 OFF if no longer required.

If Pack Temperature Controller P/N S210U130-41 (or later) and Zone Temperature Controller P/N S210U130-32 (or later) are not incorporated, select ALTN on PASS TEMP selector and placard selector - AUTO INOP - USE ALTN.
Status message ZONE TEMP may remain displayed.

item.title: Master Trim Air Valve Pressure Regulating Function

remarks.para: May be inoperative or deactivated provided shutoff feature is operative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the TRIM AIR switch "PRESS REG - INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To deactivate pressure regulating function:
Lower air conditioning access panel 191 (note: panel has 58 fasteners, ref AMM 21-61-08-04). The trim air PRSOV is on the left side of the keel beam and aft of the No. 2 air conditioning pack.
Remove downstream (duct) sense line tube from tee fitting.

note.para: There are two exterior pressure sensing ports in the master trim air valve. The aft port is the downstream (duct) pressure sensing port. The forward port is the cabin pressure sensing port.

numlitem.para: Plug and secure downstream (duct) sense line tube.
Allow tee fitting to remain open. Do not cap or plug opening.
Test trim air supply valve operation as follows:
Provide electrical power.
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5) TRIM AIR switch OFF.
Pressurize pneumatic system using the APU or an external supply of pneumatic air.
Select EICAS-ECS-Maintenance page via the CMC.
Position the Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PAC 1 selector to NORM.
Check the TRIM AIR PRESS is approximately zero.
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5) TRIM AIR switch ON.
Check that TRIM AIR PRESS increases.
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5) TRIM AIR switch OFF.
Check that TRIM AIR PRESS returns to approximately zero.
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5) TRIM AIR switch is ON.
Remove pneumatic supply if no longer required and position the Temperature Control panel (P5): PACK 1 selector OFF if no longer required.
Remove electrical power if no longer required.
Secure air conditioning access panel.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided zone temperature control system is operative.

placard.para: Placard Zone Reset switch "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: Control to individual zones may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated zone trim air modulation valve(s) is secured in an appropriate position unless it is verified that associated zone operation in MAN mode is normal, and
If affected, lower lobe cargo A/C is operated in MAN mode, or A/C FLOW RATE selector remains OFF.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
ZONE TEMP

numlitem.para: Associated pack discharge temperature automatically drives to full cold when MAN mode is selected on FWD LOWER LOBE TEMP or AFT LOWER LOBE TEMP selector.
For operation with individual zone(s) temp control inoperative and trim air modulation valve(s) secured in an appropriate position:
For taxi, takeoff, climb, approach and landing, select Trim Air switch OFF.
For cruise and descent, select Trim Air switch ON. During descent, to avoid high temperature in affected Zone(s), select Trim Air switch OFF before passing through Flight Level 150.
If Manual mode is inoperative, carriage of animals or perishables in associated cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard as instructed in DMP procedure 21-61-8-1. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To confirm individual zone operative control status:

Access the CMC Other Functions page, and select SHOP FAULTS, 21 AIR CONDITIONING, and ZONE TEMP CONTROL. An inoperative Zone Temperature Controller (ZTC) will be reporting one or more of the following shop faults:
If one or both Board A faults are reported, the ZTC has lost control to one or more of zones Crew Rest (C/R), Fwd Main Deck, Aft Main Deck (Left and/or Right) and/or Fwd Lower Lobe Cargo.
If one or both Board B faults are reported, the ZTC has lost control to one or more of zones Flight Deck (F/D), Upper Deck (U/D), Fwd Lower Cargo, and/or Aft Lower Lobe Cargo.

note.para: If one or both Board C faults are report, the ZTC has lost control to one or more of the following valves, dispatch may be available under other MEL items:
Flight Deck Flow Regulating Valve
FWD Lower Lobe Cargo Flow Regulating Valve
Aft Lower Lobe Cargo Flow Regulating Valve

numlitem.para: To verify normal MAN mode operation for F/D, Fwd Main Deck, Aft Main Deck (Left and Right), Fwd Lower Lobe Cargo and/or Aft Lower Lobe Cargo zones, alternately select MAN W and MAN C on the associated ZONE TEMP Selector on the ECS Maintenance Page that the associated zone's trim air modulation valve responds as commanded:
If MAN mode is operative, placard associated Zone Temp Selector(s) on P5 panel "AUTO INOP - USE MANUAL".
If MAN mode is inoperative for F/D, Fwd Main Deck and/or Aft Main Deck zone(s), go to Step 3 below and secure associated zone's trim air modulation valve(s) in the appropriate position.
If MAN mode is inoperative for Fwd Lower Lobe Cargo and/or Aft Lower Lobe Cargo zone(s), select Cargo Cond Air Flow Rate selector OFF (P461 panel) and placard the selector "INOP - LEAVE OFF".
To secure an associated trim air modulation valve(s) in the appropriate position:
Open the P6 panel ZONE TEMP CONT AC and ZONE TEMP CONT DC circuit breakers.
Location of zone trim air modulation valve(s):

entry.para: Flight Deck: STA 1113, WL 340, LBL 14 (Above Main Deck Ceiling)
Upper Deck: STA 1109, WL 340, LBL 10 (Above Main Deck Ceiling)
Crew Rest: STA 1111, WL 340, LBL 10 (Above Main Deck Ceiling)
Fwd Main Deck: STA 1253, WL 170, RBL 94 (RH Wheel Well)
Aft Main Deck: L STA 1253, WL 170, LBL 94 (LH Wheel Well)
Aft Main Deck: R STA 1253, WL 170, RBL 87 (RH Wheel Well)

note.para: The Aft Main Deck zone is equipped with two trim air modulation valves (Left and Right). If control to only one of these valves fails, it can be secured fully closed with minimal effect on the zone’s normal temperature control.

numlitem.para: Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from affected valves.

Install an Allen wrench in the affected valve’s manual positioning shaft. Rotate the shaft until valves are in the appropriate position as determined below and shown by the valve’s position indicator. Note that, except for full open and full closed, there are no position markings on the indicators. Degree of rotation must therefore be approximation between full open and full closed – note that for each 1/4 turn of the Allen wrench, the valve will move 10%.

For the Fwd Main Deck zone, a closed (0%) valve position will result in a zone temperature that eventually stabilizes at approximately 40°F (4°C). A valve secured 40% open will result in a zone temperature that eventually stabilizes at approximately 70°F (21°C). This assumes cargo carried in the Fwd Main Deck is not heat generating. For desired intermediate temperatures between 40°F and 70°F, secure the valve at a position between 0% and 40%. For the Aft Main Deck zone, there are two trim air mod valves. Both valves secured closed with result in a zone temperature that eventually stabilizes at approximately 40°F (4°C). With one valve secured closed and the other valve secured 40% open, Aft Main Deck zone temperature will eventually stabilize at approximately 70°F (21°C). This assumes cargo carried in the Aft Main Deck is not heat generating. For desired intermediate temperatures between 40°F and 70°F, secure the valve at a position between 0% and 40%. F/D, U/D, and C/R zone(s) trim air mod valve position selection must take into consideration the fact that pack outlet air temperature is controlled to satisfy the zone needing the coldest air supply temperature. If a relatively cold zone temperature is selected for main deck or a lower lobe zone, the F/D, U/D, and C/R zone(s) trim air mod valve position should be positioned more open in their recommended range. (The opposite is true if a relatively warm zone temperature is selected for a main or lower lobe zone.)
Close the P6 panel ZONE TEMP CONT AC and ZONE TEMP CONT DC circuit breakers.
If Crew Rest and/or Upper Deck Zones are affected, placard Cabin Temperature selector (located in Upper Deck) as appropriate “CREW REST TEMP CONTROL INOP and/or UPPER DECK TEMP CONTROL INOP.”
If the FLIGHT DECK TRIM MOD VALVE is secured in an appropriate position, placard the FLY DECK TEMP selector on the Temperature Control panel (P5): "FLT DECK TEMP CONTROL INOP".
If the FORWARD MAIN DECK TRIM MOD VALVE is secured in an appropriate position, placard the FWD MAIN DECK TEMP selector on the Temperature Control panel (P5): "INOP".
If the AFT MAIN DECK TRIM MOD VALVE is secured in an appropriate position, placard the AFT MAIN DECK TEMP selector on the Temperature control panel (P5): "INOP".
Advisory message TEMP ZONE may remain displayed and the status message ZONE TEMP may remain displayed.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: TRIM AIR Switch remains OFF,
Lower lobe cargo A/C FLOW RATE selector remains OFF, and
Lower lobe cargo A/C Cabin Shutoff Valves are verified open.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
ZONE TEMP

numlitem.para: If A/C FLOW RATE selector is OFF, no temperature sensitive cargo in associated compartments.
Carriage of animals or perishables in associated lower cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard as instructed in DMP Procedure 21-61-8-2. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To dispatch with the Trim Air switch selected OFF (Master Trim Air Valve closed):
Position the Temperature Control panel (p5) TRIM AIR switch OFF and placard switch: INOP – LEAVE INOP.
If Lower Lobe Cargo Air Conditioning is not desired, position the Overhead Maintenance panel (P461) CARGO COND AIR FLOW RATE selector OFF and placard the selector: INOP – LEAVE OFF.
To verify Lower Lobe Cargo A/C Cabin Shutoff Valves are open:
Select EICAS ECS – Air Conditioning Maintenance Page.
Observe Cabin Sov POS indicates open (OP) for both LWR FWD and LWR AFT valves.
Alternately, valves may be secured in the open position using DMP Item 21-28-3-2-3 .
Advisory message TEMP ZONE may remain displayed and the status message ZONE TEMP will remain displayed.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated valve(s) is secured in an appropriate position unless it is verified that associated zone operation in MAN mode is normal.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
ZONE TEMP

numlitem.para: For operation with individual zone(s) trim air modulation valve(s) secured in an appropriate position:
For taxi, takeoff, climb, approach and landing, select Trim Air switch OFF.
For cruise and descent, select Trim Air switch ON. During descent to avoid high temperature in affected Zone(s), select Trim Air switch OFF before passing through Flight Level 150.

placard.para: Placard as instructed in DMP Procedure 21-61-9-1. Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Ensure that the Zone Temperature Controller (ZTC) is operative by performing the Chapter 21 TRIM SYSTEM Ground Test using the CMC.
If the test fails, perform the procedures below to secure affected valve(s) in the appropriate position.

If the test passes, access the CMC Other Functions page, and select SHOP FAULTS, 21 AIR CONDITIONING, and ZONE TEMP CONTROL. If Shop Faults are present, an inoperative Zone Temperature Controller (ZTC) will report one or more of the following faults:
If one or both Board A faults are reported, the ZTC has lost control to one or more of zones Crew Rest (C/R), Fwd Main Deck, Aft Main Deck (Left and/or Right) and/or Fwd Lower Lobe Cargo.
If one or both Board B faults are report, the ZTC has lost control to one or more of zones Flight Deck (F/D), Upper Deck *U/D), Fwd Lower Cargo, and/or Aft Lower Lobe Cargo.

note.para: If one or both Board C faults are report, the ZTC has lost control to one or more of the following valves, dispatch may be available under other MEL items:
Flight Deck Flow Regulating Valve
FWD Lower Lobe Cargo Flow Regulating Valve
Aft Lower Lobe Cargo Flow Regulating Valve

numlitem.para: To verify normal MAN mode operation for F/D, Fwd Main Deck, Aft Main Deck (Left & Right), Fwd Lower Lobe cargo and/or Aft Lower Lobe Cargo zones, alternately select MAN W and MAN C on the associated ZONE TEMP Selector on the ECS Maintenance Page that the associated zone’s trim air modulation valve responds as commanded:
If MAN mode is operative, placard associated Zone Temp Selector(s) (P5 panel) "AUTO INOP – USE MANUAL".
If MAN mode is inoperative for F/D, Fwd Main Deck and/or Aft Main Deck zone(s), go to Step 3 below and secure associated zone’s trim air modulation valve(s) in the appropriate position.
To secure an associated trim air modulation valve(s) in the appropriate position:
Open the P6 panel ZONE TEMP CONT AC and ZONE TEMP CONT DC circuit breakers.
Location of zone trim air modulation valve(s):

entry.para: Flight Deck: STA 1113, WL 340, LBL14 (Above Main Deck Ceiling)
Upper Deck: STA 1109, WL 340, LBL 13 (Above Main Deck Ceiling)
Crew Rest: STA 1111, WL 340, LBL 10 (Above Main Deck Ceiling)
Fwd Main Deck: STA 1253, WL 170, RBL 94 (RH Wheel Well)
Aft Main Deck: L STA 1253, WL 170, LBL 94 (LH Wheel Well)
Aft Main Deck: R STA 1253, WL 170, RBL 87 (RH Wheel Well)

note.para: The Aft Main Deck zone is equipped with two trim air modulation valves (Left and Right). If control to only one of these valves fails, it can be secured fully closed with minimal effect on the zone’s normal temperature control. Trim air modulation valves are identical and interchangeable. A zone’s temperature control with an inoperative F/D, U/D, C/R, or Fwd Main Deck trim air mod valve can be enhanced by interchanging with an operable Aft Main Deck trim air mod valve.

numlitem.para: Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from affected valves.

Install an Allen wrench in the affected valve’s manual positioning shaft. Rotate the shaft until valves are in the appropriate position as determined below and shown by the valve’s position indicator. Note that, except for full open and full closed, there are no position markings on the indicators. Degree of rotation must therefore be approximation between full open and full closed – note that for each 1/4 turn of the Allen wrench, the valve will move 10%.

For the Fwd Main Deck zone, a closed (0%) valve position will result in a zone temperature that eventually stabilizes at approximately 40°F (4°C). A valve secured 40% open will result in a zone temperature that eventually stabilizes at approximately 70°F (21°C). This assumes cargo carried in the Fwd Main Deck is not heat generating. For desired intermediate temperatures between 40°F and 70°F, secure the valve at a position between 0% and 40%. For the Aft Main Deck zone, there are two trim air mod valves. Both valves secured closed with result in a zone temperature that eventually stabilizes at approximately 40°F (4°C). With one valve secured closed and the other valve secured 40% open, Aft Main Deck zone temperature will eventually stabilize at approximately 70°F (21°C). This assumes cargo carried in the Aft Main Deck is not heat generating. For desired intermediate temperatures between 40°F and 70°F, secure the valve at a position between 0% and 40%. F/D, U/D, and C/R zone(s) trim air mod valve position selection must take into consideration the fact that pack outlet air temperature is controlled to satisfy the zone needing the coldest air supply temperature. If a relatively cold zone temperature is selected for main deck or a lower lobe zone, the F/D, U/D, and C/R zone(s) trim air mod valve position should be positioned more open in their recommended range. (The opposite is true if a relatively warm zone temperature is selected for a main or lower lobe zone.)
Close the P6 panel ZONE TEMP CONT AC and ZONE TEMP CONT DC circuit breakers.
If Crew Rest and/or Upper Deck Zones are affected, placard Cabin Temperature selector (located in Upper Deck) as appropriate "CREW REST TEMP CONTROL INOP and/or UPPER DECK TEMP CONTROL INOP".
If the FLIGHT DECK TRIM MOD VALVE is secured in an appropriate position, placard the FLT DECK TEMP selector on the Temperature Control panel (P5) "FLT DECK TEMP CONTROL INOP".
If the FORWARD MAIN DECK TRIM MOD VALVE is secured in an appropriate position, placard the FWD MAIN DECK TEMP selector on the Temperature Control panel (P5) "INOP".
If the AFT MAIN DECK TRIM MOD VALVE is secured in an appropriate position, placard the AFT MAIN DECK TEMP selector on the Temperature Control panel (P5) "INOP".
Advisory message TEMP ZONE may remain displayed and the status message ZONE TEMP may remain displayed.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided TRIM AIR Switch remains OFF.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
ZONE TEMP

numlitem.para: Flight deck temperature remains controllable by the FLT DECK TEMP selector. Selecting AUTO W or AUTO C will control pack outlet temperature.
Upper Deck Zone, Crew Rest Zone and both Main Deck Cargo Zones receive pack outlet air at the same temperature commanded by the FLT DECK TEMP selector.

placard.para: Placard associated TRIM AIR switch "LEAVE OFF". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated Zone Duct Overheat Switch(es) is deactivated, and
Associated zone trim air modulation valve is secured closed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
ZONE TEMP

numlitem.para: When a zone trim air mod valve is secured closed, that zone's temperature will be determined by the temperature of pack outlet air.

placard.para: Placard as instructed in DMP Procedure 21-61-10-1. Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: For dispatch with the associated zone trim air modulation valve(s) secured closed:

note.para: If the F/D zone overheat switch is affected, interchange the inoperative F/D zone duct overheat switch with an operative switch from the U/D zone or C/R zone.

If the Fwd Main Deck zone and/or Aft Main Deck zone overheat switch is affected, it is recommended to interchange the inoperative zone's duct overheat switch(es) with an operative switch (if available) from the U/D zone or C/R zone.

numlitem.para: Open the P6 panel ZONE TEMP CONT AC and ZONE TEMP CONT DC circuit breakers.
Location of zone trim air modulation valve(s);

entry.para: Flight Deck STA 1114, WL 340, LBL 14 (Above Main Deck Ceiling)
Upper Deck STA 1109, WL 340, LBL 13 (Above Main Deck Ceiling)
Crew Rest: STA 1111, WL 340, LBL 10 (Above Main Deck Ceiling)
Fwd Main Deck: STA 1253, WL 170, RBL 94 (RH Wheel Well)
Aft Main Deck: L STA 1253, WL 170, LBL 94 (LH Wheel Well)
Aft Main Deck: R STA 1253, WL 170, RBL 87 (RH Wheel Well)

numlitem.para: Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from affected valve(s).
For each affected valve, install an Allen wrench in the valve's manual position shaft. Rotate the shaft to the closed position as shown on the valve's position indicator.

note.para: The Aft Main Deck zone is equipped with two trim air modulation valves (Left and Right). If the Aft main Zone Duct Overheat Protective System is affected, secure both Aft Main Deck trim air mod valves closed.

numlitem.para: Close the P6 panel ZONE TEMP CONT AC and ZONE TEMP CONT DC circuit breakers.
If Crew Rest and/or Upper Deck zone(s) valve is secured closed, placard Cabin Temperature Selector (located in Upper Deck) "CREW REST TEMP CONTROL INOP and/or UPPER DECK TEMP CONTROL INOP".
If the Fwd Main Deck zone trim mod valve is secured closed, placard the FWD MAIN DECK TEMP selector on the Temperature Control panel (P5) "INOP".
If the Aft Main Deck zone trim mod valves are secured closed, placard the AFT MAIN DECK TEMP selector on the Temperature Control panel (P5) "INOP".
To prevent a failed zone duct overheat switch(es) from commanding the Master Trim Air Valve closed, deactivate the failed switch(es) as per maintenance steps 3A thru 3D below.
For dispatch with the Master Trim Air Valve remaining closed, placard the TRIM AIR switch on the Temperature Control panel (P5) "INOP - LEAVE OFF".
To deactivate associated zone duct overheat switch(es):
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5) TRIM AIR switch OFF.
Access the associate zone duct overheat switch(es) located behind the ceiling panel in the air conditioning duct risers. Actual location of each switch is listed below:
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from affected switch(es).
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5): TRIM AIR switch ON.
If a trim air modulation valve is secured closed, status message ZONE TEMP may remain displayed.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided TRIM AIR Switch remains OFF.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
ZONE TEMP

numlitem.para: Select AUTO W or AUTO C to control pack outlet temperature. Flight deck temperature remains controllable by the FLT DECK TEMP selector.
Upper Deck Zone, Crew Rest Zone and both Main Deck Cargo Zones receive pack outlet air at the same temperature commanded by the FLT DECK TEMP selector.

placard.para: Placard associated TRIM AIR switch "LEAVE OFF". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated zone trim air valve is operative,
Associated zone duct temperature sensor is operative, and
Associated zone duct overheat switch(es) is deactivated.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the TRIM AIR switch "____ ZONE DUCT OVHT SW INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To deactivate associated zone duct overheat switch(es):
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5) TRIM AIR switch OFF.
Access the associate zone duct overheat switch(es) located behind the ceiling panel in the air conditioning duct risers. Actual location of each switch is listed below:
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from affected switch(es).
Position the Temperature Control panel (P5): TRIM AIR switch ON.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the TRIM AIR switch "_____ ZONE DUCT TEMP SENSOR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Zone Temperature Sensors – Freighter with Draw-Through Smoke Detection System

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the TRIM AIR switch "_____ ZONE TEMP SENSOR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Zone Temperature Sensors – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the TRIM AIR switch "____ZONE DUCT TEMP SENSOR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative secured open.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ZONE TEMP

numlitem.para: To maintain normal flow rate and noise level during all flight phases. Position LOWER LOBE CARGO COND AIR FLOW RATE selector to either FWD HIGH, AFT HIGH, or BOTH LOW.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the TRIM AIR switch "FLIGHT DECK FLOW REGULATING VLV INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To secure Flight Deck Flow Regulating Valve in the open position do the following:
Open the P6 panel ZONE TEMP CONT AC and ZONE TEMP CONT DC circuit breakers.
Locate the Flight Deck Flow Regulating valve under the main deck floor at STA 1130, WL 194, LBL 45.
Disconnect, cap, and stow the valve’s electrical connector.
Manually position the valve in the OPEN position (requires an Allen wrench).
Close the P6 panel ZONE TEMP CONT AC and ZONE TEMP CONT DC circuit breakers.
With the flight deck flow regulating valve secured open, status message ZONE TEMP will remain displayed.
Status message ZONE TEMP may remain displayed if the flight deck flow regulating valve is secured open.

remarks.para: One pack temperature controller (A or B) may be inoperative for each operating pack.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CACTCS AIR/GND
PACK ___
PACK CONTROL ___

placard.para: Placard associated Pack selector "PACK TEMP CNTL (A or B) INOP". Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative for an inoperative pack provided associated exit door has greater open area than inlet door.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
PACK ___

numlitem.para: Packs 2 and 3 provide conditioned air to forward and aft lower lobe cargo compartments.
If pack 2 is not used, the aft lower lobe cargo compartment may still be heated by the aft cargo heating system.
If pack 3 is not used, the forward lower lobe cargo compartment may still be heated to a limited extent by the equipment cooling exhaust air.
Increase flight plan fuel by 0.6% due to 2 packs operating in HI Flow mode.
Carriage of animals or perishables in associated lower cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated PACK selector "INLET/EXIT COOLING DR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard adjacent to associated PACK selector "INOP OFF".
Placard adjacent to Lower Lobe Cargo Cond Air Flow Rate selector "INOP OFF".

numlitem.para: If an inlet/exit cooling door(s) cannot be positioned as necessary; or, if a pack is inoperative and its associated inlet/exit door(s) is also inoperative, perform the following:
Secure affected Pack Flow Control and Shutoff valve (FCV) in closed position:
Place Associated Pack switch (P5 panel) to OFF position.
Access associated FCV(s) through the air conditioning equipment bay access doors under wing root center section.
Check associated FCV position indicator (crank arm on valve) indicates closed. Next, run locking screw (end of crank arm) into hole in casting.
Open the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT A and PACK TEMP CONT B circuit breakers.
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connectors for inlet and exit doors.
Check position of the inlet/exit doors. They must be secured in the following configuration for dispatch:
Exit door is open more than inlet door.
If inlet/exit doors are not in one of the above configuration, reposition the inlet/exit door(s) as necessary using the Allen wrench if the actuator(s) can be moved manually.

caution.para: IF DOORS ARE NOT IN POSITION DESCRIBED, DAMAGE TO DUCTING COULD OCCUR, OR CABIN TEMPERATURE COULD BECOME EXCESSIVELY WARM.

numlitem.para: Close the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT A and PACK TEMP CONT B circuit breakers.
Make associated pack inoperative by accomplishing DMP 21-51-1.
Position the associated Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK selector OFF.
Status message PACK____ may remain displayed.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative for an inoperative pack provided associated inlet and exit doors are secured closed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
PACK ___

numlitem.para: Packs 2 and 3 provide conditioned air to forward and aft lower lobe cargo compartments.
If pack 2 is not used, the aft lower lobe cargo compartment may still be heated by the aft cargo heating system.
If pack 3 is not used, the forward lower lobe cargo compartment may still be heated to a limited extent by the equipment cooling exhaust air.
Increase flight plan fuel by 0.6% due to 2 packs operating in HI Flow mode.
Carriage of animals or perishables in associated lower cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated PACK selector "INLET/EXIT COOLING DR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard adjacent to associated PACK selector "INOP OFF".
Placard adjacent to Lower Lobe Cargo Cond Air Flow Rate selector "INOP OFF".

numlitem.para: If an inlet/exit cooling door(s) cannot be positioned as necessary; or, if a pack is inoperative and its associated inlet/exit door(s) is also inoperative, perform the following:
Secure affected Pack Flow Control and Shutoff valve (FCV) in closed position:
Place Associated Pack switch (P5 panel) to OFF position.
Access associated FCV(s) through the air conditioning equipment bay access doors under wing root center section.
Check associated FCV position indicator (crank arm on valve) indicates closed. Next, run locking screw (end of crank arm) into hole in casting.
Open the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT A and PACK TEMP CONT B circuit breakers.
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connectors for inlet and exit doors.
Check position of the inlet/exit. They must be secured in the following configuration for dispatch:
Both are fully closed.
If inlet/exit doors are not in one of the above configurations, reposition the inlet/exit door(s) as necessary using the Allen wrench if the actuator(s) can be moved manually.

caution.para: IF DOORS ARE NOT IN POSITION DESCRIBED, DAMAGE TO DUCTING COULD OCCUR, OR CABIN TEMPERATURE COULD BECOME EXCESSIVELY WARM.

numlitem.para: Close the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT A and PACK TEMP CONT B circuit breakers.
Make associated pack inoperative by accomplishing DMP 21-51-1.
Position the associated Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK selector OFF.
Status message PACK__ may remain displayed.

item.title: Pack Coolant (Inlet/Exit Doors) Systems – Inlet Doors

remarks.para: One inlet door may be inoperative secured 60% open to full open provided:

numlitem.para: Remaining two packs are operative,
Associated turbine bypass valve is operative, and
Associated exit door is secured at least 50% open.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: If inlet door is inoperative open, monitor pack output temperature due to high temperature at low altitudes.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated PACK selector "INLET COOLING DR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: Refer to CDL Item 21-62-1 for missing inlet door:

numlitem.para: Secure inlet and exit door(s) as required to meet position requirements:

note.para: IF THE FOLLOWING PROCEDURES CANNOT BE MET, SEE MEL 21-62-2-0-1

numlitem.para: Open the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT A and PACK TEMP CONT B circuit breakers.
Disconnect the electrical connector from door actuator.
Install Allen wrench into adapter on end of gearbox opposite linear screw.

caution.para: TURN WRENCH BY HAND ONLY. A TORQUE GREATER THAN 15 INCH POUNDS MAY DAMAGE ACTUATOR GEARS.

numlitem.para: Move door to desired position:

If pack to be used with an inoperative inlet door, position inlet door at least 60% open. This corresponds to 9.45 inches between centerline of actuator support bolt and centerline of ram bolt (see illustration).

Position exit door at least 50% open. If pack is to be used with an inoperative exit door, position it full open if possible (louver doors are approximately vertical); otherwise pack may trip off when operated in warm ambient conditions.
Loosen strain relief clamp supporting the removed electrical connector’s wiring bundle.
Disconnect the wire from pin 6, pin 7, and pin 8. Individually, sleeve the disconnected wires per Boeing Standard Wiring Practices Manual section 20-10-15 using sleeve material RT-876.

note.para: The shorting wire in the following step is UPS P/N 747-21-004-101, if available.

numlitem.para: Fabricate a 4 inch shorting wire from type UA (BMS 13-48 TY VIII CL 1) 20-gauge wire and two 20-gauge sockets P/N BACC47CP1A.
Insert fabricated shorting wire to connector pins 6 and 8. Note that pin 7, on the connector’s back side, will remain unconnected.
Stow the following wires to the connector’s wiring bundle per Boeing Standard Wiring Practice Manual section 20-10-11:
Wire disconnected and sleeved per step F above.
Excess wire from shorting wire connected per step H above.
Tighten the strain relief clamp supporting the wiring bundle.
Reconnect the electrical connector, with shorting wire installed, to the inlet/exit door actuator(s).
Close the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT A and PACK TEMP CONT B circuit breakers.

item.title: Pack Coolant (Inlet/Exit Doors) Systems – Exit Doors

remarks.para: Any exit doors may be inoperative secured at least 50% open.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
PACK ___

numlitem.para: If exit door is inoperative but not full open, monitor pack output temperature due to high temperature at lower altitudes. If a pack overheat condition develops, EICAS advisory message PACK_ will be annunciated.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated PACK selector "EXIT COOLING DR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Secure exit door(s) as required to meet position requirements:

note.para: IF THE FOLLOWING PROCEDURES CANNOT BE MET, SEE MEL 21-62-2-0-1.

numlitem.para: Open the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT A and PACK TEMP CONT B circuit breakers.
Disconnect the electrical connector from door actuator.
Install Allen wrench into adapter on end of gearbox opposite linear screw.

caution.para: TURN WRENCH BY HAND ONLY. A TORQUE GREATER THAN 15-INCH POUNDS MAY DAMAGE ACTUATOR GEARS.

numlitem.para: Move door to desired position:

Position exit door at least 50% open. If pack is to be used with an inoperative exit door, position it full open if possible (louver doors are approximately vertical); otherwise, pack trip off when operated in warm ambient conditions.
Loosen strain relief clamp supporting the removed electrical connector's wiring bundle.

Disconnect the wire from pin 6, pin 7, and pin 8. Individually, sleeve the disconnected wires per Boeing Standard Wiring Practice Manual section 20-10-15 using sleeve material RT-876. Sleeve should extend one half inch beyond end of pin. Identify the disconnected wires for later restoration.

note.para: The shorting wire in the following step is UPS P/N 747-21-004-101, if available.

numlitem.para: Fabricate a 4-inch shorting wire from type UA (BMS 13-48 TY VIII CL 1) 20-gauge wire and two 20-gauge sockets P/N BACC47CP1A.
Insert fabricated shorting wire to connector pins 6 and 8. Note that pin 7, on the connector's back side, will remain unconnected.
Stow the following wires to the connector's wiring bundle per Boeing Standard Wiring Practice Manual section 20-10-11:
Wire disconnected and sleeved per step F above.
Excess wire from shorting wire connected per step H above.
Tighten the strain relief clamp supporting the wiring bundle.
Reconnect the electrical connector, with shorting wire installed, to the exit door acutator(s).
Close the P6 panel PACK TEMP CONT A and PACK TEMP CONT B circuit breakers.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel "COMPT TEMP IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel "ZONE SYS FAULT LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated FCC SERVO circuit breaker is opened and collared,
Autopilot Flight Director System is verified not in a single source configuration before each departure, and
Approach minimums do not require its use.
If Autopilot engagement between 250 feet and 500 feet AGL is desired: the pilot will not engage the autopilot unless the Auto Flight Director System being used is fully operational.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.

placard.para: Placard affected A/P ENGAGE switch "INOP" or "MODE(S) INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Open and collar the FCC servo circuit breaker (P7 panel) for the inoperative FCC:

entry.para: Left L FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO
Center C FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO
Right R FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO

numlitem.para: Before each departure, verify that status message A/P SINGLE SYS is not displayed. If A/P SINGLE SYS is displayed see MEL 22-10-1-3 for dispatch.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

remarks.para: Two may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: At least two FCC power circuit breakers remain closed,
Associated FCC SERVO circuit breakers are opened and collared,
Autopilot Flight Director System is verified not in a single source configuration before each departure, and
Approach minimums do not require their use.
If Autopilot engagement between 250 feet and 500 feet AGL is desired: the pilot will not engage the autopilot unless the Auto Flight Director System being used is fully operational.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 1.
One Autopilot and associated Autoflight Director System (AFDS) required for dispatch to charted ILS CAT 1 minimums below RVR 4000 or 3/4 mile visibility.

placard.para: Placard affected A/P ENGAGE switch "INOP" or "MODE(S) INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

entry.para: Left L FLT CONT CMPTR PWR
Center C FLT CONT CMPTR PWR
Right R FLT CONT CMPTR PWR

numlitem.para: Open and collar the FCC servo circuit breaker (P7 panel) for the inoperative FCC:

entry.para: Left L FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO
Center C FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO
Right R FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO

numlitem.para: Before each departure, verify that status message A/P SINGLE SYS is not displayed. If A/P SINGLE SYS is displayed see MEL 22-10-1-3 for dispatch.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: At least one FCC power circuit breaker remains closed,
All three FCC SERVO circuit breakers are opened and collared,
Approach minimums do not require their use,
En route operations do not require their use, and
Flight crewmembers are limited to 5 flight hours per scheduled flight day.

note.para: North Polar Route Restrictions.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
A/P SINGLE SYS

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 1.
Two operative Flight Directors required to fly charted ILS CAT 1 minimums below RVR 4000 or 3/4 mile visibility.
RVSM Operations prohibited.
Flight does not exceed 5 flight hours.
RNP-4/FANS operations prohibited.
Modify ATC Flight plan suffix to the appropriate code.
North Polar Routes prohibited.

placard.para: Placard all A/P ENGAGE switches "INOP" or "MODE(S) INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

entry.para: Left L FLT CONT CMPTR PWR
Center C FLT CONT CMPTR PWR
Right R FLT CONT CMPTR PWR

numlitem.para: Open and collar all three FCC servo circuit breakers (P7 panel):

entry.para: Left L FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO
Center C FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO
Right R FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO

numlitem.para: EICAS status message A/P SINGLE SYS may remain displayed.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

item.title: Control Wheel Autopilot Disengage Switches – One Inoperative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: No autopilot is used below 1,500 feet AGL, and
Approach minimums do not require autopilot use.

note.para: When one control wheel disengage switch is inoperative, do not utilize the autopilot at an altitude less than 1,500 feet AGL.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 1.
Two operative Flight Directors required to fly charted ILS CAT 1 minimums below RVR 4000 or 3/4 mile visibility.
PRM approaches prohibited.

placard.para: Placard affected Control Wheel Disengage switch "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided selected airspeed indications on both PFDs are operative.

placard.para: Placard Airspeed (IAS/MACH) window "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided selected heading indications on both PFDs are operative.

placard.para: Placard Heading window "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Mode Control Panel Windows – Vertical Speed (VERT SPD)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided selected vertical speed indications on both PFDs are operative.

placard.para: Placard Vertical Speed window "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided selected altitude indications on both PFDs are operative.

placard.para: Placard Altitude window "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Mode Control Panel Selectors – VERT SPD Selector (DN & UP)

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

numlitem.para: Normal AFDS operation procedures do not require V/S selection.
Use VNAV and FLCH as desired.

placard.para: Placard Vertical Speed Selector "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Mode Control Panel Selectors – BANK LIMIT Selector (AUTO 5, 10, 15, 20, 25)

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

numlitem.para: If AFDS is not providing desired commands, turn off Flight Director and manually maneuver the aircraft.

LNAV limits bank angle to comply with maneuvering limitations. When operating at MAX altitude using a roll mode other than LNAV, fly at least 10 knots above minimum maneuver amber speed band and limit bank angle to 10 degrees.

placard.para: Placard Bank Limit Selector "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Mode Control Panel Selectors Selector Push Functions – ALT

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

note.para: Use FMS-CDU entries to modify altitude restraints.

placard.para: Placard ALT switch "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Mode Control Panel Selectors Selector Push Functions – HDG SEL

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

numlitem.para: Use Heading Hold, or LNAV modes. APP or LOC, once established, will be operative.
Autpilot disengagement will be required for radar vectors.
Heading Hold and LNAV must be operative.

placard.para: Placard HDG SEL switch "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: MODE CONTROL PANEL SELECTORS SELECTOR PUSH FUNCTIONS – IAS/MACH

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

numlitem.para: Speed intervention is not available. If VNAV operation is desired, speed entries can be made via the FMS-CDU.
VNAV will not be available for approach.

note.para: The rotation function of the IAS/MACH Selector must still operate to enable the crew to select the desired command speed in the IAS/MACH window and on both PFD’s.

placard.para: Placard IAS/MACH switch "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Mode Control Panel Switches – A/P Engage Switches (L CMD, C CMD, R CMD) Two Inoperative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated autopilot system is considered inoperative.

note.para: Additional Deferral Required – AUTOPILOT SYSTEMS.

numlitem.para: If Autopilot engagement between 250 feet and 500 feet AGL is desired: the pilot will not engage the autopilot unless the Auto Flight Director System being used is fully operational.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 1.
One Autopilot and associated Autoflight Director System (AFDS) required for dispatch to charted ILS CAT 1 minimums below RVR 4000 or 3/4 mile visibility.

placard.para: Placard A/P Engage Switches "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

Center C FLT CONT CMPTR PWR
Right R FLT CONT CMPTR PWR

Right R FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

item.title: Mode Control Panel Switches – A/P Engage Switches (L CMD, C CMD, R CMD) Three Inoperative

note.para: North Polar Route Restrictions.

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 1.

RVSM Operations prohibited.
Flight does not exceed 5 flight hours.
RNP-4/FANS operations prohibited.
Modify ATC Flight plan suffix to the appropriate code.
North Polar Routes prohibited.

entry.para: Left L FLT CONT CMPTR PWR
Center C FLT CONT CMPTR PWR
Right R FLT CONT CMPTR PWR
