item.title: Main Deck Cargo Smoke Detector System Detectors – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System (Detector of Opposite Loop Inoperative)

remarks.para: Multiple detectors within a smoke zone(s) (Forward, Mid, and/or Aft) may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All inoperative detectors per smoke zone are of the same loop type (loop A or B), and
All detectors of opposite loop type are verified to be operative before each departure.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be dispalyed:
MD CGO__LP__

numlitem.para: Push and hold the flight deck FIRE/OVHT TEST button on the overhead panel.
Verify proper system indications followed by EICAS>FIRE TEST PASS message accompained by the status message associated with the inoperative smoke detection loop(s).
Release the FIRE/OVHT TEST button.

placard.para: Install Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel "MULTIPLE MAIN DECK CARGO DECK SMOKE DETECTORS IN____ (fwd, mid or aft) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: MAIN DECK CARGO SMOKE DETECTOR SYSTEM DETECTORS

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify integrity of main deck cargo smoke detection system as follows:
Close circuit breakers (MM 26-14-00/501).
Select either one of the following switches to the ENABLE position:
S2089 Ground Test Enable Switch (P461).
S2090 Remote Test Enable Switch (RCDU) at STA 400 in the left Main Equipment Center.
Set CDU to the CMC main menu and press LINE SELECT key for GROUND TEST.
When screen displays ATA name and chapter, select 26 FIRE PROTECTION SYSTEM.
Press LINE SELECT key to initiate FIRE/OVHT TEST. TEST IN PROGRESS will display for the duration of the test. Upon completion of the test, TEST PASSED or FIRE TEST FAIL will be displayed on the CDU.
If TEST PASSED is displayed, system integrity is verified.
If FIRE TEST FAIL is displayed:

note.para: FIRE TEST FAIL may appear because of a fault in a different fire/overheat detection system.

numlitem.para: Verify the following EICAS/CMC messages do not appear:

entry.para: CARGO FIRE SIGNAL> MM-A CARD FAIL
CARGO FIRE SIGNAL> MM-B CARD FAIL

numlitem.para: If the above EICAS/CMC messages appear, seek corrective action: dispatch is not allowed.
Check for the following EICAS status messages:
For each of the above EICAS status messages displayed, dispatch is allowed provided:
* The Forward zone (sub-zones 1 through 5) remain empty for above EICAS status message(s) listed and followed by one asterisk (*).
** The Mid zone (sub-zones 6 through 9) remain empty for above EICAS status message(s) listed and followed by two asterisks (**).
*** The Aft zone (sub-zones 10 through 16) remain empty for above EICAS status message(s) listed and follwed by three asterisks (***).
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

remarks.para: Multiple detectors within a smoke zone(s) (Forward, Mid, and/or Aft) may be inoperative provided procedures are established and used to verify the associated smoke zone(s) remains empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULD's), or fly away kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
MD CGO____ LP ____

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Associated smoke zone must remain empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Install Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel "MULTIPLE MAIN DECK CARGO DECK SMOKE DETECTORS IN ____ (fwd, mid or aft) INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Crew Rest Area Smoke Detection System

remarks.para: Two may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Center detector is operative, and
Associated detector(s) is deactivated.
If any crew rest area is placarded CREW REST AREA SMOKE DET SYS INOP – DO NOT ENTER, do not use the affected crew rest area for any purpose.

note.para: International flights may be affected if crew rest area or supernumerary seats are deemed unusable.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "CREW REST AREA SMOKE DET SYS INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Confirm normal detector operation by noting the following while the self test switch on detector’s faceplate is depressed:
Caution message> SMOKE CREW REST displays on EICAS.
The detector’s alarm horn sounds off.
For each inoperative detector:
Disconnect, cap and stow the inoperative detector’s electrical connector (AMM 26-14-21, page 401).
Crew Rest Area smoke detectors are identical and interchangeable. If the center detector (STA 595, BL 0, WL 391) is inoperative, it may be interchanged with an operable detector from a bunk bed room.

item.title: CARGO DET AIR Indicating System (Main Deck/Lower Lobe)

remarks.para: Indication(s) for associated cargo areas may be inoperative provided associated smoke sampling system integrity is verified before each departure.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CGO DET AIR ___

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "CARGO DET AIR IND SYS INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Verify integrity of smoke sampling system by one of the following two methods:

note.para: Refer to AMM 26-14-00/522 (Main Deck) and AMM 26-16-00/518 (Lower Lobe) for locations of smoke detection orifices.

numlitem.para: Provide pneumatic pressure in the center crossover duct (AMM 26-00-00/201).
Using a hot wire anemometer and adapter (AMM 26-16-00/508), verify at least 120 fpm velocity airflow through the appropriate smoke sampling orifices as listed below for associated status message(s):

entry.para: Forward-most orifice in fwd lower lobe cargo compartment smoke detection Zone 1 and aft-most orifice in fwd lower lobe cargo compartment detection Zone 4.
Forward-most orifice aft lower lobe cargo compartment smoke detection Zone 1 and aft-most orifice in aft lower lobe cargo compartment smoke detection Zone 4.
Forward-most orifice in main deck smoke detection Zone 1 and aft-most orifice in main deck smoke detection Zone 8.
Forward-most orifice in main deck smoke detection Zone 9 and aft-most orifice in main deck smoke detection Zone 16.

numlitem.para: Provide pneumatic pressure in the center crossover duct (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Apply electrical power to aircraft.
Using smoke from an available smoke generating source, accomplish the following for each orifice listed above (in Method 1) for the associated status message(s):
For the forward-most orifice apply smoke adjacent to the detection orifice.
Verify that the flight deck fire warning bell sounds off and the appropriate EICAS warning message displays.
After the flight deck fire warning bell has silenced and the appropriate EICAS warning message is no longer annunciated, apply smoke adjacent to the aft-most detection orifice.

Smoke sampling system integrity is verified provided the flight deck fire warning bell sounds off and the appropriate EICAS warning message displays for both the forward-most and the aft-most orifices as listed for the associated status message(s).

item.title: CARGO DET AIR Indicating System (Main Deck/Lower Lobe) – Empty Cargo Handling Equipment Only

remarks.para: Indication(s) for associated cargo areas may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Procedures are established and used to verify associated lower lobe cargo compartment remains empty, or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits, and

Procedures are established and used to verify associated main deck cargo area(s) remain empty, or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CGO DET AIR ___

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Associated main deck and lower lobe cargo compartments remain empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "CARGO DET AIR IND SYS INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: APU Fire Detection System – Detection Loop

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
APU FIRE LOOP ___

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "APU FIRE LOOP A (or B) INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: APU Fire Detection System – Detection Loop – Both Inoperative

remarks.para: Both loops may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: APU is used for ground operations only, and is continuously monitored,
APU external control system is operative, and
APU is shut down before taxi.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
APU FIRE LOOP ___

numlitem.para: A fire guard must be positioned near the tail of the aircraft to continuously monitor the APU.

If fire is observed at the APU, the fire guard must proceed immediately to the APU FIRE CONTROL handle in the right main wheel well, pull the APU fire control handle, and push the APU EXTINGUISHER DISCHARGE switch.

note.para: Ensure APU is shut down prior to taxi and a fire guard is positioned at destination before starting APU.

numlitem.para: APU TO PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "APU FIRE LOOP A (and B) INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: APU Fire Detection System – Flight Deck Test System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided an alternate procedure is established to ensure integrity of the system.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "TEST FEATURE INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: If the flight deck test system is inoperative, the following CMC ground test procedure may be used to ensure system integrity:

numlitem.para: Close circuit breakers (AMM 26-15-00/501).
Set either of the following switches to ENABLE position:
S2089 Ground Test Enable Switch (P461).
S2090 Remote Test Enable Switch (RCDU) at STA 400 bulkhead in the left main equipment center located near upper left side of ladder.
Set the CDU to the CMC main menu.
Press LINE SELECT key for GROUND TEST.
When screen displays ATA name and chapter, select 26 FIRE PROTECTION SYSTEM.
To initiate test, press LINE SELECT key for FIRE/OVHT TEST.
The TEST IN PROGRESS indication will be displayed for the duration of the test.
When the test is done, CDU will display TEST PASSED or FIRE TEST FAIL.

note.para: The indication FIRE TEST fail may appear as a result of circuit breaker being open on related fire/overheat detection system.

numlitem.para: If the indication is TEST PASSED, the test is finished and system integrity is verified.
If the indication is FIRE TEST FAIL, verify that following CMC messages do not appear on CDU:

entry.para: APU FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>MAWEA MM-A INTERFACE FAIL
APU FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>MAWEA MM-B INTERFACE FAIL
APU FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>EIU INTERFACE FAIL

numlitem.para: If CMC fault messages appear, seek corrective action.
Ensure S2090 Remote Test switch at the left main Equipment Center is left in the NORM position.

item.title: Lower Lobe Cargo Compartment Smoke Detection System (Forward, Aft) – Flight Deck Test System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided smoke detector system integrity is verified before each departure.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "LOWER LOBE COMP SMOKE DET SYS INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify integrity of lower cargo smoke detection system as follows:
Close circuit breakers (MM 26-16-00/501).
Select either one of the following switches to the ENABLE position:
S2089 Ground Test Enable Switch (P461).
S2090 Remote Test Enable Switch (RCDU) at STA 400 in the left Main Equipment Center.
Set the CDU to the CMC main menu and press LINE SELECT key for GROUND TEST.
When screen displays ATA name and chapter, select 26 FIRE PROTECTION SYSTEM.
Press LINE SELECT key to initiate FIRE/OVHT TEST. TEST IN PROGRESS will display for the duration of the test. Upon completion of the test, TEST PASSED or FIRE TEST FAIL will be displayed on the CDU.
If TEST PASSED is displayed, system integrity is verified.
If FIRE TEST FAIL is displayed:
Ensure S2090 Remote Test Enable Switch (RCDU) at STA 400 in the left Main Equipment Center is left in the NORM position.

note.para: FIRE TEST FAIL may appear because of a fault in a different fire/overheat detection system.

numlitem.para: Verify the following EICAS/CMC fault messages do not appear on the CDU.
FIRE CARGO FWD
FIRE CARGO AFT
FWD CARGO FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>MAWEA MM-A FAIL INTERFACE FAIL
FWD CARGO FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>MAWEA MM-B FAIL INTERFACE FAIL
AFT CARGO FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>MAWEA MM-A FAIL INTERFACE FAIL
AFT CARGO FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>MAWEA MM-B FAIL INTERFACE FAIL
If the above fault messages appear, seek corrective action - dispatch is not allowed.
Check for the following Status messages on the lower EICAS display:
If the above status messages appear, seek corrective action or dispatch is allowed provided the associated lobe cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty ULD’s, or fly away kits.
Restore Aircraft to its required configuration.
While not required, an inoperative smoke detector may be deactivated as follows:
Remove and stow the electrical connector from affected detector.

With the electrical connector removed the AFOLTS will automatically configure for single loop operation and the FIRE/OVHT test should indicate passed with a status message for the inoperative detector.

item.title: Lower Lobe Cargo Compartment Smoke Detection System (Forward, Aft) – Flight Deck Test System Empty Cargo Handling Equipment Only

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided procedures are established and used to verify associated cargo compartments remain empty, or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Associated cargo compartments remain empty or contain only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "LOWER LOBE COMP SMOKE DET SYS INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Lower Lobe Cargo Compartment Smoke Detection System Detectors (Forward, Aft) – Freighter with Draw-Through Smoke Detection System – One Detector Per Smoke Zone Inoperative

remarks.para: One detector (loop A or B) per smoke zone may be inoperative provided remaining detector is verified to be operative before each departure.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CARGO DET ___

numlitem.para: Prior to each departure, verify the remaining smoke detector(s) are operative:
Push and hold the flight deck FIRE/OVHT TEST button on the overhead panel.
Verify proper system indications followed by EICAS FIRE TEST PASS message accompanied by the status message associated with the inoperative smoke detection loop(s).
Release the FIRE/OVHT TEST button.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "LOWER LOBE COMP SMOKE DET LOOP A (or B) IS INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 26-16-1-1-1.

item.title: Lower Lobe Cargo Compartment Smoke Detection System Detectors (Forward, Aft) – Freighter with Draw-Through Smoke Detection System – Both Detectors Per Smoke Zone Inoperative – Empty Cargo Handling Equipment Only

remarks.para: Both detectors (loops A and B) per smoke zone may be inoperative provided procedures are established and used to verify associated cargo compartment remains empty, or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CARGO DET ___

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Associated cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "LOWER LOBE COMP SMOKE DET LOOP A (or B) IS INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Lower Lobe Cargo Compartment Smoke Detection System Detectors (Forward, Aft) – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System

remarks.para: Multiple detectors within a smoke zone(s) (Forward and/or Aft) may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All inoperative detectors per smoke zone are of the same loop type (loop A or B), and
All detectors of opposite loop type are verified to be operative before each departure.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CARGO DET ____

numlitem.para: Prior to each departure, verify the remaining smoke detector(s) are operative:
Push and hold the flight deck FIRE/OVHT TEST button on the overhead panel.
Verify proper system indications followed by EICAS FIRE TEST PASS message accompanied by the status message associated with the inoperative smoke detection loop(s).
Release the FIRE/OVHT TEST button.

placard.para: Install Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel "LOOP (A or B) LOWER LOBE CARGO DECK SMOKE DETECTORS IN (FWD or AFT) PIT INOP". Enter item inAircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 26-16-1-1-1.

item.title: Lower Lobe Cargo Compartment Smoke Detection System Detectors (Forward, Aft) – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System

remarks.para: Multiple detectors (Loop A and B) within a smoke zone(s) (Forward and/or Aft) may be inoperative provided procedures are established and used to verify the associated smoke zone(s) remains empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULD's), or fly away kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CARGO DET____

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Associated cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Install Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel "LOOP A and B LOWER LOBE CARGO DECK SMOKE DETECTORS IN (FWD OR AFT) PIT INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Wheel Well Fire Detection System – EICAS Brake Temp NOT Available

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated provided brakes are verified cool to the touch before engine start.

numlitem.para: Verify brakes are cool before engine start by carefully touching each wheel’s brake to determine that each is cool.
After takeoff, avoid the possibility of retracting a wheel overheated from dragging brakes by leaving the landing gear extended for 10 minutes.

In case of engine failure after V1, performance is the prime consideration. Landing gear should be retracted until obstruction clearance requirement has been met, then extended for a 10 minute cooling period.
An additional 2,000 lbs. of fuel should be planned to account for increased fuel burn due to the landing gear being possibly extended for 10 minutes.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "WHEEL WELL FIRE DET INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: For dispatch with the Wheel Well Fire Detection System inoperative:

numlitem.para: To verify the brakes are cool before engine start, carefully touch each wheel’s brake to determine that each is cool.
Deactivate Flight Deck annunciations for Wheel Well Fire Warning by opening and collaring the P6 panel W/W FIRE DET AC circuit breaker.

item.title: Wheel Well Fire Detection System – EICAS Brake Temp Available

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated provided brakes are verified cool by monitoring brake temperature indications before engine start.

numlitem.para: Verify brakes are cool before engine start by monitoring brake temperature indications:
Select the Gear Synoptic on the Secondary EICAS Display.
Ensure Brake Temperature Indications for all brakes are at level one (1) or zero (0).
After takeoff, avoid the possibility of retracting a wheel overheated from dragging brakes by monitoring brake temperature indications before gear retraction.

In case of engine failure after V1, performance is the prime consideration. Landing gear should be retracted until obstruction clearance requirement has been met, then extended if required for cooling.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "WHEEL WELL FIRE DET INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: For dispatch with the Wheel Well Fire Detection System inoperative:

numlitem.para: To verify the brakes are cool before engine start, carefully touch each wheel’s brake to determine that each is cool.
Deactivate Flight Deck annunciations for Wheel Well Fire Warning by opening and collaring the P6 panel W/W FIRE DET AC circuit breaker.

item.title: Wheel Well Fire Detection System – Flight Deck Test System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided an alternate procedure is established to ensure integrity of the system.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "WHEEL WELL FIRE DET TEST INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: For dispatch with the flight deck test system inoperative, the following CMC ground test procedure may be used to ensure system integrity:

numlitem.para: Close circuit breakers (AMM 26-18-00/501).
Set either of the following switches to the ENABLE position:
S2089 Ground Test Enable Switch (P461).
S2090 Remote Test Enable Switch (RCDU) at STA 400 bulkhead in the left main equipment center located near upper left side of ladder.
Set the CDU to the CMC Main Menu.
Press LINE SELECT key for GROUND TEST.
When the screen displays ATA name and chapter, select 26 FIRE PROTECTION.
To initiate test, press LINE SELECT key for FIRE/OVHT TEST.
The TEST IN PROGRESS indication will be displayed for the duration of the test.
When the test is done, the CDU will display TEST PASSED or FIRE TEST FAIL.

note.para: The indication FIRE TEST FAIL may appear as a result of circuit breakers being on related fire/overheat detection system.

numlitem.para: If the indication is TEST PASSED, the test is finished, and system integrity is verified.
If the indication is FIRE TEST FAIL, verify that following CMC messages do not appear on CDU:

entry.para: WHEEL WELL FIRE SIGNAL>MM-A CARD FAIL
WHEEL WELL FIRE SIGNAL>MM-B CARD FAIL

numlitem.para: If CMC fault messages appear, seek corrective action or dispatch according to provisions for system inoperative.
Ensure S2090 Remote Test switch at the left main Equipment Center is left in the NORM position.

item.title: Wing Leading Edge Overheat Detection System – Dual Loop System – One Loop Per Wing Inoperative

remarks.para: One loop in each wing may be inoperative provided the remaining loop(s) is operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
DUCT LEAK ___ LP ___

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "WING L/E FIRE DET LOOP A (or B) INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Wing Leading Edge Overheat Detection System – Flight Deck Test System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided an alternate procedure is established to ensure integrity of the system.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "WING L/E FIRE DET LOOP A (or B) INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: The following procedure may be used to ensure system integrity:

numlitem.para: Close circuit breakers (AMM 26-18-00/501).
Set either of the following switches to the ENABLE position:
S2089 Ground Test Enable Switch (P461).
S2090 Remote Test Enable Switch (RCDU) at STA 400 bulkhead in the left main equipment center located near upper left side of ladder.
Set the CDU to the CMC Main Menu.
Press LINE SELECT key for GROUND TEST.
When the screen displays ATA name and chapter, select 26 FIRE PROTECTION.
To initiate test, press LINE SELECT key for FIRE/OVHT TEST.
The TEST IN PROGRESS indication will be displayed for the duration of the test.
When the test is done, the CDU will display TEST PASSED or FIRE TEST FAIL.

note.para: The indication FIRE TEST FAIL may appear because circuit breakers are open or due to other related fire/overheat detection system faults.

numlitem.para: If the indication is TEST PASSED, the test is finished, and system integrity is verified.
If the indication is FIRE TEST FAIL, verify that following CMC messages do not appear on CDU:

entry.para: BLEED DUCT LEAK - LEFT DETECTION SYSTEM FAIL
BLEED DUCT LEAK - RIGHT DETECTION SYSTEM FAIL
BLEED DUCT LEAK - LEFT LOOP A FAIL
BLEED DUCT LEAK - LEFT LOOP B FAIL
BLEED DUCT LEAK - RIGHT LOOP A FAIL
BLEED DUCT LEAK - RIGHT LOOP B FAIL

numlitem.para: If CMC fault messages appear, seek corrective action.
Ensure S2090 Remote Test switch at the left main Equipment Center is in the NORM position.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided alternate procedures are established and used.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BLD DUCT LEAK C

caution.para: RECALL ITEMS FOR CABIN ALTITUDE (RAPID DEPRESSURIZATION) NON-NORMAL PROCEDURES ARE MODIFIED.

numlitem.para: With the entire system inoperative, use the modified CABIN ALTITUDE (RAPID DEPRESSURIZATION) Non-Normal Procedure Listed in AOM Chapter 2.1 and QRH.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "CTR DUCT LEAK DET SYS INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Center Duct Leak Detection Systems – Dual Loop System Loops A or B Inoperative

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
DUCT LEAK C LP ___

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "CTR DUCT LEAK DET LOOP A (or B) INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Center Duct Leak Detection Systems – Flight Deck Test System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided an alternate procedure is established to ensure integrity of the system.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "CTR DUCT LEAK DET SYS INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: The following procedure may be used to ensure system integrity:

numlitem.para: Close circuit breakers (AMM 26-18-00/501).
Set either of the following switches to the ENABLE position:
S2089 Ground Test Enable Switch (P461).
S2090 Remote Test Enable Switch (RCDU) at STA 400 bulkhead in the left main equipment center located near upper left side of ladder.
Set the CDU to the CMC Main Menu.
Press LINE SELECT key for GROUND TEST.
When the screen displays ATA name and chapter, select 26 FIRE PROTECTION.
To initiate test, press LINE SELECT key for FIRE/OVHT TEST.
The TEST IN PROGRESS indication will be displayed for the duration of the test.
When the test is done, the CDU will display TEST PASSED or FIRE TEST FAIL.

note.para: The indication FIRE TEST FAIL may appear because circuit breakers are open or due to other related fire/overheat detection system faults.

numlitem.para: If the indication is TEST PASSED, the test is finished, and system integrity is verified.
If the indication is FIRE TEST FAIL, verify that following CMC messages do not appear on CDU:

entry.para: BLEED DUCT LEAK - CENTER DETECTION SYSTEM FAIL
BLEED DUCT LEAK - CENTER LOOP A FAIL
BLEED DUCT LEAK - CENTER LOOP B FAIL

numlitem.para: If CMC fault messages appear, dispatch is allowed considering the center duct leak detection system inoperative.
Ensure S2090 Remote Test switch at the left main Equipment Center is in the NORM position.

item.title: APU Duct Leak Detection System – APU OFF

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided APU selector switch remains OFF.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
APU DUCT LEAK

numlitem.para: If engines cannot be started due to insufficient external power, select UTILITY power OFF. Utility power can be restored after completion of the engine start procedure.

note.para: If utility power is selected off for engine start an EEC CLNG SUP FAN status message may be displayed. It can be cleared by rotating the EQUIP COOLING switch to OVRD, then back to NORM.
If utility power is selected off for engine start a RECIRC FAN UPR or LWR status message may be displayed. Momentarily depress the PACK RST switch until each has cleared.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to APU Selector Switch: "APU INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open and collar the following P83 panel circuit breakers: AIR INLET DOOR, APU PRIMARY CONT, and APU START.
Open and collar the P6 main power supply panel circuit breaker APU ALTN CONT.
See AMM 09-11-00 for towing aircraft if APU not used.

item.title: Fire Bottle Pressure Indication Systems (Engine, Lower Cargo, APU)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Squib test is used to verify squib integrity, and
Procedure is used to verify that the associated bottle is full.

note.para: Not required for inoperative APU, main deck cargo or lower cargo fire extinguisher system.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BTL LOW ___ ENG ___
BTL LOW CARGO ___
BOTTLE LOW APU

placard.para: Placard adjacent to SQUIB TEST module on the pilots overhead panel: "FIRE BOTTLE PRESS IND SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: This MEL item includes associated lights and EICAS messages. Refer to MEL item 31-61-4-1 for possible relief with invalid EICAS status messages.

numlitem.para: Push and hold SQUIB TEST, TEST 1 button, M7327 squib test module on P461 pilot’s overhead maintenance panel.
Observe that following indicating lights on M7327 illuminate (green):
All ENG 1, 2, 3, and 4 squib test lights.
All CARGO squib test lights.
The APU squib test light.

note.para: If optional two bottle system is installed, SQUIB TEST, TEST 1 button will test APU Bottle A.

numlitem.para: Release the SQUIB TEST, TEST 1 button.
Observe that all squib test indicating lights extinguish.
Push and hold SQUIB TEST, TEST 2 button, M7327 squib test module on P461 pilot’s overhead maintenance panel.
Observe the following indicating lights on M7327 illuminate (green):
All ENG 1, 2, 3, and 4 squib test lights.
All CARGO squib test lights.
The APU squib test light.

note.para: If optional two bottle system is installed, SQUIB TEST, TEST 2 button will test APU Bottle B.

numlitem.para: Release the SQUIB TEST, TEST 2 button.
Observe that all squib test indicating lights extinguish.
Remove electrical power if no longer required.
Perform the following tests:
ENGINE Pressure Switch Test - System Test (AMM 26-21-00/501).
APU Pressure Switch Test - System Test (AMM 26-22-00/501).
LOWER CARGO Pressure Switch Test - System Test (AMM 26-23-00/501).
MAIN DECK Pressure Switch Test - System Test (AMM 26-24-00/501).
If above tests fail, remove and weigh the bottle.
LOWER CARGO (AMM 26-23-01/401 and AMM 26-24-01/601).
Disconnect, cap and stow the affected bottle’s Pressure Switch connector after serviceable bottle weight is confirmed.

item.title: Fire Extinguisher Squib Test (Engine, APU, Lower Cargo)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided it is verified that the failure is in the light circuit.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to SQUIB TEST module on the pilots overhead panel: "FIRE EXT SQUIB TEST SYS INOP”. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: Individual fire extinguisher bottle squib test failures may be permitted. Refer to MEL items 26-22-X, 26-23-X, or 26-24-X for possible relief.

maintenance.para: Perform the Squib Discharge Circuit Test portion of the Fire Extinguisher Bottle Squib System Test:

item.title: Fire Extinguisher Squib Test (Engine, APU, Lower Cargo) – Lower Cargo Squib Test System Empty Cargo Handling Equipment Only

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided procedures are established and used to verify associated cargo compartment remains empty, or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Associated cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment

placard.para: Placard adjacent to SQUIB TEST module on the pilots overhead panel: "LWR CARGO AND/OR MN DK FIRE EXT SQUIB TEST SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Fire Extinguisher Squib Test – APU Squib Test System APU OFF

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided APU is not used.

numlitem.para: If engines cannot be started due to insufficient external power, select UTILITY power OFF. Utility power can be restored after completion of the engine start procedure.

note.para: If utility power is selected off for engine start an EEC CLNG SUP FAN status message may be displayed. It can be cleared by rotating the EQUIP COOLING switch to OVRD, then back to NORM.
If utility power is selected off for engine start a RECIRC FAN UPR or LWR status message may be displayed. Momentarily depress the PACK RST switch until each has cleared.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to SQUIB TEST module on the pilots overhead panel: "APU SQUIB TEST SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard APU Selector Switch “INOP” and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: APU is not used, and
APU fuel valve is secured closed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BOTTLE LOW APU

numlitem.para: If engines cannot be started due to insufficient external power, select UTILITY power OFF. Utility power can be restored after completion of the engine start procedure.

note.para: If utility power is selected off for engine start an EEC CLNG SUP FAN status message may be displayed. It can be cleared by rotating the EQUIP COOLING switch to OVRD, then back to NORM.
If utility power is selected off for engine start a RECIRC FAN UPR or LWR status message may be displayed. Momentarily depress the PACK RST switch until each has cleared.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fire switch and warning light on the pilots overhead panel: "APU INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard APU Selector Switch "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Position APU master switch on P5 pilot’s overhead panel to OFF.
Open and collar the following P83 panel circuit breakers: AIR INLET DOOR, APU PRIMARY CONT., and APU START.
Open and collar the P6 main power supply panel circuit breaker APU ALTN CONT.
Access APU fuel valve in left wing gear wheel well, rear wing spar.
Check that override lever on valve actuator indicates CLOSED. If not, manually position override lever to CLOSED position.
Restore aircraft to required configuration.

item.title: APU Fire Extinguisher System – APU Auto Discharge Inoperative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided the APU controls at the wheel well or flight deck are monitored by a qualified operator at all times when the APU is used during ground operations.

note.para: Ensure APU, if operating, is not left unattended.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to APU fire switch and warning light on the pilots overhead panel: "APU BTL A (or B) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: APU Fire Extinguisher System – APU Auto Discharge

numlitem.para: If APU is to be used during ground operations:
Provide electrical power to aircraft.
For APU controls monitored from Flight Deck:

When the aircraft is on the ground and a fire is detected in the APU compartment, the APU fire switch handle (M7326) red warning light illuminates. The fire extinguishing agent is discharged in APU compartment when APU fire switch handle is pulled and rotated in either direction.
For APU controls monitored from Wheel Well:

When the aircraft is on the ground and fire is detected in APU compartment, the red APU FIRE light on M869 APU shutdown module illuminates. The fire extinguishing agent is discharged in APU compartment by pulling the APU FIRE CONTROL handle and pushing the APU EXTINGUISHER DISCHARGE switch located in the right main wheel well.

item.title: Lower Cargo Compartment Fire Extinguisher System – Freighter with Draw-Through Smoke Detection System – Empty Cargo Handling Equipment Only

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Procedures are established and used to verify lower cargo compartments remain empty, or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits, and

For Combi, procedures are established and used to verify main deck cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BTL LOW CARGO ___

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Lower cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Placard adjacent or on fire control module located on the pilots overhead panel: "LOWER CARGO COMP FIRE EXT SYST INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Lower Cargo Compartment Fire Extinguisher System – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Procedures are established and used to verify lower cargo compartments remain empty, or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits, and
Lower Cargo Smoke Detection System is deactivated.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BTL LOW CARGO ___

remarks.para: Any in excess of those required by FAR may be inoperative or missing provided:

Required distribution is maintained.

"PORTABLE FIRE BOTTLE _______ INOP".

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: For Combi, procedures are established and used to verify main deck cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
Main deck cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Placard blank panel below O2 indicator "Main Deck Portable Fire Extinguisher INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Remove and stow fire extinguisher in a secure area.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided aileron trim system is verified to be centered.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
AILERON LOCKOUT

placard.para: Placard on aisle stand aileron trim switches: "AILERON TRIM INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The terminology “aileron trim system is verified to be centered” is not intended to imply any particular tolerance. The intent is that the system be centered to the extent that it is acceptable to the pilot. A tolerance of +/- 1.0 unit of trim should normally make it acceptable.

numlitem.para: If trim system is within tolerance (control wheels essentially centered), open and collar the P7 panel AILERON TRIM circuit breaker.
If trim system is not centered within tolerance (control wheels not centered), install a dummy link to maintain a centered system:
Open and collar the P7 panel AILERON TRIM circuit breaker.
Gain access to aileron trim actuator (access is forward bulkhead, LH wing gear wheel well).
Disconnect electrical connector DM254 from trim actuator and stow.
Remove trim actuator.
Using bolts, washers, nuts and cotter pins from trim actuator, install dummy actuator link.

note.para: Fabricate the dummy actuator link using the sketch below or from the drawing for P/N A27088-13.

numlitem.para: Restore aircraft its required configuration.

remarks.para: May be inoperative unlocked provided maximum airspeed limit is 225 KIAS or 0.73 Mach, whichever is less.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
AILERON LOCKOUT

numlitem.para: Do not exceed 225 KIAS or .73 Mach. The 225 KIAS limit will preclude operation using normal VREF+100 flaps up maneuver speed. Sufficient maneuver margin exists at weights lighter than 550,000 to permit operation at VREF+80 for flaps up maneuver speed.
Limit maximum speed to 225 KIAS or 0.73 Mach, whichever is less.
Max takeoff weight is limited to 555,000 lbs.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "OUTB AILERON LOCKOUT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To check that the outboard ailerons are unlocked, perform the following steps:
Display the flight controls synoptic page to view the position of the outboard ailerons.
Open and collar the P7 panel OUTBD AIL LOCKOUT circuit breaker to ensure outboard ailerons remain unlocked during the flight.
Rotate either control wheel (Captain’s or First Officer’s) to the left and verify that the outboard ailerons move freely.
Rotate either control wheel (Captain’s or First Officer’s) to the right and verify that the outboard ailerons move freely.
Placard near Captain’s and First Officer’s Primary Flight Display - DO NOT EXCEED 225 KIAS OR 0.73 MACH.

graphic.title: OUTBOARD AILERON CONTROL PACKAGE AND LOCKOUT MECHANISM

item.chgdesc: Adds Not Applicable item per MMEL.

title.revision: NOT APPLICABLE

item.chgdesc: Renumbers item per MMEL.

title.revision: Outboard Aileron Lockout System Indication System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided the aileron lockout system is verified to be operative before each departure.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
AILERON LOCKOUT

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "OUTB AILERON LOCKOUT INDICATION INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: For an indication system failure, verify the aileron lockout system function before each departure:
Display the flight controls synoptic page to view the position of the outboard ailerons.
Perform an Aileron Lockout System Existing Faults Check (AMM 27-11-00/501) including the mechanical operation check (requires hydraulic power).

Verify the outboard ailerons return to the neutral position during the lockout portion of the CMC test. If the outboard ailerons fail to lockout, dispatch is allowed with the lockout system unlocked with the appropriate speed restriction.
Following the test, verify the outboard ailerons move freely.

note.para: The CMC test will indicate FAIL due to the inoperative indication system. Dispatch with the indication system inoperative is allowed provided the lockout function operated normally during the test.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided visual confirmation of proper aileron movement is made before each departure.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "AILERON POS IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Perform visual check of surface movement:
Establish communications – flight deck to ground.

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Pressurize all four hydraulic systems.

entry.para: Observe left ailerons up, right ailerons down.
Observe right ailerons up, left ailerons down.

note.para: Inboard aileron deflection will be approximately 20º up or down. Outboard aileron deflection will be approximately 25° up and 15° down.

numlitem.para: Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

remarks.para: One per axis may be inoperative provided the associated valve position is verified open before each departure.

placard.para: Placard on affected switch(es): "S/O LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: The FLT CONTROL HYD POWER switches are located on the overhead maintenance panel. This MMEL item allows dispatch with up to 2 VALVE CLOSED lights inoperative. “One per axis” means that only 1 in the upper row (TAIL) and 1 in the lower row (WING) may be inoperative. Use the following procedure to verify that the associated flight control hydraulic valve(s) is open before dispatch.

numlitem.para: Supply electrical power to aircraft.
Check the position of the associated valve(s).
Make sure the applicable FLT CONTROL HYD POWER switch(es) on the P461 Pilot’s Overhead Maintenance Panel are in the NORM position.
For the applicable system, make sure the following circuit breakers are closed on the P180 DC Power Distribution Panel:
Gain access to the associated valve(s).
If shutoff valve is WING system 1, remove outboard aileron access panel 591BB on left wing to access the aileron/spoiler shutoff valve.
If shutoff valve is WING system 4, remove outboard aileron access panel 691BB on right wing to access the aileron/spoiler shutoff valve.
If shutoff valve is WING system 2 or 3, the associated aileron/spoiler shutoff valve is located at the rear spar through the opening of the left or right wing gear wheel well.

If the shutoff valve is TAIL 1, 2, 3, or 4, open access door 312A (Horizontal Stabilizer Jackscrew Access Door) to gain access to the area aft of the pressure bulkhead where the associated elevator/rudder shutoff valves are located.
Verify that the visual indicator lever on the associated shutoff valve motor is in the valve open position (POS 2).
Close the access door or panel and remove electrical power.

remarks.para: May be inoperative open.

placard.para: Placard on affected FLT CONTROL HYD POWER shutoff switch(es): "INOP OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Supply electrical power to aircraft.
Check the position of the associated valve(s).
Make sure the applicable FLT CONTROL HYD POWER switch(es) on the P461 Pilot’s Overhead Maintenance Panel are in the NORM position.
For the applicable system, make sure the following circuit breakers are closed on the P180 DC Power Distribution Panel:
Gain access to the associated valve(s).
If shutoff valve is WING system 1, remove outboard aileron access panel 591BB on left wing to access the aileron/spoiler shutoff valve.
If shutoff valve is WING system 4, remove outboard aileron access panel 691BB on right wing to access the aileron/spoiler shutoff valve.
If shutoff valve is WING system 2 or 3, the associated aileron/spoiler shutoff valve is located at the rear spar through the opening of the left or right wing gear wheel well.

If the shutoff valve is TAIL 1, 2, 3, or 4, open access door 312A (Horizontal Stabilizer Jackscrew Access Door) to gain access to the area aft of the pressure bulkhead where the associated elevator/rudder shutoff valves are located.

Verify that the visual indicator lever on the associated shutoff valve motor is in the valve open position (POS 2). If the visual indicator lever on the affected valve motor is in the valve closed position (POS 1), use the following procedure to secure valve(s) open:
For the applicable system(s), open and collar the appropriate circuit breakers on the P180 DC Power Distribution Panel:
Manually move the indicator lever to the valve open position (POS 2) on the inoperative shutoff valve(s).
Install lockwire on the indicator lever of the inoperative shutoff valve(s) to secure open.
Make sure the VALVE CLOSED indicator light(s) on P461 Pilot’s Overhead Maintenance Panel are off.
Close the access door or panels and remove electrical power.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided visual confirmation of proper rudder movement is made before each departure.

placard.para: Placard on rudder trim indicator: "RUD TRIM IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Perform visual check of surface movement:
Establish communications – flight deck to ground.

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Pressurize all four hydraulic systems.

entry.para: Rudder Pedal Full Left, then Full Right
Observe both upper and lower rudder deflection to left, then right.

note.para: Full rudder deflection is approximately ± 31.5°

numlitem.para: Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Rudder trim actuator is operative, and
Rudder trim is verified centered before each departure.
Before each takeoff, confirm rudder position is centered by checking that the rudder pedals are essentially centered and by checking the rudder position indication displayed on secondary EICAS.

placard.para: Placard on rudder trim indicator: "RUD TRIM IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: To verify the rudder trim actuator is operative.

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Supply electrical and hydraulic power to aircraft.
Select STAT on the EICAS display select panel to display the flight controls position indications on secondary EICAS.
Rotate the rudder trim control, located on the aisle stand, to NOSE LEFT.
On both Captain’s and First Officer’s sides, observe that left rudder pedals move forward and that right rudder pedals move aft.
Also observe that rudder position indications (upper and lower) on secondary EICAS indicate rudder moving to left.
Rotate the rudder trim control to NOSE RIGHT.
On both Captain’s and First Officer’s sides, observe that left rudder pedals move aft and that right rudder pedals move forward.
Also observe that rudder position indications (upper and lower) on secondary EICAS indicate rudder moving to right.

Return rudder trim to neutral position by rotating the rudder trim control as required until rudder pedals are aligned together and rudder position indication on EICAS shows rudder (upper and lower) centered.
Apply opaque tape over inoperative rudder trim indicator on aisle stand.
Restore aircraft to required configuration.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided remaining system is verified to be operative before each departure.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
STALL WARN SYS

placard.para: Placard on rudder trim indicator: "(L) or (R) STALL WARN SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

entry.para: Conduct confidence test * of left stall warning channel. If stick shaker(s) activate, dispatch is allowed. If left stall warning channel is inoperative, conduct confidence test of right stall warning channel. If stick shaker(s) activate, dispatch is allowed.

numlitem.para: Confidence tests of the stall warning system are activated by the CMCS using the MCDU as follows:
Press MENU key.
Press Line Select Key (LSK) 6L (<CMC)
Press LSK 2L (<CONFIDENCE TESTS)
Press LSK 1L (<STALL L SHAKER) or LSK 2L (<STALL R SHAKER) as appropriate.

note.para: A single stall warning computer activates both stick shakers. If one stall warning channel does not function at all, no deactivation procedure is required.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
STALL WARN SYS

placard.para: Placard on rudder trim indicator: "(L) or (R) STICK SHAKER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided visual confirmation of proper elevator movement is made before each departure.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ELEV POS IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Perform visual check of surface movement:

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Pressurize all four hydraulic systems.

entry.para: Control Column Full Aft, then Full Forward
Observe all four elevators up, down.

note.para: Outboard elevator deflection will be approximately 23° up, 17° down. Inboard elevator deflection will be approximately 25° up, 16° down.

numlitem.para: Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

item.title: Stabilizer Trim/ Rudder Ratio Changer Modules (SRM) – Stabilizer Trim Control

remarks.para: Stabilizer trim control in one module may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Horizontal stabilizer is verified to be operative with the Alternate Stab Trim Switches, and
Rudder ratio control in both modules are operative.

note.para: If Stabilizer Trim control in the other SRM fails, autopilot will not be available.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
STAB AUTO CUTOUT
STAB AUTO TRIM
STAB TRIM

numlitem.para: Manual stabilizer trim control is available from either control wheel trim switch. However, stabilizer will move at one-half drive speed.
Autotrim may be affected as follows:

In cruise, if the left SRM stabilizer trim control is inoperative, the left autopilot will not engage because the left FCC will not receive a valid signal from the SRM. Similarly, the right autopilot will not engage if the right SRM trim control is inoperative.

After arming APP mode when autoland status displays LAND 2 or LAND 3, the FCCs ignore the SRM valid signal input, allowing all autopilots to engage. Normal (half-rate) autotrim control is retained by the fully operative SRM.
Speed Stability Trim and Mach Trim are operative.

Inflight failure of the other SRM, or stabilizer trim control in the other SRM, will result in the loss of all autotrim capability and possible loss of all autotrim capability and possible loss of manual trim from both of the control wheel trim switches. Stabilizer trim control may only be available through the Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches.

The EICAS advisory message >STAB TRIM 2 or >STAB TRIM 3 may remain displayed. Also, the message may be cleared when the stabilizer is moved with the Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches and reappear when using the control wheel trim switches due to half drive speed stabilizer movement.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 2.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "STAB TRIM CONTROL IN L (R) SRM INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Provide electrical power to aircraft and pressurize hydraulic systems 2 and 3.
Check that stabilizer is operative with the Alternate Stabilizer Trim switches:

note.para: During the following tests, the EICAS advisory messages >STAB TRIM 2 and >STAB TRIM 3 will display, along with the status message STAB TRIM. If both advisory messages >STAB TRIM 2 and >STAB TRIM 3 remain displayed at the conclusion of the tests, dispatch is not allowed.

numlitem.para: Ensure stabilizer trim cutout switches and cutout valves operate normally:
Select STAB TRIM 2 CUT OUT and STAB TRIM 3 CUT OUT position on the guarded Stabilizer Trim Cutout Switches located on the control stand.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches located on the control stand, select APL NOSE UP for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm the stabilizer does not move. If the stabilizer does move, dispatch is not allowed until repairs are made.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches, select APL NOSE DN for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm the stabilizer does not move. If the stabilizer does move, dispatch is not allowed until repairs are made.
Close the guards on both the STAB TRIM 2 and STAB TRIM 3 Stabilizer Trim Cutout Switches.
Check that no alternate trim solenoid valve is failed in the energized position:

Move the left Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switch in both the aircraft nose up and aircraft nose down directions. Verify the stabilizer does not move. If the stabilizer does move, an arm or control solenoid valve within a STCM (Stabilizer Trim Control Module) is failed in the energized position and dispatch is not allowed until repairs are made.

Move the right Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switch in both the aircraft nose up and aircraft nose down directions. Verify the stabilizer does not move. If the stabilizer does move, an arm or control solenoid valve within a STCM (Stabilizer Trim Control Module) is failed in the energized position and dispatch is not allowed until repairs are made.

note.para: If the EICAS advisory message >STAB TRIM 2 is displayed, perform step D before step C below:

numlitem.para: Ensure stabilizer is operative using Hydraulic System 2 as follows:
Select STAB TRIM 3 CUT OUT position on the guarded Stabilizer Trim Cutout Switch located on the control stand.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches, select APL NOSE UP for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm motion of stabilizer in aircraft nose up direction. Note that the stabilizer will move at one half drive speed. If the stabilizer does not move, dispatch is not allowed.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches, select APL NOSE DN for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm motion of stabilizer in aircraft nose down direction. Note that the stabilizer will move at one half drive speed. If the stabilizer does not move, dispatch is not allowed.
Close the guard on the STAB TRIM 3 Stabilizer Trim Cutout Switch.
Ensure stabilizer is operative using Hydraulic System 3 as follows:
Select STAB TRIM 2 CUT OUT position on the guarded Stabilizer Trim Cutout Switch located on the control stand.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches, select APL NOSE UP for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm motion of stabilizer in aircraft nose up direction. Note that the stabilizer will move at one half drive speed. If the stabilizer does not move, dispatch is not allowed.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches, select APL NOSE DN for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm motion of stabilizer in aircraft nose down direction. Note that the stabilizer will move at one half drive speed. If the stabilizer does not move, dispatch is not allowed.
Close the guard on the STAB TRIM 2 Stabilizer Trim Cutout Switch.

Dispatch is not allowed with rudder ratio control inoperative in either the left or right SRM. To confirm that rudder ratio control is functioning properly in both modules, verify EICAS status message RUDDER RATIO is not displayed.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided Alternate Stabilizer Trim System is verified to be operative before each departure.

numlitem.para: Before each departure, verify the Alternate Stab Trim System is operative:

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches located on the control stand, select APL NOSE UP for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm the stabilizer moves in the nose up direction.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches located on the control stand, select APL NOSE DN for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm the stabilizer moves in the nose down direction.

note.para: The remaining control wheel stab trim switch may be verified to be operative by applying manual trim input in each direction for at least 3 seconds and observing corresponding stabilizer motion.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "CAPTS (F/O) STAB TRIM SWITCHES INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative (including multiple greenband indication) provided faulty indicator is not visible.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
STAB GREENBAND

placard.para: Placard over faulty stabilizer trim indicator ensuring indication is obscured: "STAB TRIM IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Perform check of stabilizer movement:

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Pressurize hydraulic systems 2 and 3.

Hold the STAB TRIM ALTN switches on the control stand to the APL NOSE UP position until the stabilizer stops moving. Check that the operating stabilizer trim indicator reads 14.60 to 14.90 units of trim.
Hold the STAB TRIM ALTN switches to the APL NOSE DN position until the stabilizer stops moving. Check that the operating stabilizer trim indicator reads 0.10 to 0.40 units of trim.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided stabilizer trim position is properly set before each departure for the actual aircraft weight, center of gravity and takeoff thrust setting.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
>STAB GREENBAND
STAB GREENBAND
Steps 1, 2 and 3 are accomplished only at initial time of Nose Gear Pressure Switch deferral and does not need to be accomplished on subsequent flights with this item deferred.

numlitem.para: The Captain and Load Supervisor will confirm Automated Scales were used for weighing the containers.

note.para: If Automated Scales were not used, the aircraft load must be removed and reweighed.

numlitem.para: The Captain and Load Supervisor will visually verify all Main Deck container numbers and positions match the Load Plan.
The Captain and Load Supervisor will visually verify the correct container numbers in door position of both forward and aft lower cargo compartments.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to Capt’s and F/O’s stabilizer trim indicator: "NOSE GEAR PRESS SW INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: STAB GREENBAND status level (and advisory level) message indicates that the nose gear pressure switch disagrees with the selected greenband, or an invalid CG has been entered into the MCDU. Invalid CG values are CG < 8.5 or CG > 33.0. If the message is due to an invalid CG input, the greenband indications on the Stabilizer Trim Indicators will not be illuminated. If the message is due to disagreement between the Nose Pressure Switch and the selected greenband, either the NOSE UP or NOSE DOWN greenband indications will be illuminated.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative or removed provided:

numlitem.para: It is verified that flap position RVDT sensors are operative before each departure,
For PW and GE, if right FCU is inoperative or removed, No. 1 demand pump is selected ON during takeoff and landing, and
For PW and GE, if left FCU is inoperative or removed, No. 4 demand pump is selected ON during takeoff and landing.

note.para: If S/B 747-34-2349 or production equivalent has not been incorporated and center FCU is inoperative or removed, MODE 4 of the ground proximity warning system is considered inoperative.
S/B 747-34-2349 has been accomplished on UPS aircraft.

caution.para: IF EICAS STATUS MESSAGE "FLAP SYS MONITOR" IS DISPLAYED, A BLOCK TURN BACK IS REQUIRED.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FLAP CONTROL ___

numlitem.para: Triple channel autoland may not be available with an inoperative or removed FCU. If triple channel autoland is not available, status message NO LAND 3 will be displayed.

When operating with an inoperative or removed FCU, if the flight director is selected to the FCC associated with the inoperative or removed FCU channel, the flight director will not be displayed at speeds below 60 knots. Each FCC receives inputs from the associated FCU channel.
The FMC scratch pad message PERF/VNAV UNAVAILABLE may be displayed.
With an inoperative removed L or R FCU, the EICAS advisory message >IDLE DISAGREE may be displayed in flight when selecting idle thrust with flaps not in landing position and engine anti-ice off.
If right FCU is inoperative or removed, select Demand Pump 1 ON for takeoff and landing.
If left FCU is inoperative or removed, select Demand Pump 4 ON for takeoff and landing.

note.para: Display of the EICAS advisory message >IDLE DISAGREE on the ground indicates failure of the ground minimum idle selection system and MEL Item 73-21-1 should be used.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 2.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "L (C or R) FCU INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: The FCU's are interchangeable.
AD 2005-04-03 requires at least one operative FCU. Needs to be P/N 285U0011-208 in accordance with SB 747-27A2386.
SB 747-27A2386 has been accomplished on all UPS aircraft.

numlitem.para: If status message FLAP CONTROL__ is displayed:

Verify RVDT sensors are operative. This is accomplished by ensuring status message FLAP SYS MONITOR is not displayed. If FLAP SYS MONITOR is not displayed, no additional maintenance action is required unless FCU interchange is elected due to an inoperative GPWS MODE 4.
If the center FCU is inoperative and interchange is necessary for GPWS MODE 4 operation:
Open circuit breakers listed in Step 2. A. (2) below and exchange either the left or right FCU with the center unit.
Close the previously opened circuit breakers.
After interchange, EICAS Status Message FLAP CONTROL __ will re-display to the inoperative FCU position.
If status message FLAP SYS MONITOR is displayed:
Verify the RVDT sensors are operative as follows:
Access CMC Existing Faults for >27 FLAP CONTROL. If any of the following faults are present, all three FCUs detect an RVDT fault. Dispatch is not allowed.
LE_SWITCH FAIL
_RVDT FAIL

Access CMC Existing Faults for >27 FLAP CONTROL. If any of the following faults are present, either an FCU fault or an FCU detected RVDT fault has occurred and the following procedure must be accomplished to verify the RVDT sensors are operative:
_RVDT – FCU-_INTERFACE FAIL
FLAP 26 VAC-_>FCU-_INTERFACE FAIL
Open the following circuit breakers on the P7 panel.
Label each FCU with LEFT, RIGHT and CENTER identification marks so their original location remains known.
Remove the FCU that corresponds to the above reported Interface Fail faults.
Close the above circuit breakers. Verify FLAP SYS MONITOR status message does not appear within 30 seconds. If FLAP SYS MONITOR message appears, dispatch is not allowed.
Open the above circuit breakers and remove one of the FCUs which is still installed. Install this FCU in the vacant slot of the previously removed unit.
Close the above circuit breakers.
Wait a minimum of 30 seconds, if FLAP SYS MONITOR message appears, an RVDT sensor fault is confirmed and dispatch is not allowed
If FLAP SYS MONITOR message does not appear, RVDT sensors are verified to be operative. The removed FCU is classified inoperative.
Open the above circuit breakers and replace the two operable FCUs in their original EE shelf slot. Do not replace the inoperative FCU.

note.para: If the center FCU is inoperative and interchange is necessary for GPWS MODE 4 operation, move either the left or right unit to the removed center FCUs position at this time.

numlitem.para: Close the above circuit breakers. Status message FLAP CONTROL__ will re-display to the removed FCUs position.

caution.para: IF FLAP SYS MONITOR REMAINS DISPLAYED, DISPATCH IS NOT ALLOWED.

item.title: TE Flap Drive System – No-Coast Drag Brake

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Flap Drive Torque Tube and No-Coast Drag Brake support bracket are verified to be undamaged before each departure,
Flap control handle remains in agreement with flap position when hydraulics are unpressurized and Alternate Flaps Arm Switch remains OFF during ground operations in the terminal ramp area, and
Repairs are made within three flight days.

placard.para: Placard near alternate flap switch on center instrument panel: "ALTN FLAPS ARM SWITCH – LEAVE OFF IN RAMP AREA". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Prior to each flight, the following verification procedure must be accomplished:

numlitem.para: Examine the Flap Drive Torque Tube at its connection to the No-Coast Drag Brake. Ensure that there is no evidence of damage.
Examine the Flap Drive Torque Tube where it passes through the body to wing air seal. Ensure that there is no evidence of damage.
Examine the No-Coast Drag Brake. Ensure that there is no evidence of damage to its support bracket.

maintenance.para: If there is abnormal wear or damage evident, dispatch is not allowed.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: System is deactivated, and
AA Data performance decrements are applied.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
SPEED BRAKE AUTO

numlitem.para: For rejected takeoff (RTO) or landing, deploy speed brakes manually.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 2.
Refer to AA landing data for auto spoilers inoperative.

placard.para: Placard near speedbrake level: "AUTO GRD SPOILERS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open and collar circuit breaker for SPEEDBRAKE AUTO CONT.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

remarks.para: May be inoperative in the GROUND position provided speed brake lever is not moved beyond the FLIGHT position during flight.

numlitem.para: Observe FLIGHT detent when speed brakes are used in flight.

note.para: If lever is inadvertently extended to the UP position in flight, aircraft will pitch nose-up, since the two outboard spoilers on each side (which do not deploy in FLIGHT detent) will be deployed.

placard.para: Placard near speedbrake lever: "OBSERVE FLT DETENT – SOLENOID INOP". Enter item in aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open P7 panel SPEEDBRAKE FLT DETENT circuit breaker.
If speed brake lever cannot be moved from DOWN to full UP position:
Remove ceiling panel 211E, forward of main entry door No. 1, approximately at the aircraft centerline.
Disconnect electrical wire from solenoid.

Move solenoid or solenoid actuated lever lock to the relaxed “on the ground” position so that speed brake lever is free to move to full UP position. Remove solenoid (if required) and lockwire (if required).
Re-install ceiling panel.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided visual confirmation of proper spoiler movement is made before each departure.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "SPOILER POS IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Perform visual check of surface movement:

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Establish communications – flight deck to ground.
Pressurize all four hydraulic systems:

entry.para: Observe that left wing spoilers extend.
Observe that right wing spoilers extend.

note.para: The most inboard spoilers will not extend, the second most inboard will extend approximately 20°, outboard four will extend approximately 45°.

numlitem.para: Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All electric drives are operative, and
Takeoff obstacle clearance is not required upon retraction of flaps from takeoff position.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
LE SINGLE DRIVE

numlitem.para: With one pneumatic drive inoperative, the caution message FLAPS PRIMARY will be displayed during flap operation. The FLAPS PRIMARY message indicates a temporary LE Flap disagreement as a result of slower electrical actuation of the affected LE Flap panels. At the completion of flap motion, with all panels in commanded position, FLAPS PRIMARY will extinguish. Dispatch with FLAPS PRIMARY displayed, or the status message LE MULT DRIVE, is prohibited.
After Takeoff:
Leave flaps in takeoff position until obstacle clearance is assured.
Retract flaps with the flap lever using normal procedures. (The affected leading edge flaps will automatically be retracted electrically at a slower rate than the pneumatic flaps).
If “Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA)” is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.

placard.para: Placard near flap lever: "NUMBER ___ L (R) PNEU DR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Check operation of the leading edge electric drives as follows:

warning.para: ENSURE PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: If all leading edge and trailing edge flaps are not fully retracted, retract them using the flap lever.
To inhibit trailing edge motion and leading edge pneumatic motion, open the following circuit breakers on the P6 panel:

entry.para: PRI LE FLAP DR CONT GRP A (AC)
PRI LE FLAP DR CONT GRP B (AC)

caution.para: DO NOT ELECTRICALLY EXTEND OR RETRACT THE FLAPS MORE THAN ONE TIME IN 5 MINUTES. DAMAGE TO THE MOTOR CAN OCCUR IF THE MOTOR BECOMES TOO HOT.

numlitem.para: Move the flap lever to 5:

The leading edge flaps should remain stationary for approximately 15 seconds, and then extend electrically. Verify that all leading edge flaps extend by observing the EICAS non-normal (expanded) flap display and by observing the flap panels.

note.para: The Caution message FLAPS DRIVE and the status messages LE MULT DRIVE and TE FLAPS will remain displayed on EICAS following this step.

numlitem.para: Move the flap lever to UP:

The leading edge flaps should remain stationary for approximately 15 seconds, and then retract electrically. Verify that all leading edge flaps retract fully by observing the EICAS display and the flap panels.
Close the 5 circuit breakers opened in step B.
Press the ALT FLAPS arm switch. Press the arm switch again and verify the messages FLAPS DRIVE, LE MULT DRIVE, and TE FLAPS are extinguished.

note.para: Status message LE MULT DRIVE may be latched by a single pneumatically inoperative Flap Drive unit. If LE MULT DRIVE remains displayed at conclusion of the maintenance procedure above, dispatch may still be available by accomplishing the steps below and verifying the message was latched by a single pneumatically inoperative Flap drive unit.

The following procedure may be used to verify that LE MULT DRIVE was latched by a single pneumatically inoperative Flap drive unit. If LE MULT DRIVE remains annunciated at the conclusion of the verification procedure, dispatch is not allowed.

warning.para: LEADING AND TRAILING EDGE FLAPS WILL OPERATE. ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Apply power to Flap Control Units (FCUs).
Apply hydraulic and pneumatic power to the flaps.
Move the flap lever to the “UP” detent and wait until the flaps are fully retracted.
Open and close the following circuit breakers located on the P7 panel:
7C10 FLT CONT ELEC 2L AC
7C11 FLT CONT ELEC 2L DC
7C12 FLT CONT ELEC 1L AC
7C13 FLT CONT ELEC 1L DC
7C14 FLT CONT ELEC 1R AC
7C15 FLT CONT ELEC 1R DC
7C16 FLT CONT ELEC 2R AC
7C17 FLT CONT ELEC 2R AC
Verify that all flap related EICAS messages and all existing flap related CMC faults are no longer displayed.
Move the flap lever to the “5” detent and wait until the flaps fully extend. Affected leading edge flaps will operate in the primary electric mode.

caution.para: DO NOT ELECTRICALLY EXTEND OR RETRACT THE FLAPS MORE THAN ONE TIME IN 5 MINUTES. DAMAGE TO THE MOTOR CAN OCCUR IF THE MOTOR BECOMES TOO HOT.

numlitem.para: Verify that LE MULT DRIVE is not displayed.
Move the flap lever to the “UP” detent and wait until the flaps fully retract. Affected leading edge flaps will operate in the primary electric mode.
Verify that LE MULT DRIVE is not displayed.

note.para: Dispatch is not allowed if LE MULT DRIVE was displayed at any time after the circuit breakers were open and closed by Step 4 above.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All pneumatic drives are operative, and
Associated electric drive is deactivated.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
LE SINGLE DRIVE

placard.para: Placard near flap lever: "NUMBER ___ L (R) ELEC DR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deactivate the associated electric drive.

numlitem.para: Extend the leading edge flaps pneumatically (AMM 27-81-00).
Check the Primary EICAS Display to ensure that all leading edge flaps are extended to the correct position.
Remove pneumatic power (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Open the following circuit breakers and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE tags:

entry.para: PRI LE FLAP CONT GRP A AC
PRI LE FLAP CONT GRP A DC
PRI LE FLAP CONT GRP B AC
PRI LE FLAP CONT GRP A DC
LE FLAP ELEC CONT GRP B
LE FLAP ELEC CONT GRP A
LE FLAP ELEC CONT GRP A
LE FLAP ELEC CONT GRP A

numlitem.para: Locate the associated electric drive motor in the leading edge wing cavity, remove and securely stow alternate drive motor’s electrical connector.
Close circuit breakers opened above.

item.title: Leading Edge Flaps Retraction System – (Reverser Actuated)
