remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard near flap lever: "L/E RETRACTION SYS (REV ACTUATED) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Leading Edge Flaps System Position Monitor

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "L/E FLAPS SYS POS IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: There is no evidence of leakage, and
Alternate procedures are used to prevent water accumulation in associated tank.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "SUMP DRAIN VALVE FOR ___ TANK INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: See illustration for location of fuel sump drain valves.
Visually inspect exterior of associated valve for evidence of fuel leakage.
Use alternate procedures to prevent water accumulation in the associated tank.

note.para: One alternate procedure is to check the refuel service equipment for moisture accumulation before and after each refuel operation.

item.title: FUEL SCAVENGE PUMP (ELECTRIC) – CENTER TANK EMPTY

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated provided center tank remains empty.

note.para: The EICAS status message FUEL SCAV PUMP will be displayed and latched when the fuel scavenge pump is commanded on.
The EICAS advisory message >SCAV PUMP ON may be displayed on the ground (due to failure of the pump low pressure indicating switch S314).

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "SCAVENGE PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the inoperative pump by opening and collaring the SCAV PUMP circuit breaker located on the P414 panel (row M2).

item.title: FUEL SCAVENGE PUMP (ELECTRIC) – CENTER TANK WITH FUEL

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated provided the first 3,000 lbs (1360 kg) of center tank fuel is included as part of Zero Fuel Weight and is considered unusable.

note.para: If fuel is loaded in the center tank, the first 3,000 lbs of fuel loaded in the center tank is considered unusable, must be considered as payload, and must be accounted for during flight planning and for weight and balance calculations.
The EICAS status message FUEL SCAV PUMP will be displayed and latched when the fuel scavenge pump is commanded on.
The EICAS advisory message >SCAV PUMP ON may be displayed on the ground (due to failure of the pump low pressure indicating switch S314).

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "SCAVENGE PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the inoperative pump by opening and collaring the SCAV PUMP circuit breaker located on the P414 panel (row M2).

item.title: Hydro-mechanical Fuel Scavenge Systems – Center Tank Empty

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Center tank remains empty, and
Center tank quantity indication is operative.
Center tank must remain empty.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "SCAVENGE PUMPS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The hydro-mechanical system includes two jet pumps and two float valves in each system. If the pump is inoperative or either float valve is inoperative closed, that system will not transfer fuel from the center tank making the system inoperative. With either float valve inoperative open, it may be necessary to deactivate system to prevent the unwanted fuel transfer from center wing tank to inboard main tank(s).

numlitem.para: Defuel the center tank using the pressure defueling procedure and drain the remaining center tank fuel (approximately 125 gallons) through the sump drain (AMM 28-26-00/201).
If it is necessary to deactivate system, remove the fuel strainers per DMP 28-15-2-0-2.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided the first 3,000 lbs (1,360 kgs) of center tank fuel is included as part of Zero Fuel Weight and is considered unusable.

note.para: With two float valves inoperative open, it will be necessary to deactivate the associated system(s).

When the FUEL PRESS CTR L or R alerting messages are displayed and related override/jettison pumps are turned off, 3,000 lbs. of fuel will be trapped (unusable) in the center tank. Ensure load manifest includes adjusted ZFW.

numlitem.para: First 3,000 pounds of fuel is included as part of the Zero Fuel Weight and is considered unusable.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "SCAVENGE PUMPS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Defuel the center tank using the pressure defueling procedure and drain the remaining center tank fuel (approximately 125 gallons) through the sump drain (AMM 28-26-00/201).
Deactivate the Fuel Scavenge Systems.

note.para: Steps to remove the left fuel strainer are given. Steps to remove the right fuel strainer are the same.

numlitem.para: Go into the left wheel well for the wing landing gear.
Access the fuel strainer housing on the rear spar of the center wing tank.
Position fluid absorbent pad (or something similar) below the fuel strainer housing.
Put a suitable 5 gallon (19 Liters) fuel resistant container below the fuel strainer housing.
The quantity of fuel that can drain our of the fuel strainer housing is 9.0 fl-oz.
Do these steps to remove the fuel strainer:
Remove the lockwire from the strainer cap.

warning.para: be prepared to re-install the cap on the fuel strainer housing and contain any fuel that can spill. if the shut-off mechanism for the strainer housing fails, fuel from the fuel-feed manifold can drain through the strainer housing port. a fuel spill can cause a fire or an explosion.

numlitem.para: Remove the strainer cap and the washer (solid disk inside the strainer cap).
Remove the fuel strainer.
Remove and discard the O-ring.
Do these steps to reassemble the fuel strainer housing:

para.emphasis: Do not install the fuel strainer or washer.

numlitem.para: Lubricate a new O-ring with petrolatum grease.
Install the O-ring on the strainer cap.
Install the strainer cap into the fuel strainer housing.
Torque the strainer cap to 250 in-lb. (28.2 Nm).
Lockwire the strainer cap to the housing body.
Do these steps again at the right fuel strainer housing.
Prepare the fuel strainers and washers for storage:
Inspect the fuel strainer and washer for damage.
Discard the component(s) if there is damage. Contact AMC if any parts are damaged or discarded.
Clean the fuel strainer with water or air pressure (90 psi (621kPa) maximum).
Identify, place parts in plastic bag and store the fuel strainers and washers in PFM box.
Fuel Strainer Housing Leak Check:
Make sure that one main tank contains a minimum of 2500 lb. (1134 kg) of fuel (sufficient fuel to operate a fuel boost pump).
Add or transfer fuel if it is necessary.
Set the crossfeed valve switches to the ON position.

warning.para: do not operate a fuel pump if the low pressure light comes on and stays on. this condition can cause the ignition of the fuel fumes in the fuel tank. a fire or an explosion can cause injuries to personnel and damage to equipment.

numlitem.para: To operate any of the fuel pumps, you must be in the flight compartment to continuously monitor the low pressure indication and the fuel quantity in the fuel tank.
Immediately set the applicable fuel pump switch(es) to the off position if the amber PRESS light comes on and stays on.
Do an external leak check for the fuel strainer cap:
Set one or more of the boost pump switches to the ON position.

note.para: The boost pump switches are found on the fuel management control module, M154.

numlitem.para: Operate the boost pump(s) for 5 minutes.
Monitor the left and right fuel strainer housing for leaks.
After 5 minutes, set the boost pump(s) to the OFF position.
Set the crossfeed valves to the OFF position.
Visually examine the two strainer caps for leaks.

caution.para: NO FUEL LEAKS ARE ALLOWED AT THE FUEL STRAINER HOUSINGS.

item.title: HYDRO-MECHANICAL FUEL SCAVENGE SYSTEMS – WITHOUT SB 747-28-2255 INCORPORATED

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

note.para: With either float valve for one system inoperative open, it may be necessary to deactivate the associated system unless center tank remains empty.

numlitem.para: Center tank must remain empty.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "____ SCAVENGE PUMP(S) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

para.emphasis: For N578UP-N579UP (For aircraft without SB 747-400-28-2255 incorporated or Production Equivalent PRR 85580-R)

note.para: Each of the two hydro-mechanical fuel scavenge systems include two jet pumps located in the CWT and two float valves; One valve located in the CWT and one valve located in the associated inboard main tank. For a system with both jet pumps inoperative or either float valve inoperative closed, that system will not transfer fuel from the center wing tank, making the system inoperative. With either float valve inoperative open, it may be necessary to deactivate the system to prevent the unwanted fuel transfer from center wing tank to the associated inboard main tank.

numlitem.para: Defuel the center tank using the pressure defueling procedure and drain the remaining center tank fuel (approximately 125 gallons) through the sump drain (AMM 28-26-00/201).
If it is necessary to deactivate system, remove the fuel strainers (AMM 28-15-00/201).

item.title: HYDRO-MECHANICAL FUEL SCAVENGE SYSTEMS – FLOAT VALVE OPERATIVE

remarks.para: One system may be inoperative provided associated main fuel tank float valve is operative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "SCAVENGE PUMPS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: HYDRO-MECHANICAL FUEL SCAVENGE SYSTEMS – FLOAT VALVE INOPERATIVE CLOSED

remarks.para: One system may be inoperative provided associated main fuel tank float valve is inoperative closed.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "SCAVENGE PUMPS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: HYDRO-MECHANICAL FUEL SCAVENGE SYSTEMS – FLOAT VALVE INOPERATIVE OPEN

remarks.para: One main fuel tank float valve may be inoperative open provided associated system is deactivated.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "SCAVENGE PUMPS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Defuel the center tank using the pressure defueling procedure and drain the remaining center tank fuel (approximately 125 gallons) through the sump drain (AMM 28-26-00/201).
Deactivate left or right system by removing the appropriate fuel strainer per DMP 28-15-2-0-2.

remarks.para: One per tank may be inoperative deactivated closed (with reserve tanks fueled) provided:

numlitem.para: Zero Fuel Weight CG limit is 2% MAC forward of the Aft Limit, and
If fuel in reserve tanks 2 or 3 does not transfer, observe 325 KCAS/0.92M speed limitation for remainder of flight.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
RES ___ XFR VLV

numlitem.para: Plan required fuel load considering that fuel may become trapped in affected reserve tank.
Observe fuel quantity indication and verify fuel transfer from reserve tanks when either Main Tank #2 or #3 quantity is reduced below 40,000 lbs.
If fuel in either reserve tank does not transfer, limit Vmo/Mmo to 325 KCAS/.92 Mach.

note.para: Lateral imbalance due to one reserve tank full and one reserve tank empty is less than the maximum lateral imbalance allowable.

numlitem.para: Zero Fuel Weight CG is limited to 2% MAC forward of the aft CG limit.

placard.para: Install Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "RESERVE #2 and #3 RESERVE TRANSFER VALVES INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: To deactivate affected valve(s):

numlitem.para: Open the associated circuit breaker(s):
For Reserve 2A and/or 3A transfer valves, open the P7 panel FUEL XFR VALVE RES 2A & 3A circuit breaker.
For Reserve 2B and/or 3B transfer valves, open the P7 panel FUEL XFR VALVE RES 2B & 3B circuit breaker.
Access actuator by extending and deactivating outboard trailing edge flaps (AMM 27-51-00/201).
Disconnect, cap and stow electrical connector from affected valve(s) (AMM 28-16-01/401).
Position manual override lever for affected valve(s) in the CLOSED position and lockwire.
Close the P7 panel FUEL XFR VALVE RES 2A & 3A and FUEL XFR VALVE RES 2B & 3B circuit breakers.

item.title: Reserve 2 and 3 Fuel Transfer Valves – Converted Freighter

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Reserve tanks 2 and 3 remain empty, and
Maximum Takeoff Weight is limited to 740,000 lbs. (335,664 kg)

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
RES ____ XFR VLV

numlitem.para: CWT fuel included as part of ZFW may be used en route.
Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Reserve tanks 2 and 3 must remain empty.
All tanks (except reserve tanks 2 and 3) may be fueled to capacity, provided takeoff weight does not exceed 740,000 lbs.
Center wing tank (CWT) fuel must be included as part of the ZFW but may be used en route.

placard.para: Install Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "RESERVE #2 AND #3 RESERVE TRANSFER VALVES INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Reserve 2 and 3 Fuel Transfer Valves – Reserve Tanks 2 and 3 Empty

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Reserve tanks 2 and 3 remain empty, and
Maximum Takeoff Weight is limited to 785,000 lbs (356,070 kg).

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
RES ___ XFR VLV

numlitem.para: CWT fuel included as part of ZFW may be used en route.
Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Reserve tanks 2 and 3 must remain empty.
All tanks (except reserve tanks 2 and 3) may be fueled to capacity, provided takeoff weight does not exceed 785,000 lbs. (-400F) or 740,000 lbs. (-400BCF).
Center wing tank (CWT) fuel must be included as part of ZFW but may be used en route.

placard.para: Install Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "RESERVE #2 and #3 RESERVE TRANSFER VALVES INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative open provided alternate refueling procedures are established and used.

note.para: For an inoperative refuel valve indicator light, the associated refuel valve is considered inoperative.
Any function of the Fueling Control Panel that is operative may be used.
Additional Deferral Required – REFUEL VALVE.

numlitem.para: For operations with a refuel valve failed open in reserve tanks 2 or 3, maximum takeoff weight may not exceed the lessor of:
OR
The landing climb limit weight at the departure airport plus 17,000 lbs of additional fuel.
For operation with a refuel valve failed open in main tanks 1 or 4, the maximum takeoff weight may not exceed the maximum ZFW.

placard.para: Refer to Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 28-21-1-0-1 for placard procedures. Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: If a refuel valve has failed closed, the valve may be operated manually using the manual override screw as follows:
Depressurize fueling manifold.
Gain access to affected refuel valve control unit as follows:

entry.para: Trailing edge lower access panel 572GB (outboard valve) or 571AB (inboard valve).
Trailing edge lower access panel 672GB (outboard valve) or 671AB (inboard valve).

numlitem.para: Turn override screw (do not remove screw retainer) in the open direction (10 to 13 full revolutions will be required). Initial screw rotation, as well as last few turns to full open, may be difficult.
Begin manual mode fueling. When fuel in tank is at desired quantity, set the refuel nozzle adapter’s manual shutoff valve lever(s) (located at the fueling station) to the off position.
Close refuel valve by turning override screw in CLOSE direction, 10 to 13 revolutions.
Placard (at P42 fueling control panel) FUEL VALVE INOP.
If a main tank refuel valve cannot be open, tank may be fueled through overwing fill port (AMM 12-11-01/301).

If a refuel valve has failed open and cannot be manually closed, pressure fuel aircraft , using manual mode, until affected tank is full or filled to desired level. Use overwing filling for the remainder of the fueling operation (AMM 12-11-01/301).
All main tank 1 and 4 boost pumps must be operative.
Fuel jettison system be considered inoperative. Deactivate the jettison system per steps listed below:

Center wing tank and main tanks 2 and 3 jettison/transfer valves must be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-31-04/401).
Jettison nozzle valves must be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-31-05/401).
Main tanks 1 and 4 transfer valves must be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-16-04/401).
Gain access to transfer valves through upper wing access panel 573AT (673AT).
Remove and stow the associated electrical connector DV55 (DV50).

Position the associated actuator manual override lever to the closed position. For the #1 transfer valve, the valve is closed with the lever on the inboard side and positioned down. For the #4 transfer valve, the valve is closed with the lever on the inboard side and positioned up.
Secure the manual override lever with locking wire.
Refit the access panel.
Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "JETTISON SYSTEM INOP". Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative open provided:

numlitem.para: Alternate refueling procedures are established and used,
Fuel jettison system is considered inoperative, and
Stabilizer and auxiliary tanks (if installed) remain empty.

note.para: Stabilizer and Auxiliary tanks are not installed on UPS aircraft.
Additional Deferral Required – FUEL JETTISON SYSTEM.

numlitem.para: Fuel jettison system must be considered inoperative.
For operations with a refuel valve failed open in reserve tanks 2 or 3, maximum takeoff weight may not exceed the lessor of:
OR
The landing climb limit weight at the departure airport plus 17,000 lbs. of additional fuel.
For operation with a refuel valve failed open in main tanks 1 or 4, the maximum takeoff weight may not exceed the maximum ZFW.

placard.para: Refer to Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 28-21-1-1-1 for placard procedures. Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: If a refuel valve has failed closed, the valve may be operated manually using the manual override screw as follows:
Depressurize fueling manifold.
Gain access to affected refuel valve control unit as follows:

entry.para: Trailing edge lower access panel 572GB (outboard valve) or 571AB (inboard valve).
Trailing edge lower access panel 672GB (outboard valve) or 671AB (inboard valve).

numlitem.para: Turn override screw (do not remove screw retainer) in the open direction (10 to 13 full revolutions will be required). Initial screw rotation, as well as last few turns to full open, may be difficult.
Begin manual mode fueling. When fuel in tank is at desired quantity, set the refuel nozzle adapter's manual shutoff valve lever(s) (located at the fueling station) to the off position.
Close refuel valve by turning override screw in CLOSE direction, 10 to 13 revolutions.
Placard (at P42 fueling control panel) FUEL VALVE INOP.
If a main tank refuel valve cannot be open, tank may be fueled through overwing fill port (AMM 12-11-01/301).

If a refuel valve has failed open and cannot be manually closed, pressure fuel aircraft, using manual mode, until affected tank is full or filled to desired level. Use overwing filling for the remainder of the fueling operation (AMM 12-11-01/301).
All main tank 1 and 4 boost pumps must be operative.
Fuel jettison system must be considered inoperative. Deactivate the jettison system per steps listed below:

Center wing tank and main tanks 2 and 3 jettison/transfer valves must be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-31-04/401).
Jettison nozzle valves must be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-31-05/401).
Main tanks 1 and 4 transfer valves must be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-16-04/401).
Gain access to transfer valves through upper wing access panel 573AT (673AT).
Remove and stow the associated electrical connector DV55 (DV50).

Position the associated actuator manual override lever to the closed position. For the #1 transfer valve, the valve is closed with the lever on the inboard side and positioned down. For the #4 transfer valve, the valve is closed with the lever on the inboard side and positioned up.
Secure the manual override lever with locking wire.
Refit the access panel.
Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "JETTISON SYSTEM INOP". Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative closed provided:

numlitem.para: Alternate refueling procedures are established and used, and
For any center tank refuel valve inoperative closed, stabilizer and auxiliary tanks (if installed) remain empty.

note.para: Stabilizer and Auxiliary tanks are not installed on UPS aircraft.

placard.para: Refer to Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 28-21-1-0-1 for placard procedures. Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 28-21-1-0-1.

item.title: Pressure Fueling System – Volumetric Top-Off (VTO) Feature

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided alternate refueling procedures are established and used.

placard.para: Placard at refuel panel: "VOLUME TOP OFF FEATURE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: Each time aircraft is refueled the procedures below needs to be followed.

numlitem.para: At P415 panel in E&E, pull circuit breaker C00062 fuel overfill control.

caution.para: WITH OVERFILL CIRCUIT BREAKER PULLED, AIRCRAFT DOES NOT HAVE OVERFILL PROTECTION AND A FUEL SPILL CAN OCCUR IF NOT CONSTANTLY MONITORED DURING FUELING.

numlitem.para: Manually fuel aircraft starting with forward most tank(s): First (center), then next most forward tanks (2 and 3 main) and then tanks 1 and 4 last in order to prevent weight and balance concerns.

caution.para: FUEL DISTRIBUTION WILL NEED TO BE MANUALLY MONITORED.

numlitem.para: At P415 panel in E&E, reset circuit breaker C00062 fuel overfill control.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided alternate procedures are established and used for refueling associated fuel tank.

placard.para: Placard at refuel panel: "FUELING PRESELECT FEATURE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Manually fuel aircraft starting with forward most tank(s): First (center), then next most forward tanks (2 and 3 main) and then tanks 1 and 4 last in order to prevent weight and balance concerns.

caution.para: FUEL DISTRIBUTION WILL NEED TO BE MANUALLY MONITORED.

item.title: Pressure Fueling System – Fueling Power Control Switch (Fueling Panel)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided fueling panel is deactivated before each departure.

placard.para: Placard at refuel panel: "FUELING PWR CNTRL SW INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: If the fueling power control switch (S681) has failed such that power cannot be removed from the refueling control panel, deactivate the panel following refueling as follows:
Position the refueling control panel power switch to NORM.
Open and collar the P414 panel FUELING PWR (or FUELING LTS) circuit breaker.
Verify that power has been removed from the refueling control panel.
Close the refueling control panel access door.

item.title: PRESSURE FUELING SYSTEM – FUELING POWER CONTROL SWITCH (FUELING PANEL)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided the fuel control panel indicator test switch is operative when Refuel POWER Select Switch is used in the BATT position.

placard.para: Placard at refuel panel: "FUELING PWR CNTRL SW INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: If the fueling power control switch (S681) has failed such that power cannot be removed from the refueling control panel, deactivate the panel following refueling as follows:
Position the refueling control panel power switch to NORM.
Open and collar the P414 panel FUELING PWR (or FUELING LTS) circuit breaker.
Verify that power has been removed from the refueling control panel.
Close the refueling control panel access door.

remarks.para: May be inoperative (missing) provided no leakage can be detected after refueling is complete.

placard.para: Placard at refuel panel: "FUELING CAP MISSING". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Main Tank Boost Pumps Main Tank 1 and 4 Boost Pumps – Preferred Method

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All main tank 2 and 3 boost pumps are operative,
Main tanks 1 and 4 transfer valves are verified to be operative,
Fuel quantity indicating system for the associated tank is operative, and
The following minimum fuel quantities are retained in the associated tank for the flight conditions shown (normal fuel loading, balance and usage requirements still apply):

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL PUMP ___
Inoperative boost pump operations may require large amounts of fuel to be retained in the main fuel tanks for takeoff and landing. Payload and/or range restrictions may result.

Payload restrictions when operating short range flights can be minimized by dispatching in accordance with provisos as outlined in MEL for Main Tank Boost Pumps, Main Tank 1 and 4 Boost pumps with a minimum CWT Fuel of 17,000 lbs.

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
For operation with a Main Tank 1 or 4 boost pump inoperative, maintain the following amount of fuel in each Main Tank 1, 2, 3 and 4:

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected pump switch: "#___ AFT or FWD FUEL PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: MAIN TANK BOOST PUMPS MAIN TANK 1 AND 4 BOOST PUMPS

note.para: Main Tank 2 or 3 boost pumps are interchangeable with Main Tank 1 or 4 boost pumps.

numlitem.para: With an inoperative Main Tank 1 or 4 Boost Pump, the main tank transfer valves must be verified to be operative.
Fuel System Synoptic verification method:

On the Pilots Overhead Panel, set the FUEL XFER MAIN 1 & 4 switch to the ON position. On the Fuel System Synoptic display, observe that transfer arrows are displayed between Main Tanks 1 & 2 and Main Tanks 3 & 4.
Observe that Main Tanks 1 & 4 quantity indications are decreasing.
Set the FUEL XFER MAIN 1 & 4 switch to the OFF position. On the Fuel System Synoptic display, observe that the transfer arrows are no longer displayed between Main Tanks 1 & 2 and Main Tanks 3 & 4.
Manual Override Handle visual verification method:

Cycle the gravity valves using the FUEL XFER MAIN 1 & 4 switch and visually observe that the Manual Override Handle on both main tank transfer valves cycle to the open and closed position as commanded by FUEL XFER MAIN 1 & 4 switch.
Deactivate the inoperative fuel pump by opening the collaring the appropriate circuit breaker.
Tank 1 Fwd Boost Pump: P415 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN FWD 1.
Tank 1 Aft Boost Pump: P414 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN AFT 1.
Tank 4 Fwd Boost Pump: P414 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN FWD 4.
Tank 4 Aft Boost Pump: P415 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN AFT 4.

item.title: Main Tank Boost Pumps Main Tank 1 and 4 Boost Pumps – Alternate Method

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Prior to engine start, a minimum of 17,000 lb (7,711 kg) fuel is loaded in the center wing tank and all center wing tank fuel is included as part of Zero Fuel Weight,
All main tank 2 and 3 boost pumps are operative,
Main tanks 1 and 4 transfer valves are verified to be operative,
Both center wing tank override/jettison pumps are operative,
Fuel quantity indicating system for the associated tank is operative,
For takeoff, engine 1 and 4 are manifolded to the center wing tank, and
A minimum fuel quantity of 4,690 lbs (2,127 kgs) is retained in the associated tank for takeoff and landing (normal fuel loading balance and usage requirements still apply).

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL PUMP ___
Inoperative boost pump operations may require large amounts of fuel to be retained in the main fuel tanks for takeoff and landing. Payload and/or range restrictions may result.

numlitem.para: For operation with a Main Tank 1 or 4 boost inoperative with a minimum of 17,000 lbs fuel in the CWT for takeoff and Main Tanks 1, 2, 3 and 4 less than full, ensure that:
Both center wing tank override/jettison pumps are selected ON.
For takeoff, crossfeed valves 1 and 4 are selected ON.

note.para: EICAS advisory message >FUEL TANK/ENG will remain displayed in the above configuration.
CWT fuel included as part of ZFW may be used en route.

numlitem.para: For takeoff, a minimum of 17,000 lbs fuel is loaded in the center wing tank and all center wing tank fuel is included as part of Zero Fuel Weight.
A minimum fuel quantity of 4,690 lbs is retained in each main tank for takeoff and landing (normal fuel loading, balance and usage requirements still apply).

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected pump switch: "#___ AFT or FWD FUEL PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 28-22-1-1-1.

item.title: Main Tank Boost Pumps Main Tank 2 and 3 Boost Pumps – Preferred Method

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All main tank 1 and 4 boost pumps are operative,
All main tank fuel quantity indicating systems are operative,
The associated fuel crossfeed valve is deactivated open,
Remaining fuel crossfeed valves are operative,
Associated tank override/jettison pumps are selected on for takeoff,
Center tank and auxiliary tank (if installed) remain empty, or fuel is included as part of Zero Fuel Weight,
Horizontal stabilizer tank remains empty, and
The following minimum fuel quantities are retained in the associated tank for the flight conditions shown (normal fuel loading, balance and usage requirements still apply):

note.para: No AUX or STAB Tanks installed on UPS Aircraft.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL X FEED
FUEL PUMP ___
The EICAS Fuel Synoptic crossfeed valve position display will be blank for all four crossfeed valves (i.e., low intensity white with no fuel flow bars).

numlitem.para: For operation with a Main Tank 2 of 3 boost pump inoperative and associated crossfeed valve deactivated open, CWT fuel, if carried, must be included as part of ZFW for dispatch. Fuel may be included as part of ZFW in any quantity up to the maximum ZFW or the capacity of the center wing tank.

note.para: CWT fuel included as part of ZFW may be used en route.
Takeoff fuel feed must be main tank to engine or main tanks 2 and 3 to all engines.

numlitem.para: Ensure tank 2 and 3 override/jettison pumps are ON and if fuel is present in the CWT, CWT override/jettison pumps must be selected OFF before takeoff.
Center wing tank fuel must be included as part of the ZFW but is considered usable en route.
For landing: Main tanks 1, 2, 3 and 4 contain a minimum of 8,610 lbs of fuel each.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected pump switch: "#___ AFT or FWD FUEL PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: MAIN TANK BOOST PUMPS MAIN TANK 2 AND 3 BOOST PUMPS

note.para: Main Tank 2 or 3 boost pumps are interchangeable with Main Tank 1 or 4 boost pumps.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the inoperative fuel pump by opening and collaring the appropriate circuit breaker:
Tank 2 Fwd Boost Pump: P415 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN FWD 2.
Tank 2 Aft Boost Pump: P414 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN AFT 2.
Tank 3 Fwd Boost Pump: P414 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN FWD 3.
Tank 3 Aft Boost Pump: P415 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN AFT 3.
Secure Crossfeed Valve 2 or 3 open as follows:
Access front wing spar. (No. 2 or No. 3 is just inboard of the inboard engines).
Extend leading edge flaps (AMM 27-81-00/201).
Open the circuit breaker associated with the inoperative crossfeed valve and install DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier:
For crossfeed valve 2, open P6 panel FUEL XFEED VALVE ENG 3 circuit breaker.
For crossfeed valve 3, open P6 panel FUEL XFEED VALVE ENG 3 circuit breaker.
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from affected valve. (AMM 28-22-02/401).
Position manual override lever for affected valve in the OPEN position and lockwire.
Remove DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier and close the circuit breaker opened above.

item.title: Main Tank Boost Pumps Main Tank 2 and 3 Boost Pumps – Aft Boost Pumps Override/Jettison Pump Operative Alternate Method

remarks.para: One aft boost pump may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All main tank 1 and 4 boost pumps and main tank 2 and 3 fwd boost pumps are operative,
Aft override/jettison pump in associated tank is operative,
Fuel quantity indicating system for the associated tank is operative, and
The following minimum fuel quantities are retained in the associated tank for the flight conditions shown (normal fuel loading, balance and usage requirements still apply):

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL PUMP ___ AFT
Inoperative boost pump operations may require large amounts of fuel to be retained in the main fuel tanks for takeoff and landing. Payload and/or range restrictions may result.

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
For takeoff: Main tanks 2 and 3 contain a minimum of 78,390 lbs of fuel each and main tanks 1 and 4 are fueled to capacity.
For landing: Main tanks 1, 2, 3 and 4 contain a minimum of 8,610 lbs of fuel each.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected pump switch: "#___ AFT FUEL PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: MAIN TANK BOOST PUMPS MAIN TANK 2 AND 3 BOOST PUMPS AFT BOOST PUMPS

numlitem.para: Deactivate the inoperative fuel pump by opening and collaring the appropriate circuit breaker:
Tank 2 Aft Boost Pump: P414 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN AFT 2.
Tank 3 Aft Boost Pump: P415 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN AFT 3.

item.title: Main Tank Boost Pumps Main Tank 2 and 3 Boost Pumps – Aft Boost Pumps Engine Driven Generator Systems Operative Alternate Method

remarks.para: One aft boost pump may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All main tank 1 and 4 boost pumps and main tank 2 and 3 fwd boost pumps are operative,
Fuel quantity indicating system for the associated tank is operative,
All engine driven generator systems are operative, and
The following minimum fuel quantities are retained in the associated tank for the flight conditions shown (normal fuel loading, balance and usage requirements still apply):

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL PUMP ___ AFT
Inoperative boost pump operations may require large amounts of fuel to be retained in the main fuel tanks for takeoff and landing. Payload and/or range restrictions may result.

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
For takeoff: Main tanks 2 and 3 contain a minimum of 78,390 lbs of fuel each and main tanks 1 and 4 are fueled to capacity.
For landing: Main tanks 1, 2, 3 and 4 contain a minimum of 8,610 lbs of fuel each.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected pump switch: "#___ AFT FUEL PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: MAIN TANK BOOST PUMPS MAIN TANK 2 AND 3 BOOST PUMPS – AFT BOOST PUMPS
maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 28-22-1-2-1-1.

item.title: Main Tank Boost Pumps Main Tank 2 and 3 Boost Pumps – Fwd Boost Pumps Alternate Method

remarks.para: One fwd boost pump may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All main tank 1 and 4 boost pumps and main tank 2 and 3 aft boost pumps are operative,
Fuel quantity indicating system for the associated tank is operative, and
The following minimum fuel quantities are retained in the associated tank for the flight conditions shown (normal fuel loading, balance and usage requirements still apply):

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL PUMP ___ FWD
Inoperative boost pump operations may require large amounts of fuel to be retained in the main fuel tanks for takeoff and landing. Payload and/or range restrictions may result.

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
For takeoff: Main tanks 1, 2, 3 and 4 contain a minimum of 24,254 lbs of fuel each.
For landing: Main tanks 1, 2, 3 and 4 contain a minimum of 8,610 lbs of fuel each.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected pump switch: "#___ FWD FUEL PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: MAIN TANK BOOST PUMPS MAIN TANK 2 AND 3 BOOST PUMPS FWD BOOST PUMPS
maintenance.para: Deactivate the inoperative fuel pump by opening and collaring the appropriate circuit breaker:

numlitem.para: Tank 2 Fwd Boost Pump: P415 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN FWD 2.
Tank 3 Fwd Boost Pump: P414 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN FWD 3.

item.title: Fuel Management System (FSMC A/ FSMC B) – Reserve Tanks Fueled

remarks.para: One card may be inoperative with reserve tanks 2 and 3 fueled provided:

numlitem.para: Stabilizer tank remains empty,
Zero Fuel Weight CG limit is 4% MAC forward of the Aft Limit,
If fuel in reserve tanks 2 or 3 does not transfer, observe 325 KIAS/0.92M speed limitation for remainder of flight, and
Main tanks 2 and 3 fuel quantity indicating systems are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FSMC ___
M2/M3<6K SIG

numlitem.para: If reserve tanks 2 and 3 are fueled, and additional failure may occur en route and cause fuel to become trapped in the reserve tanks. Operating procedures must therefore include the following:
Plan required fuel load considering that fuel may become trapped in both reserve tanks.

note.para: Observe fuel quantity indication and confirm fuel transfer from the reserve tanks when either main tank 2 or 3 quantity is reduced below 40,000 lbs. This is necessary since EICAS annunciation may not occur after subsequent failure en route.

numlitem.para: If fuel in reserve tanks does not transfer, limit maximum operating speed to 325 KCAS/.92 Mach.

note.para: Lateral imbalance due to one reserve tank full and one reserve tank empty is less than the max lateral imbalance allowable.

numlitem.para: Aircraft is to be loaded so that ZFW CG limit is 4% MAC forward of the Aft Limit.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "A or B FUEL MGMT SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: FUEL MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (FSMC A/FSMC B)
maintenance.para: Verify one of the FSMCs is operative by performing the FSMC operational test (AMM 28-13/501).

para.emphasis: MS NOTE: The Fuel Management Systems include:

numlitem.para: Two Fuel System Management Cards - FSMC A and FSMC B.
Input signals to FSMC A and FSMC B.

maintenance.para: The status message M2/M3 <6K SIG indicates that a reserve (R2 or R3) fuel-transfer-control-signal may have failed. Possible input signal failures are:

numlitem.para: In-air signals
Main tank 2 quantity signal
Main tank 3 quantity signal
Single Point Sensor signals

maintenance.para: For item 1 above, dispatch is allowed with one In-Air signal failed. Dispatch is also allowed with both In-Air failed provided both reserve tanks remain empty.
For items 2, 3, and 4 above, refer to applicable MELs for dispatch.

item.title: Fuel Management System (FSMC A/FSMC B) – Converted Freighter

remarks.para: One card may be inoperative with reserve tanks 2 and 3 empty provided:

numlitem.para: Stabilizer tank remains empty, and
Maximum takeoff weight is limited to 740,000 lbs (356,000 kgs).

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FSMC ___
M2/M3<6K SIG

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.

note.para: CWT fuel included as part of ZFW may be used en route.

numlitem.para: Actual takeoff weight cannot exceed 740,000 lbs.
Center Wing Tank fuel must be included as part of the ZFW but is considered usable en route.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "A or B FUEL MGMT SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 28-22-2-0-1.

item.title: Fuel Management System (FSMC A / FSMC B) – Reserve Tanks Empty

remarks.para: One card may be inoperative with reserve tanks 2 and 3 empty provided maximum takeoff weight is limited to 785,000 lbs (356,000 kgs).

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FSMC ___
M2/M3<6K SIG

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/ PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.

note.para: CWT fuel included as part of ZFW may be used en route.

numlitem.para: Actual takeoff weight cannot exceed 785,000 lbs.
Center Wing Tank fuel must be included as part of the ZFW but is considered usable en route.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "A or B FUEL MGMT SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 28-22-2-0-1

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided associated valve is operative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected crossfeed switch: "____ FUEL XFEED VLV LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Use fuel synoptic page to verify associated valve position.

item.title: Fuel Crossfeed Valves – Fuel Crossfeed Valves 1 and 4

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Valve is secured open,
All main tank fuel quantity indicating systems are operative, and
Crossfeed Valves 2 and 3 are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL X FEED ___

numlitem.para: Operate normally until main tanks are equal (i.e., EICAS Advisory message >FUEL TANK/ENG is displayed).
When EICAS Advisory message >FUEL TANK/ENG is displayed, push main tank 2 and 3 OVRD FWD and AFT pump switches to OFF and crossfeed valve switches 2 and 3 to OFF.

note.para: EICAS advisory messages >FUEL TANK/ENG and >XFEED CONFIG may remain displayed.

Because of the CWT scavenge system, expect fuel usage from Tanks 1 and 4 to be greater than from Tanks 2 and 3 after closing crossfeed valves 2 and 3. EICAS advisory message >FUEL IMBALANCE may be displayed. After completion of the FUEL IMBALANCE NON-NORMAL procedure and >FUEL IMBALANCE is no longer displayed, switch MAIN PUMP 1 and 4 to ON and CROSSFEED VALVE 2 and 3 to OFF.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected crossfeed switch: "___ FUEL XFEED VLV LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Secure the affected valve open as follows:
Access front wing spar. (Access for No. 1 or No. 4 crossfeed valves between inboard and outboard engines.)
Extend leading edge flaps (AMM 27-81-00/201).
Open the circuit breaker associated with the inoperative crossfeed valve and install DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier:
For crossfeed valve 1, open P6 panel FUEL XFEED VALVE ENG 1 circuit breaker.
For crossfeed valve 4, open P6 panel FUEL XFEED VALVE ENG 4 circuit breaker.
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from affected valve (AMM 28-22-02/401).
Position manual override lever for affected valve in the OPEN position and lockwire.
Remove DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier and close the circuit breaker opened above.

item.title: Fuel Crossfeed Valves – Fuel Crossfeed Valves 2 and 3

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Valve is secured open,
All main tank fuel quantity indicating systems are operating, and
Crossfeed Valves 1 and 4 are operative.
Center tank and auxiliary tank (if installed) remain empty, or fuel is included a part of Zero Fuel Weight, and
Horizontal stabilizer tank remains empty.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL X FEED ___
The EICAS Fuel Synoptic crossfeed valve position display will be blank for all four crossfeed valves (i.e. low intensity white with no fuel flow bars).

numlitem.para: CWT fuel, if carried, must be included as part of ZFW. Fuel may be included as part of ZFW in any quantity up to the maximum ZFW or the capacity of CWT.

note.para: CWT fuel included as part of ZFW may be used en route.
Takeoff fuel feed must be main tank-to-engine or main tanks 2 and 3 to all engines.

numlitem.para: If fuel is present in the center wing tank, center wing tank override/jettison pumps must be selected OFF for takeoff.
Condition #1: Center tank remains empty.
Condition #2: Center Wing Tank fuel must be included as part of the ZFW but is considered usable en route.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected crossfeed switch: "___ FUEL XFEED VL LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Secure the affected valve open as follows:
Access front wing spar. (Access for No. 2 or No. 3 crossfeed valves between inboard and outboard engines.)
Extend leading edge flaps (AMM 27-81-00/201).
Open the circuit breaker associated with the inoperative crossfeed valve and install DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier:
For crossfeed valve 2, open P6 panel FUEL XFEED VALVE ENG 2 circuit breaker.
For crossfeed valve 3, open P6 panel FUEL XFEED VALVE ENG 3 circuit breaker.
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from affected valve (AMM 28-22-02/401).
Position manual override lever for affected valve in the OPEN position and lockwire.
Remove DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier and close the circuit breaker opened above.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
APU FUEL PUMP
For APU operation:

numlitem.para: Apply External Power to the AC Buses.
Select No. 2 Main Aft Boost Pump ON.
Start and run APU using normal procedures.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to APU selector switch: "DC FUEL PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open and collar the P6 panel DC FUEL PUMP APU circuit breaker.

remarks.para: May be inoperative closed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
APU FUEL VALVE

numlitem.para: Use External Air and Electrical power.
If engines cannot be started due to insufficient external power, select UTILITY power OFF. Utility power can be restored after completion of the engine start procedure.

note.para: If utility power is selected OFF for engine start an EEC CLNG SUP FAN status message may be displayed, it can be cleared by rotating the EQUIP COOLING switch to OVRD, then back to NORM.
If utility power is selected OFF for engine start a RECIRC FAN UPR or LWR status message may be displayed, momentarily depress the PACK RST switch until each is cleared.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to APU selector switch: "APU INOP DUE TO FUEL VLV". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Position the Electrical System Control Panel (P5) APU master control switch OFF. If desired (to prevent inadvertent switching to START) open the P6 panel APU ALTN CONT and P83 panel APU PRIMARY CONT circuit breakers.
Open and collar the P6 panel APU FUEL SHUT OFF circuit breaker.
Manually position the APU fuel valve closed using the manual override lever (valve is on the aft side of No. 2 main fuel tank rear spar, accessible from the left wing gear wheel well).

note.para: See AMM 09-11-00/201 for towing aircraft with an inoperative APU (braking availability, etc.).

remarks.para: May be inoperative secured closed.

placard.para: Placard at refuel panel: "MAN OP DEFUEL VLV INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To secure valve(s) closed, manually rotate valve handle to closed position and lockwire valve handle to nearby structure.

item.chgdesc: Renumbers item to align with MMEL.

title.revision: Fuel Jettison System

remarks.para: All components may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Aircraft performance requirements are satisfied, including Approach Climb and Landing Climb capability,
Jettison nozzle valves are secured closed, and
Main tanks 1 and 4 transfer valves are secured closed, and
All main tank 1 and 4 boost pumps are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL JETT SYS
FUEL JETT ___
JETT XFR VLV
FUEL XFR VLV ___
JETT NOZZLE ___

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/ PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Maximum takeoff weight may not exceed the landing climb limit weight at the departure airport plus 16,000 lbs of additional fuel.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "JETTISON FUEL SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Fuel jettison valves are required to be secured in the closed position. Procedures are listed below:
Jettison nozzle valves must be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-31-05/401).
Main tanks 1 and 4 transfer valves must be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-16-04/401).
Gain access transfer valves through upper wing access panel 573AT (673AT).
Remove and stow the associated electrical connector DV55 (DV50).

Position the associated actuator manual override lever to the closed position. For the #1 transfer valve, the valve is closed with the lever on the inboard side and position down. For the #4 transfer valve, the valve is closed with the lever on the inboard side and positioned up.
Secure the manual override lever with locking wire.
Refit the access panel.

item.chgdesc: Renumbers item and revises proviso per MMEL. Revises Maintenance procedure.

title.revision: Fuel Jettison System – Center Wing Tank Jettison/Transfer Valves – Secured Closed

para.revision: May be inoperative secured closed provided associated inboard main tank jettison/transfer valve(s) is operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
JETT XFR VALVE

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "CWT JETTISON/XFER VLV SECURED OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

para.revision: If verification of fuel jettison valve operation is required, perform the following applicable procedures:

Center tank jettison/transfer valve(s) operation may be verified by performing fuel jettison transfer valve CMC Ground Test (AMM 28-31-00/501) – TASK 28-31-00-715-066. CMC messages 28649 or 28650 will identify the inoperative center tank jettison/transfer valves.

The applicable center wing tank jettison/transfer valve(s) must be secured open by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-31-04/401).

item.chgdesc: Adds Not Applicable item per MMEL.

title.revision: NOT APPLICABLE

item.chgdesc: Revises title and proviso per MMEL. Revises Maintenance procedure.

title.revision: Fuel Jettison System Center Wing Tank Jettison/Transfer Valves – Secured Open

para.revision: May be inoperative provided:
Valve(s) is secured open, and
Both jettison nozzle valves are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
JETT XFR VALVE

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "CWT JETTISON/XFER VLV SECURED CLOSED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: If verification of fuel jettison valve operation is required, perform the following applicable procedures:

para.revision: Center tank jettison/transfer valve(s) operation may be verified by performing fuel jettison transfer valve CMC Ground Test (AMM 28-31-00/501) – TASK 28-31-00-715-066. CMC messages 28649 or 28650 will identify the inoperative center tank jettison/transfer valves.

The applicable center wing tank jettison/transfer valve(s) must be secured open by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the open position (AMM 28-31-04/401).

item.chgdesc: Renumbers item to align with MMEL. Revises Maintenance procedure.

title.revision: Fuel Jettison System – Main Tanks 2 and 3 Jettison/Transfer Valves

remarks.para: May be inoperative secured closed provided associated center wing tank jettison/transfer valve(s) is operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
JETT XFR VALVE

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "#2 and/or #3 MAIN JETTISON/XFER VLV SECURED CLOSED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: If verification of fuel jettison valve operation is required, perform the following applicable procedures:

para.revision: Main tanks 2 and 3 jettison/transfer valve(s) operation may be verified by performing fuel jettison transfer valve CMC Ground Test (AMM 28-31-00/501) – TASK 28-31-00-715-066. CMC messages 28651 or 28652 will identify the inoperative main tank jettison/transfer valves.

numlitem.para: The applicable main tank 2 and 3 jettison/transfer valve(s) must be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-31-04/401).

item.chgdesc: Adds Not Applicable item per MMEL.

title.revision: NOT APPLICABLE

item.chgdesc: Adds item per MMEL.

title.revision: FUEL JETTISON SYSTEM – MAIN TANKS 2 AND 3 JETTISON/TRANSFER VALVES – SECURED OPEN

para.revision: May be inoperative provided:
Valve(s) is secured open, and
Both jettison nozzle valves are operative.
Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "#2 and/or #3 MAIN JETISON/XFER VLV SECURED OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Secure the applicable inoperative main tank 2 and/or 3 jettison/transfer valve(s) open:
Gain access to the inoperative jettison/transfer valve (AMM 28-31-04/401).
Disconnect, cap and stow the valve electrical connector.
Manually position valve(s) open.

item.title: Fuel Jettison System Main Tanks 1 and 4 Transfer Valves

remarks.para: May be inoperative secured closed provided:

numlitem.para: Required fuel to be jettisoned does not deplete inboard main tank below the quantity in the outboard main tanks, and
Both boost pumps for associated tank are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL XFR VALVE ___

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "#1 and/or #4 MAIN XFER VLV SECURED CLOSED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Main tanks 1 and 4 transfer valves may be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-16-04/401).
Gain access to transfer valves through upper wing access panel 573AT (673AT).
Remove and stow the associated electrical connector DV55 (DV50).

Position the associated actuator manual override lever to the closed position. For the #1 transfer valve, the valve is closed with the lever on the inboard side and positioned down. For the #4 transfer valve, the valve is closed with the lever on the inboard side and positioned up.
Secure the manual override lever with locking wire.
Refit the access panel.

item.title: Fuel Jettison System Fuel Jettison Control Cards

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided the remaining FJCC is verified to be operative before departure.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "JETTISON FUEL SYS CNTRL CARD INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify Fuel jettison control card operation by performing fuel jettison control care operational test (AMM 28-31-00/501).

item.title: Main Tanks 2 and 3 Override/Jettison Pumps – Generator Systems Operative

remarks.para: One forward or aft override/jettison pump may be inoperative deactivated provided, for an aft override/jettison pump, all engine driven generator systems are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL OVRD ___

To preclude possibility of fuel imbalance between main tanks 2 and 3 when only one override/jettison pump is operative, it is recommended that an override/jettison pump in the symmetrical main tank be selected OFF. If an operative pump is selected OFF, it may be selected ON should the crew desire to minimize time required to jettison fuel.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "#2 or #3 MAIN OVRD/JETT PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: MAIN TANKS 2 AND 3 OVERRIDE/JETTISON PUMPS
maintenance.para: Deactivate the inoperative fuel pump(s) by opening and collaring the appropriate circuit breaker(s):

numlitem.para: Tank 2 FWD override/jettison pump: P414 PANEL, FUEL OVRD/JTSN PUMP FWD 2.
Tank 2 AFT override/jettison pump: P415 PANEL, FUEL OVRD/JTSN PUMP AFT 2.
Tank 3 FWD override/jettison pump: P414 PANEL, FUEL OVRD/JTSN PUMP FWD 3.
Tank 3 AFT override/jettison pump: P415 PANEL, FUEL OVRD/JTSN PUMP AFT 3.

item.title: Main Tanks 2 and 3 Override/Jettison Pumps – Main Tank Boost Pumps Operative

remarks.para: One forward or aft override/jettison pump may be inoperative deactivated provided, for an aft override/jettison pump, both associated main tank boost pumps are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL OVRD ___

To preclude possibility of fuel imbalance between main tanks 2 and 3 when only one override/jettison pump is operative, it is recommended that an override/jettison pump in the symmetrical main tank be selected OFF. If an operative pump is selected OFF, it may be selected ON should the crew desire to minimize time required to jettison fuel.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "#2 or #3 MAIN OVRD/JETT PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 28-31-2-1.

item.title: Main Tanks 2 and 3 Override/Jettison Pumps – One Jettison Pump Per Tank Inoperative

remarks.para: One forward or aft override/jettison pump per tank may be inoperative deactivated provided:

numlitem.para: For an inoperative aft override/jettison pump, all engine driven generator systems are operative, and
All Main Tanks 2 and 3 boost pumps are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL OVRD ___

To preclude possibility of fuel imbalance between main tanks 2 and 3 when only one override/jettison pump is operative, it is recommended that an override/jettison pump in the symmetrical main tank be selected OFF. If an operative pump is selected OFF, it may be selected ON should the crew desire to minimize time required to jettison fuel.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "#2 or #3 MAIN OVRD/JETT PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 28-31-2-1.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated provided:

numlitem.para: Horizontal stabilizer tank remains empty,
With center tank fueled, fuel quantity remaining in main wing tanks is adequate to reach a suitable airport if remaining center tank pump fails at any time,
Center tank and auxiliary tank (if installed) fuel included as part of Zero Fuel Weight, and
Center tank quantity indication is operative.

note.para: Stabilizer and Auxiliary tanks are not installed on UPS aircraft.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL OVRD CTR ___

On the ground prior to engine start the >FUEL OVD CTR L (or R) EICAS advisory message may be displayed if the CWT contains more than 17,000 lbs of fuel. After engine start and prior to cruise the EICAS advisory may be displayed if CWT contains more than 6000 lbs and at cruise the message may be displayed of the CWT contains more than 4000 lbs.

numlitem.para: Related CWT Override/Jettison Pump Switch must remain selected OFF.
For takeoff, ensure the Override/Jettison Pumps are selected OFF until cruise.

note.para: With both pumps OFF, the fuel management system will automatically operate as if CWT is empty.

numlitem.para: CWT fuel included as part of ZFW may be used en route provided one CWT Override/Jettison is operative. To use CWT fuel en route select the operative Override/Jettison Pump ON and accomplish AOM Non-Normal Checklist FUEL PRESS CTR for a single CWT pump inoperative.
Wing tank fuel must be adequate to reach a suitable airport if the remaining center tank pump fails.
Center tank fuel must be included as part of the Zero Fuel Weight but is considered usable en route.

note.para: Make a manual calculation of the ZFW to assure "if" fuel becomes trapped (second pump fails) the aircraft has adequate fuel to make it to destination and/or not land over maximum landing weight. A second weight and balance is not required.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "L (or R) CWT OVRD/JETT PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deactivate the inoperative fuel pump(s) by opening and collaring the appropriate circuit breaker(s):

numlitem.para: Center Left override/jettison pump: P414 panel, FUEL OVRD/JTSN PUMP CTR LEFT.
Center Right override/jettison pump: P415 panel, FUEL OVRD/JTSN PUMP CTR RIGHT.

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated provided:

numlitem.para: Horizontal stabilizer tank remains empty,
Center tank and auxiliary tank (if installed) fuel is included as part of Zero Fuel Weight, and
Center tank and auxiliary tank (if installed) fuel is considered unusable.

note.para: Auxiliary tanks are not installed on UPS aircraft.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL OVRD CTR ___

On the ground prior to engine start the >FUEL OVD CTR L (or R) EICAS advisory message may be displayed if the CWT contains more than 17,000 lbs of fuel. After engine start and prior to cruise the EICAS advisory may be displayed if CWT contains more than 6000 lbs and at cruise the message may be displayed of the CWT contains more than 4000 lbs.

numlitem.para: CWT Override/Jettison Pump Switch must remain selected OFF.

note.para: With both pumps OFF, the fuel management system will automatically operative as if CWT is empty.

numlitem.para: Center tank fuel is included as part of the Zero Fuel Weight and is considered unusable.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "BOTH CWT OVRD/JETT PUMPS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 28-31-4-1

item.chgdesc: Revises proviso per MMEL. Adds Note to proviso for clarification.
item.title: Main Tank Fuel Quantity Indicating Systems – (Flight Deck)

para.revision: Except for ER operations, one may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: FMC is initialized with the known total fuel quantity,
Engine fuel flow indications are operative,
FMC calculated fuel quantity is operative,
Tank is emptied and serviced with a known quantity of fuel, or measuring stick readings are taken to verify fuel quantity in tank with inoperative indicator after each refueling,
All boost pumps for the associated tank are operative,
If failed indicator is for main tank 2 or 3, management and jettison single point sensor systems for both tanks are operative,
Remaining individual tank quantity indications are available,
Appropriate procedures are used en route to identify engine fuel leaks if suspected or confirmed, and
For Combi, if ballast fuel is carried, stabilizer tank remains empty and CWT fuel in excess of ballast fuel may not be carried.

para.revision: All cargo operations using aircraft with more than two engines do not have to comply with ETOPS regulations.

note.para: Stabilizer tanks have been deactivated.
North Polar Route Restrictions.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL QTY SYS
M2/M3<3K SIG
M2/M3<6K SIG

numlitem.para: Total Fuel quantity indication may also be inoperative, if so:
Total fuel quantity must be calculated and manually initialized on the FMC PERF INIT page after engines have been started.
If it is necessary to jettison fuel:
Record the FUEL TO REMAIN quantity selected for the jettison operation.
Wait two minutes after fuel jettison is complete and then manually re-initialize the FMC with the total FUEL TO REMAIN quantity recorded above.
In case of en route failure of the FMC calculated total fuel quantity; flight crew must keep a fuel log for the remainder of the flight.

note.para: The PROGRESS page 1 display of Fuel quantity and actual time of arrival (ATA) at the last waypoint prior to failure may be used as a starting point. In some failure modes, PROGRESS page 2 FUEL USED data may be available.

numlitem.para: An inoperative main tank Fuel Quantity Indication System (FQIS) may cause advisory message FUEL IMBALANCE (>FUEL IMBALANCE) to be inhibited. Additionally, as appropriate for affected main tank pair, FUEL IMBAL 1-4 (>FUEL IMBAL 1-4) or FUEL IMBAL 2-3 (>FUEL IMBAL 2-3) will be inhibited.
To identify an engine affected by an engine fuel leak with individual FQIS’s inoperative refer to AOM Chapter 2.1 and QRH.
North Polar Routes prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ MAIN TANK QTY IND SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Verify the fuel quantity in the tank associated with the inoperative quantity indication using one of the following methods:

numlitem.para: Defuel the associated tank (AMM 28-26-00/201) and service the tank with a known quantity of fuel (AMM 12-11-01/301).
Determine the fuel quantity using the associated tank’s measuring sticks (AMM 28-44-00/001).

entry.para: Regarding FMC operation – UPS B747-400F’s have the GE-504 IDS software installed.

item.title: SINGLE POINT SENSOR SYSTEMS – CENTER TANK SENSORS

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided center tank fuel quantity indicating system is operative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: CTR TANK SINGLE PT SENSOR INOP.

item.title: Single Point Sensor Systems Main Tanks 2 and 3 Sensors (Reserve Transfer) – One Inoperative

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided main tanks 2 and 3 fuel quantity indicating systems are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL QTY SYS
M2/M3<6K SIG

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "#2 OR #3 MAIN TANK SINGLE PT SENSOR SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Single Point Sensor Systems Main Tanks 2 and 3 Sensors (Reserve Transfer) – Reserve Tanks Fueled

remarks.para: May be inoperative with reserve tanks 2 and 3 fueled provided:

numlitem.para: Main tanks 2 and 3 fuel quantity indicating systems are operative,
Zero Fuel Weight CG limit is 4% MAC forward of the Aft Limit, and
If fuel in reserve tanks 2 or 3 does not transfer, observe 325 KCAS/0.92M speed limitation for remainder of flight.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL QTY SYS
M2/M3<6K SIG

numlitem.para: When operating with both transfer sensors inoperative, an additional failure may occur en route which causes fuel not to transfer from the reserve tanks. Flight crew must therefore:
Plan required fuel load considering that fuel may become trapped in reserve tank(s).

Ensure reserve tank fuel automatically transfers when either Main Tank 2 or 3 quantity is reduced below 40,000 lbs. This is necessary since EICAS annunciation may not occur after subsequent failure en route.
If fuel in reserve tank(s) does not transfer, limit Vmo/Mmo to 325 KCAS/.92 Mach for the remainder of the flight.

note.para: Lateral imbalance due to one reserve tank full and one reserve tank empty is less than the max lateral imbalance allowable in the Weight and Balance Manual.

numlitem.para: Aircraft is to be loaded so that the actual ZFW CG is at least 4% MAC forward of the aft limit.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "#2 OR #3 MAIN TANK SINGLE PT SENSORS SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Single Point Sensor Systems Main Tanks 2 and 3 Sensors (Reserve Transfer) – Converted Freighter

remarks.para: May be inoperative with reserve tanks 2 and 3 empty provided maximum takeoff weight is limited to 740,000 lbs (335,664 kgs).

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL QTY SYS
M2/M3<6K SIG
CWT fuel included as part of ZFW may be used en route.

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Actual takeoff weight cannot exceed 740,000 lbs.
Center Wing Tank fuel must be included as part of the ZFW but is considered usable en route.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "#2 OR #3 MAIN TANK SINGLE PT SENSORS SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative with reserve tanks 2 and 3 empty provided maximum takeoff weight is limited to 785,000 lbs (356,000 kgs).

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL QTY SYS
M2/M3<6K SIG

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Actual takeoff weight cannot exceed 785,000 lbs.
Center Wing Tank fuel must be included as part of the ZFW but is considered usable en route.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "#2 OR #3 MAIN TANK SINGLE PT SENSORS SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL QTY SYS
M2/M3<3K SIG

item.chgdesc: Revises proviso per MMEL. Adds Note to proviso for clarification.
item.title: Total Fuel Quantity Indication – Manually Initialize Total Fuel Quantity

para.revision: Except for ER operations, may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: FMC is initialized with the known total fuel quantity,
Engine fuel flow indication and FMC Calculated fuel quantity are operative,
Both FMCs are operative, and
For Combi, if ballast fuel is carried, stabilizer tank remains empty and CWT fuel in excess of ballast fuel may not be carried.

para.revision: All cargo operations using aircraft with more than two engines do not have to comply with ETOPS regulations.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL QTY SYS

numlitem.para: Total fuel quantity must be calculated and manually initialized on the FMC PERF INIT page after engines have been started.
If it is necessary to jettison fuel:
Record the FUEL TO REMAIN quantity selected for the jettison operation.
Wait two minutes after fuel jettison is complete and then manually re-initialize the FMC with the total FUEL TO REMAIN quantity recorded above.
In case of en route failure of the FMC calculated total fuel quantity; flight crew must keep a fuel log for the remainder of the flight.

note.para: The PROGRESS page 1 display of Fuel quantity and actual time of arrival (ATA) at the last waypoint prior to failure may be used as a starting point. In some failure modes, PROGRESS page 2 FUEL USED data may be available.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "TOTAL FUEL QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: If any individual tank quantities required for dispatch are not available on the EICAS fuel synoptic page, MEL restrictions for the associated tank quantity indicating system must be observed.

item.chgdesc: Revises proviso per MMEL. Adds Note to proviso for clarification.
item.title: Center Tank Fuel Quantity Indicating System – (Flight Deck)

para.revision: Except for ER operations, may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Center tank, stabilizer tank and auxiliary tank (if installed) remains empty, and
FMC is initialized with the known total fuel quantity.

para.revision: All cargo operations using aircraft with more than two engines do not have to comply with ETOPS regulations.

note.para: Stabilizer and Auxiliary Tanks are not installed on UPS aircraft.
North Polar Route Restrictions.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL QTY SYS

numlitem.para: Total Fuel quantity indication may also be inoperative, if so:
Total fuel quantity must be calculated and manually initialized on the FMC PERF INIT page after engines have been started.
If it is necessary to jettison fuel:
Record the FUEL TO REMAIN quantity selected for the jettison operation.
Wait two minutes after fuel jettison is complete and then manually re-initialize the FMC with the total FUEL TO REMAIN quantity recorded above.
Center tank override/jettison pumps should remain OFF.
In case of en route failure of the FMC calculated total fuel quantity, flight crew must keep a fuel log for the remainder of the flight.

note.para: The PROGRESS page 1 display of Fuel quantity and actual time of arrival (ATA) at the last waypoint prior to failure may be used as a starting point. In some failure modes, PROGRESS page 2 FUEL USED data may be available.

numlitem.para: Center tank remains empty.
North Polar Routes prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "CTR FUEL QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.chgdesc: Revises proviso per MMEL. Adds Notes to proviso for clarification.

note.para: North Polar Route Restrictions.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

If it is necessary to jettison fuel:
Record the FUEL TO REMAIN quantity selected for the jettison operation.
Wait two minutes after fuel jettison is complete and then manually re-initialize the FMC with the total FUEL TO REMAIN quantity recorded above.
Center tank override/jettison pumps should remain OFF.

note.para: The PROGRESS page 1 display of Fuel quantity and actual time of arrival (ATA) at the last waypoint prior to failure may be used as a starting point. In some failure modes, PROGRESS page 2 FUEL USED data may be available.

numlitem.para: North Polar Routes prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "RES TANK #2 or #3 FUEL QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: RESERVE TANK FUEL QUANTITY INDICATING SYSTEMS

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Verify the fuel quantity in the tank associated with the inoperative quantity indication using one of the following methods:

numlitem.para: Defuel the associated tank (AMM 28-26-00/201) and service the tank with a known quantity of fuel (AMM 12-11-01/301).
Determine the fuel quantity using the associated tank’s measuring sticks (AMM 28-44-00/001).

item.chgdesc: Revises proviso per MMEL. Adds Notes to proviso for clarification.
item.title: Reserve Tank Fuel Quantity Indicating Systems (Flight Deck) – Converted Freighter

para.revision: Except for ER operations, may be inoperative with reserve tanks 2 and 3 empty provided:

numlitem.para: Takeoff weight is limited to a maximum of 740,000 lbs (335,664 kgs),
Remaining individual tank quantity indications are available, and
For Combi, if ballast fuel is carried, stabilizer tank remains empty and CWT fuel in excess of ballast fuel may not be carried.

FUEL QTY SYS

numlitem.para: Total Fuel quantity indication may also be inoperative, if so:
Total fuel quantity must be calculated and manually initialized on the FMC PERT INIT page.
If it is necessary to jettison fuel:

note.para: For Combi aircraft carrying center tank ballast fuel – DO NOT JETTISON BALLAST FUEL.

numlitem.para: Record the FUEL TO REMAIN quantity selected for the jettison operation.
Wait two minutes after fuel jettison is complete and then manually re-initialize the FMC with the total FUEL TO REMAIN quantity recorded above.
In case of en route failure of the FMC calculated total fuel quantity, flight crew must keep a fuel log for the remainder of the flight.

note.para: The PROGRESS page 1 display of Fuel quantity and actual time of arrival (ATA) at the last waypoint prior to failure may be used as a starting point. In some failure modes, PROGRESS page 2 FUEL USED data may be available.

Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Actual takeoff weight cannot exceed 740,000 lbs.
Center Wing Tank fuel must be included as part of the ZFW but is considered usable en route.
North Polar Routes prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "RES TANK #2 or #3 FUEL QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Takeoff weight is limited to a maximum of 785,000 lbs (356,000 kgs),
