item.title: Wing Fueling Station Quantity Indicating System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided preselect refueling is not used.

placard.para: Placard at refuel panel: "WING REFUEL STATION QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Use the manual mode fueling procedure (AMM 12-11-01/301). Use the flight deck fuel synoptic or measuring sticks (AMM 28-44-00/001) to ensure that the correct amount of fuel has been loaded.

note.para: If the flight deck fuel synoptic is blank for one or more tanks, the automatic fuel shutoff for the related tank(s) will be inoperative.

remarks.para: One PRESS light may be inoperative for each tank containing fuel.

note.para: Not required for empty tanks.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected fuel pump low pressure light: "PUMP LOW PRESS LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided Total Air Temperature (TAT) or Static Air Temperature (SAT) to (TAT) conversion is substituted as an indication of fuel temperature.

note.para: North Polar Route Restrictions.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FUEL TEMP

numlitem.para: Substitute TAT as an indication of fuel temperature.
North Polar Routes prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "FUEL TEMP IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided fuel quantity is verified by other means.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ TANK DRIP STICK INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Verify the fuel quantity in the tank associated with the inoperative measuring stick using one of the following methods:

numlitem.para: Use the flight deck fuel synoptic to ensure that the correct amount of fuel has been loaded.
Defuel the associated tank (AMM 28-26-00/201) and service the tank with a known quantity of fuel (AMM 12-11-01/301).

note.para: If the flight deck fuel synoptic is blank for one or more tanks, the automatic fuel shutoff for the related tank(s) will be inoperative.

item.title: Engine Driven Hydraulic Pump Systems – Operate in Depressurized Mode

remarks.para: One engine pump system, including the pump and/or associated plumbing, may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All Demand pumps are operative,
Demand pump for the associated hydraulic system remains ON, and
Associated pump is operated in the depressurized mode with fluid supply and pump case return functioning normally.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HYD PRESS ENG ___

numlitem.para: The Demand Pump Selector on the affected system must remain ON throughout flight.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated engine hydraulic pump switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To ensure fluid supply is available while operating in the depressurized mode, confirm that the affected EDP shutoff valve is in the open position as follows:
Gain access to the hydraulic shutoff valve via the appropriate strut access panel/fairing (AMM 29-11-04).
View thru the access door and confirm that the hydraulic shutoff valve position indicator is in the open position.
Verify affected pump system reservoir hydraulic quantity using sight gauge located on reservoir in engine pylon.

maintenance.para: If the affected engine driven pump (EDP) fluid supply or pump case drain lines are not functioning normally or are leaking, use MEL 29-11-1-0-2 or 29-11-1-0-3.

item.title: Engine Driven Hydraulic Pump Systems – Pump Deactivated

remarks.para: One engine pump system, including the pump and/or associated plumbing, may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All Demand pumps are operative,
Demand pump for the associated hydraulic system remains ON, and
Associated pump is deactivated.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HYD PRESS ENG ___

numlitem.para: The Demand Pump Selector on the affected system must remain ON throughout flight.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated engine hydraulic pump switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The EDP deactivation/dispatch kit is P/N G29003-8.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the engine driven pump (EDP) per AMM 29-11-05/201 procedures.

note.para: This task removes the EDP from the engine, then the quillshaft from the EDP and installs a device to seal the gear shaft. The EDP is then reinstalled (which now will not operate) on the engine. This task also caps the pump fluid supply and pump case fittings along with the associated lines.

numlitem.para: If the affected EDP fluid supply or pump case drain lines are not functioning normally or are leaking, use the procedure below (step 2) to isolate the leak in the EDP hydraulic lines.
To deactivate the EDP hydraulic supply shutoff valve closed:

note.para: The hydraulic shutoff valve is installed in the strut. You must open the forward thrust reverser to strut mid fairing access door to gain access to the valve. You must remove approximately 50 screws to open the access door.

numlitem.para: Gain access to the hydraulic shutoff valve via the appropriate strut access panel/fairing.
Open the associated P6 panel engine fire extinguisher circuit breakers:
Engines 1 or 3: FIRE EXT ENG 1 & 3 BTL A and FIRE EXT ENG 1 & 3 BTL B
Engines 2 or 4: FIRE EXT ENG 2 & 4 BTL A and FIRE EXT ENG 2 & 4 BTL B
Pull the associated P5 Engine Fire Control panel Engine Fire handle.

note.para: You must push the fire override switch installed below the fire switch to operate the fire handle.

warning.para: DO NOT TURN THE FIRE HANDLE. THE EXTINGUISHER BOTTLES WILL LET THE CONTENTS OUT AND CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE ENGINE IF YOU TURN THE FIRE HANDLE.

numlitem.para: Verify the position indicator on the EDP hydraulic shutoff valve moves to the CLOSED position and the motor stops.
Open and collar the associated P7 panel HYDRAULICS EDP SUPPLY circuit breaker:
Push the fire handle back to its usual position.
Close the engine fire extinguisher circuit breakers opened above.

item.title: Engine Driven Hydraulic Pump Systems – Associated Pump Removed

remarks.para: One engine pump system, including the pump and/or associated plumbing, may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All Demand pumps are operative,
Demand pump for the associated hydraulic system remains ON, and
Associated pump is removed and a cover plate installed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HYD PRESS ENG___

numlitem.para: The Demand Pump Selector on the affected system must remain ON throughout flight.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated engine hydraulic pump switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The EDP deactivation/dispatch kit is P/N G29003-8.

numlitem.para: Remove EDP, install approved cover plate and cap lines per AMM 29-11-05/201 procedures. If the affected EDP fluid supply or pump case drain lines are not functioning normally or are leaking, use the procedure below (step 2) to isolate the leak in the EDP hydraulic lines.
To deactivate the EDP hydraulic supply shutoff valve closed:

note.para: The hydraulic shutoff valve is installed in the strut. You must open the forward thrust reverser to strut mid fairing access door to gain access to the valve. You must remove approximately 50 screws to open the access door.

numlitem.para: Gain access to the hydraulic shutoff valve via the appropriate strut access panel/fairing.
Open the associated P6 panel engine fire extinguisher circuit breakers:
Engines 1 or 3: FIRE EXT ENG 1 & 3 BTL A and FIRE EXT ENG 1 & 3 BTL B
Engines 2 or 4: FIRE EXT ENG 2 & 4 BTL A and FIRE EXT ENG 2 & 4 BTL B
Pull the associated P5 Engine Fire Control panel Engine Fire handle.

note.para: You must push the fire override switch installed below the fire switch to operate the fire handle.

warning.para: DO NOT TURN THE FIRE HANDLE. THE EXTINGUISHER BOTTLES WILL LET THE CONTENTS OUT AND CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE ENGINE IF YOU TURN THE FIRE HANDLE.

numlitem.para: Verify the position indicator on the EDP hydraulic shutoff valve moves to the CLOSED position and the motor stops.
Open and collar the associated P7 panel HYDRAULICS EDP SUPPLY circuit breaker:
Push the fire handle back to its usual position.
Close the engine fire extinguisher circuit breakers opened above.

item.title: Engine Driven Hydraulic Pump Systems – Pump Depressurization Function

remarks.para: One pump depressurization function may be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated engine hydraulic pump switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the engine driven pump (EDP) per AMM 29-11-05/201 procedures.

note.para: This task removes the EDP from the engine, then the quillshaft from the EDP and installs a device to seal the gear shaft. The EDP is then reinstalled (which now will not operate) on the engine. This task also caps the pump fluid supply and pump case fittings along with the associated lines.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the EDP hydraulic supply shutoff valve closed per the steps listed below:

note.para: The hydraulic shutoff valve is installed in the strut. You must open the forward thrust reverser to strut mid fairing access door to gain access to the valve. You must remove approximately 50 screws to open the access door.

numlitem.para: Gain access to the hydraulic shutoff valve via the appropriate strut access panel/fairing.
Open the associated P6 panel engine fire extinguisher circuit breakers:
Engines 1 or 3: FIRE EXT ENG 1 & 3 BTL A and FIRE EXT ENG 1 & 3 BTL B
Engines 2 or 4: FIRE EXT ENG 2 & 4 BTL A and FIRE EXT ENG 2 & 4 BTL B
Pull the associated P5 Engine Fire Control panel Engine Fire handle.

note.para: You must push the fire override switch installed below the fire switch to operate the fire handle.

warning.para: DO NOT TURN THE FIRE HANDLE. THE EXTINGUISHER BOTTLES WILL LET THE CONTENTS OUT AND CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE ENGINE IF YOU TURN THE FIRE HANDLE.

numlitem.para: Verify the position indicator on the EDP hydraulic shutoff valve moves to the CLOSED position and the motor stops.
Open and collar the associated P7 panel HYDRAULICS EDP SUPPLY circuit breaker:
Push the fire handle back to its usual position.
Close the engine fire extinguisher circuit breakers opened above.

item.title: Engine Driven Hydraulic Pump Systems Supply Shutoff Valves – Associated Pump Removed

remarks.para: One supply shutoff valve may be inoperative closed provided:

numlitem.para: All Demand pumps are operative,
Demand pump for the associated hydraulic system remains ON, and
Associated pump is removed and a cover plate installed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HYD PRESS ENG ___

numlitem.para: The Demand Pump Selector on the affected system must remain ON throughout flight.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated engine hydraulic pump switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The EDP deactivation/dispatch kit is P/N G29003-8.

numlitem.para: Remove EDP, install approved cover plate and cap lines per AMM 29-11-05/201 procedures.
Deactivate the EDP hydraulic supply shutoff valve closed per the steps listed below:

note.para: The hydraulic shutoff valve is installed in the strut. You must open the forward thrust reverser to strut mid fairing access door to gain access to the valve. You must remove approximately 50 screws to open the access door.

numlitem.para: Gain access to the hydraulic shutoff valve via the appropriate strut access panel/fairing.
Open the associated P6 panel engine fire extinguisher circuit breakers:
Engines 1 or 3: FIRE EXT ENG 1 & 3 BTL A and FIRE EXT ENG 1 & 3 BTL B
Engines 2 or 4: FIRE EXT ENG 2 & 4 BTL A and FIRE EXT ENG 2 & 4 BTL B
Pull the associated P5 Engine Fire Control panel Engine Fire handle.

note.para: You must push the fire override switch installed below the fire switch to operate the fire handle.

warning.para: DO NOT TURN THE FIRE HANDLE. THE EXTINGUISHER BOTTLES WILL LET THE CONTENTS OUT AND CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE ENGINE IF YOU TURN THE FIRE HANDLE.

numlitem.para: Verify the position indicator on the EDP hydraulic shutoff valve moves to the CLOSED position and the motor stops.
Open and collar the associated P7 panel HYDRAULICS EDP SUPPLY circuit breaker:
Push the fire handle back to its usual position.
Close the engine fire extinguisher circuit breakers opened above.

item.title: Demand Hydraulic Pumps – No. 1 or No. 4 Demand Pump Systems

remarks.para: One may be inoperative deactivated provided:

numlitem.para: VMCG is increased by 5 kts.,
Takeoff performance must be in accordance with the AOM/AA Data appendix for landing gear extended,
Takeoff obstacle clearance must be dependent upon flaps remaining in the takeoff position, and
Demand pumps 2 and 3 are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HYD PRESS DEM ___

numlitem.para: Takeoff:

With Demand Hydraulic Pumps No. 1 or No. 4 inoperative, an engine failure at the same position will cause a hydraulic system loss, preventing retraction of the related landing gear, and will require secondary mode (electric) operation of trailing edge flaps. Takeoff performance (including obstacle clearance) is thus based on gear and flaps extended.
After takeoff:
Retract gear with gear lever using normal procedures.
Retract flaps with the flap lever using normal procedures.
At takeoff weights greater than 720,000 lbs, flaps up maneuver speed (Vref +100 kt) may exceed 270 kts. Therefore, ensure gear is retracted prior to selecting Flaps Up.
Apply restricted takeoff climb weights from the takeoff climb limit weight, landing gear extended or brakes deactivated by capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
If Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA) is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated #1 or #4 Demand pump switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Position affected HYD PUMPS DEMAND switch to OFF.
Open and collar the associated P7 panel HYDR__DEMAND circuit breaker.
If the inoperative demand pump is an Air Driven Pump (ADP), verify that the air shutoff valve is closed using one of the following two methods:
Pressurize the pneumatic manifold (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Check that no air is being exhausted from the ADP exhaust louvers. If air is exhausting, continue with Method 2.
Depressurize the pneumatic manifold (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Open the RH trailing edge fairing door.
Check that the shutoff valve is closed (actuator should be fully extended).

If both speed and shutoff valves are open, disconnect at least one valve actuator from the valve shaft (leaving cranking arm on shaft). Move valve shaft to the closed position and lockwire. If shaft is loose or binds, indicating valve damage, close and lockwire the other valve.
Close the RH trailing edge fairing door.

item.title: Demand Hydraulic Pumps – No. 2 or No. 3 Demand Pump Systems

remarks.para: One may be inoperative deactivated provided demand pumps 1 and 4 are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HYD PRESS DEM ___

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated #2 or #3 Demand pump switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 29-11-2-1.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: If the affected pump is either No. 1 and/or No. 4, it remains ON during takeoff and landing, and
Verify OFF and ON positions are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HYD PRESS DEM ___

numlitem.para: If the AUTO position is inoperative on either the No. 1 or No. 4 system, move the demand pump selector(s) to the ON Position for takeoff and landing.

placard.para: Placard the associated Demand Pump Selector AUTO Position: "AUTO INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: AUTO Position INOP:
After engine start for affected pump, verify that associated system pressure with Demand Pump in ON position, and no other pumps running, is 2800-3200 psi.

item.title: Demand Pump Selector – ON Position One or Two Inoperative

remarks.para: Two may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Verify AUTO and OFF function of the associated demand pump are operative, and
Associated EDP is operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HYD PRESS DEM ___

placard.para: Placard the associated Demand Pump Selector ON Position switch(es): "ON POS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: ON Position INOP:

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: After engine start for affected pump, verify that associated system pressure with Engine Driven Pump (EDP) OFF and Demand Pump in AUTO position is 2800-3200 psi. Verify after turning Demand pump to OFF, that associated system pressure decreases to less than 500 psi. Reselect EDP ON and Demand Pump to AUTO.
For demand pumps 1 and/or 4, verify the auto control of the ADP continuous solenoid functions properly:
Select the Hydraulic Synoptic page for display on EICAS. Verify the associated ADP is not operating.

With the Flaps Up, select Flaps 1 while monitoring ADP run status on the synoptic display. Verify the ADP starts to operate upon selecting Flaps 1. If the ADP does not start, it must be considered inoperative and deferred per MEL item 29-11-2-1.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard the associated reservoir servicing gauge: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Auxiliary Pump – (AC Motor Pump) Systems #4 Pump

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided Demand Pump Selector is properly positioned.

numlitem.para: Before engine start, position the associated Demand Pump Selector to OFF.
After engines are started, use normal procedures to position the Demand Pump Selector.

placard.para: Placard the Demand Pump Selector AUX Position: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Position associated Demand Pump Selector(s) to OFF or AUTO.
When towing aircraft, have APU running to provide electrical power and bleed air. Pressurize hydraulic system 4, 1, or 2 with applicable system demand pump.

note.para: UPS B-747-400Fs have an AC motor-driven demand pump on System No. 2.

item.title: Auxiliary Pump – (AC Motor Pump) Systems #1 & #4 Pumps

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided Demand Pump Selector is properly positioned.

numlitem.para: Before engine start, position the associated Demand Pump Selector to OFF.
After engines are started, use normal procedures to position the Demand Pump Selector.

placard.para: Placard the Demand Pump Selector AUX Position: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 29-21-1.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated reservoir pressurization is verified to be operative once each flight day.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HYD RSVR PRESS ____

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ HYD RSVR PRESS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify that the reservoir pressurization is operative by using either Method 1 or Method 2:

Pressurize the pneumatic system. Depress the reservoir pressurization bleed valve (port “BLD” on the reservoir pressurization module) for two minutes and verify that air can continually be heard flowing through the valve.

With the reservoir depressurized, install a pressure gauge at the “GA” port on the reservoir pressurization module. Pressurize the pneumatic system and verify that pressure is maintained greater than 21 psia (6 psig).

item.title: Hydraulic System Temperature Indications – Hydraulic Quantity Indication Operative

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided the following indications are verified to be operative:

numlitem.para: Associated system pressure indication, and
Associated hydraulic quantity indication.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HYD OVHT SYS ____

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ HYD SYS TEMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Required indications for the associated system are verified as follows:
Push the HYD switch on the EICAS Display Select Panel. The Hydraulic Synoptic Page will come into view on the Auxiliary EICAS screen.
Verify the associated SYS FAULT light is ON before the system is pressurized.
Pressurize the associated system and verify the following indications on the Hydraulic Synoptic Page:
Hydraulic fluid pressure is 2800-3200 psi.
Verify Hydraulic quantity is 0.75 to 1.15 full (fraction of total capacity).

item.title: Hydraulic System Temperature Indications – Hydraulic “SYS FAULT” Light Operative

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided the following indications are verified to be operative:

numlitem.para: Associated system pressure indication, and
Associated hydraulic “SYS FAULT” light.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HYD OVHT SYS ____

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ HYD SYS TEMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Required indications for the associated system are verified as follows:
Push the HYD switch on the EICAS Display Select Panel. The Hydraulic Synoptic Page will come into view on the Auxiliary EICAS screen.
Verify the associated SYS FAULT light is ON before the system is pressurized.
Pressurize the associated system and verify the following indications on the Hydraulic Synoptic Page:
Hydraulic fluid pressure is 2800-3200 psi.
Verify associated SYS FAULT light is OFF when the system is pressurized and indicating 2800-3200 psi.

item.title: Hydraulic Quantity Indications – Hydraulic Temperature Indication Operative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated reservoir level is verified normal before each departure,
Associated system pressure indication is verified to be operative, and
Associated hydraulic temperature indication is verified to be operative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ HYD QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Before each departure, check reservoir level for proper fluid quantity using the fill indicator at the fill station.
Service the reservoir if required (AMM 12-12-01).

A sight gauge installed on each reservoir may be used to check the reservoir fluid level if the EICAS or fill station indication(s) is inoperative. Fill or drain reservoir as required (AMM 12-12-01) to ensure that fluid level is in upper half of the sight gauge.

note.para: To prevent incorrect quantity display due to inoperative indications, the appropriate Hydraulic Quantity Transmitter Connectors (DT401, DT402, DT403, or DT404) may be disconnected, capped and stowed.

numlitem.para: Required indications for the associated system are verified as follows:
Push the HYD switch on the EICAS Display Select Panel. The Hydraulic Synoptic Page will come into view on the Auxiliary EICAS screen.
Verify the associate SYS FAULT light is ON before the system is pressurized.
Pressurize the associated system and verify the following indications on the Hydraulic Synoptic Page:
Hydraulic fluid pressure 2800-3200 psi.
Verify hydraulic fluid temperature is less than 80°C.

item.title: Hydraulic Quantity Indications – Hydraulic “SYS FAULT” Light Operative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated reservoir level is verified normal before each departure,
Associated system pressure indication is verified to be operative, and
Associated hydraulic SYS FAULT light is verified to be operative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ HYD QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Before each departure, check reservoir level for proper fluid quantity using the fill indicator at the fill station.
Service the reservoir if required (AMM 12-12-01).

A sight gauge installed on each reservoir may be used to check the reservoir fluid level if the EICAS or fill station indication(s) is inoperative. Fill or drain reservoir as required (AMM 12-12-01) to ensure that fluid level is in upper half of the sight gauge.

note.para: To prevent incorrect quantity display due to inoperative indications, the appropriate Hydraulic Quantity Transmitter Connectors (DT401, DT402, DT403, or DT404) may be disconnected, capped and stowed.

numlitem.para: Required indications for the associated system are verified as follows:
Push the HYD switch on the EICAS Display Select Panel. The Hydraulic Synoptic Page will come into view on the Auxiliary EICAS screen.
Verify the associate SYS FAULT light is ON before the system is pressurized.
Pressurize the associated system and verify the following indications on the Hydraulic Synoptic Page:
Hydraulic fluid pressure 2800-3200 psi.
Verify associated SYS FAULT light is OFF when the system is pressurized and indicating 2800-3200 psi.

item.title: Hydraulic Quantity Indications – Hydraulic Temperature Indication Operative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated reservoir level is verified normal before each departure,
Associated system pressure indication is verified to be operative, and
Associated hydraulic temperature indication is verified to be operative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ HYD QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 29-33-1-1.

item.title: Hydraulic Quantity Indications – Hydraulic “SYS FAULT” Light Operative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated reservoir level is verified normal before each departure,
Associated system pressure indication is verified to be operative, and
Associated hydraulic SYS FAULT light is verified to be operative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ HYD QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 29-33-1-2.

item.title: Pump Low Pressure Indication Systems – Pump LOW PRESS Lights

remarks.para: One light per hydraulic system may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated system pressure indication is verified to be operative, and
Associated pump is operative before each departure.

note.para: If requested, Confirm affected pump(s) operation after flight with maintenance, prior to shutdown.

numlitem.para: If Demand Pump LOW PRESS light is inoperative:
Ensure exterior flight control/gear areas are clear prior to pressurizing hydraulic system.
With the pneumatic manifold pressurized and electrical power on the aircraft, turn affected pump(s) to AUTO or ON.
System synoptic hydraulic display on EICAS must read between 2800-3200 psi.
If Engine Driven Pump LOW PRESS light is inoperative:
After engine start and prior to blockout, turn associated system Demand Pump(s) OFF.
System synoptic hydraulic display on EICAS must read between 2800-3200 psi.
Return associated Demand Pump(s) to AUTO.
To satisfy repetitive inspection requirement, enter comment in Logbook after check.

note.para: Do not operate pumps for more than 15 minutes with less than 3000 lbs of fuel in each main tank (1 thru 4) due to possible pump overheat.

placard.para: Placard the affected Pump Low Pressure Light(s): "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Check affected pump operation as follows:

caution.para: DO NOT OPERATE PUMPS FOR MORE THAN 15 MINUTES WITHOUT MINIMUM QUANTITIES IN FUEL TANKS DUE TO POSSIBLE PUMP OVERHEAT.

numlitem.para: Air Drive Pump (ADP) or AC Motor-Driven Pump (ACMP):
Ensure that personnel are clear of flight controls.
With electrical power on aircraft, and pneumatic manifold pressurized, turn HYD PUMPS DEMAND switch to AUTO or ON.
System hydraulic pressure display on EICAS must read between 2800-3200 psig.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.
Engine Driven Pump:

With affected engine running, perform same check as for ADP/ACMP above. This check could also be performed by the flight crew prior to shuttling down engines on previous flight, or just prior to departure.

item.title: Pump Low Pressure Indication Systems – Engine Driven Pump (EDP) Pressure Switches

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated demand pump AUTO function is considered inoperative,
Associated system pressure indication is verified to be operative,
Associated pump is operative before each departure, and
Associated demand pump indication system is operative.

The AUTO position of the respective Demand Pump must be considered inoperative. Therefore, the respective Demand Pump selector for the No. 1 or No. 4 system (if either is the affected system) must be selected ON for departure and arrival.
If requested, Confirm affected pump(s) operation after flight with maintenance, prior to shutdown.
To satisfy repetitive inspection requirement, enter comment in Logbook after check.

placard.para: Placard the affected EDP Pressure switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard the associated Demand Pump Selector AUTO Position: "AUTO INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Check affected pump operation as follows:

caution.para: DO NOT OPERATE PUMPS FOR MORE THAN 15 MINUTES WITHOUT MINIMUM QUANTITIES IN FUEL TANKS DUE TO POSSIBLE PUMP OVERHEAT.

numlitem.para: With affected engine running, perform check below. This check could also be performed by the flight crew prior to shutting down engines on previous flight, or just prior to departure.
Ensure that personnel are clear of flight controls.
Push EDP switch ON.
Verify system hydraulic pressure display on EICAS must read between 2800-3200 psig.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 29-11-3-1-1.

item.title: Pump Low Pressure Indication Systems – Demand Pump Pressure Switches

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated system pressure indication is operative,
Associated pump is operative before each departure, and
Associated engine driven pump indication system is operative.

placard.para: Placard the affected DEMAND Pressure switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Check affected pump operation as follows:

caution.para: DO NOT OPERATE PUMPS FOR MORE THAN 15 MINUTES WITHOUT MINIMUM QUANTITIES IN FUEL TANKS DUE TO POSSIBLE PUMP OVERHEAT.

numlitem.para: Air Driven Pump (ADP) or AC Motor-Driven Pump (ACMP):
Ensure that personnel are clear of flight controls.
With electrical power on aircraft, and pneumatic manifold pressurized, turn HYD PUMPS DEMAND switch to AUTO or ON.
System hydraulic pressure display on EICAS must read between 2800-3200 psig.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

item.title: Hydraulic SYS FAULT Lights – Hydraulic Quantity Indication Operative

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided the following indications are verified to be operative:

numlitem.para: Associated system pressure indication, and
Associated hydraulic quantity indication.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HYD OVHT SYS

placard.para: Placard the affected Hydraulic System Fault Light: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Required indications for the associated system are verified as follows:
Push the HYD switch on the EICAS Display Select Panel. The Hydraulic Synoptic Page will come into view on the Auxiliary EICAS screen.
Pressurize the associated system and verify the following indications on the Hydraulic Synoptic Page:
Hydraulic fluid pressure is 2800-3200 psi.
Verify hydraulic quantity is 0.75 to 1.15 full (fraction of total capacity).

item.title: Hydraulic SYS FAULT Lights – Temperature Indication Operative

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided the following indications are verified to be operative:

numlitem.para: Associated system pressure indication, and
Associated System Temperature Indication.

placard.para: Placard the affected Hydraulic System Fault Light: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Required indications for the associated system are verified as follows:
Push the HYD switch on the EICAS Display Select Panel. The Hydraulic Synoptic Page will come into view on the Auxiliary EICAS screen.
Pressurize the associated system and verify the following indications on the Hydraulic Synoptic Page:
Hydraulic fluid pressure is 2800-3200 psi.
Verify hydraulic fluid temperature is less than 80°C.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided defogging valve(s) is secured ON.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to WSHLD AIR switch on Captain’s (First Officer’s) Auxiliary Panel: "INOP SECURED ON". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: For Windshield Air (Defog) System fault(s) that result in a valve(s) inoperative in the closed position:
Gain access to the associated air valve(s) as follows:
Remove captain’s (First Officer’s) oxygen mask/stowage box (AMM 35-11-18/401).
Remove flight crew sidewall lining below the number 2 window.
Open the P180 panel WSHLD AIR circuit breaker.
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector DV464 (Captain) or DV465 (First Officer) from valve.
Secure valve(s) ON as follows:
If defog valve with Manual Override Lever (P/N 86705-1) is installed, move the manual override lever to the open position.
If defog valve without Manual Override Lever (P/N 84535-1) is installed:
Loosen two clamps on valve and remove from flexible hose.
As shown in the following illustration, fabricate a shutoff valve replacement duct.
Install fabricated replacement duct in place of defogging valve.
Re-install flight deck sidewall lining.
Close the circuit breaker open in step B.
Install Captain’s (First Officer’s) oxygen mask/stowage box.
For Windshield Air (Defog) System fault(s) that result in one or both valves inoperative in the open position, both valves must be secured ON as follows:
Select Captain’s and First Officer’s WSHLD AIR Switches ON.
With one or more Packs operating, ensure air is being supplied to both windshields by feeling that air flow freely from the defog outlets.
Open and collar the P180 panel WSHLD AIR circuit breaker.

remarks.para: May be inoperative secured closed provided aircraft is not operated in known or forecast icing conditions.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ANTI-ICE WING ___

numlitem.para: Operations into known or forecast icing conditions prohibited.

placard.para: Placard on Pilot’s Overhead Panel: "LEFT (RIGHT) WAI VALVE INOP CLOSED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To secure valve(s) closed:

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Gain access to valve by extending leading edge flap segments adjacent to (and above) outboard engine. (Valve is located just off the pneumatic manifold.)
Disconnect and stow electrical connector.
Move manual handle until position indicator on top of valve indicates CLOSED.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

item.title: Wing Anti-Ice VALVE Light or WAI Indications – Valve Verified Operative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated valve is verified to be operative before departure in known or forecast icing conditions.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
WAI VALVE ___

placard.para: Placard on Pilot’s Overhead Panel: "LEFT (RIGHT) WAI VALVE IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: To verify valve associated with inoperative VALVE light or WAI indication is operative, perform the Wing Thermal Anti-Ice System Test (AMM 30-11-00/504) excluding the Wing TAI system CMC ground test.

note.para: Since VALVE Light and/or EICAS WAI indications are inoperative under this MMEL item, disregard test procedure steps calling for verification that these items function. Verification is by observing the position indicator on the valve assembly on the wing.

item.title: Wing Anti-Ice VALVE Light or WAI Indications – Valve Inoperative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided the associated wing anti-ice valve is inoperative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
WAI VALVE___

numlitem.para: Operations into known or forecast icing conditions prohibited.

placard.para: Placard on Pilot’s Overhead Panel: "LEFT (RIGHT) WAI VALVE IND INOP" and "LEFT (RIGHT) WAI VALVE INOP CLOSED". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To verify valve associated with inoperative VALVE light or WAI indication is operative, perform the Wing Thermal Anti-Ice System Test (AMM 30-11-00/504) excluding the Wing TAI system CMC ground test.

note.para: Since VALVE Light and/or EICAS WAI indications are inoperative under this MMEL item, disregard test procedure steps calling for verification that these items function. Verification is by observing the position indicator on the valve assembly on the wing.

numlitem.para: To dispatch with WAI Valve inoperative secure WAI valve(s) closed:

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Gain access to valve by extending leading edge flap segments adjacent to (and above) outboard engine. (Valve is located just off the pneumatic manifold.)
Disconnect and stow electrical connector.
Move manual handle until position indicator on top of valve indicates CLOSED.
Restore aircraft to its require configuration.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative secured closed provided aircraft is not operated in known or forecast icing conditions.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ANTI-ICE NAC ___
NAC DUCT ___ LEAK
If icing conditions are inadvertently encountered, reducing thrust on affected engine will minimize possible damage if ice is ingested.

numlitem.para: Operations into known or forecast icing conditions prohibited.

placard.para: Placard on NAI VALVE switch Pilot’s Overhead Panel: "NAI VALVE INOP CLOSED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To secure NAI valve in the closed position:
Gain access to affected NAI valve through access door in nacelle strut.
Disconnect and stow electrical connector.
Turn shaft hex stud to closed position.
With valve in the desired position, pull and rotate the lockout knob to the LOCKED CLOSED position.
Verify the fan air modulating valve is operative (AMM 36-12-04).
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative open provided:

numlitem.para: High pressure shutoff valve is secured closed,
Bleed air switch for associated engine remains OFF except for engine start,
Associated engine nacelle anti-ice switch is operated manually,
Bleed systems on the remaining engines are operative,
Left and right ISLN valves remain open for takeoff and during flaps operation,
A minimum of 70% N1 (60% N1 for RR) is maintained at or above 10,000 ft. MSL, or 55% N1 is maintained below 10,000 ft. MSL on the associated engine while in icing conditions,
For GE, associated engine thrust reverser is deactivated,
For PW & GE, associated PRV is operative,
For RR, associated FWSOV is operative, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ANTI-ICE NAC ___
NAC DUCT ___ LEAK
BLEED HP ENG ___
ENG ___ REVERSER
BLEED OVERPRESS ___
BLEED ___ OVHT

numlitem.para: Disregard the anti-ice valve position disagreement advisory level message NAI VALVE ___ for the affected engine.
For the affected engine, select Engine Bleed OFF except for ground starting. Starter assisted inflight start is not available for the affected engine.
When operating in icing conditions, maintain a minimum of 70% N1 at or above 10,000 MSL and 55% N1 below 10,000 MSL.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted since L and R ISLN valves must remain open during takeoff.
The associated engine reverser will be deactivated. The REV amber indication may be displayed for the engine with the reverser deactivated. Use symmetrical reverse thrust.
EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverse thrust operations.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Increase flight planning fuel by .5%
With Anti-ice selected ON, reduce performance limited weights by: Takeoff and Landing 12,200 lbs. and En route Climb 17,600 lbs.
With Anti-ice selected OFF, reduce performance limited weights by: Takeoff and Landing 4,500 lbs. and En route Climb 17,600 lbs.
Associated Thrust Reverser is inoperative.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard on NAI VALVE switch Pilot’s Overhead Panel: "NAI VALVE INOP CLOSED". Install placards below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: ENG ___ REVERSER INOP" and "ENG ___ HPSOV INOP CLOSED". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: To secure NAI valve in the open position:
Gain access to affected NAI valve through access door in nacelle strut.
Disconnect and stow electrical connector.
Turn shaft hex stud to open position.
With valve in the desired position, pull and rotate the lockout knob to the LOCKED OPEN position.
Verify the fan air modulating valve is operative (AMM 36-12-04).
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.
Secure the associate engine’s high pressure shutoff valve (HPSOV) closed.

note.para: The HPSOV is located on the right side of the high pressure compressor (HPC) case. To deactivate the HPSOV, it is necessary to remove the positioning screw in the valve actuator to release actuator pressure. The positioning screw is then installed in the switch actuating lever to lock the valve in the CLOSED position. It is necessary to open the right thrust reverser half to gain access to the HPSOV.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the HPSOV
Release the pressure in the pneumatic system (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Open the right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Remove the positioning screw from the actuator cap. Do not disconnect the retaining cable from the positioning screw.
Install the positioning screw in the switch actuating lever to lock the HPSOV in the CLOSED position.
Close the right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Secure the Thrust Reverser.
Refer to DMP 78-31-1. Accomplish the Maintenance (M) procedure to deactivate the reverser in the forward thrust position.

item.title: Nacelle Anti-Ice VALVE Lights or NAI Indications – Valve Verified Operative

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided associated valve is verified to be operative before each departure in known or forecast icing conditions.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
NAI VALVE ___

placard.para: Placard on NAI VALVE switch Pilot’s Overhead Panel: "NAI VLV IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: To verify valve associated with inoperative VALVE light or NAI indication is operative, perform the following procedure:
Supply electrical power (AMM 24-22-00/201).
Pressurize the pneumatic system with either a ground air source or with the APU (AMM 36-00-00/201).

warning.para: ENGINES MUST NOT BE RUNNING WHEN PERSONNEL OR EQUIPMENT ARE NEARBY.

numlitem.para: Manually open the associated engine PRSOV (AMM 36-11-04/201).
Gain access to the associated nacelle anti-ice valve assembly on the nacelle anti-ice duct. Access panel is located on the left side of the strut forward fairing, No. 3 fairing:
Locate the valve position indicator hex nut adjacent to the valve manual override selector. Hex nut has position pointer indicating OPEN or CLOSED. The manual override selector must remain at NORMAL.
Verify that nacelle anti-ice valve opens:
Position associated Anti-Ice/Rain Removal panel (P5) NACELLE ANTI-ICE switch ON.

caution.para: IF THE PNEUMATIC AIR IS HOT (APPROXIMATELY 350ºF), DO NOT OPEN THE ENGINE INLET ANTI-ICE VALVE FOR MORE THAN 30 SECONDS. AFTER THE VALVE CLOSES, LET THE INLET COWL BECOME COOL. TOO MUCH HEAT CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE INLET COWL.

numlitem.para: Visually confirm that the valve position indicator hex nut rotates toward OPEN.
Verify that nacelle anti-ice valve closes:
Position associated Anti-Ice/Rain Removal panel (P5) NACELLE ANTI-ICE switch OFF.
Visually confirm that the valve position indicator hex nut rotates to indicate CLOSED.
Release the pressure in the pneumatic system (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Remove electrical power (AMM 24-22-00/201).

item.title: Nacelle Anti-Ice VALVE Lights or NAI Indications – Valve Inoperative

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided associated nacelle anti-ice valve is inoperative.

note.para: If icing conditions are inadvertently encountered, reducing thrust on affected engine will minimize possible damage if ice is ingested.

numlitem.para: Operations into known or forecast icing conditions prohibited.

placard.para: Install Placards on NAI VALVE switch Pilot’s Overhead Panel: "NAI VLV INOP CLOSED" and "NAI VLV IND INOP". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 30-21-1-1.

remarks.para: Heater elements in one probe may be inoperative provided aircraft is not operated in visible moisture or in known or forecast icing conditions.

note.para: For probe heat to be considered operative, both heater elements in that probe must be operative.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
HEAT P/S ___

numlitem.para: Operations into visible moisture or in known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ PITOT-STATIC PROBE HEATER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Angle of Attack Sensor Heater Systems

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided aircraft is not operated in known or forecast icing conditions.

HEAT ___ AOA

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ AOA HEATER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

Flight in icing conditions may result in unreliable performance calculations.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ TEMP PROBE HEATER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided associated heater is operative.

placard.para: Placard on Anti-Ice Rain Removal Panel (P5): "WINDOW HT INOP LIGHT – INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: Both F/O’s window heater systems must be operative.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
WINDOW HEAT ___

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 1.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard on Anti-Ice Rain Removal Panel (P5): "#____ WINDOW HT SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 2.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard on Anti-Ice Rain Removal Panel (P5): "#____ WINDOW HT SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Flight Deck Window Heater Systems (No. 1 & No. 2) – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System – Captain's Inoperative

remarks.para: One window heater system (No. 1 or No. 2) may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Flight Deck Vent Fan is operative, and
AOM limitations are followed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
WINDOW HEAT ___

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 1.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard on Anti-Ice Rain Removal Panel (P5): "#____ WINDOW HT SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Flight Deck Window Heater Systems (No. 1 & No. 2) – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System – F/O's Inoperative

remarks.para: One window heater system (No. 1 or No. 2) may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Flight Deck Vent Fan is operative, and
AOM limitations are followed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
WINDOW HEAT ___

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 2.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard on Anti-Ice Rain Removal Panel (P5): "#____ WINDOW HT SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided affected No. 3 window heat circuit is deactivated.

placard.para: Placard on Anti-Ice Rain Removal Panel (P5): "#3 WINDOW HT SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: No. 3L and 2R window heat circuits share a common power supply and circuit breaker, as do No. 3R and 2L circuits. To ensure that No. 2 window heat is unaffected by associated No. 3 window heat circuit faults over the dispatch repair interval, one of the following two methods may be used to deactivate the No. 3 window heat circuit.

numlitem.para: Remove the control thermostat from the affected No. 3 window(s) (AMM 30-41-06/401). This method is recommended if the control thermostat has the separate electrical connector installed.

note.para: The No. 3 window control thermostat (Window 3L Control Thermostat S759 and/or Window 3R Control Thermostat S762) is installed below the overheat thermostat on the aft edge of the window.

numlitem.para: Open 6E28 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2L & 3R and 6E30 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2R & 3L circuit breakers on the P6 Main Power Distribution Panel.
Lift the retainer and move the thermostat away from the windowpane.
Move the thermostat to one side and carefully lower the spring.
Remove the thermostat from the electrical connector.
Cap and stow the electrical connector for the removed control thermostat.

warning.para: ELECTRICAL SHOCK MAY INJURE PERSONNEL OR DAMAGE EQUIPMENT IF CONTROL THERMOSTAT WIRING IS NOT PROPERLY SECURED.

numlitem.para: Close 6E28 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2L & 3R and 6E30 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2R & 3L circuit breakers on the P6 Main Power Distribution Panel.

Remove the overheat thermostat from the affected No. 3 window(s) (AMM 30-41-06/403). This method is recommended if the control thermostat does not have the separate electrical connector installed. Removal of the overheat thermostat will generate the CMC message WINDOW 3 ___ HEAT FAIL if not already displayed.

note.para: The No. 3 window overheat thermostat (Window 3L Overheat Thermostat S1026 and/or Window 3R Overheat Thermostat S1029) is installed above the control thermostat on the aft edge of the window.

numlitem.para: Open 6E28 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2L & 3R and 6E30 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2R & 3L circuit breakers on the P6 Main Power Distribution Panel.
Lift the retainer and move the thermostat from the rubber ring.
Disconnect the wiring from the thermostat.
Lower the spring against the windowpane.
Cap and stow the wiring for the removed overheat thermostat.

warning.para: ELECTRICAL SHOCK MAY INJURE PERSONNEL OR DAMAGE EQUIPMENT IF OVERHEAT THERMOSTAT WIRING IS NOT PROPERLY SECURED.

numlitem.para: Close 6E28 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2L & 3R and 6E30 WINDOW HEAT PWR 2R & 3L circuit breakers on the P6 Main Power Distribution Panel.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided the aircraft is not operated in known or forecast precipitation within 5 statute miles of the airport of departure or intended landing.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 1.
Operation in precipitation within 5 statute miles of the airport of departure or intended landing is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard on Anti-Ice Rain Removal Panel (P5): "CAPT’s and/or F/O’s WINDSHIELD WIPER(S) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated high speed function is operative.

placard.para: Placard on Anti-Ice Rain Removal Panel (P5): "CAPT’s and/or F/O’s LOW SPD WINDSHIELD WIPER(S) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
