item.title: Windshield Wipers – High Speed – Both Inoperative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Both low speed functions are operative, and
Aircraft is not operated in known or forecast precipitation of moderate or greater intensity within 5 statute miles of the airport of departure or intended landing.
Operation in precipitation of moderate or greater intensity with 5 statute miles of the airport of takeoff or intended landing are prohibited.

placard.para: Placard on Anti-Ice Rain Removal Panel (P5): "CAPT’s and F/O’s HIGH SPD WINDSHIELD WIPER(S) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard on Anti-Ice Rain Removal Panel (P5): "CAPT’s and/or F/O’s WINDSHIELD WASHER SYS(S) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Waste Water Drain Heater System(s) – Secured Off

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Water supply to associated lavatory, galley and service center basin(s) is secured off, and
Associated lavatory, galley and service center basin(s) is not used.

note.para: Lavatory basin is not available. All other functions of lavatory are available.

placard.para: Placard on service basin: "DO NOT USE – DRAIN MAST HEATER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To secure the associated basin shutoff valve(s) closed:
Open access panel at all lavatory sinks, galley sinks, and drinking fountains which drain into inoperative drain mast.
Close water supply shutoff valve at each location.
Close access panels.

item.title: Waste Water Drain Heater System(s) – Basin Not Used

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Water supply to associated galley and service center basin(s) is not used,
Associated lavatory, galley and service center basin(s) is not used,
Associated lavatory door is locked closed and placarded, INOPERATIVE – DO NOT ENTER, and
Lavatory is used only by crewmembers.

note.para: These provisos are not intended to prohibit lavatory use or inspections by crewmembers.
Lavatory basin is not available. All other functions of lavatory are available.

placard.para: Placard on service basin: "DO NOT USE – DRAIN MAST HEATER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 30-71-1-1.

item.chgdesc: Revises effectivity in Maintenance Procedure Note.
item.title: Ice Detection System

remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated provided nacelle and wing anti-ice systems are operated manually.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ICE DETECTOR ___

numlitem.para: Use Nacelle TAI when appropriate.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ICE DETECTION SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: The Ice Detection System is considered to consist of primary or advisory ice detection. To prevent nuisance messages and aural warnings from occurring when the Ice Detection System is inoperative, it is recommended that the ice detectors be deactivated as follows:

para.revision: Aircraft 570 thru 577 only have 1 ice detector which is located on the left side of the fuselage. Aircraft 578 thru 584 have two ice detectors (both L & R).

numlitem.para: Open and collar the following circuit breakers:
Disconnect, cap and stow ice detector connector DM6703 and DM5704.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative at either pilot’s or copilot’s station.

placard.para: Placard near affected clock: "CLOCK INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Cockpit Voice Recorder (CVR) is operative,
Aircraft is not dispatched from a designated airport as listed in the operator’s MEL unless:
The FDR failure occurs after pushback but prior to takeoff, or
The FDR repair was attempted but was not successful.

In those cases where repair is attempted but not successful, the aircraft may be dispatched on a flight or series of flights until the next designated airport where repair must be accomplished prior to dispatch, and
Repairs are made within three flight days.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FLIGHT RCDR SYS

numlitem.para: Designated FDR Repair Airports are SDF, PHL, and ONT.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "FLIGHT RCDR SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.chgdesc: Revises proviso per MMEL.
item.title: Flight Data Recorder (FDR) System – FDR Recording – Parameters required by FAR

para.revision: Up to three (3) recording parameters may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Cockpit Voice Recorder (CVR) is operative, and
Repairs are made within 20 calendar days.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FLIGHT RCDR SYS

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "FLIGHT RCDR SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Flight Data Recorder (FDR) System FDR Recording – Parameters not required by FAR

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided repairs are made prior to the completion of the next heavy maintenance visit.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
FLIGHT RCDR SYS

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "NON-CRITICAL FLT RCDR PARAMETERS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard next to QAR on P-11 panel (side panel behind F/O's seat): "QUICK ACCESS RECORDER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD panel: "ACMS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Master Caution/ Warning Systems – Master Warning Lights (Pilot’s Glare Shield)

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided master warning aural systems and all discrete warning lights are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
AURAL SYNTH CARD
AURAL WARN SPKR

placard.para: Placard near affected Master Warning Light: "MASTER WARNING LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Master Caution/ Warning Systems – Master Caution Lights (Pilot’s Glare Shield)

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided master caution aural systems and all discrete caution lights are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
AURAL SYNTH CARD
AURAL WARN SPKR

placard.para: Placard near affected Master Warning Light: "MASTER CAUTION LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Master Caution/ Warning Systems – Aural Warning Speaker Systems

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided Master Warning, Master Caution, and all discrete lights are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
AURAL SYNTH CARD
AURAL WARN SPKR

placard.para: Placard near affected Master Warning Light: "AURAL WARNING SPEAKER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: MAWEA ID Card may be inoperative.

note.para: ACARS will be inoperative.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
MAWEA ID CARD
Perform ACARS Inoperative procedure from FOM Communications chapter.

numlitem.para: FANS Operations prohibited.
RNP -4 Operations prohibited.

placard.para: Placard near affected Master Warning Light: "MAWEA ID CARD INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided it is verified that EICAS can be switched to an alternate IDU (in case of en route failure of the EICAS Upper IDU).

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
IDS DU

placard.para: Placard on lower EICAS display unit: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: This item allows dispatch only with the IDU located in the lower EICAS position inoperative. The four EFIS IDU’s and the upper EICAS IDU must operate normally. However, all of the IDU’s are interchangeable. Therefore, if an IDU located in the upper EICAS position or any one of the EFIS positions is inoperative (and no spares are available), it can be swapped with the lower (operative) IDU. This switches the inoperative IDU to the lower EICAS position to permit dispatch per this MEL item.

note.para: CRT and LCD IDU's are completely interchangeable in the UPPER and LOWER EICAS positions. The Captain's PF and ND IDU's or the First Officer's PF and ND IDU's are to be maintained as a matched set of either CRT or LCD IDU's. The mixing of both types of IDU on the same side is not allowed. Mixing between the Captain's and First Officer's sides is allowed but not preferred.

maintenance.para: Use the following procedure to verify that EICAS display can be switched to an alternate IDU:

numlitem.para: Select INBD CRT switch on CAPT or F/O Display Transfer Module to EICAS position.
Verify that EICAS is switch to CAPT or F/O inboard IDU.
Return switch to NORM position.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative deactivated provided left and right CDU EFIS control functions are verified to be operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EFIS CONTROL ___
EICAS DSP

numlitem.para: Access EFIS control on the affected pilot’s display via the associated CDU.

placard.para: Placard near or on inoperative EFIS control panel (pilots’ glareshield): "INOP – USE CDU". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: For both left and right Control Display Units (CDUs), verify the EFIS control function is operative as follows:
Open both P7 panel EFIS CONT L and EFIS CONT R circuit breakers.
Press MENU key on left and right CDUs and verify SELECT> prompt is displayed below EFIS CP annunciation on both CDUs.
Collar the circuit breaker opened above associated with the inoperative control panel.
Close the circuit breaker opened above associated with the operative control panel.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Left and right CDU EICAS control functions are verified to be operative, and
Individual fuel quantity indications required for dispatch are operative.
Access EICAS control on the affected pilot’s display via the associated CDU.

placard.para: Placard near or on inoperative EFIS control panel (pilots’ glareshield): "INOP – USE CDU". Install Placard near or on EICAS display select panel (pilots’ glareshield): "INOP – USE CDU". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Verify EICAS control function is operative from the left and right Control Display Units (CDUs):
Open both P7 panel EFIS CONT L and EFIS CONT R circuit breakers.
Press MENU key on left and right CDUs and verify SELECT> prompt is displayed below EICAS CP annunciation on both CDUs.
Deactivate one of the EFIS control panels and use the associated CDU for EFIS control panel and EICAS display select panel functions:
Collar one of the P7 panel EIFS CONT L or EFIS CONT R circuit breakers opened above and close the other.

note.para: It is preferable to collar the EFIS CONT R circuit breaker.

numlitem.para: Select EICAS CP function and EFIS CP function using the CDU associated with the deactivated EFIS control panel.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated equipment is verified to be operative.

numlitem.para: Dispatch with inoperative (nuisance) Status level message(s) is allowed by provisions of this MEL item. An inoperative message is one which is displayed when there is no actual equipment fault. Dispatch may be accomplished by verifying the equipment associated with the inoperative EICAS Status Message is operative.

placard.para: Placard "DISREGARD STATUS MESSAGE _____" below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: Dispatch with inoperative (nuisance) Status level messages is allowed by the provisions of this MEL item. An inoperative message is one which is displayed when there is no actual equipment fault. If such an EICAS message is suspected, dispatch may still be accomplished by verifying the equipment associated with the inoperative EICAS Status Message is operative, or by observing the Dispatch Deviation(s) for the associated equipment, if available. The EICAS Cross Reference List in Section 1 can be used to locate the appropriate MEL item for possible dispatch.

Maintenance (M) procedures are presented herein to verify normal operation of equipment for three nuisance Status messages. These three messages do not have associated Operations (O) procedures. The EICAS STATUS MESSAGE list and procedures associated with them that follow are not intended to be all inclusive.
The following procedure may be used to verify that the Fuel Spar Valve is operative if dispatching with the EICAS status message FUEL SPAR VLV_ displayed.

numlitem.para: Check that all boost pumps and override/jettison pump switches on the Fuel Control Panel are OFF.
Check that all fuel crossfeed valve switches on the Fuel Control Panel are OFF.
Check that all FUEL CONTROL switches on the Control Stand are set to CUTOFF.
Check that all Engine start switches on the P5 panel are OFF.

warning.para: FAILURE TO OPEN APPLICABLE ENGINE IGNITION CIRCUIT BREAKERS (CB’S) PRIOR TO OPENING ENGINE FUEL CONT VALVE CB’S WILL RESULT IN AUTOMATIC FIRING OF IGNITER PLUGS IF/WHEN FLAPS ARE OUT OF ZERO DETENT, NACELLE ANTI-ICE IS ON, CONTINUOUS IGNITION SWITCH IS PULLED “ON,” OR ENGINE START SWITCH IS PULLED “ON.” WHEN UNBURNED FUEL IS IN THE COMBUSTION CHAMBER, INTERNAL ENGINE OR TAILPIPE FIRE MAY RESULT, CAUSING PERSONNEL INJURY OR ENGINE DAMAGE.

numlitem.para: On the P6 Main Power Panel, open the following CBs and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE identifiers:

note.para: Do not proceed to Step 6 until Step 5 has been accomplished in its entirety.

numlitem.para: 6H2 FIRE EXTINGUISHER ENG 1 & 3 A
6H1 FIRE EXTINGUISHER ENG 1 & 3 B
6H4 FIRE EXTINGUISHER ENG 2 & 4 A
6H3 FIRE EXTINGUISHER ENG 2 & 4 B
6F1 IGN 1 ENG 1
6F2 IGN 1 ENG 2
6F3 IGN 1 ENG 3
6F4 IGN 1 ENG 4
6G19 STBY IGN ENG 1
6G20 STBY IGN ENG 2
6G21 STBY IGN ENG 3
6G22 STBY IGN ENG 4
6K19 IGN 2 ENG 1
6K20 IGN 2 ENG 2
6K21 IGN 2 ENG 3
6K22 IGN 2 ENG 4
On the P6 Main Power Panel, open the following CBs and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE identifiers:
6L10 FUEL CONT VALVE ENG 1
6L11 FUEL CONT VALVE ENG 2
6L12 FUEL CONT VALVE ENG 3
6L13 FUEL CONT VALVE ENG 4
Extend Wing Leading Edge Flaps for access to Spar Valves.
Station an observer on an elevated platform near the affected Spar Valve.
Observer visually verify that the Manual Override Lever on the Spar Valve is in the CLOSED position.
Set the associated FUEL CONTROL switch on the Aisle Stand to RUN.
Observer visually verify that the Manual Override Lever on the Spar Valve moves to the OPEN position.
Pull the associated engine FIRE switch on the P5 Fire Control Module.
Observer visually verify that the Manual Override Lever on the Spar Valve moves to the CLOSED position.
Reset the Fire switch.
Observer visually verify that the Manual Override Lever on the Spar Valve moves to the OPEN position.
Set the associated FUEL CONTROL switch on the Aisle Stand to CUTOFF.
Observer visually verify that the Manual Override Lever on the Spar Valve moves to the CLOSED position.
Restore the aircraft to its required configuration. Remove, DO-NOT-CLOSE identifiers and close all CBs opened in Step E and Step F.
If the Fuel Spar Valve positions were all positively verified in the above Steps, the affected Spar Valve is operative and the aircraft may be dispatched.

note.para: The following procedure may be used to verify that LE MULT DRIVE was latched by a single pneumatically inoperative Flap drive unit. If LE MULT DRIVE remains annunciated at the conclusion of the verification procedure, dispatch is not allowed.

warning.para: LEADING AND TRAILING EDGE FLAPS WILL OPERATE. ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Apply power to Flap Control Units (FCUs).
Apply hydraulic and pneumatic power to the flaps.
Move the flap lever to the “UP” detent and wait until the flaps are fully retracted.
Open and close the following circuit breakers located on the P7 panel:
7C10 FLT CONT ELEC 2L AC
7C11 FLT CONT ELEC 2L DC
7C12 FLT CONT ELEC 1L AC
7C13 FLT CONT ELEC 1L DC
7C14 FLT CONT ELEC 1R AC
7C15 FLT CONT ELEC 1R DC
7C16 FLT CONT ELEC 2R AC
7C17 FLT CONT ELEC 2R DC
Verify that all flap related EICAS messages and all existing flap related CMC faults are no longer displayed.
Move the flap lever to the “5” detent and wait until the flaps fully extend. Affected leading edge flaps will operate in the primary electric mode.

caution.para: DO NOT ELECTRICALLY EXTEND OR RETRACT THE FLAPS MORE THAN ONE TIME IN 5 MINUTES. DAMAGE TO THE MOTOR CAN OCCUR IF THE MOTOR BECOMES TOO HOT.

numlitem.para: Verify that LE MULT DRIVE is not displayed.
Move the flap lever to the “UP” detent and wait until the flaps fully retract. Affected leading edge flaps will operate in the primary electric mode.
Verify that LE MULT DRIVE is not displayed.

note.para: Dispatch is not allowed if LE MULT DRIVE was displayed at any time after the circuit breakers were open and closed by Step 2. D. above. Refer to MEL 27-81-1 if LE SINGLE DRIVE status level message remains displayed.
GE SB 75-123 has been complied with on 570 thru 579. EEC software configuration is later than 8.2N on 570 thru 579.
The following may be used to verify that the ESC Valves have been removed if dispatching with the EICAS status message ENG ESCV displayed on aircraft powered by GE engines only.

numlitem.para: Verify that either GE Service Bulletin 75-123, or the GE Block II Change or its production equivalent has been accomplished. The Service Bulletin 75-123 permanently deactivates the ESC Valves open. The GE Block II Change or its production equivalent permanently removes ESC Valves from GE engines.

For aircraft with the ESC Valves permanently deactivated, or permanently removed, or the production equivalent, the EICAS status message ENG_ ESCV message may appear with EEC Software 8.2M and earlier installed. No corrective action is necessary for the associated engine.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided dispatch deviations for associated equipment are observed.

numlitem.para: Dispatch with inoperative (nuisance) Status level message(s) is allowed by provisions of this MEL item. An inoperative message is one which is displayed when there is no actual equipment fault. Dispatch may be accomplished by observing the Dispatch Deviation for the associated equipment.

placard.para: Placard "DISREGARD STATUS MESSAGE _____" below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 31-61-4-1.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided individual fuel quantity indications required for dispatch are operative.

note.para: Individual fuel tank quantity will display automatically if one EICAS screen fails.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ EICAS SYNOPTIC DISPLAY INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: Center or right EIU may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: EIU Instrument Source Selector is verified to be operative, and
EICAS EIU Selector is verified to be operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
EIU ___

placard.para: Install appropriate Placard(s) in accordance with Dispatch Maintenance Procedure. Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the inoperative EIU by opening and collaring the associated P7 panel EIU C or EIU R circuit breaker.
Verify EIU Instrument Source Selector is operative.

On Captain’s source select panel, position EIU source selector to inoperative EIU and observe that Captain’s EFIS displays are blank. Select L on source selector and observe that EFIS displays return to normal. Then select the other operative EIU (C or R) on source selector and observe that EFIS displays are normal. Return selector to AUTO position and observe that EFIS displays remain normal.
Repeat procedure A on First Officer’s source select panel and EFIS displays.

If EIU selectors are positioned to the same source on both pilots’ source selectors, the EICAS advisory message SOURCE SEL EIU will be displayed. Captain’s and First Officer’s instruments must be on separate sources for dispatch. See MEL 34-00-1-1 for dispatch with inoperative EIU auto-select feature.
With AUTO selected on both pilots’ EIU source selectors, check that EICAS advisory message SOURCE SEL EIU is not displayed.
On both pilots’ EIU source selectors, placard selector position corresponding to inoperative EIU (C or R) “INOP.”
Verify EICAS EIU selector is operative.
With both primary and secondary EICAS displays operating, position EICAS EIU selector to the inoperative EIU and observe that EICAS displays are blank.

Position selector to L and observe that EICAS displays return to normal. Then select the other operative EIU (C or R) on selector and observe that EICAS displays are normal. Return selector to AUTO and observe that EICAS display remains normal.
Placard selector position corresponding to inoperative EIU (C or R) “INOP.”

para.emphasis: If EICAS message EIU DISAGREE is displayed while performing this maintenance procedure, dispatch is not allowed.

remarks.para: One per wheel may be broken or missing provided:

numlitem.para: Affected wheel is removed, checked for broken parts or damage, and replaced if broken parts or damage is found,
Associated brake is checked for broken parts or damage, and is replaced or deactivated if broken parts or damage is found,
After each landing, wheel is inspected for additional broken or missing tiebolts, and
Operations are limited to five departures before repairs are made.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "WHEEL(S)___ TIEBOLT MISSING". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Remove the wheel and tire assembly, and inspect the wheel and brake assemblies for broken parts or damage. Inspect the wheel after each landing and replace the affected wheel after five departures.

numlitem.para: Deflate affected wheel to 40 psig or less.

caution.para: YOU MUST DEFLATE THE TIRE BEFORE YOU REMOVE THE WHEEL AND TIRE ASSEMBLY. A DEFECTIVE WHEEL AND TIRE CAN BURST IF YOU DO NOT DEFLATE THE TIRE BEFORE YOU REMOVE THE ASSEMBLY. INJURY TO PERSONS OR DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT CAN OCCUR.

note.para: Do not move the aircraft while the tire is deflated. If the aircraft is moved, the deflated tire and associated wheel, and the wheel and tire on the opposite side of the axle must be replaced.

numlitem.para: Remove each wheel with a broken, loose or missing tiebolt per AMM 32-45-01/401.
Inspect the wheel for broken parts or damage.
If other bolts are broken, loose or missing, or if other areas of the wheel have been damaged, the affected wheel is to be replaced.
Inspect the brake for broken or missing parts or damage (AMM 32-41-15/601). If parts are missing or damage is found, the affected brake is to be replaced or deactivated (MEL item 32-41-1-X).
Re-install the affected wheel per AMM 32-45-01/401.
Inflate tire to correct pressure per AMM 12-15-06/301.

After each landing (up to 5 maximum), inspect remaining tiebolts on the affected wheel (wheel removal not required) to ensure no other bolts are broken, loose or missing. The affected wheel is to be replaced immediately if discrepant tiebolts are found.
Replace the affected wheel after a maximum of 5 subsequent landings.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided landing gear strut is checked for proper inflation and extension.

placard.para: Placard on affected strut gauge: "____ MAIN (or NOSE) STRUT GAUGE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Use external pressure gauge. Check shock strut for proper inflation and extension as specified on placard located on shock strut (wing or body gear) or adjacent to strut in wheel well (nose gear). If required, service shock strut (AMM 12-15-03/301, AMM 12-15-04/301 or AMM 12-15-05/301).

item.chgdesc: Adds Note in Limitations.
item.title: Landing Gear Retracting System

remarks.para: May be partially or completely inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Inoperative components are properly secured, and
Aircraft is operated in accordance with AOM gear down appendix Chapter 5.
Operate aircraft in accordance with Landing Gear Extended performance.
If all landing gear is not to be left extended, use of the following procedure will keep all wheel well doors closed.
Before retraction of operable landing gear, depressurize the hydraulic system associated with the inoperative landing gear: Body and Nose gear Hyd Sys #1, Wing gear Hyd Sys #4.
After gear retraction, position gear lever OFF.
Repressurize the hydraulic system associated with the inoperative landing gear.
Maximum operating speed is 270 KIAS/ 0.73 M.
Maximum takeoff weight is limited to 720,000 lbs.
Apply restricted takeoff climb weights from the Takeoff Climb Limit Weight, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping Chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
RVSM operations prohibited.
Modify ATC flight plan suffix to the appropriate code.
Extended overwater operation prohibited.

para.revision: Extended Overwater operations is a horizontal distance of more than 50 NM from the nearest shoreline.

numlitem.para: If operations are conducted in known or forecasted icing conditions during any part of the flight and if the destination airport has a forecast landing temperature below 8° C, reduce the landing climb limit weight by 78,150 lbs.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ LANDING GEAR TO REMAIN EXTENDED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Configure (pin) the landing gear to be left extended for dispatch per AMM 32-00-00/201. The nose gear and/or main gear (in symmetric wing and body pairs) may be left extended.
If all landing gear are to be left extended, in addition to complying with the step above, the landing gear lever lock circuit breaker (C01435) on the P7 panel must be pulled and collared.
Configure the Mach/airspeed warning system as required by the applicable AOM appendix.
Access the Gear Down Dispatch Switch in the main electronic equipment center.
Remove the safety wire from the switch guard.
Lift switch guard and place switch in the Gear Down Dispatch position.
Close switch guard and install safety wire.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Solenoid is in the latched position, and
Override mechanism is operative.
To retract the landing gear, use the checklist GEAR LEVER WILL NOT MOVE UP.

placard.para: Placard near landing gear lever on center panel: "LEVER LATCH SOLENOID INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: With landing gear lever down, determine that the lock solenoid is in the latched position and the override mechanism operates normally as follows:

numlitem.para: Install all landing gear lockpins in gear.
Move the landing gear control handle from the DN to the OFF position.
Without pushing the landing gear control handle LOCK OVRD button, ensure that the landing gear control handle cannot be moved from the OFF to the UP position.
Push the landing gear control handle LOCK OVRD button and ensure that the landing gear control handle moves from the OFF to the UP position and into the detent.
Return the landing gear control handle to the DN position.
Remove all landing gear lockpins installed in step 1.

remarks.para: One may be broken or missing provided gear handle remains UP after gear retraction.

numlitem.para: After takeoff, retract the gear normally and leave the landing gear lever in the UP position. Extend gear normally.

placard.para: Placard near landing gear lever on center panel: "LEAVE IN UP POSITION AFTER RETRACTION". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Remove affected uplock bungee springs.

remarks.para: One may be broken or missing provided gear handle remains UP after gear retraction.

numlitem.para: After takeoff, retract the gear normally and leave the landing gear lever in the UP position. Extend gear normally.

placard.para: Placard near landing gear lever on center panel: "LEAVE IN UP POSITION AFTER RETRACTION". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Remove affected uplock bungee springs.

item.title: Wheel Brakes – Deactivation Tool Preferred Method

remarks.para: One or two brakes may be deactivated with a deactivation tool provided performance complies with AOM/AA Data for two brakes deactivated.

numlitem.para: Normal gear retraction procedure may be used. Stopping distances will increase.
Observe performance limitations.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, One or Two Brakes Deactivated or One or Two Anti-Skid Channels Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply takeoff performance runway weight corrections from the Takeoff Runway Limit Weight Reduction, Brake(s) Deactivated Using Special Tool Chart in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply landing weight performance for 1 or 2 brakes deactivated in the AA landing Data.
Operations on cluttered or icy runways prohibited.
Use cutback runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "WHEEL___ BRAKE(S) DEACTIVATED WITH DEACTIVATION TOOL". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: WHEEL BRAKES DEACTIVATION TOOL
maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: If Brake System Control Unit (BSCU) P/N S283U002-5 or later version is installed and one or two brakes are deactivated, advisory message ANTI-SKID for the affected wheels may be inhibited as follows: Rotate the BSCU (E9 Rack) message inhibit knobs on the unit’s front face so that one knob points to each affected wheel’s position number. Advisory level message ANTI-SKID will not display if an anti-skid fault is present. While en route, if an additional anti-skid fault occurs affecting another wheel, EICAS will again display ANTI-SKID.

numlitem.para: Examine the wheel brake(s) for leaks or damage.

If there is no leak and no damage, use DEACTIVATION TOOL Procedure in step 2 below. If there is a leak and no damage, and the leak exceeds the limits defined in AMM 32-41-15, use MEL 32-41-1-2. If brake damage exists use MEL 32-41-1-3.
DEACTIVATE BRAKE(S) USING DEACTIVATION TOOL:
Remove pressure from hydraulic systems 1, 2, and 4.
Release the parking brake.
Release pressure from the hydraulic brake accumulator by operating the brake pedals until the HYD BRAKE PRESS gauge on the P1 panel shows pre-charge pressure (approximately 750 psi).

caution.para: REMOVAL OF OTHER THAN ONLY THE SHUTTLE VALVE END CAP CAN RESULT IN EJECTION OF THE SHUTTLE VALVE.

numlitem.para: Remove the applicable shuttle valve cap (the valve that supplies the brakes to be deactivated).

note.para: To identify the shuttle valve that supplies the brakes to be deactivated, refer to FIM 32-42-00/101, Figure 126.

numlitem.para: Install brake deactivation tool (P/N A32080-1) in place of the valve cap and tighten 50-pound inches. Install a lockwire.
Restore the aircraft to its required configuration.
Test for proper deactivation:
Pressurize hydraulic system 4.
Operate the brakes and make sure that the deactivated brake does not apply by observing brake piston movement.

remarks.para: One or two brakes may be deactivated by capping the brake line provided:

numlitem.para: Takeoff and landing performance complies with AOM/AA Data, both for Gear Down dispatch and for two brakes deactivated, and
After takeoff, gear remains down for two minutes before retraction.
Maximum takeoff thrust must be used.
Stopping distances will increase.
Leave gear down for a minimum of 2 minutes after takeoff to permit affected wheel(s) to spin down prior to gear retraction.
Observe performance limitations.

note.para: At takeoff weights greater than 720,000 lbs., flaps up maneuver speed (V REF+ 100 kt) may exceed the landing gear retract speed (270 kt.). Therefore, ensure gear is retracted prior to selecting Flaps Up.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, One or Two Brakes Deactivated or One or Two Anti-Skid Channels Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply takeoff performance runway weight corrections from the Takeoff Runway Limit Weight Reduction, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply restricted takeoff climb weights from the Takeoff Climb Limit Weight, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply landing weight performance for 1 or 2 brakes deactivated in the AA landing data.
If "Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA)" is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.
Operations on cluttered or icy runways prohibited.
Use cutback runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "WHEEL___ BRAKE(S) DEACTIVATED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: WHEEL BRAKES LINE DEACTIVATION
maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: If Brake System Control Unit (BSCU) P/N S283U002-5 or later version is installed and one or two brakes are deactivated, advisory message ANTI-SKID for the affected wheels may be inhibited as follows: Rotate the BSCU (E9 Rack) message inhibit knobs on the unit’s front face so that one knob points to each affected wheel’s position number. Advisory level message ANTI-SKID will not display if an anti-skid fault is present. While en route, if an additional anti-skid fault occurs affecting another wheel, EICAS will again display ANTI-SKID.

numlitem.para: Examine the wheel brake(s) for leaks or damage.
If there is a leak and no damage, and the leak exceeds the limits defined in AMM 32-41-15, use DEACTIVATE BRAKE(S) Procedure in paragraph 3 below. If brake is damaged use MEL 32-41-1-3.
DEACTIVATE BRAKE(S:
Remove pressure from hydraulic systems 1, 2, and 4.
Release the parking brake.
Release pressure from the hydraulic brake accumulator by operating the brake pedals until the HYD BRAKE PRESS gauge on the P1 panel shows pre-charge pressure (approximately 750 psi).

Uncouple the Brake Quick Disconnect – Brake Hose Half and attach the hose to the landing gear truck using tie-wrap P/N BACS38K3D or P/N PLT2S-C3. This will ensure that the hose will not interfere with brake rotation when the gear is retracted.

note.para: The part of the Brake Quick Disconnect that is attached to the hose is called the Brake Quick Disconnect – Brake hose Half. The part of the Brake Quick Disconnect that is attached to the brake is called the Brake Quick Disconnect – Brake Half.
The Brake Quick Disconnect incorporates a pressure release function in the Brake Half; there is no need to open the brake bleed fitting for dispatch.

numlitem.para: Pressurize hydraulic system 1, 2 or 4.
Apply brake pressure and check for leaks.
If removed brake line disconnect is found to leak:
Depressurize system by following steps 3.A thru 3.C.
Remove, disconnect and cap line.
Perform steps 3.E. and 3.F.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

remarks.para: One or two brakes may be deactivated by removing the brake(s) and capping the lines provided:

numlitem.para: Takeoff and landing performance complies with AOM/AA Data, both for Gear Down dispatch and for two brakes deactivated, and
After takeoff, gear remains down for two minutes before retraction, and.

If inoperative brake(s) are on wheels other than No. 1, 2, 13, or 14, one forward and one aft brake on the same side must be removed to maintain a balanced truck, or if inoperative brake(s) are on wheels No. 1, 2, 13, or 14, one brake on each affected truck may be removed.
Maximum takeoff thrust must be used.
Stopping distances will increase.
Leave gear down for a minimum of 2 minutes after takeoff to permit affected wheel(s) to spin down prior to gear retraction.
Observe performance limitations.

note.para: At takeoff weights greater than 720,000 lbs. flaps up maneuver speed (VREF+ 100 kt) may exceed the landing gear retract speed (270 kt.). Therefore, ensure gear is retracted prior to selecting Flaps Up.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, One or Two Brakes Deactivated or One or Two Anti-Skid Channels Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply takeoff performance runway weight corrections from the Takeoff Runway Limit Weight Reduction, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply restricted takeoff climb weights from the Takeoff Climb Limit Weight, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply landing weight performance for 1 or 2 brakes deactivated in the AA landing data.
If "Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA)" is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.
Operations on cluttered or icy runways prohibited.
Use cutback runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "WHEEL___ BRAKE(S) DEACTIVATED – BRAKE(S) REMOVED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: If Brake System Control Unit (BSCU) P/N S283U002-5 or later version is installed and one or two brakes are deactivated, advisory message ANTI-SKID for the affected wheels may be inhibited as follows: Rotate the BSCU (E9 Rack) message inhibit knobs on the unit’s front face so that one knob points to each affected wheel’s position number. Advisory level message ANTI-SKID will not display if an anti-skid fault is present. While en route, if an additional anti-skid fault occurs affecting another wheel, EICAS will again display ANTI-SKID.

numlitem.para: REMOVE INOPERATIVE BRAKE(S):

note.para: To ensure that the truck will tilt to the retract position, one forward and one aft brake on the same side must be removed to maintain a balanced truck. It may be necessary to remove or relocate an operative brake in order to balance the truck and ensure proper retraction. However, if the inoperative brake(s) is on wheel No. 1, 2, 13 or 14, one brake on each affected truck may be removed.

numlitem.para: Remove the affected brakes (AMM 32-41-15).
Cap and secure the hydraulic lines and electrical wiring for the affected brakes, using procedures below:
Remove pressure from hydraulic systems 1, 2 and 4 (AMM 29-11-00/201).
Release the parking brake.
Release pressure from the hydraulic brake accumulator by operating the brake pedals until HYD BRAKE PRESS gauge on the P1 panel shows pre-charge pressure (approximately 750 psi).

Uncouple the Brake Disconnect - Brake Hose Half and attach the hose to the landing gear truck using tie-wrap P/N BACS38K3D or P/N PLT2S-C3. This will ensure that the hose will not interfere with brake rotation when the gear is retracted.

note.para: The part of the Brake Disconnect that is attached to the hose is called the Brake Disconnect - Brake hose half. The part of the Brake Disconnect that is attached to the brake is called the Brake Disconnect – Brake Half.
The Brake Disconnect incorporates a pressure release function in the Brake Half; there is no need to open the brake bleed fitting for dispatch.

numlitem.para: Pressurize hydraulic system 1, 2 or 4.
Apply brake pressure and check for leaks.
Remove the associated brake equalizer rods from the truck.
Install tire and wheel assemblies and restore the aircraft to normal (AMM 23-41-15).

item.title: Brake Accumulator Pressure Indicator – (In Wheel Well)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided flight deck indication is operative.

placard.para: Install Placard on wheel well accumulator gauge: "BRAKE ACCUM PRESS GAUGE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Brake accumulator charge is verified normal once each flight day, and
Brake source discrete light is operative.

placard.para: Placard on wheel well accumulator gauge: "BRAKE PRESS GAUGE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: BRAKE SOURCE discrete light check:
Pressurize hydraulic systems No. 1, 2 and 4.
Check that the BRAKE SOURCE discrete light on the P1 panel is off.
Depressurize hydraulic system No. 4. Check that BRAKE SOURCE discrete light remains off.
Depressurize hydraulic system No. 1. Check that BRAKE SOURCE discrete light remains off.
Depressurize hydraulic system No. 2. Check that BRAKE SOURCE discrete light is on.
Brake Accumulator Charge Check:
Chock the wheels, release the parking brake and depressurize hydraulic systems 1, 2 and 4.
Apply and release brakes 8 times.
Gain access to the hydraulic brake accumulator direct reading pressure gauge in the right side body landing gear wheel well.
Check that the direct reading pressure gauge adjacent to the hydraulic brake accumulator air charging valve indicates correct pre-charge (approximately 750 psi – see placard adjacent to gauge.)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Takeoff performance is based on landing gear extended, and
After takeoff, landing gear remains extended for a minimum of two minutes before retraction.
Leave gear down for a minimum of 2 minutes after takeoff to permit affected wheel(s) to spin down prior to gear retraction.
Observe performance limitations.

note.para: At takeoff weights greater than 720,000 lbs., flaps up maneuver speed (VREF+ 100 kt) may exceed the landing gear retract speed (270 kt.). Therefore, ensure gear is retracted prior to selecting Flaps Up.

numlitem.para: Apply restricted takeoff climb weights from the Takeoff Climb Limit Weight, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
If "Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA)" is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.

placard.para: Placard near gear handle: "INFLIGHT WHEEL BRAKING INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "BRAKE SOURCE LIGHT INOP." Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided operations comply with AOM/AA Data anti-skid inoperative procedures and performance data.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ANTI-SKID
ANTI-SKID OFF

numlitem.para: Maximum takeoff thrust must be used.
For rejected takeoff:
Immediately place all thrust levers to idle.
Deploy full speed brakes.
Apply steady light braking for weights under approximately 500,000 lbs. or apply steady light to moderate manual braking at heavier weights.
For landing:
Deploy full speed brakes immediately after touchdown.
Apply steady light braking for landing weights under approximately 500,000 lbs. or apply steady light to moderate manual braking at heavier weights. Modulate brakes as necessary to prevent skidding.
Observe performance limitations.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 1.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, Cluttered/Icy Runway or Complete Anti-Skid System Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply anti-skid inoperative takeoff weight performance penalty as found in the AA takeoff data.
Apply anti-skid inoperative landing weight performance weight correction in the AA landing data.
If "Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA)" is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.
All brakes must be operative.
All Thrust Reversers must be operative.
Use cutback runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Install Placards as directed in DMP procedure. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
GENERAL

para.emphasis: Following conclusion of the MAINTENANCE (M) procedure, if EICAS message ANTI-SKID or ANTI-SKID OFF remains displayed, the Fault isolation procedure must be performed prior to every departure to determine if additional anti-skid faults occurred en route. Contact Aircraft Maintenance Control to inform them of a repetitive inspection requirement.

numlitem.para: FAULT ISOLATION:
Conduct a CMC Brake System Ground Test to identify anti-skid fault(s):

note.para: The ground set-up procedure may be simplified as follows:
The IRUs do not need to be in NAV mode. (Ignore any IRS signal fault indications.) Hydraulic pressure is not required. Autobrake system does not need to be armed.

numlitem.para: Select 32 BRAKE CONTROL from the CMC GROUND TEST menu.
Execute the BRAKE SYSTEM BITE test. Record all anti-skid system configuration and input faults annunciated during the test.

Following the conclusion of the CMC Brake System Ground Test, select the line-select key opposite the FAIL prompt on the CMC and record the anti-skid system fault. Continue to select the NEXT PAGE key on the CMC as required and record the anti-skid system faults.

note.para: When CMC message PARK BRK VLV NOT OPEN WHEN RELEASED or NO PARK BRK PWR is displayed, dispatch is not allowed (Brake Torque Limiter is inoperative). This condition causes EICAS Status message PARK BRK VALVE as well as ANTI-SKID OFF and BRAKE LIMITER Advisory messages.

numlitem.para: MAINTENANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Install Placard Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ANTI-SKID SYSTEM - INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

If CMC messages ANTI-SKID TRANSDUCER X FAIL and/or BSCU FAIL; ANTI-SKID CONTROL CHANNEL X-Y are identified in fault isolation (Step 1) above, open and collar C/B(s) corresponding to the affected wheel(s) as indicated in the Circuit Breaker (C/B) Table below:

note.para: Each C/B contains a fore-aft locked-wheel-protection pair. If any two circuit breakers associated with wing gear wheels are open, body gear steering will be inoperative.

numlitem.para: If CMC message NO POWER ON ANTI-SKID CHANNEL X-Y is identified, the associated anti-skid system channel is already unpowered. Therefore, it is not required to open associated CB(s).
If CMC message NORMAL ANTI-SKID VALVE X FAIL is identified, verify manual operation of the normal brake system for the affected wheel(s):
Provide electrical power to all operative anti-skid and torque limiter channels (AMM 24-22-00/201).
Chock wheels.
Pressurize hydraulic system 4.
Fully depress and fully release brake pedals. Observe the brake wear indicator pins and/or brake pistons to verify that the affected brakes apply and release.
If manual operation is not available:
Open the P180 panel ANTISKID X-X circuit breaker for the affected wheels.
Remove and stow associated anti-skid valve electrical connector(s).
Close the opened circuit breakers.

note.para: Previous deactivation of the associated wheel antiskid system may require the circuit breaker be collared.

Since one C/B provides power for anti-skid protection of two wheels, if a failed valve interferes with manual braking the electrical connector is removed from the valve instead of opening and collaring the associated C/B.

numlitem.para: Fully depress and release the brake pedals and confirm the brake wear indicator pins and/or brake pistons indicate the affected brakes apply and release.

item.title: Anti-skid System Control Channels – Deactivation Tool Preferred Method

remarks.para: Anti-skid control channels for one or two brakes may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: The affected brakes are deactivated, and
AOM/AA Data performance decrements are applied for the selected procedure.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ANTI-SKID

operation.para: If brakes are deactivated using the tool,

numlitem.para: Normal gear retraction procedure may be used.
Stopping distances will increase.
Observe performance limitations.
Maximum takeoff thrust must be used.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, One or Two Brakes Deactivated or One or Two Anti-Skid Channels Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply takeoff performance runway weight corrections from the Takeoff Runway Limit Weight Reduction, Brake(s) Deactivated Using Special Tool Chart in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply landing weight performance for 1 or 2 brakes deactivated in the AA landing data.
Operations on cluttered or icy runways prohibited.
Use cutback runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Install Placards as directed in DMP procedure. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: ANTI-SKID SYSTEM

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
Confirm antiskid faults, deactivate the associated brakes, and prior to every flight review CMC messages when ANTISKID advisory message is displayed.

numlitem.para: Conduct a CMC Brake System Ground Test.

note.para: The ground set-up procedure may be simplified. The IRUs do not need to be in NAV mode. (Ignore any IRS signal fault indications). Hydraulic pressure is not required. Autobrake system does not need to be armed.

numlitem.para: Select 32 BRAKE CONTROL from the CMC GROUND TEST menu.
Execute the BRAKE SYSTEM BITE test. Record all antiskid system configuration and input faults annunciated during the test.

Following the conclusion of the CMC Brake System Ground Test, select the line-select key opposite the FAIL prompt on the CMC and record the antiskid system fault. Continue to select the NEXT PAGE key on the CMC as required and record the antiskid system faults.

note.para: When CMC message PARK BRK VLV NOT OPEN WHEN RELEASED or NO PARK BRKE PWR is displayed, dispatch is not allowed (Brake Torque Limiter is inoperative). This condition causes Status message PARK BRK VALVE as well as ANTISKID OFF and BRAKE LIMITER Advisory messages.

numlitem.para: ******** For Brake System Control Unit (BSCU) P/N S283U002-5 (or later) not installed:
Deactivate the associated wheel brakes.
Use MEL item 32-41-1-1 to deactivate the associated wheel brakes.
********For Brake System Control Unit (BSCU) P/N S283U002-5 (or later) installed:
Deactivate the associated wheel brakes.
Use MEL item 32-41-1-1 to deactivate the associated wheel brakes.
Position the BSCU (E9 Rack) front face message inhibit knobs so that one knob points to each affected wheel position number. Advisory message ANTISKID will not remain annunciated.
If EICAS message ANTI-SKID or ANTI-SKID OFF remains displayed, the Fault isolation procedure must be performed prior to every departure to determine if additional anti-skid faults occurred en route.

item.title: Anti-skid System Control Channels – Line Capped Alternate Method

remarks.para: Anti-skid control channels for one or two brakes may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: The affected brakes are deactivated, and
AOM/AA Data performance decrements are applied for the selected procedure.

operation.para: If brakes are deactivated capping the lines,

numlitem.para: Maximum takeoff thrust must be used.
Stopping distances will increase.
Leave gear down for a minimum of 2 minutes after takeoff to permit affected wheel(s) to spin down prior to gear retraction.
Observe performance limitations.
If Advisory level message ANTI-SKID remains displayed:
Ensure that maintenance Fault Isolation is performed prior to each departure.
RTO and landing autobrakes are inoperative.

note.para: At takeoff weights greater than 720,000 lbs., flaps up maneuver speed (VREF+ 100 kt) may exceed the landing gear retract speed (270 kt). Therefore, ensure gear is retracted prior to selecting Flaps Up.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, One or Two Brakes Deactivated or One or Two Anti-Skid Channels Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply takeoff performance runway weight corrections from the Takeoff Runway Limit Weight Reduction, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply restricted takeoff climb weights from the Takeoff Climb Limit Weight, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply landing weight performance for 1 or 2 brakes deactivated in the AA landing data.
If "Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA)" is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.
Operations on cluttered or icy runways prohibited.
Use cutback runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "WHEEL___ BRAKE(S) DEACTIVATED WITH LINES CAPPED." Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: ANTI-SKID SYSTEM

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
Confirm antiskid faults, deactivate the associated brakes, and prior to every flight review CMC messages when ANTISKID advisory message is displayed.

numlitem.para: Conduct a CMC Brake System Ground Test.

note.para: The ground set-up procedure may be simplified. The IRUs do not need to be in NAV mode. (Ignore any IRS signal fault indications). Hydraulic pressure is not required. Autobrake system does not need to be armed.

numlitem.para: Select 32 BRAKE CONTROL from the CMC GROUND TEST menu.
Execute the BRAKE SYSTEM BITE test. Record all antiskid system configuration and input faults annunciated during the test.

Following the conclusion of the CMC Brake System Ground Test, select the line-select key opposite the FAIL prompt on the CMC and record the antiskid system fault. Continue to select the NEXT PAGE key on the CMC as required and record the antiskid system faults.

note.para: When CMC message PARK BRK VLV NOT OPEN WHEN RELEASED or NO PARK BRKE PWR is displayed, dispatch is not allowed (Brake Torque Limiter is inoperative). This condition causes Status message PARK BRK VALVE as well as ANTISKID OFF and BRAKE LIMITER Advisory messages.

numlitem.para: ******** For Brake System Control Unit (BSCU) P/N S283U002-5 (or later) not installed:
Deactivate the associated wheel brakes.
Use MEL item 32-41-1-2 to deactivate the associated wheel brakes.
********For Brake System Control Unit (BSCU) P/N S283U002-5 (or later) installed:
Deactivate the associated wheel brakes.
Use MEL item 32-41-1-2 to deactivate the associated wheel brakes.
Position the BSCU (E9 Rack) front face message inhibit knobs so that one knob points to each affected wheel position number. Advisory message ANTISKID will not remain annunciated.
If EICAS message ANTI-SKID or ANTI-SKID OFF remains displayed, the Fault isolation procedure must be performed prior to every departure to determine if additional anti-skid faults occurred en route.

remarks.para: One transducer in a locked-wheel protection pair (fore & aft wheels) may be inoperative provided performance complies with AOM/AA Data for two brakes deactivated.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ANTI-SKID

numlitem.para: Locked wheel protection remains available.
Two Brakes Deactivated with tool penalty must be applied.
Observe performance limitations.
Maximum takeoff thrust must be used.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, One or Two Brakes Deactivated or One or Two Anti-Skid Channels Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply takeoff performance runway weight corrections from the Takeoff Runway Limit Weight Reduction, Brake(s) Deactivated Using Special Tool Chart in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply landing weight performance for 1 or 2 brakes deactivated in the AA landing data.
Operations on cluttered or icy runways prohibited.
Use cutback runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Install Placards as directed in DMP procedure. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: ANTI-SKID SYSTEM WHEEL SPEED TRANSDUCERS

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

Confirm antiskid faults, deactivate the associated wheel brakes for ANTISKID TRANSDUCER X FAIL affecting fore-aft pair, and prior to every flight review CMC messages when ANTISKID advisory message is displayed.

numlitem.para: Conduct a CMC Brake System Ground Test.

note.para: The ground set-up procedure may be simplified. The IRUs do not need to be in NAV mode. (Ignore any IRS signal fault indications). Hydraulic pressure is not required. Autobrake system does not need to be armed.

numlitem.para: Select 32 BRAKE CONTROL from the CMC GROUND TEST menu.
Execute the BRAKE SYSTEM BITE test. Record all antiskid system configuration and input faults annunciated during the test.

Following the conclusion of the CMC Brake System Ground Test, select the line-select key opposite the FAIL prompt on the CMC and record the antiskid system fault. Continue to select the NEXT PAGE key on the CMC as required and record the antiskid system faults.

note.para: When CMC message PARK BRK VLV NOT OPEN WHEN RELEASED or NO PARK BRKE PWR is displayed, dispatch is not allowed (Brake Torque Limiter is inoperative). This condition causes Status message PARK BRK VALVE as well as ANTISKID OFF and BRAKE LIMITER Advisory messages.

numlitem.para: For ANTISKID TRANSDUCER X FAIL (fore-aft pair not involved):
Notify AMC and flight crew that antiskid transducers are inoperative, but affected wheel brakes remain operative.

note.para: Do not use BSCU message inhibit knobs.

numlitem.para: For ANTISKID TRANSDUCER X FAIL (fore-aft pair involved):
Use MEL item 32-41-1-X to deactivate the associated wheel brakes.

remarks.para: One valve (affecting two wheels) may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Both of the associated brakes are deactivated by capping the supply pressure hydraulic line, and
AOM/AA Data performance decrements are applied.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ANTI-SKID

numlitem.para: Stopping distances will increase.
Leave gear down for a minimum of 2 minutes after takeoff to permit affected wheel(s) to spin down prior to gear retraction.
Observe performance limitations.
Maximum takeoff thrust must be used.

note.para: At takeoff weights greater than 720,000 lbs., flaps up maneuver speed (VREF + 100 kt) may exceed the landing gear retract speed (270 kt). Therefore, ensure gear is retracted prior to selecting Flaps Up.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, One or Two Brakes Deactivated or One or Two Anti-Skid Channels Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply takeoff performance runway weight corrections from the Takeoff Runway Limit Weight Reduction, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply restricted takeoff climb weights from the Takeoff Climb Limit Weight, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply landing weight performance for 1 or 2 brakes deactivated in the AA landing data.
If "Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA)" is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.
Operations on cluttered or icy runways prohibited.
Use cutback runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Install Placards as directed in DMP procedure. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
Placard Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "WHEEL_ BRAKE(S) DEACTIVATED WITH LINES CAPPED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Cap and deactivate the associated brake lines and prior to every flight review CMC messages when ANTISKID advisory message is displayed.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the associated brakes using DMP 32-41-1-2.
For ANTISKID advisory message displayed, before each flight review CMC for additional antiskid faults.

note.para: The ground set-up procedure may be simplified. The IRUs do not need to be in NAV mode. (Ignore any IRS signal fault indications). Hydraulic pressure is not required. Autobrake system does not need to be armed.

numlitem.para: Select 32 BRAKE CONTROL from the CMC GROUND TEST menu.
Execute the BRAKE SYSTEM BITE test. Record all antiskid system configuration and input faults annunciated during the test.

Following the conclusion of the CMC Brake System Ground Test, select the line-select key opposite the FAIL prompt on the CMC and record the antiskid system fault. Continue to select the NEXT PAGE key on the CMC as required and record the antiskid system faults.

note.para: When CMC message PARK BRK VLV NOT OPEN WHEN RELEASED or NO PARK BRKE PWR is displayed, dispatch is not allowed (Brake Torque Limiter is inoperative). This condition causes Status message PARK BRK VALVE as well as ANTISKID OFF and BRAKE LIMITER Advisory messages.

numlitem.para: For additional faults indicated, use DMP item 32-42-1-0-1, 32-42-1-1, 32-42-1-1-1, or 32-42-1-2 as applicable.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Autobrake selector remains in the OFF position,
Autobrake solenoid valve is verified closed, and
Approach minimums do not require its use.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
AUTOBRAKES

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.

placard.para: Placard near Autobrake Selector Switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
To verify the Autobrake solenoid valve is closed:

numlitem.para: Apply electrical power to aircraft, chock the wheels, set parking brake OFF, and pressurize hydraulic system No. 4 (auxiliary pump or a ground pressure source may be used).
Place the AUTOBRAKE SELECTOR SWITCH to the OFF position.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message is no longer displayed, the solenoid valve is closed.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message remains displayed on EICAS at this point, either an electrical malfunction or a solenoid valve malfunction is indicated. Continue with the next step.
Open and collar the P180 panel AUTOBRAKES circuit breaker.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message is no longer displayed, a valve malfunction is not indicated and the valve is assumed to be closed.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message remains displayed on EICAS, continue with the next step.
Depressurize Hydraulic Systems No. 1, 2 and 4, then pump the brake pedals until the brake accumulator pressure gauge on the Captain’s panel will reduce no further (approximately 750 psi).
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message remains displayed, a solenoid valve pressure switch or indication system malfunction is indicated, and the solenoid valve is closed.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message is no longer displayed, the solenoid valve has failed open. Refer to MEL 32-42-3-2 for dispatch.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Autobrake selector remains in the OFF position,
Autobrake hydraulic control module is deactivated, and
Approach minimums do not require its use.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
AUTOBRAKES

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.

placard.para: Placard near Autobrake Selector Switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: Apply electrical power to aircraft, chock the wheels, set parking brake OFF, and pressurize hydraulic system No. 4 (auxiliary pump or a ground pressure source may be used).
Place the AUTOBRAKE SELECTOR SWITCH to the OFF position.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message is no longer displayed, the solenoid valve is closed and aircraft can be dispatched per MEL 32-42-3-1
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message remains displayed on EICAS at this point, either an electrical malfunction or a solenoid valve malfunction is indicated. Continue with the next step.
Open and collar the P180 panel AUTOBRAKES circuit breaker.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message is no longer displayed, a valve malfunction is not indicated and the valve is assumed to be closed and aircraft can be dispatched per MEL 32-42-3-1.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message remains displayed on EICAS, continue with the next step.
Depressurize Hydraulic Systems No. 1, 2 and 4, then pump the brake pedals until the brake accumulator pressure gauge on the Captain’s panel will reduce no further (approximately 750 psi).

If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message remains displayed, a solenoid valve pressure switch or indication system malfunction is indicated, and the solenoid valve is closed. Aircraft can be dispatched per MEL 32-42-3-1.
If the AUTOBRAKES advisory message is no longer displayed, the solenoid valve has failed open. Continue with the next step.
Hydraulically deactivate the Autobrake system as follows:
Remove the hydraulic power from system No. 4. Pump the brake pedals until the brake accumulator pressure gauge will reduce no further (approximately 750 psi).
Locate the Autobrake Pressure Control Module in the right hand wing gear wheel well on aft bulkhead near top center.

Disconnect and cap the PRESSURE line on the Autobrake Pressure Control Module (P/N 60B00263-3), or Remove the Autobrake Pressure Control Module (P/N 60B00263-3), cap the PRESSURE line to the module, and interconnect the BRAKE and RETURN lines (straight section of - 10 tubing 7-1/2 inches long including fittings, will suffice).

note.para: Do not cap the BRAKE line from the valve. Interconnection between the BRAKE and RETURN ports, either through the valve or interconnect tube, is required to ensure that a leaky Autobrake Shuttle Valve cannot result in an inability to release brakes when the pilots’ pedals are released.

numlitem.para: Restore hydraulic power to system No. 4 and check for leaks.
Leaving the AUTOBRAKES circuit opened and collared, restore the aircraft to its normal configuration.

item.chgdesc: Revises item and proviso to align with MMEL. Revises Placard Statement and Maintenance Procedure.

title.revision: Torque Limiter System – Torque Limiter Control – Two Inoperative on One Gear Deactivation Tool

remarks.para: Torque limiter control for two brakes on one truck may be inoperative provided:

para.revision: Associated brakes are considered inoperative,
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied, and
BRAKE LIMITER indication is not displayed.
Only two brakes maximum can be deferred on aircraft at a time.

note.para: EICAS message BRAKE LIMITER may be displayed. If the advisory level message BRAKE LIMITER is displayed, then torque limiter control for more than one active brake per gear truck is inoperative and dispatch is not allowed.

numlitem.para: Normal gear retraction procedure may be used.
Stopping distances will increase.
Observe performance limitations.
Maximum takeoff thrust must be used.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, One or Two Brakes Deactivated or One or Two Anti-Skid Channels Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply takeoff performance runway weight corrections from the Takeoff Runway Limit Weight Reduction, Brake(s) Deactivated Using Special Tool Chart in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply landing weight performance for 1 or 2 brakes deactivated in the AA landing data.
Operations on cluttered or icy runways prohibited.
Use cutback runway is prohibited.

para.revision: Placard near Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel "____ Torque LMTR CNTL". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: TORQUE LIMITER SYSTEM – TORQUE LIMITER CONTROL

para.revision: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

para.revision: If torque limiter control for only one brake is inoperative, dispatch is allowed if:
Affected brake is deactivated.
The BRAKE LIMITER advisory and status level EICAS messages are not displayed following accomplishment of the Maintenance (M) procedure.

numlitem.para: If torque limiter control for two brakes on the same truck is inoperative, dispatch is allowed if:
Both affected brakes are deactivated.

para.revision: The BRAKE LIMITER advisory and status level EICAS messages are not displayed following accomplishment of the Maintenance (M) procedure.
BRAKE LIMITER advisory and status messages will again display if additional brake limiter faults occur affecting other wheel positions.
Only two brakes maximum can be deferred on aircraft at a time.

maintenance.para: Inhibit of the BRAKE LIMITER EICAS messages associated with the brake limiter faults on the deactivated brakes requires that the aircraft have Brake System Control Unit P/N S283U002-5 (E9 Rack) or later version installed. Additional brake limiter faults which occur en route, that affect non-deactivated brake channels, will still be indicated by annunciation of the BRAKE LIMITER status and advisory level EICAS messages, as appropriate.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the one or two affected brakes per MEL 32-41-1-1.

para.revision: Inhibit EICAS advisory and status level BRAKE LIMITER messages:

numlitem.para: Rotate the two EICAS message inhibit knobs on the front face of the Brake System Control Unit (requires P/N S283U002-5 or later version installed) so that each knob points to a different wheel position number of the two deactivated brakes. The advisory and status level BRAKE LIMITER messages will no longer be annunciated for the selected wheel positions.

Once the inhibit knobs are set for the affected wheel positions, if additional brake limiter faults occur en route, affecting other wheel positions, EICAS will again display the status and/or advisory level EICAS messages as appropriate.

item.chgdesc: Adds item per MMEL.

title.revision: Torque Limiter System – Torque Limiter Control – Two Inoperative on One Gear Line Capped

para.revision: May be inoperative provided:
Two torque limiters and associated brakes per truck are operative,
For two torque limiters inoperative on the same truck, at least one associated brake must be considered inoperative, and

EICAS message BRAKE LIMITER may be displayed. If the advisory level message BRAKE LIMITER is displayed, then torque limiter control for more than one active brake per gear truck is inoperative and dispatch is not allowed.
If brakes deactivated by capping:
