item.title: Engine Bleed Pressure Regulating and Shutoff Valves – (PRSOV)

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated PRSOV is secured closed except for engine start,
L and R ISLN valves are open for takeoff, and when flaps are operated,
Bleed systems on remaining engines are operative, and
Start valves on remaining engine are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ START VLV

numlitem.para: A manual override ground start is required.

note.para: The amount of torque necessary to open the PRSOV depends on existing pneumatic pressure. If manifold is unpressurized, the PRSOV will open easily. If manifold is pressurized, the PRSOV may require up to 50 ft-lb. of applied torque to open.

numlitem.para: If PRSOV is to be opened with wing pneumatic manifold unpressurized:
Select the appropriate L or R ISLN VALVE switch OFF.
If the other engine on the same wing is running, select its ENGINE BLEED switch OFF.
When ready for engine start, advise ground crew to open the PRSOV.
Ensure the pneumatic manifold is pressurized and pull the appropriate engine start switch.

note.para: If PRSOV is opened with the wing pneumatic manifold unpressurized, select appropriate L or R ISLN VALVE switch ON after PRSOV is confirmed open by ground crew.

numlitem.para: At 45-50% N2, request closed PRSOV to ground crew.
Continue engine start.
Select ENGINE BLEED switch OFF when requested by ground crew to enable them to secure the PRSOV closed.
Select ON for the associated ENGINE BLEED switch after ground crew has secured the PRSOV locked closed. This enables other engine valves to be operative.
Ensure ENGINE BLEED switch for other engine on same wing is selected ON.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted since L and R ISLN valves must remain open during takeoff.
Starter assisted inflight start is not available for the affected engine.

During takeoff and for all flap operations, ensure that the L and R ISLN valve switches are in the open position. This assures air is available for operation of the air-driven hydraulic demand pump and LE flaps in the event of an adjacent engine shutdown.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated ENGINE BLEED switch on the Bleed Air Control panel (P5): "ENG_PRSOV INOP CLOSED". Placard adjacent to associated START switch on the Engine Ignition and Start Control panel (P5): "ENG_STARTER INOP INFLIGHT". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: The PRSOV is installed in the strut. Access to the PRSOV manual override drive is on the left side of the strut. It is not necessary to open any access panels to operate the PRSOV manual override drive. The PRSOV is spring loaded to the closed position. It can be manually held in the open position for engine starting. After engine start, the inoperative PRSOV must be manually placed in the locked closed position.

para.emphasis: Special Tools and Equipment: G71021-6 – Drive Extension – Starter Valve and PRSOV.

warning.para: DO NOT OPERATE THE THRUST REVERSER DURING MANUAL OPERATION OF THE PRSOV. THRUST REVERSER OPERATION DURING MANUAL OPERATION OF THE PRSOV CAN CAUSE SERIOUS PERSONNEL INJURY AND DAMAGE.
DO NOT USE ENGINE NACELLE SERVICE INTERPHONE JACK ON ENGINE WHICH IS TO BE STARTED OR ON ENGINE IN OPERATION. PERSONNEL COULD ENTER HAZARD AREA RESULTING IN SERIOUS INJURY OR LOSS OF LIFE.

numlitem.para: Establish interphone communication with the flight deck and determine if the applicable wing manifold will be pressurized or unpressurized for associated engine start.

note.para: The amount of torque necessary to open the PRSOV depends on existing pneumatic pressure. If manifold is unpressurized, the PRSOV will open easily. If manifold is pressurized, the PRSOV may require up to 50 ft-lb of applied torque to open.

para.emphasis: DO NOT ROTATE THE MANUAL OVERRIDE DRIVE QUICKLY WHEN THERE IS NO WING MANIFOLD PNEUMATIC PRESSURE. FAST OPERATION OF THE MANUAL OVERRIDE DRIVE MAY RESULT IN TEMPORARY JAMMING OF THE ACTUATOR OR POSSIBLE DIAPHRAGM DAMAGE.

numlitem.para: When requested by the flight crew, slowly turn the PRSOV manual override drive 90º clockwise to the open position. Hold it in the open position until the flight crew requests a closed PRSOV.
When flight crew requests closed PRSOV, turn the PRSOV manual override drive 90º counterclockwise to the closed position.

note.para: Request that flight deck select ENGINE BLEED Switch OFF before proceeding to next step.

numlitem.para: After the flight crew switches engine bleed off, lock the PRSOV in the locked closed position by depressing the manual override drive approximately 1/4 inch. Then turn the drive counter-clockwise to the locked closed position (90º past the closed position). Advise flight deck that the PRSOV is locked closed.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Bleed valve otherwise functions normally, and
Start valves on remaining engines are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ START VLV

numlitem.para: A manual override ground start is required.

note.para: The amount of torque necessary to open the PRSOV depends on existing pneumatic pressure. If manifold is unpressurized, the PRSOV will open easily. If manifold is pressurized, the PRSOV may require up to 50 ft-lb. of applied torque to open.

numlitem.para: If PRSOV is to be opened with wing pneumatic manifold unpressurized:
Select the appropriate L or R ISLN VALVE switch OFF.
If the other engine on the same wing is running, select its ENGINE BLEED switch OFF.
When ready for engine start, advise ground crew to open the PRSOV.
Ensure the pneumatic manifold is pressurized and pull the appropriate engine start switch.

note.para: If PRSOV is opened with the wing pneumatic manifold unpressurized, select appropriate L or R ISLN VALVE switch ON after PRSOV is confirmed open by ground crew.

numlitem.para: At 45-50% N2, request closed PRSOV to ground crew.
Continue engine start.
Ensure ENGINE BLEED switch for other engine on same wing is selected ON.
Starter assisted inflight start is not available for the affected engine.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated START switch on the Engine Ignition and Start Control panel (P5): "ENG_STARTER INOP INFLIGHT". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: The PRSOV is installed in the strut. Access to the PRSOV manual override drive is on the left side of the strut. It is not necessary to open any access panels to operate the PRSOV manual override drive. The PRSOV is spring loaded to the closed position. It can be manually held in the open position for engine starting. After engine start, the inoperative PRSOV must be manually placed in the locked closed position.

para.emphasis: Special Tools and Equipment: G71021– 6 – Drive Extension – Starter Valve and PRSOV.

warning.para: DO NOT OPERATE THE THRUST REVERSER DURING MANUAL OPERATION OF THE PRSOV. THRUST REVERSER OPERATION DURING MANUAL OPERATION OF THE PRSOV CAN CAUSE SERIOUS PERSONNEL INJURY AND DAMAGE.
DO NOT USE ENGINE NACELLE SERVICE INTERPHONE JACK ON ENGINE WHICH IS TO BE STARTED OR ON ENGINE IN OPERATION. PERSONNEL COULD ENTER HAZARD AREA RESULTING IN SERIOUS INJURY OR LOSS OF LIFE.

numlitem.para: Establish interphone communication with the flight deck and determine if the applicable wing manifold will be pressurized or unpressurized for associated engine start.

note.para: The amount of torque necessary to open the PRSOV depends on existing pneumatic pressure. If manifold is unpressurized, the PRSOV will open easily. If manifold is pressurized, the PRSOV may require up to 50 ft-lb of applied torque to open.

para.emphasis: DO NOT ROTATE THE MANUAL OVERRIDE DRIVE QUICKLY WHEN THERE IS NO WING MANIFOLD PNEUMATIC PRESSURE. FAST OPERATION OF THE MANUAL OVERRIDE DRIVE MAY RESULT IN TEMPORARY JAMMING OF THE ACTUATOR OR POSSIBLE DIAPHRAGM DAMAGE..

numlitem.para: When requested by the flight crew, slowly turn the PRSOV manual override drive 90° clockwise to the open position. Hold it in the open position until the flight crew requests a closed PRSOV.
When flight crew requests closed PRSOV, turn the PRSOV manual override drive 90° counterclockwise to the closed position.

note.para: Do not lock the PRSOV in the CLOSED position.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated High Pressure Shutoff Valve (HPSOV) is secured closed,
A minimum of 70% N1 (60% N1 for RR) is maintained at or above 10,000 ft. MSL, or 55% N1 is maintained below 10,000 ft. MSL on the associated engine while in icing conditions,
Bleed systems on remaining engines are operative, and
For GE, associated engine thrust reverser is deactivated.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BLEED HP ENG ___
BLEED OVPRESS ___
BLEED ___ OVHT
ENG ___ REVERSER
BLEED ___

numlitem.para: When Nacelle Anti-Ice is on, maintain a minimum of 70% N1 above 10,000 MSL and 55% below 10,000.

With the HPSOV secured closed, it is normal for the Pressure Regulating and Shutoff Valve (PRSOV) to close during engine operation at idle or if engine power setting are unequal. Consequently, the associated Engine Bleed Air OFF light will illuminate whenever the PRSOV is closed. Advancing the throttle to approximately 75% N2 will open the PRSOV and extinguish the Engine Bleed Air OFF light.

The associated engine’s thrust reverser is deactivated. The REV amber indication and EICAS message ENG_REVERSER may be displayed for the engine with reverser deactivated. Use symmetrical reverser thrust as required.

Thrust Reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affected engine will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverse thrust operation.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a
If runway clutter or icy conditions exist at origin, takeoff is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG_HPSOV INOP CLOSED and ____TR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: For GE engines, the High Pressure Shutoff Valve and the Pressure Regulating Valve (MEL 36-11-8-X) are the same part number and can be interchanged.

The HPSOV is located on the right side of the high pressure compressor (HPC) case. To deactivate the HPSOV, it is necessary to remove the positioning screw in the valve actuator to release actuator pressure. The positioning screw is then installed in the switch actuating lever to lock the valve in the CLOSED position. It is necessary to open the right thrust reverser half to gain access to the HPSOV.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the HPSOV
Release the pressure in the pneumatic system (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Open the right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Remove the positioning screw from the actuator cap. Do not disconnect the retaining cable from the positioning screw.
Install the positioning screw in the switch actuating lever to lock the HPSOV in the CLOSED position.
Close the right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Secure the Thrust Reverser
Refer to DMP 78-31-1-1. Accomplish Maintenance (M) procedure to deactivate the reverser in the forward thrust position.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative deactivated open provided the pack on the same side as operative valve is operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BLEED ISLN ___

numlitem.para: With a Wing Isolation Valve deactivated in the open position the following Non-Normal procedures are modified. The new procedures are located in the AOM Chapter 2.1 and QRH. Ensure that the proper checklist for the deferred condition is used.
SMOKE AIR CONDITIONING - the changes affect which pack is turned off to isolate the smoke.
BLEED DUCT LEAK L, C or R - the changes affect closing engine bleed valves since one wing isolation valve is deactivated open.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated Wing Isolation Valve switch (overhead panel): "L/R WING ISLN VALVE INOP OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: The two isolation valves are installed in the pneumatic manifold aft of the air-conditioning bay. It is necessary to open the appropriate air-conditioning access door to gain access to the valves. To deactivate the isolation valve, you must put the valve in the open position and disconnect the electrical connector.
Deactivate the Wing Isolation Valve

numlitem.para: Supply electrical power (AMM 24-22-00/201).
Open the access door 191NL for the left isolation valve or 192NR for the right isolation valve (AMM 06-09-03/201).
Put the wing ISLN switch (P5 Overhead Panel) in the open position. Wait approximately 10 seconds for the valve to open.
Open and collar the associated P6 panel L ISO VLV AIR SUPPLY PWR or R ISO VLV AIR SUPPLY PWR circuit breaker.
Examine the position indicator on the actuator housing. If the position indicator is not in the OPEN position, turn the manual drive until the valve is in the OPEN position.
Disconnect, cap and stow the electrical connector from the isolation valve:
DV108 VALVE - WING ISOLATION L
DV109 VALVE - WING ISOLATION R
Remove electrical power if it is not necessary for other operations (AMM 24-22-00/201).
Close the applicable access door (191NL or 192NR).

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided the APU Isolation valve remains closed after first engine starts.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BLEED LOSS APU

numlitem.para: After the first engine is started, close APU Isolation Valve. Perform subsequent engine starts using crossbleed starts. Keep APU Isolation Valve closed.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "APU CHECK VALVE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided valve is deactivated closed after engines are started.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BLEED LOSS APU
BLEED ISLN APU

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "APU ISOL VALVE INOP CLOSED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: The APU bleed air shutoff valve is installed in the upper outboard aft corner of the left body gear wheel well. Access to the valve is available in the body gear wheel well. To deactivate the APU bleed air valve, you must put the valve in the CLOSED position and disconnect the electrical connector.
Deactivate the APU Bleed Air Valve (AMM 36-11-09/201)

numlitem.para: Supply electrical power (AMM 24-22-00/201).
Make sure that the landing gear ground lock pins are installed (AMM 09-11-00/201).
Put the APU BLEED switch (P5 Overhead Panel) in the OFF position. Wait approximately 10 seconds for the valve to close.
Open and collar the 6H22 APU ISO VLV AIR SUPPLY PWR circuit breaker on the P6 main power distribution panel.
Examine the position indicator on the actuator housing. If the position indicator is not in the CLOSED position, turn the manual drive until the valve is in the CLOSED position.
Disconnect, cap and stow the electrical connector from the APU bleed air valve.
Install cap on the connection on the valve's actuator housing.
Remove electrical power (AMM 24-22-00/201).

item.title: Left and Right Wing Isolation VALVE Lights

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided associated duct pressure indication is available.

operation.para: Refer to the ECS Synoptic page and/or Duct Pressure indications if proper operation of an Isolation Valve is in question.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to appropriate Wing Isolation valve Light: "L/R WING ISLN VALVE LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Bleed Air Pressure Regulating Valve (PRV) Systems – PRV CLOSED AND FAV FULL OPEN

remarks.para: One may be inoperative with associated PRV secured closed provided:

numlitem.para: Aircraft is not operated in known or forecast icing conditions,
L and R ISLN valves are open for takeoff, and when flaps are operated,
Bleed systems on remaining engine are operative,
Associated ENGINE BLEED switch is select OFF except for engine start,
For GE, associated engine thrust reverser is deactivated, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BLEED PRV ENG ___
BLEED OVPRESS ___
BLEED ___ OVHT
ENG ___ REVERSER

numlitem.para: For the associated engine, select Engine Bleed OFF except for ground engine start and when bleed air is required for inflight start.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted since L and R ISLN Valves must remain open during takeoff.

The associated engine’s thrust reverser is deactivated. The REV amber indication and EICAS message ENG_REVERSER may be displayed for the engine with reverser deactivated. Use symmetrical reverse thrust as required.

Thrust Reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affected engine will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverse thrust operation.

During takeoff and for all flap operations, ensure that the L and R ISLN valve switches are in the open position. This assures air is available for operation of the air-driven hydraulic demand pump and LE flaps in the event of an adjacent engine shutdown.
Do not select associated engine Nacelle Anti-Ice Switch ON. If icing conditions are inadvertently encountered, reducing thrust on affected engine will minimize possible damage if ice is ingested.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.
Reduce takeoff and landing limited weights by 4,500 lbs.
Reduce en route climb limited weight by 6,300 lbs.
Increase flight planning fuel by 0.5%.
If runway clutter or icy conditions exist at origin, takeoff is prohibited.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ PRV INOP CLOSED" and " ___ TR INOP". Placard adjacent to associated Bleed Air SYS FAULT Light (P5 Panel): "SYS FAULT LIGHT INOP". Placard the associated engine Nacelle Anti-Ice Valve Switch (P5 Panel): "INOP - LEAVE OFF". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: The Pressure Regulating Valve and the High Pressure Shutoff Valve (MEL Item 36-11-3) are the same part number and can be interchanged.

numlitem.para: To dispatch with the associated PRV closed:

note.para: The PRV is installed forward of the precooler in the 1:00 o'clock position on GE CF6-80C series engines.

numlitem.para: Release the pressure in the pneumatic system (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Open right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Remove locking pin screw from the PRV actuator cap. Do not disconnect the retaining cable from locking pin screw.
Rotate the hex for manual operation to the valve CLOSED position.
Install the locking pin screw in the switch actuating lever to lock the PRV in the CLOSED position.
Close the thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Deactivate the associated thrust reverser per DMP78-31-1-1.

item.title: Bleed Air Pressure Regulating Valve (PRV) Systems – PRV Closed and FAV INTERMEDIATELY OPEN

remarks.para: One may be inoperative with associated PRV secured closed provided:

numlitem.para: Associated fan air valve is secured in the intermediate open position,
Aircraft is not operated in known or forecast icing conditions,
L and R ISLN valves are open for takeoff, and when flaps are operated,
Bleed systems on remaining engine are operative,
Associated ENGINE BLEED switch is select OFF except for engine start,
For GE, associated engine thrust reverser is deactivated, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BLEED PRV ENG ___
BLEED OVPRESS ___
BLEED ___ OVHT
ENG ___ REVERSER
BLEED ___

operation.para: Advisory message BLEED_OVHT/PRV may be displayed.

numlitem.para: For the associated engine, select Engine Bleed OFF except for ground engine start and when bleed air is required for inflight start.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted since L and R ISLN Valves must remain open during takeoff.

The associated engine’s thrust reverser is deactivated. The REV amber indication and EICAS message ENG_REVERSER may be displayed for the engine with reverser deactivated. Use symmetrical reverse thrust as required.

Thrust Reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affected engine will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverse thrust operation.

During takeoff and for all flap operations, ensure that the L and R ISLN valves switches are in the open position. This assures air is available for operation of the air-driven hydraulic demand pump and LE flaps in the event of an adjacent engine shutdown.
Do not select associated engine Nacelle Anti-Ice Switch ON. If icing conditions are inadvertently encountered, reducing thrust on affected engine will minimize possible damage if ice is ingested.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.
Reduce takeoff and landing limited weights by 2,200 lbs.
Reduce en route climb limited weight by 3,200 lbs.
Increase flight planning fuel by 0.3%.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ PRV INOP CLOSED", "ENG FV INOP INTERMEDIATE OPEN" and " ___ TR INOP". Placard adjacent to associated Bleed Air SYS FAULT Light (P5 Panel): "SYS FAULT LIGHT INOP". Placard the associated engine Nacelle Anti-Ice Valve Switch (P5 Panel): "INOP - LEAVE OFF". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: BLEED AIR PRESSURE REGULATING VALVE (PRV) SYSTEMS
maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: The Pressure Regulating Valve and the High Pressure Shutoff Valve (MEL Item 36-11-3) are the same part number and can be interchanged.

numlitem.para: To dispatch with the associated PRV closed:

note.para: The PRV is installed forward of the precooler in the 1:00 o’clock position on GE CF6-80C series engines.

numlitem.para: Release the pressure in the pneumatic system (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Open right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Remove locking pin screw from the PRV actuator cap. Do not disconnect the retaining cable from locking pin screw.
Rotate the hex for manual operation to the valve CLOSED position.
Install the locking pin screw in the switch actuating lever to lock the PRV in the CLOSED position.
Close the thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Secure the associated Fan Air Valve (FAV) in the intermediate open position as follows:
Open the left thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).

note.para: The FAV is installed on the left side of the precooler. The valve is spring-loaded open and is controlled by the Fan Air Temperature sensors. It has a locking crank to permit the valve to be operated manually.

numlitem.para: Remove the positioning screw from the FAV actuator housing. Remove and discard the O-ring. Do not disconnect the retaining cable from the positioning screw.
Turn the locking crank to the 45 degree position.
Install the positioning screw in the locking crank until it is engaged with the switch bracket. This will lock the valve in the 45 degree position.
Close the thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Deactivate the associated thrust reverser per MEL 78-31-1-1.

item.title: Bleed Air Pressure Regulating Valve (PRV) Systems – PRV Open

remarks.para: One may be inoperative with associated PRV open provided:

numlitem.para: Associated PRV operates pneumatically in the full open position,
Associated HPSOV is secured closed,
Associated Bleed Air Overpressure switch is deactivated,
Associated ENGINE BLEED switch is select OFF except for engine start,
L and R ISLN valves are open for takeoff, and when flaps are operated,
Bleed systems on remaining engine are operative,
A minimum of 70% N1 is maintained at or above 10,000 ft. MSL, or 55% N1 is maintained below 10,000 ft. MSL on the associated engine while in icing conditions,
For GE, associated engine thrust reverser is deactivated.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BLEED PRV ENG ___
BLEED ___ OVHT
ENG ___ REVERSER
BLEED ___

numlitem.para: For the associated engine, select Engine Bleed OFF except for ground engine start and when bleed air is required for inflight start.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted since L and R ISLN Valves must remain open during takeoff.

The associated engine’s thrust reverser is deactivated. The REV amber indication and EICAS message ENG_REVERSER may be displayed for the engine with reverser deactivated. Use symmetrical reverse thrust as required.

Thrust Reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affected engine will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverser thrust operation.

During takeoff and for all flap operations, ensure that the L and R ISLN valve switches are in the open position. This assures air is available for operation of the air-driven hydraulic demand pump and LE flaps in the event of an adjacent engine shutdown.
When Nacelle Anti-Ice is ON, maintain a minimum of 70% N1 above 10,000 MSL and 55% below 10,000 MSL.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted.

placard.para: Install Placards below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG____PRV INOP OPEN" and "ENG____HPSOV INOP CLOSED and ____TR INOP". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: Bleed Air Pressure Regulating Valve (PRV) Systems
maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: To dispatch with PRV inoperative open:
Secure the HPSOV closed:

note.para: For GE engines, the High Pressure Shutoff Valve and the Pressure Regulating Valve (MEL 36-11-3) are the same part number and can be interchanged.

The HPSOV is located on the right side of the high pressure compressor (HPC) case. To deactivate the HPSOV, it is necessary to remove the positioning screw in the valve actuator to release actuator pressure. The positioning screw is then installed in the switch actuating lever to lock the valve in the CLOSED position. It is necessary to open the right thrust reverser half to gain access to the HPSOV.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the HPSOV
Release the pressure in the pneumatic system (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Open the right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Remove the positioning screw from the actuator cap. Do not disconnect the retaining cable from the positioning screw.
Install the positioning screw in the switch actuating lever to lock the HPSOV in the CLOSED position.
Verify the PRV operates pneumatically:
Pressurize the pneumatic manifold to above 20 psig.
Select the associated engine bleed switch ON.
Open the PRSOV:
Hold thrust reverser ground service switch S2178 in the UP position. Release the switch when the PRSOV is in the open position.
Using a ratchet wrench, rotate the PRV’s manual override hex toward the open position.

caution.para: THE PRV CAN OPEN QUICKLY WHEN THE MANUAL OVERRIDE DRIVE IS TURNED AND PULL A WRENCH OUT OF YOUR HANDS. THIS CAN CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONS OR EQUIPMENT DAMAGE.

numlitem.para: Confirm that the PRV opens fully and remains in the full open position by using any one of the following methods:
Observe the position pointer on the valve, or
Observe the position indicated on CMC ECS Maintenance page, or
CMC input monitoring.
Depressurize pneumatic manifold.
Close the thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).

Deactivate the associated Bleed Air Overpressure Switch. This will prevent the BLEED_ advisory message and the BLEED OVPRESS_ status message from displaying due to activation from the Bleed Air Overpressure Switch.
Extend the leading edge flaps (AMM 27-81-00/201).

Gain access to the associated engine bleed air overpressure switch (through access panel located on wing leading edge inboard of the engine strut) and disconnect the electrical connector from the switch.

note.para: The shorting wire in the following steps is UPS tool 747-36-002-101, if available.

numlitem.para: Fabricate a 3 to 4 inch shorting wire from 20 to 24 SWG type 6A wire (BMS 13-60 Type 1 or BMS 13-48 Type 10) and two 20 gauge pins (P/N BACC47CN1A).
Connect sockets 2 and 5 with the fabricated shorting wire and stow the connector securely using a bundle strap.
Deactivate the associated thrust reverser per MEL78-31-1-1.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative open provided:

numlitem.para: A minimum of 70% N1 (60% N1 for RR) is maintained at or above 10,000 ft. MSL, or 55% N1 is maintained below 10,000 ft. MSL on the associated engine while in icing conditions,
Associated HPSOV is secured closed,
Bleed systems on remaining engines are operative, and
For GE, associated engine thrust reverser is deactivated.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BLEED HP ENG ___

numlitem.para: The associated engine’s thrust reverser is deactivated. The REV amber indication and EICAS message ENG_REVERSER may be displayed for the engine with reverser deactivated. Use symmetrical reverse thrust as required.

Thrust Reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affected engine will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverse thrust operation.
When Nacelle Anti-Ice is ON, maintain a minimum of 70% N1 above 10,000 MSL and 55% below 10,000 MSL.

With the HPSOV secured closed, it is normal for the Pressure Regulation and Shutoff Valve (PRSOV) to close during engine operation at idle or if engine power settings are unequal. Consequently, the associated Engine Bleed Air OFF light will illuminate whenever the PRSOV is closed. Advancing the throttle off idle to approximately 75% N2 will open the PRSOV and extinguish the Engine Bleed Air OFF light.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Install Placards below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG_INTERMEDIATE BLEED CHECK VALVE INOP OPEN", "ENG_HPSOV INOP CLOSED" and " ___ THRUST REVERSER INOP". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: The HPSOV is located on the right side of the high pressure compressor (HPC) case. To deactivate the HPSOV, it is necessary to remove the positioning screw in the valve actuator to release actuator pressure. The positioning screw is then installed in the switch actuating lever to lock the valve in the CLOSED position. It is necessary to open the right thrust reverser half to gain access to the HPSOV.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the HPSOV
Release the pressure in the pneumatic system (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Open the right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Remove the positioning screw from the actuator cap. Do not disconnect the retaining cable from the positioning screw.
Install the positioning screw in the switch actuating lever to lock the HPSOV in the CLOSED position.
Close the right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Secure the Thrust Reverser
Refer to DMP 78-31-1-1. Accomplish Maintenance (M) procedure to deactivate the reverser in the forward thrust position.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated ENGINE BLEED switch is selected OFF except for engine start,
Aircraft is not operated in known or forecast icing conditions,
L and R ISLN valves are open for takeoff, and when flaps are operated,
Bleed systems on remaining engines are operative,
Associated Engine Anti-Ice switch remains OFF, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.
For the associated engine, select Engine Bleed OFF except for ground engine start and when bleed air is required for inflight start.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted since L and R ISLN Valves must remain open during takeoff.

During takeoff and for all flap operations, ensure that the L and R ISLN valve switches are in the open position. This assures air is available for operation of the air-driven hydraulic demand pump and LE flaps in the event of an adjacent engine shutdown.
Do not select associated engine Nacelle Anti-Ice Switch ON. If icing conditions are inadvertently encountered, reducing thrust on affected engine will minimize possible damage if ice is ingested.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.
Increase flight planning fuel by .5%.
Reduce performance limited takeoff and landing weight by 4,500 lbs.
Reduce performance limited en route weight by 6,300 lbs.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG_PRECOOLER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated ENGINE BLEED switch is selected OFF except for engine start,
Aircraft is not operated in known or forecast icing conditions,
L and R ISLN valves are open for takeoff, and when flaps are operated,
Bleed systems on remaining engines are operative,
Associated Engine Anti-Ice switch remains OFF,
For PW & GE, associated fan air valve is secured in the intermediate open position, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.

note.para: Aircraft may be dispatched with damage to the precooler (including core damage) provided engine start is not precluded.

numlitem.para: For the associated engine, select Engine Bleed OFF except for ground engine start and when bleed air is required for inflight start.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted since L and R ISLN Valves must remain open during takeoff.

During takeoff and for all flap operations, ensure that the L and R ISLN valve switches are in the open position. This assures air is available for operation of the air-driven hydraulic demand pump and LE flaps in the event of an adjacent engine shutdown.
Do not select associated engine Nacelle Anti-Ice Switch ON. If icing conditions are inadvertently encountered, reducing thrust on affected engine will minimize possible damage if ice is ingested.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.
Increase flight planning fuel by .3%.
Reduce performance limited takeoff and landing weight by 2,200 lbs.
Reduce performance limited en route weight by 3,200 lbs.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted.

placard.para: Install Placards below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG____PRECOOLER INOP" and "ENG____FAV INOP INTERMEDIATE OPEN". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Secure the associated Fan Air Valve (FAV) in the intermediate open position as follows:
Open the left thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).

note.para: The FAV is installed on the left side of the precooler. The valve is spring- loaded open and is controlled by the Fan Air Temperature sensors. It has a locking crank to permit the valve to be operated manually.

numlitem.para: Remove the positioning screw from the FAV actuator housing. Remove and discard the O-ring. Do not disconnect the retaining cable from the positioning screw.
Turn the locking crank to the 45 degree position.
Install the positioning screw in the locking crank until it is engaged with the switch bracket. This will lock the valve in the 45 degree position.
Close the thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).

remarks.para: One control system per side may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated Fan Air valve(s) is secured in the intermediate open position, and
For each inoperative system, the appropriate performance adjustments are applied.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BLEED FAMV ENG ___
BLEED ___ OVHT

numlitem.para: Apply performance limitations.
Increase flight planning fuel by .3% for each valve affected.
Reduce performance limited takeoff and landing weight by 2,200 lbs. for each valve affected.
Reduce performance limited en route weight by 3,200 lbs. for each valve affected.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG_FAV - INOP INTERMEDIATE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 36-12-1-2.

item.title: Fan Air (Precooler) Control Systems – All Engines

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated Fan Air valve(s) is secured full open,
Aircraft is not operated in known or forecast icing conditions,
For RR RB211-524H2, at least one pack is selected ON for takeoff and landing, and
For each inoperative system, the appropriate performance adjustments are applied.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BLEED FAMV ENG ___
BLEED ___ OVHT

numlitem.para: Apply performance limitations.
If icing conditions are inadvertently encountered, reducing thrust on affected engine(s) will minimize possible damage if ice is ingested.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.
Increase flight planning fuel by .5% for each valve affected.
Reduce performance limited takeoff and landing weight by 4,500 lbs. for each valve affected.
Reduce performance limited en route weight by 6,300 lbs.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: “ENG_FAV - INOP FULL OPEN.” Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The FAV is installed on the left side of the precooler on CF6-80C series engines. The valve is spring-loaded open and is controlled by the Fan Air Temperature sensors. It has a locking crank to permit the valve to be operative.

numlitem.para: Secure the associated Fan Air Valve (FAV) in the full open position:
Release the pressure in the pneumatic system (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Remove the mid lower forward strut access door for the applicable system (AMM 54-62-00/201).

note.para: It is first necessary to remove the fairing that covers the mid lower forward strut access door. Remove the screws from the skirt fairing that overlaps the lower aft corner of the mid lower forward strut fairing.

numlitem.para: Disconnect the signal pressure tube from the Fan Air Temperature sensor.
Open the appropriate thrust reverser half, left for GE engines (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Make sure that the valve position indicator shows that the valve is in the full open position. If necessary, turn the locking crank to the full open position.
Put caps on the open signal pressure tube and tube port.
Lockwire the signal pressure tube to the cooling air tube.
Install the mid lower forward strut access door for the applicable system (AMM 54-62-00/201).
Install the fairings removed in step 2 to gain access to the door.
Close the thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).

remarks.para: May be inoperative (leaking) provided:

numlitem.para: APU check valve is operative, and
IF APU is used for electrical power, the APU Bleed Air Valve is deactivated closed.
Observe the placard on the APU control module.
If APU is to be used for electrical power, use normal procedures except leave the APU bleed switch OFF. APU bleed air will not be available.
APU is to be used for electrical power only.

placard.para: Install Placard(s) as instructed per DMP. Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Confirm the operation of the forward APU check valve and configure the valve for dispatch, if necessary:
Open wing and body gear doors.

If the APU check valve has a valve bypass line installed, remove the bypass line from the pneumatic duct. On the downstream side of the APU check valve only, seal the connection on the pneumatic duct with a suitable cap.
Using an external air source, pressurize the pneumatic manifold.

para.emphasis: ENSURE THAT SYSTEMS AND CONTROLS NOT INTENDED FOR OPERATION IN THIS CHECK ARE TURNED OFF TO PREVENT INADVERTENT OPERATION OF EQUIPMENT AND LOSS OF DUCT PRESSURE.

numlitem.para: Check the pneumatic duct pressure normal for the air source.
Check the APU check valve for internal leaks by listening near the valve.
Remove external air source.
Close the doors, if appropriate.
If leak is between the APU and the APU bleed air valve or if the APU is not to be used for electrical power, install placard on the cockpit APU control module: "DUCT LEAK - DO NOT USE APU".
If the leak is between the APU check valve and the APU bleed air valve and the APU is to be used as a source of electrical power, secure the APU bleed air valve closed:
Open wing and body gear doors.
With the APU shut down and the APU bleed air valve closed, check the valve position indicator in the closed position.
Disconnect the electrical connector from the APU bleed air valve and stow securely.
Close the gear doors.
Install placard on the cockpit APU control module: "APU TO BE USED FOR ELECTRICAL POWER ONLY".

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided L and R ISLN valves are verified to be operative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "L(R) DUCT PRESSURE INDICATION INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Perform the following Wing Isolation Valves Operational Check procedure to verify that the L and R ISLN valves are operative:

numlitem.para: Push the ECS switch on the EICAS Display Select Panel.
On the ECS Temperature Control (P5 panel):
Place the L and R ISLN valve switches to the closed position.
Verify on the ECS synoptic page that both Left and Right Isolation Valves go to the closed position within ten seconds.
Place the L ISLN valve switch to the open position.
Verify on the ECS synoptic page that the Left Isolation Valve goes to the open position within ten seconds.
Place the R ISLN valve switch to the open position.
Verify on the ECS synoptic page that the Right Isolation Valve goes to the open position within ten seconds.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Crossover duct leak detection is installed and operative, and
L and R ISLN valves are verified to be operative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "L(R) DUCT PRESSURE INDICATION INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 36-21-1-1.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated Bleed Air Switch: "BLEED OFF LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: “_____ ENG BLEED PRESS SENSOR INOP.” Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative deactivated provided:

numlitem.para: Associated HPSOV is secured closed,
Associated Bleed switch remains OFF for takeoff,
A minimum of 70% N1 (60% N1 for RR) is maintained at or above 10,000 ft. MSL, or 55% N1 is maintained below 10,000 ft. MSL on the associated engine while in icing conditions,
Bleed systems on remaining engines are operative, and
For GE, associated engine reverser is deactivated.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
BLEED HP ENG ___

numlitem.para: When nacelle Anti-Ice is on, maintain a minimum of 70% N1 above 10,000 MSL and 55% below 10,000 MSL.
With the HPSOV secured closed, it is normal for the Pressure Regulating and Shutoff Valve (PRSOV) to close during engine operation at idle or if engine power setting are unequal.

The associated engine’s thrust reverser is deactivated. The REV amber indication and EICAS message ENG_REVERSER may be displayed for the engine with reverser deactivated. Use symmetrical reverser thrust as required.

Thrust Reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affect engine will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverser thrust operation.
The associated Bleed Switch should be selected OFF for takeoff and may be selected ON after flaps are UP.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Install Placards below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG____HPSOV INOP CLOSED and ____ENG BLEED OVERPRESS SW INOP and ____TR INOP". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
Deactivate the associated Bleed switch. This will prevent the BLEED_ advisory message and the BLEED OVPRESS_ status message from displaying due to activation from the Bleed switch.

numlitem.para: Extend the leading edge flaps (AMM 27-81-00/201).

Gain access to the associated engine bleed air overpressure switch (through access panel located on wing leading edge inboard of the engine strut) and disconnect the electrical connector from the switch.

note.para: The shorting wire in the following steps is UPS tool 747-36-002-101, if available.

numlitem.para: Fabricate a 3 to 4 inch shorting wire from 20 to 24 SWG type 6A wire (BMS 13-60 Type 1 or BMS 13-48 Type 10) and two 20 gauge pins (P/N BACC47CN1A).
Connect sockets 2 and 5 with the fabricated shorting wire and stow the connector securely using a bundle strap.
Secure the HPSOV CLOSED using the following procedures:

note.para: The HPSOV is located on the right side of the high pressure compressor (HPC) case. To deactivate the HPSOV, it is necessary to remove the positioning screw in the valve actuator to release actuator pressure. The positioning screw is then installed in the switch actuating lever to lock the valve in the CLOSED position. It is necessary to open the right thrust reverser half to gain access to the HPSOV.

numlitem.para: Release the pressure in the pneumatic system (AMM 36-00-00/201).
Open the right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Remove the positioning screw from the actuator cap. Do not disconnect the retaining cable from the positioning screw.
Install the positioning screw in the switch actuating lever to lock the HPSOV in the CLOSED position.
Close the right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Secure the Thrust Reverser
Refer to MEL 78-31-1-1. Accomplish Maintenance (M) procedure to deactivate the reverser in the forward thrust position.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated Bleed Air SYS FAULT Light: "SYS FAULT LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated EICAS message is not displayed.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated APU Bleed Air Valve Light (overhead panel): "APU BLEED VALVE LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG_ BLEED SENSOR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Potable Water Systems – System Does Not Leak

remarks.para: Individual components may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated components are deactivated or isolated, and
Associated system components are verified not to have leaks.

note.para: Any portion of system which is operative may be used.

placard.para: For deactivated or isolated components, placard as appropriate. "INOP - DO NOT USE". Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: For inoperative individual components:
Deactivate or isolate inoperative components.
Verify associated system components do not have leaks.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: System is drained, and
Procedures are established to ensure that system is not serviced.

placard.para: For inoperative potable water system, placard Potable Water Service Panel: "POTABLE WATER SYS INOP - DO NOT FILL". Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: For an inoperative potable water system:
Drain potable water system (AMM 12-14-01/301).
Placard Water Service Panel: POTABLE WATER SYSTEM INOPERATIVE-DO NOT FILL.

item.chgdesc: Adds Effectivity to item.
item.title: Lavatory Waste Systems (Including Wheelchair Accessible Lavatories) – System Does Not Leak

remarks.para: Individual components may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated components are deactivated or isolated, and
Associated system components are verified not to have leaks.

note.para: Any portion of system which is operative may be used.
If flush motor is inoperative, use bottle water to rinse bowl. Lavatory is considered operative provided system does not leak.

placard.para: For deactivated or isolated components, placard as appropriate: "INOP - DO NOT USE". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: For inoperative individual components:
Deactivate or isolate inoperative components.
Verify associated system components do not have leaks.

item.title: Lavatory Waste Systems (Including Wheelchair Accessible Lavatories) – System Leaks

remarks.para: Associated lavatory system(s) may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated components are deactivated or isolated to prevent leaks,
The Pilot-in-Command will determine if flight duration is acceptable with an Upper Deck lavatory unusable, and
Associated lavatory door(s) is secured closed and placarded INOPERATIVE - DO NOT ENTER.

note.para: These provisions are not intended to prohibit inspections by crewmembers.

placard.para: Placard Waste Tank Service Panel: "WASTE TANK INOP" and associated lavatory door. "INOPERATIVE - DO NOT ENTER". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: For an inoperative lavatory waste system:
Drain the associated waste tank (AMM 12-17-01/301).

caution.para: DO NOT ADD THE PRECHARGE CHEMICAL TO THE ASSOCIATED WASTE TANK.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to inoperative Central Maintenance Computer: "CMC INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided switch(es) are deactivated.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
GND TESTS ENABLE

placard.para: Placard adjacent to Ground Test Enable Switch: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open and collar CMC ENABLE SWITCH circuit breaker 180 DM (P180).

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided alternate procedures are established and used.

numlitem.para: Obtain required paperwork prior to departure. Advise flight control that no inflight printer will be available.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to Printer: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: An alternate source of terminal charts for intended destination and planned alternate(s) are available to the flight crew, and
Repairs are made within two flight days.
The pilot with the inoperative EFB will use his or her paper manuals and charts in their flight kits or the ship's library.

placard.para: Install Placard on Captain’s P-1-1 panel: "___ EFB INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided an alternate source for the associated information required for the flight is available to the flight crew.

numlitem.para: Crews will use their paper manuals and charts in their flight kits or the ship's library.

placard.para: Install Placard on Captain’s P-1-1 panel: "___ EFB INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided an alternate procedures are established and used.

note.para: Any function which is operative may be used.

numlitem.para: Crews will use their paper manuals and charts in their flight kits or the ship's library.

placard.para: Install Placard on Captain’s P-1-1 panel: "BOTH EFB’s INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided procedures do not require its use.

note.para: APU battery and APU charger are not deferrable and must be operative for flight.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
APU
APU DUCT LEAK
APU STRT INHIBIT

numlitem.para: Use external power and air for engine start.
If EEC CLNG SUP FAN status message is displayed, it can be cleared by rotating the EQUIP COOLING switch to OVRD, then back to NORM.
If any RECIRC FAN UPR or LWR status message is displayed, momentarily depress the PACK RST switch until each has cleared.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to APU Selector Switch: "APU INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided procedures do not require its use.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
APU
APU DUCT LEAK
APU STRT INHIBIT

numlitem.para: Use external air for engine start.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to APU Selector Switch: "APU PNEUMATICS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative secured closed provided APU is not used.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
APU DOOR

numlitem.para: Use external power and air for engine start.
If EEC CLNG SUP FAN status message displayed, it can be cleared by rotating the EQUIP COOLING switch to OVRD, then back to NORM.
If any RECIRC FAN UPR or LWR status message is displayed, momentarily depress the PACK RST switch until each has cleared.
APU is not be used.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to APU Selector Switch: "APU DOOR INOP CLOSED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: See AMM 09-11-00 for towing aircraft if APU not used.

numlitem.para: If door closing is required, refer to AMM 49-15-00/201 and perform following steps:
With manual drive actuator installed:
Open the P83 panel circuit breakers: AIR INLET DOOR, APU PRIMARY CONT, and APU START.
Open P6 main power supply panel circuit breaker APU ALTN CONT.
Open APU access doors.
Remove access cover (located on top external surface of actuator canister).
With 1/4 inch square drive, turn the transfer socket to the MANUAL position.

para.emphasis: MAKE SURE TO SET THE TRANSFER SOCKET TO THE MANUAL POSITION BEFORE YOU OPERATE THE ACTUATOR WITH YOUR HANDS. DAMAGE TO THE ACTUATOR CAN OCCUR.

numlitem.para: With 1/4 inch square drive, engage socket on actuator and using 25-pound inches (2.8 N.M) or less of torque, turn socket counterclockwise until the door is closed.

para.emphasis: DO NOT GO ABOVE 25 POUND-INCHES (2.8 N.M) OF TORQUE WHEN YOU TURN THE ACTUATOR SOCKET. THE TORQUE THAT IS NECESSARY TO TURN THE CRANK WILL INCREASE AS THE ACTUATOR ROD BECOMES FULLY EXTENDED. DAMAGE CAN OCCUR IF YOU APPLY TOO MUCH TORQUE ON THE CRANK.

numlitem.para: Remove 1/4 inch drive from actuator socket.
With 1/4 inch square drive, turn the transfer socket to the ELECTRICAL position.
Install the access cover.
Close P6 main power supply panel circuit breaker APU ALTN CONT.
Close the P83 panel circuit breakers: AIR INLET DOOR, APU PRIMARY CONT, and APU START.
Close the APU access doors.
If manual drive is not installed or door cannot be operated manually, refer to AMM 49-15-00/201 and perform following steps:
Open the P83 panel circuit breakers: AIR INLET DOOR, APU PRIMARY CONT, and APU START.
Open P6 main power supply panel circuit breaker APU ALTN CONT.
Remove actuator and install fixed link to secure door closed.
Use Boeing Tool MIT65B98813 for fixed link, or manufacture per drawing below.
Close P6 main power supply panel circuit breaker APU ALTN CONT.
Close the P83 panel circuit breakers: AIR INLET DOOR, APU PRIMARY CONT, and APU START.
Close the APU access doors.

remarks.para: May be inoperative open or partially open provided appropriate performance adjustments are applied.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
APU DOOR

numlitem.para: If required use external power and air for engine start.
If EEC CLNG SUP FAN status message is displayed, it can be cleared by rotating the EQUIP COOLING switch to OVRD, then back to NORM.
If any RECRIC FAN UPR or LWR status message is displayed, momentarily depress the PACK RST switch until each has cleared.
Apply performance penalties.
Reduce takeoff and landing limited weight by 3,200 lbs.
Reduce en route climb weight by 9,700 lbs.
Increase flight planning fuel by 2.0%.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to APU Selector Switch: "APU DOOR INOP OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided APU automatic fire bottle discharge system is operative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to APU Remote Control Module: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative (and APU used) provided a qualified operator remains in the vicinity of the APU controls on the flight deck.

numlitem.para: A qualified operator must remain in the vicinity of the APU controls on the flight deck.
This MEL allows for any or all of the functions of the APU remote control module to be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to APU Remote Control Module: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "APU RPM IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "APU EGT IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative (and APU used) provided:

numlitem.para: APU oil quantity is filled to capacity,
After five flight days, APU oil quantity is again filled to capacity, and
There is no evidence of above normal oil consumption or leakage.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "APU OIL QTY INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Ensure APU oil is filled to capacity.
Ensure APU oil is again filled to capacity after five (5) flight days.
Ensure there is no history of abnormal APU oil consumption and visually inspect the aft fuselage around the APU area for evidence of oil leakage.

item.chgdesc: Revises Repair Interval Category and adds n) to proviso per MMEL. Adds Note to proviso l) for clarification.
item.title: MAIN ENTRY DOORS/SLIDES – CARGO OPERATIONS

remarks.para: One may be inoperative or slide missing provided:

numlitem.para: All remaining entry doors are fully operations
Associated door is not used for passenger loading,
A conspicuous barrier strap or rope and a placard stating that the door is inoperative shall be placed across the inoperative door,
Emergency exit sign or light associated with the inoperative exit must be covered to obscure the sign,
Passengers must be advised to not use associated door,
Crew shall be advised that evacuation procedures must not include associated door, though opposite door may be used,
Persons (other than assigned cabin attendants) are not permitted to be seated in blocked areas when the associated door is as indicated below:
Door L-1 or R-1: From forward cabin end to a line midway between L-1/R-1 and L-2/R-2.
Door L-2 or R-2: Halfway to next exits in both directions from the affected door.
Door L-3 or R-3: Halfway to next exits in both directions from the affected door.
Door L-4 or R-4: Halfway to next exits in both directions from the affected door.
Door L-5 or R-5: From a line midway between L-4/R-4 and L-5/R-5 to aft cabin end.

note.para: Restriction extends across entire cabin and those seats located on designated boundaries will be blocked.

numlitem.para: Tapes or ropes of conspicuous colors shall be installed to block access to unusable seats before boarding of passengers,
Conspicuous signs and placards shall be placed in appropriate locations to indicate seats are not to be occupied by passengers,
Main passenger aisles, cross aisles and exit access areas must not be blocked,
Seated capacity must not exceed rated capacity of remaining pairs of exits.

For extended overwater operations, occupancy shall not exceed the normal rated capacity of the slide/rafts, or the remaining slide/rafts, or the rated overload capacity of the slide/rafts remaining after loss of one additional slide/raft of greatest capacity, whichever is least, and

para.revision: Extended Overwater operations is a horizontal distance of more than 50 NM from the nearest shoreline.

numlitem.para: Blocked seating layouts and evacuation procedures must be developed and approved by the FAA certificate-holding office for inclusion in the operator’s manual.

para.revision: Repairs are made within one flight day.

note.para: Cabin attendants may be stationed in the vicinity of each door within blocked areas.
Weight and Balanced Manifest must be revised as necessary to ensure proper loading limits are observed.
On all-cargo and combination passenger/cargo airplanes, main entry doors located in the cargo area may be inoperative with no restrictions.

numlitem.para: Prior to departure the flight crew will request instruction from aircraft maintenance, how to properly open, close and secure main cargo door.
Block the inoperative door with a conspicuous barrier strap or rope and placard INOPERATIVE.

item.title: Pressure Stop Fitting Assemblies (Main Entry Doors)

remarks.para: One forward fitting assembly and/or one aft fitting assembly per door (with a total of 10 fittings per aircraft) may be missing or inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: There are no visible defects on other fittings assemblies for the associated door(s),
Cabin altitude auto controller is operative, and
Maximum cabin differential pressure is limited to 5.2 psi.
In Automatic Cabin Altitude control, comply with maximum cabin pressure differential limit of 5.2 by not exceeding the 11,000 feet MSL maximum aircraft altitude.
Flight is limited to 11,000 feet MSL en route altitude.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "MAIN DOOR__ PRESSURE STOP FITTING MISSING/INOP – MAX CABIN DIFF PRESSURE: 5.2 PSI". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Visually inspect remaining fitting assemblies on affected door(s) for defects.

remarks.para: May be inoperative for all-cargo operations only.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "MAIN ENTRY DOOR__ HOLD OPEN LATCH INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Main Entry Door Hold-Open Latch – Latch Release Lever

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "MAIN ENTRY DOOR__ HOLD OPEN LATCH REL LEVER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Crew Compartment Overhead Hatch Latch Pins

remarks.para: One may be removed provided hatch is operative.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to or below Crew compartment overhead hatch: "LATCH PIN REMOVED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Remove the crew compartment overhead hatch (AMM 52-21-01).
Using the applicable steps of 747 Overhaul Manual, 52-22-11, remove the broken or cracked latch pin assembly.
Replace the latch pin assembly with washer(s) the same diameter as Part No. 63-1658 and equal in thickness to the rack gear on the latch pin assembly.
Reassemble the door mechanism using the applicable steps of 747 Overhaul Manual, 52-22-11.
Reinstall the crew compartment overhead hatch (AMM 52-21-01).

note.para: With a missing latch pin with the extend stop collar, be careful not to over-rotate the door handle when securing the door closed. When closing the door, do not rotate the outside handle past the hatch skin cutout or the interior handle past the closed guide markings.

item.chgdesc: Adds Not Applicable item to align with MMEL.

title.revision: NOT APPLICABLE

item.chgdesc: Revises proviso per MMEL.
item.title: Upper Deck Escape Door/Slide – Freighter with Draw-Through Smoke Detection System

remarks.para: May be inoperative or slide missing provided:

para.revision: Upper deck occupancy is limited to those flight crewmembers essential to the flight (including official observer in observer seats) during takeoff or landing, and

numlitem.para: Inertial escape reels are installed and operative for upper deck occupants.
Ensure all occupants are briefed prior to takeoff and landing regarding which exits are available for emergency evacuation.
Only flight crewmembers (including official observer) occupy the upper deck.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "UPPER DECK ESCAPE SLIDE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Each EXIT sign identifying an unusable evacuation route should be covered or otherwise blocked so that the sign is not visible.
The inoperative door should be blocked by use of tapes or ropes of conspicuous color.

numlitem.para: Inertial escape reels and escape harnesses are installed (as required) and operative for upper deck occupants.
Ensure all occupants are briefed prior to takeoff and landing regarding which exits are available for emergency evacuation.
Only flight crewmembers (including official observer) occupy the upper deck.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "UPPER DECK SLIDE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Each EXIT sign identifying an unusable evacuation route should be covered or otherwise blocked so that the sign is not visible.
The inoperative door should be blocked by use of tapes or ropes of conspicuous color.

item.chgdesc: Revises proviso per MMEL.
item.title: Upper Deck Escape Door/Slide – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System

para.revision: May be inoperative, or slides missing provided:
Upper deck occupancy is limited to those flight crewmembers essential to the flight (including official observer in observer seats) during takeoff or landing, and

numlitem.para: Inertial escape reels are installed and operative for upper deck occupants.
Ensure all occupants are briefed prior to takeoff and landing regarding which exits are available for emergency evacuation.
Only flight crewmembers (including official observer) occupy the upper deck.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "UPPER DECK SLIDE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Each EXIT sign identifying an unusable evacuation route should be covered or otherwise blocked so that the sign is not visible.
The inoperative door should be blocked by use of tapes or ropes of conspicuous color.

item.title: Upper Deck type "A" Emergency Exit Door Actuator(s)

remarks.para: Electrical operation feature of doors may be inoperative.

placard.para: Install Placards below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 on affected door: "____ ELEC DR ACT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: DOOR U/D Flight Lock Actuators – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System

remarks.para: May be inoperative or missing provided each upper deck Type "A" door is verified to be capable of being unlatched before each departure.

numlitem.para: Verify upper deck doors are capable of being latched before each departure.

placard.para: Install Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 on affected door: "__U/D DOOR FLT LK ACT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: If the affected flight lock actuator needs to be removed follow the steps below:
Open and collar the affected (LH)(RH) UPR DK DR FLT LOCK circuit breaker on the P180 panel.
Disconnect, cap and stow flight lock electrical connector.
Remove the flight lock actuator (AMM 52-23-08).
Verify the upper deck type A door is capable of being unlatched.
Place the mode selector lever in the Manual position.

caution.para: DO NOT RAISE INSIDE HANDLE WHEN DOOR IS IN AUTOMATIC MODE. DOOR WILL OPEN RAPIDLY AND SLIDE WILL BE DEPLOYED AND INFLATED.

numlitem.para: Rotate the inside handle to the open position. Door should translate upward approximately 2 inches.
Rotate the inside handle downward to the latched position.

item.title: DOOR U/D GND MODE Lights (Above Door) – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Each upper deck type "A" door is verified to be capable of being unlatched before each departure, and
DOOR U/D FLT LK message is operative.

placard.para: Install Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 on affected door: "____ U/D DOOR GRD MODE LIGHTS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: DOOR U/D GND MODE LIGHTS (ABOVE DOOR)

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify the upper deck type A door is capable of being unlatched.
Place the mode selector lever in the MANUAL position.

caution.para: DO NOT RAISE INSIDE HANDLE WHEN DOOR IS IN AUTOMATIC MODE. DOOR WILL OPEN RAPIDLY AND SLIDE WILL BE DEPLOYED AND INFLATED.

numlitem.para: Rotate the inside handle to the open position. Door should translate upward approximately 2 inches.
Rotate the inside handle downward to the latched position.
Ensure the EICAS caution message DOOR U/D FLT LK is operating normally.
Energize all 28 V DC Buses.
Remove the flight lock actuator access panel. (These are the 10-inch square access panels located in the door upper lining just left of the inside handle)
Rotate the flight lock lever arm until it comes in contact with the inside handle shaft and verify the message DOOR U/D FLT LK appears on EICAS.
Release the flight lock lever arm and verify that the EICAS message DOOR U/D FLT LK is not displayed.

warning.para: refer to amm 32-09-02/201. put the air/ground relay system in the air mode. automatic operation of aircraft systems in the air mode can cause injury or damage.

numlitem.para: Put the air/ground relay system in the air mode (AMM 32-09-02/201).
Open 180G02 LH UPR DK DR FLT LK circuit breaker on the P180 DC Power Distribution Panel.
Check that the message DOOR U/D FLT LK appears on EICAS.
Close 180G02 LH UPR DK DR FLT LK circuit breaker on the P180 DC Power Distribution Panel.
Check that the EICAS message DOOR U/D FLT LK is established.
Open 180D02 RH UPR DK DR FLT LK circuit breaker on the P180 CR Power Distribution Panel.
Check that the EICAS message DOOR U/D FLT LK is extinguished.
Close 180D02 RH UPR DK DR FLT LK circuit breaker on the P180 CR Power Distribution Panel.
Check that the EICAS message DOOR U/D FLT LK is extinguished.
Put the air/ground relay system back to the ground mode (AMM 32-09-02/201).
Restore the flight lock actuator access panel.

item.title: Pressure Stop Fitting Assemblies (Upper Deck Door(s)) – Freighter with Draw-Through Smoke Detection System – Flight Pressurized Manual Mode Only

remarks.para: One forward fitting assembly and/or one aft fitting assembly per door may be missing or inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: There are no visible defects on remaining fitting assemblies for associated door(s),
Cabin altitude auto controller is operative,
Maximum cabin pressure differential is limited to 6.1 psi.
Use Manual Cabin Altitude Control. Do not exceed maximum cabin pressure differential limit of 6.1 psi.

note.para: When at FL290 MSL with a 6.1 psi cabin pressure differential, the cabin altitude will be approximately 9,000 ft.

limitation.para: Flight is limited to FL290 MSL.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "U/D DOOR____PRESS STOP FITTING MISSING/INOP: MAX PRESSURE DIFF 6.1 PSI". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Visually inspect remaining fittings on affected door(s) for defects.

item.title: Pressure Stop Fitting Assemblies (Upper Deck Door(s)) – Freighter with Draw-Through Smoke Detection System – Flight Unpressurized

remarks.para: One forward fitting assembly and/or one aft fitting assembly per door may be missing or inoperative in unpressurized configuration.

numlitem.para: With supernumeraries on board, en route altitude must be limited to 10,000 feet MSL.
Equipment cooling may be operated in NORM or STBY.

Flight must remain with 60 minutes of a suitable landing airport. If operation with equipment Cooling in OVRD mode becomes necessary, an unpressurized configuration yields insufficient equipment cooling.
A minimum of two packs is required.
Flight is conducted unpressurized.
With supernumeraries on board, flight is limited to an en route altitude of 10,000 feet MSL.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "STOP FITTINGS INOP – AIRCRAFT UNPRESSURIZED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Visually inspect remaining fittings on affected door(s) for defects.

item.title: Pressure Stop Fitting Assemblies (Upper Deck Door(s)) – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System – Flight Pressurized Manual Mode ONLY

remarks.para: One forward fitting assembly and/or one aft fitting assembly per door may be missing or inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: There are no visible defects on remaining fitting assemblies for associated door(s),
Cabin altitude auto controller is operative,
Maximum cabin pressure differential is limited to 3.0 psi.
Use Manual Cabin Altitude Control. Do not exceed maximum cabin pressure differential limit of 3.0 psi.

note.para: When at 17,000 ft. MSL with a 3.0 psi. cabin pressure differential, the cabin altitude will be approximately 8,000 ft.

numlitem.para: Flight is limited to 17,000 ft. MSL.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "U/D DOOR ____ PRESS STOP FITTING MISSING/INOP: MAX PRESSURE DIFF 3.0 PSI". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Visually inspect remaining fittings on affected door(s) for defects.

item.title: Pressure Stop Fitting Assemblies (Upper Deck Door(s)) – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System – Flight Unpressurized

remarks.para: One forward fitting assembly and/or one aft fitting assembly per door may be missing or inoperative in unpressurized configuration.

numlitem.para: With supernumeraries on board, en route altitude must be limited to 10,000 feet MSL.
Equipment cooling may be operated in NORM or STBY.

Flight must remain with 60 minutes of a suitable landing airport. If operation with Equipment Cooling in OVRD mode becomes necessary, an unpressurized configuration yields insufficient equipment cooling.
A minimum of two packs is required.
Flight is conducted unpressurized.
With supernumeraries on board, flight is limited to an en route altitude of 10,000 feet MSL.

placard.para: Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 panel: "STOP FITTINGS INOP – AIRCRAFT UNPRESSURIZED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Visually inspect remaining fittings on affected door(s) for defects.

item.title: Door U/D FLT LK Indication – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Each upper deck type "A" door is verified to be capable of being unlatched before each departure, and
DOOR U/D GND MODE lights above each upper deck Type "A" door is operative.

placard.para: Install Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 on affected door: "____ U/D DOOR GRD MODE LIGHTS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify both upper deck type A doors are capable of being unlatched.
Place the mode selector lever in the MANUAL position.

caution.para: DO NOT RAISE INSIDE HANDLE WHEN DOOR IS IN AUTOMATIC MODE. DOOR WILL OPEN RAPIDLY AND SLIDE WILL BE DEPLOYED AND INFLATED.

numlitem.para: Rotate the inside handle to the open position. Door should translate upward approximately 2 inches.
Rotate the inside handle downward to the latched position.
Ensure both DOOR U/D GND MODE lights operate normally.
Energize all 28 V DC Buses.
Remove the flight lock actuator access panel. (These are the 10-inch square access panels located in the door upper lining just left of the inside handle)
Rotate the flight lock lever arm until it comes in contact with the inside handle shaft and verify the message DOOR U/D GND MODE light is extinguished.
Release the flight lock lever arm and verify the DOOR U/D GND MODE light is illuminated.

warning.para: refer to amm 32-09-02/201. put the air/ground relay system in the air mode. automatic operation of aircraft systems In the air mode can cause injury or damage.

numlitem.para: Put the air/ground relay system in the air mode (AMM 32-09-02/201).
Open 180G02 LH UPR DK DR FLT LK circuit breaker on the P180 DC Power Distribution Panel.
Check that the DOOR U/D GND MODE light above the left hand door is illuminated.
Close 180G02 LH UPR DK DR FLT LK circuit breaker on the P180 DC Power Distribution Panel.
Check that the DOOR U/D GND MODE light above the left hand door is extinguished.
Open 180D02 RH UPR DK DR FLT LK circuit breaker on the P180 DC Power Distribution Panel.
Check that the DOOR U/D GND MODE light above the right hand door is illuminated.
Close 180D02 RH UPR DK DR FLT LK circuit breaker on the P180 CR Power Distribution Panel.
Check that the DOOR U/D GND MODE light above the right hand door is extinguished.
Put the air/ground relay system back to the ground mode (AMM 32-09-02/201).
Restore the flight lock actuator access panel.

item.title: Upper Deck Door Battery OK Lights

remarks.para: One press-to-test system may be inoperative provided associated system is verified to be adequately charged once each flight day.

placard.para: Install Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 on affected door: "____ BATTERY OK LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Depress and hold operational BATTERY OK lighted switch on DOOR ANNUNCIATOR module above door. Check that light illuminates after a delay of approximately 2 seconds and extinguishes when switch is released.
Open hinged access panels in overhead between doors.
Remove batteries from M7037 and M7038 receptacles (AMM 52-23-14).
Install M7037 battery in M7038 receptacle and M7038 battery in M7037 receptacle.

Depress and hold operational BATTERY OK lighted switch on DOOR ANNUNCIATOR module above door. Check that light illuminates after a delay of approximately 2 seconds and extinguishes when switch is released. If light illuminates both systems are adequately charged.
Close access panels in overhead.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: It is visually verified that the door is closed and flush with the fuselage before each departure,
