It is visually verified that latches are fully extended before each departure,
The door control system is deactivated by an accepted procedure, and
Repairs are made within 30 flight hours.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
DOOR NOSE CARGO

numlitem.para: Prior to each departure, ensure nose cargo has been verified closed, latched, locked and the control system deactivated.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "NOSE CARGO DOOR INDICATION INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: To verify that the door is closed and flush with the fuselage:
Close the nose cargo door by either Normal or Manual Operation procedures (AMM 52-31-00).
Visually check that the nose cargo door is flush with the fuselage around the entire circumference of the door frame.
To visually verify that latches are fully extended, check that all 16 latches are extended to a position that is within + 0.1 of an inch of the visible end of the bushing (see illustration below).
Lock door using normal procedures and deactivate the door control system by opening and collaring the following circuit breakers:

item.title: Nose Cargo/Door Power Lift System – (Electrical Function)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided accepted maintenance procedures are established and used.

placard.para: Placard on Nose Cargo Door Control Panel: "ELECTRICAL LIFT INOP - OPERATE MANUALLY". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Disconnect flexible drive shafts and operate door manually (AMM 52-31-00).
Open and collar the following circuit breaker on the H122 panel:
Prior to departure, ensure nose cargo door is closed, latched and locked using normal procedures.

item.title: Nose Cargo Door Cam System – (Electrical Function)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided accepted maintenance procedures are established and used.

placard.para: Placard per DMP instructions. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: If Cam System can be operated manually:
Placard the Nose Cargo Door Control panel: CAM INOP - OPERATE MANUALLY.
Cycle door electrically until "camming" is required.
Manually operate cam system (AMM 52-31-00).
If MOTOR BRAKE has failed in the released position, manual input will not operate cam system; remove electrical connector to restore manual operation.
After the cam is manually positioned, replace electrical connector.

Complete door operation cycle manually or electrically (AMM 52-31-00). If door will not operate electrically, jumpers may be used on appropriate terminals located on the back side of the main control panel door as follows:

entry.para: Simultaneously jumper terminal TP-1 to terminals TP-6, TP-13 and TP-16

numlitem.para: Prior to departure, verify the door is closed, latched and locked using normal procedures.
If Cam System is jammed and cannot be operated manually:
Placard the Nose Cargo Door Control panel: CAM REMOVED.
Remove and stow Cam Actuator electrical connector.
Remove Cam Actuator (One bolt at each end. See illustration).
Remove Cam Support and Cam (4 bolts in base).
Cycle door electrically to a point where "camming" would normally be required.

Complete door operation cycle manually or electrically (AMM 52-31-00). If door will not operate electrically, jumpers may be used on appropriate terminals located on the back side of the main control panel door as follows:

entry.para: Simultaneously jumper terminal TP-1 to terminals TP-6, TP-13 and TP-16

numlitem.para: Prior to departure, verify the door is closed, latched and locked using normal procedures.

item.title: Nose Cargo Door Power Latch System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated latches are extended manually by an accepted maintenance procedure, and
Latches are visually confirmed fully extended.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
DOOR NOSE CARGO

placard.para: Placard on Nose Cargo Door Control Panel: "LATCH(ES) #__ INOP – OPERATE MANUALLY." Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

para.emphasis: CHECK THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF DOOR PATH. SERIOUS INJURY TO PERSONNEL OR EQUIPMENT COULD OCCUR.

note.para: When opening door, if the inoperative Power Latch System prevents the Cam from pushing the door open, continue to cycle the door open manually or electrically (AMM 52-31-00). If door does not operate electrically, jumpers can be used on the following terminals located on the back side of the main control panel:

numlitem.para: To extend associated latch(es) manually:
Cycle door electrically until all operative latches are in the closed position.
Position inoperative latch manually (AMM 52-31-00).
If MOTOR BRAKE has failed in the released position, manual input will not operate latch. Remove electrical connector to restore manual operation.
After the latch is manually positioned, replace electrical connector.
Lock nose cargo door using normal procedures.

Prior to each departure, visually verify all 16 latches are fully extended by viewing that each latch pin is extended to a position within +/- 0.1 inch of the visible end of the bushing (see illustration).

item.title: Nose Cargo Door Power Latch System Power Latches

remarks.para: One may be inoperative unlatched or missing provided remaining latches are visually confirmed to be fully extended.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
DOOR NOSE CARGO
If a NOSE DOOR LATCH is removed, the caution message DOOR NOSE CARGO will remain displayed until after Thrust Levers are advanced for takeoff.

placard.para: Placard on the Nose Cargo Door Control Panel: "NOSE DOOR LATCH # ____ INOPERATIVE or NOSE DOOR LATCH # ____ REMOVED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

para.emphasis: CHECK THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF DOOR PATH. SERIOUS INJURY TO PERSONNEL OR EQUIPMENT COULD OCCUR.

note.para: When opening door, if the inoperative Power Latch System prevents the Cam from pushing the door open, continue to cycle the door open manually or electrically (AMM 52-31-00). If door does not operate electrically, jumpers can be used on the following terminals located on the back side of the main control panel:

numlitem.para: To dispatch with one power latch inoperative unlatched or removed:
Cycle door electrically until all operative latches are in the closed position.
If a jammed latch pin interferes with door operation, remove the latch as follows:

para.emphasis: DISPATCH IS ALLOWED WITH ONLY ONE LATCH REMOVED.

numlitem.para: Remove and stow associated latch actuator's electrical connector.
Remove two bolts holding actuator onto latch fitting and remove actuator (including latchpin).
Lock nose cargo door using normal procedures and deactivate door by opening and collaring the following circuit breakers:

Prior to each departure, visually verify that the remaining 15 latches are fully extended by viewing that each latch pin is extended to a position within +/- 0.1 inch of the visible end of the bushing (see illustration).

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Accepted procedures are established and used,
Door is visually verified closed and flush with the fuselage before each departure,
Latches are visually verified to be fully extended before each departure,
Door control system is deactivated by an accepted procedures, and
Repairs are made within 30 flight hours.
Prior to each departure, ensure nose cargo door has been verified closed, latched, locked and the control system deactivated.

placard.para: Install Placards below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel and on Nose Cargo Door Control Panel: "LOADMASTER NOSE CARGO DOOR CONTROLS INOP". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify that the door is closed and flush with the fuselage:

para.emphasis: CHECK THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF DOOR PATH. SERIOUS INJURY TO PERSONNEL OR EQUIPMENT COULD OCCUR.

numlitem.para: Close the nose cargo door by either Normal or Manual Operation procedures (AMM 52-31-00).
Visually check that the nose cargo door is flush with the fuselage around the entire circumference of the door frame.
Visually verify all 16 latches are fully extended, check that each latch pin is extended to a position that is within + 0.1 inch of the visible end of the bushing (see illustration below).
Lock nose cargo door using normal procedures and deactivate the door by opening and collaring the following circuit breakers:

item.title: Nose Door Latch Actuator Test System

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard on Test Latch Actuator Test Panel: "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Loadmaster’s Nose Cargo Door Latch Annunciator System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided it is visually verified that latches are fully extended before each departure.

numlitem.para: Prior to each departure, ensure nose cargo door has been verified closed, latched, locked.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel and on Annunciator panel: "LOADMASTER’S NOSE CARGO DOOR ANNUNCIATOR SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Accomplish all normal procedures to ensure door is securely closed, latched and locked.
Visually verify all 16 latches are fully extended by viewing that each latch pin is extended to a position that is within + 0.1 inch of the visible end of the bushing (see illustration below).

item.title: Loadmaster’s Nose Cargo Door Closed Annunciator System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Nose door is visually verified closed and flush with the fuselage before each departure, and
Nose cargo door latch annunciator is operative.
Prior to each departure, ensure nose cargo door has been verified closed, latched, locked.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel and on Annunciator panel: "LOADMASTER’S NOSE CARGO DOOR CLOSED ANNUNCIATOR SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify that the door is closed and flush with the fuselage:
Close the nose cargo door by either Normal or Manual Operation procedures (AMM 52-31-00).
Visually check that the nose cargo door is closed and flush with the fuselage around the entire circumference of the door frame.

Ensure that the Nose Cargo Door Latch Annunciator System is operating normally and check that all sixteen latches are in the latched position by normal procedures. If Annunciator system is not operating normally see MEL 52-31-8-2.
Accomplish all remaining normal procedures to ensure door is securely closed, latched and locked.

item.title: Loadmaster’s Nose Cargo Door Closed Annunciator System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Nose door is visually verified closed and flush with the fuselage before each departure, and
Latches are visually verified to be fully extended before each departure.
Prior to each departure, ensure nose cargo door has been verified closed, latched, locked.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel and on Annunciator panel: "LOADMASTER’S NOSE CARGO DOOR CLOSED ANNUNCIATOR SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify that the door is closed and flush with the fuselage:
Close the nose cargo door by either Normal or Manual Operation procedures (AMM 52-31-00).
Visually check that the nose cargo door is closed and flush with the fuselage around the entire circumference of the door frame.
Visually check that all 16 latch pins are fully extended to a position within + 0.1 inch of the visible end of the bushing (see illustration below).
Accomplish all remaining normal procedures to ensure door is securely closed, latched and locked.

item.chgdesc: Adds Note in Limitations.
item.title: Main Deck Side Cargo Door

remarks.para: One latch or hinge section per door may be missing or inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: A visual check is made before departure to ensure that there is no damage to other hinge sections or latches on the associated door,
Flight is conducted in an unpressurized configuration,

Procedures are established and used to verify main deck and lower lobe cargo compartments remain empty or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits,
Extended overwater flight is prohibited, and

Crew rests, crew work stations and passenger business centers with a door and smoke detection system (except the Combi Enlarged Lav/Business Center) are empty, locked closed and placarded INOPERATIVE – DO NOT ENTER.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
DOOR SIDE CARGO

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
With supernumeraries on board, en route altitude must be limited to 10,000 feet MSL.
Equipment cooling may be operated in NORM or STBY.

Flight must remain with 60 minutes of a suitable landing airport. If operation with Equipment Cooling in OVRD mode becomes necessary, an unpressurized configuration yields insufficient equipment cooling. Flight time must be limited to 60 minutes when in OVRD mode.
A minimum of two packs is required.
Flight is conducted unpressurized.
With supernumeraries on board, flight is limited to an en route altitude of 10,000 feet MSL.
Main deck and lower lobe cargo compartments remain empty or contain only empty cargo handling equipment.
Extended overwater flight is prohibited.

para.revision: Extended Overwater operations is a horizontal distance of more than 50 NM from the nearest shoreline.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "MN DK SIDE CARGO DOOR LATCH/HINGE INOP – DO NOT PRESSURIZE AIRCRAFT". Placard crew rest area: "COMPARTMENT INOPERATIVE – DO NOT ENTER". Placard Cabin Pressurization Controller Selector "MODE A and MODE B INOP". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Visually check all hinges and latches on affected door to confirm that no additional damage exists.

note.para: DEACTIVATE BOTH OUTFLOW VALVES INOPERATIVE FOR UNPRESSURIZED FLIGHT.

numlitem.para: Deactivate both left and right outflow valves open as detailed below:
Open and collar the P6 panel CABIN PRESS CONT L ICU and P414 panel CABIN PRESS ICU LEFT circuit breakers.
Open and collar the P6 panel CABIN PRESS CONT R ICU and P414 panel CABIN PRESS ICU RIGHT circuit breakers.
Determine position of both outflow valves. If not fully open, manually open by one of the following methods:
If manual control is available:
Select outflow valves to manual control (MAN L and MAN R ON), and drive valves fully open.
Deselect manual control (MAN L and MAN R OFF).
If manual control is not available:
Remove AC motor from both outflow valves per (AMM 21-31-06/401).

note.para: Caution should be taken so as not to lose AC motor shim plate.

numlitem.para: Open valves by applying torque to actuator output shaft.
Reinstall AC motors.
Check that the Upper Deck Crew Rest compartment is empty and secured closed.

item.title: Main Deck Side Cargo Door Latch System (Electrical Function)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Manual function is operative,
There is no damage to the latch mechanism,
There is no damage to the master latch lock mechanism,
Door is closed and locked using an accepted maintenance manual procedure, and
All latch cams are visually confirmed to be in the closed position.

placard.para: Placard on Main Deck Side Cargo Door control panels: "ELECTRICAL LATCH ACTUATION – INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Visually check the side cargo door to ensure that there is no damage to the latch mechanism or master latch lock mechanism.
Door may be operated manually or electrically and manually as follows:
Operate door manually (AMM 52-32-00).
Alternatively, door may be operated as follows:

To open door, unlock and unlatch the door manually using the procedures described in Open Door Manually section of AMM 52-32-00. Electric actuation may then be used to unhook and lift the door to complete the door opening sequence.

To close door, operate door electrically until inoperative electric latch actuation halts door operation. Then use manual Close Latches and Lock Door Latches procedures in the Close Door Manually section of AMM 52-32-00 to complete the door closing sequence.

item.title: Main Deck Side Cargo Door Latch Lock System (Interior Master Latch Lock Handle Shear Pin)

remarks.para: Shear pin may be inoperative or missing provided:

numlitem.para: Exterior master latch lock handle is operative,
There is no damage to the master latch lock mechanism, and
Door is locked using the exterior master latch lock handle.

placard.para: Placard on main Deck Side Cargo Door control panels: "INTERIOR MASTER LATCH HANDLE INOP – USE EXTERIOR HANDLE". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Visually check the side cargo door to ensure that there is no damage to the latch mechanism or the exterior master latch lock mechanism.
The door must be locked and unlocked using the exterior master latch lock handle only.
Door may be opened and closed using normal procedures.

item.title: Cargo Door Lift Systems (Main Lower Lobe Cargo Doors and Main Deck Side Cargo Door)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: There is no damage to the latch mechanism,
There is no damage to the master latch lock mechanism, and
Associated door is opened, closed and locked using an accepted maintenance manual procedure.

placard.para: Placard on Cargo Door control panel(s): "ELECTRICAL LEFT ACTUATION INOP" or if Manual function is affected: "MANUAL LIFT ACTUATION INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Visually check the associated cargo door to ensure that there is no damage to the latch mechanism or the exterior master latch lock mechanism.
The door must be locked and unlocked using the exterior master latch lock handle only.

Open, close, latch and lock the door using the appropriate Maintenance Manual procedure AMM 52-32-00 for Main Deck Side Cargo Door, AMM 52-34-00 for Lower Lobe Cargo Door). The appropriate procedure will be contained in one or more of the following Maintenance Manual paragraphs:
Open door manually.
Close door manually.
Open or close door with one or more electrically inoperative actuators.
Open door with a jammed actuator or mechanism.
Close door with a jammed actuator or mechanism.

para.emphasis: TO AVOID PERSONNEL INJURY OR CARGO DOOR DAMAGE, USE ONLY AN APPROPRIATE SLING WHEN DOOR MUST BE LIFTED OR SUPPORTED DUE TO A JAMMED ACTUATOR OR MECHANISM.

item.title: Cargo Door Hook Systems (Main Lower Lobe Cargo Doors and Main Deck Side Cargo Door) (Electrical Function)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Manual function is operative,
There is no damage to the hook mechanism, and
Doors are closed and locked using an accepted maintenance manual procedure.

placard.para: Placard on Cargo Door control panel(s): "ELECTRICAL HOOK ACTUATION – INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Visually check associated door's hook mechanism to confirm no damage exists.

Open, close, latch and lock the associated door using the appropriate Maintenance Manual procedure (AMM 52-32-00 for Main Deck Side Cargo Door, AMM 52-34-00 for Lower Lobe Cargo Door). The appropriate procedure will be contained in one or more of the following Maintenance Manual paragraphs:
Open door manually.
Close door manually.
Open or close door with one or more electrically inoperative actuators.

item.chgdesc: Adds Note in Limitations.
item.title: Main Lower Lobe Cargo Doors – One Latch or Hinge Section

remarks.para: One latch or hinge section per door may be missing or inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: A visual check is made before departure to ensure that there is no damage to remaining hinge sections or latches on the associated door,
Flight is conducted in an unpressurized configuration,

Procedures are established and used to verify main deck and lower lobe cargo compartments remain empty or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits,
Extended overwater flight is prohibited, and

Crew rests, crew work stations and passenger business centers with a door and smoke detection system (except the Combi Enlarged Lav/ Business Center) are empty, locked, closed and placarded INOPERATIVE – DO NOT ENTER.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
DOOR AFT
FWD CARGO

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
With supernumeraries on board, en route altitude must be limited to 10,000 feet MSL.
Equipment cooling may be operated in NORM or STBY.

Flight must remain with 60 minutes of a suitable landing airport. If operation with Equipment Cooling in OVRD mode becomes necessary, an unpressurized configuration yields insufficient equipment cooling. Flight time must be limited to 60 minutes when in OVRD mode.
A minimum of two packs is required.
Flight is conducted unpressurized.
With supernumeraries on board, flight is limited to an en route altitude of 10,000 feet MSL.
Main deck and lower lobe cargo compartments remain empty or contain only empty cargo handling equipment.
Extended overwater flight is prohibited.

para.revision: Extended Overwater operations is a horizontal distance of more than 50 NM from the nearest shoreline.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "FWD/AFT LL CARGO DOOR LATCH/HINGE – INOP – OPERATE UNPRESSURIZED". Placard crew rest area: "COMPARTMENT INOPERATIVE – DO NOT ENTER". Placard Cabin Pressurization Controller Selector "MODE A and MODE B INOP". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 52-32-1.

item.title: Main Lower Lobe Cargo Door latch Systems (Electrical Function)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Manual functions is operative,
There is no damage to the latch mechanism,
There is no damage to the master latch lock mechanism,
Doors are closed and locked using an accepted maintenance manual procedure, and
All latch cams on lower sill are confirmed to be in the closed position.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
DOOR AFT
FWD CARGO

placard.para: Placard on affected cargo door control panel(s): "ELECTRICAL LATCH ACTUATION – INOP". Enter item(s) in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Visually check latch mechanism to confirm no damage exists.

Open, close, latch and lock the door using the appropriate Maintenance Manual procedure (AMM 52-34-00). The appropriate procedure will be contained in one or more of the following Maintenance Manual paragraphs:
Open door manually.
Close door manually.
Open or close door with one or more electrically inoperative actuators.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided a safety hold open device is used when door is in OPEN position.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "BULK CARGO DOOR BALANCE MECHANISM INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open Bulk Cargo Door to the full open position.
Ensure the door latch support clip at the door's lower edge engages a latch in the compartment ceiling.

item.title: Bulk Cargo Door Pressure Stop Fitting Assemblies

remarks.para: One forward fitting assembly or one aft fitting assembly may be missing or inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: There are no visible defects on remaining fitting assemblies for associated door,
Cabin altitude auto controller is operative, and
Maximum cabin pressure differential is limited to 5.2 psi.
In automatic Cabin Altitude control, comply with maximum cabin pressure differential limit of 5.2 by not exceeding the 11,000 feet MSL maximum aircraft altitude.
Flight is limited to 11,000 feet MSL en route altitude.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "BULK CARGO DOOR PRESSURE STOP FITTING INOP_ MAX CABIN PRESSURE DIFF – 5.2 PSI". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Visually inspect remaining fittings on affected door(s) for defects.

item.title: Main (Forward) Electronic Bay External Access Door Latch Pins

remarks.para: One may be damaged or removed provided door is operative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "FWD EE BAY ACCESS DOOR LATCH PIN REMOVED – DOOR OPERATIVE". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To remove a Latch Pin:
Remove the door (AMM 52-48-03).
Using the applicable steps of 747 Overhaul Manual (Ref. 52-48-21), remove the broken or cracked latch pin assembly.
Replace the latch pin assembly with washer(s) that are the same diameter and the same total thickness as the rack gear on the latch pin assembly.
Reassemble door mechanism using the applicable steps of 747 Overhaul Manual (Ref. 52-48-21) and reinstall door (AMM 52-48-03).

note.para: With a missing latch pin with the extend stop collar, be careful not to over-rotate the door handle when securing the door closed. When closing the door, do not rotate the outside handle past the hatch skin cutout or the interior handle past the closed guide markings.

item.title: Main (Forward) Electronic Bay External Access Door Latch Pins

remarks.para: One may inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Integrity of remaining pins is verified,
Remaining pins are verified to be fully engaged, and
Verification procedures are repeated each time the door is opened and closed.

note.para: If FWD EE BAY ACCESS DOOR is deferred as inoperative, do not open unless maintenance procedures are followed.

numlitem.para: Associated door indication may remain displayed.
Maintenance will verify the status of the affected door(s) and communicate this to the flight crew as appropriate.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "FWD EE BAY ACCESS DOOR INOPERATIVE – DO NOT OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify integrity of closed door's remaining latch pins (from inside the aircraft in the Main Electronic Bay):
Remove the internal handle and door liner.
Visually confirm the integrity of the three remaining latch pins.
Replace the door liner and internal handle.
Confirm that the door handle is in the latched position.
Visually confirm the three remaining latch pins are fully engaged with their respective keeper fittings.
Verify the closed door's remaining pins are fully engaged before departure:
Check that the exterior operating handle is stowed flush with the door and is secured in the latched position by the handle latch.
Check that the door is flush with the fuselage skin.
Check that the door is latched by pushing inward on the door and verify that it does not move.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided door(s) is verified closed and locked by an alternate procedure.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:
DOOR AFT CARGO
DOOR FWD CARGO
DOOR SIDE CARGO
DOOR ENTRY ___
Lower E & E and Bulk door indication will be EICAS Advisory messages only and if either is inoperative will affect ACARS report times.

numlitem.para: Associated door indication may remain displayed.
Maintenance will verify the status of the affected door(s) and communicate this to the flight crew as appropriate.

placard.para: Placard near Primary EICAS Display: "DOOR_ INDICATION INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)
Maintenance procedures are to be performed as the final closing of an affected door(s) prior to takeoff. The status of the affected door(s) should be communicated to the flight crew as appropriate.

numlitem.para: Verify the affected door(s) is closed and locked as follows:
Main Entry and Upper Deck Doors:
Check that the door is flush with the fuselage skin.
Check that the exterior operating handle is stowed flush with the door.
Check that the interior operating handle is rotated to the fully latched (closed) position.
Crew Compartment Overhead Door (Hatch):
Open the door and check that the exterior handle is stowed flush with the door and is secured in the latched position by the handle latch.
Close and latch the door.
Ensure that the latch pins properly engage the keeper fittings on the body and that the arrow on the interior handle is aligned with the LOCKED arrow on the door lining.
Bulk Cargo Door:
Ensure the interior and exterior operating handles are working in phase by pulling the exterior handle from its recess in the door until it is fully extended. Re-stow the handle.
Check that the exterior operating handle is stowed flush with the door.
Check that the door is flush with the fuselage skin.
Check that the door is latched by pushing inward on the door and verify that it does not move.
Main/Center Electronics Equipment Access Door:
Ensure the interior and exterior operating handles are working in phase by pulling the exterior handle from its recess in the door until it is fully extended. Re-stow the handle.
Check that the exterior operating handle is stowed flush with the door and is secured in the latched position by the handle latch.
Check that the door is flush with the fuselage skin.
Check that the door is latched by pushing inward on the door and verify that it does not move.
Forward and Aft Lower Lobe Cargo Doors:
Close and latch door per normal procedure.
Check that the door is fully latched by observing, through the door's view port, that the stripe on each rotary latch cam is aligned with the arrow on the adjacent latch pin fitting.

Observe that the pressure relief doors are open prior to closing the master latch lock handle. Observe the pressure relief doors closing while moving the master latch lock handle to the closed position.

note.para: Do not force master latch lock handle closed. Resistance or interference indicates latch cams may not be in fully latched position.

numlitem.para: Check that the master latch lock handle and its trigger are stowed flush with the door and that the pressure relief doors are closed. The top of a fully closed pressure relief door is approximately one half inch inboard of the cargo door skin when plane is unpressurized.
Main Deck Cargo Door:
Close and latch door per normal procedure.

Check that the door is fully latched by observing, from inside the aircraft, that the rig pin slot in both the forward-most and aft-most rotary latch cam is aligned with the rig pin hole in the adjacent door structure.

Observe, from outside the aircraft, that the pressure relief doors are open prior to closing the master latch lock handle. Observe the pressure relief doors closing while moving the master latch lock handle to the closed position.

note.para: Do not force master latch lock handle closed. Resistance or interference indicates latch cams may not be in fully latched position.

numlitem.para: Check that the master latch lock handle and its trigger are stowed flush with the door and that the pressure relief doors are closed. The top of a fully closed pressure relief door is approximately one half inch inboard of the cargo door skin when the aircraft is unpressurized.

item.title: Minimum Idle/Approach Idle Selection Systems – Ground Minimum Idle Selection Systems

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Anti-skid is operative, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
IDLE DISAGREE
ENG __ LOW IDLE

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Reduce performance limited weights by the following per affected engine:

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: " ____ GROUND MIN IDLE SEL SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Minimum Idle/Approach Idle Selection Systems – Continuous Ignition Selected Approach Idle

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided during operation in or near heavy rain or hail, N1 is maintained at 45% for Flight Levels below 10,000 ft., and N1 is maintained at 50% for Flight Levels 10,000 ft. and higher.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
IDLE DISAGREE
ENG __ LOW IDLE

numlitem.para: With inoperative Continuous Ignition Selected Approach Idle, if moderate-to-heavy rain or hail is encountered or anticipated,
If TAT 10ºC or below, turn Nacelle Anti-ice switches ON and Disconnect Autothrottles during descent.
If TAT above 10ºC turn Continuous Ignition ON. During descent disconnect Autothrottles and set a minimum of 50% N1 at or above 10,000 feet and 45% N1 below 10,000 feet (except for landing).

note.para: In heavy precipitation, engine parameter fluctuations may occur, particularly a noticeable drop in EGT. Engine parameters will return to normal immediately upon leaving the area of heavy precipitation.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: " ____ CONT IGN SEL APP IDLE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Electronic Engine Control Systems (EEC) – ENG_EEC Mode

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided all engines are operated in the alternate (ALTN) mode.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ EEC MODE

numlitem.para: Select all EEC MODE Switches to ALTN

placard.para: Placard adjacent to EEC Mode Switch (overhead panel): "ENG ___ EEC NORM MODE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Electronic Engine Control Systems (EEC) – ENG_EEC C1

remarks.para: Two may be inoperative with C1 faults provided repairs are made in accordance with times established by GE engine Type Certificate Data Sheet number E13NE note 18.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ EEC C1

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ EEC C1 FAULTS". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: EICAS message Level C = Dispatch is not allowed. Level C1 = Maximum interval of 150 operating hours.

Fault Level "C2" message is equivalent to an EICAS maintenance message and does not affect aircraft dispatch. A fault level "C2" message has a maximum operating limit of 1000 hours and should be deferred via "DMI" procedures.

item.title: Engine Overspeed Protection Systems – N2 Hydromechanical Overspeed Governor

remarks.para: May be inoperative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ OVSP GOVERNOR – INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.chgdesc: Revises proviso per MMEL. Adds Notes in proviso for company necessity.
item.title: Fuel Flow Indications

para.revision: Except for ER operations, one may be inoperative provided:
Fuel quanity indicating systems for tanks containing fuel are operative,

numlitem.para: Associated N1, N2, N3 (for RR), and EPR (for PW and RR) indications are operative, and
For Combi, if ballast fuel is carried, stabilizer tank remains empty and CWT fuel in excess of ballast fuel may not be carried.

para.revision: Stabilizer tanks are not installed on UPS aircraft.
All cargo operations using aircraft with more than two engines do not have to comply with ETOPS regulations.

note.para: The affected engine’s Fuel Used indication, FMC Calculated Fuel Quantity, and Total Fuel Used indication on Progress Page 2/3 will be inoperative. The Total Fuel indication on the primary EICAS and the FMC Totalizer Fuel Quantity on Progress Page 2/3 are not affected. The estimated fuel remaining at waypoint or destination on Progress Page 1/3 and the FMC Gross Weight indication will be available and predicted on totalizer fuel quantity.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ FUEL FLOW IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Fuel Control ENG FUEL VLV Indications

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated Engine Fuel Valve is verified to be operative, and
Associated EICAS message is deactivated.
Engine Autostart must be considered inoperative on the affected engine for ground start. Ground start the affected engine using manual start procedures.
If requested by maintenance verify operation of the engine fuel valve at each shutdown.
With the affected engine running at idle, select FUEL CONTROL switch to CUTOFF.
If N1, N2, and EGT begin to decrease rapidly within 5 seconds of CUTOFF, engine shutdown has commenced and valve is verified to be operative.
If engine continues to run at idle for more than 5 seconds after CUTOFF, the valve is not operating normally and dispatch is not allowed.
Enter comment in Log verifying engine shutdown parameters.

note.para: Fuel spar valve is commanded closed simultaneously when CUTOFF is selected. If engine fuel valve is inoperative, engine shutdown will be delayed approximately 30 seconds until fuel downstream of fuel spar valve is used.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ FUEL CONTROL VLV IND INOP". Placard the AUTOSTART switch on the Engine Ignition and Start Control panel (P5): "INOP FOR GROUND START ENG ___". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Verify operation of the engine fuel valve.
With the affected engine running at idle, select FUEL CONTROL switch to CUTOFF.
If N1, N2, and EGT begin to decrease rapidly within 5 seconds of CUTOFF, engine shutdown has commenced and valve is verified to operate normally.
If engine continues to run at idle for more than 5 seconds after CUTOFF, the valve is not operating normally and dispatch is not allowed.

note.para: Fuel spar valve is commanded closed simultaneously when CUTOFF is selected. If engine fuel valve is inoperative, engine shutdown will be delayed approximately 30 seconds until fuel downstream of fuel spar valve is used.

numlitem.para: Deactivate associated ENG __ FUEL VLV message.
Open right fan cowl (AMM 71-11-04/201) and right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201) on affected engine.
For GE, perform one of the following:
Disconnect, cap and stow the DV236B connector from the associated hydro-mechanical control unit (HMU).
Disconnect ground wire W5324-010-20 from grounding stud GD5955DC, located on upper forward right side of engine. Reinstall unaffected wires on grounding stud and secure with a new locknut.
Install protective closure on disconnected wire/ground lug, using heat-resistant tape or shrink sleeve. Secure protected wire as appropriate.
Close thrust reverser and fan cowl(s).
Placard the AUTOSTART switch on the Engine Ignition and Start Control panel (P5): INOP FOR GROUND START ENG _.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: It is verified that the malfunction is in the fuel filter bypass warning system, and
Associated fuel filter is checked for the presence of contaminants before each departure.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ FUEL FILT

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ FUEL CONTROL VLV IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify that the malfunction is in the associated fuel filter bypass warning system:
Remove and replace the fuel filter (AMM 73-11-02/401).
If the EICAS status message ENG_ FUEL FILT remains displayed after system is restored to normal configuration and 70 seconds time has elapsed, the fuel filter bypass warning system is faulty.
Prior to each departure check the fuel filter to ensure there are no contaminants:
On GE powered aircraft, check fuel filter to ensure absence of contaminants and install a new fuel filter (AMM 73-11-02/401).

remarks.para: One per engine may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Nacelle anti-ice system on the associated engine is operative,
Ignition Selector is positioned to ensure ignition to all engines, and
For PW & RR, No.1 ignition system is verified to operate on at least two engines prior to each flight.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ IGNITOR ___

numlitem.para: To ensure Ignition to all engines, after start, select NORM on STBY Ignition Selector and Select BOTH on Auto Ignition Selector.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ ENG IGN SYS 1 or 2 INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Continuous Ignition Selection System – Flap Actuated

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided continuous ignition is manually selected ON when required.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CON IGN ENG ___

numlitem.para: Select Continuous Ignition Switch ON when flaps are extended from the FLAPS UP position.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "____ FLAP CON IGN SELECTION INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Continuous Ignition Selection System – Nacelle Anti-Ice Actuated

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided continuous ignition is manually selected ON when required.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CON IGN ENG ___

numlitem.para: Select Continuous Ignition Switch ON prior to entering icing conditions.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: “____ NAI CON IGN SELECTION INOP.” Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Continuous Ignition Selection System – Switch Actuated

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided standby ignition system is used to provide continuous ignition when required.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
CON IGN ENG ___

numlitem.para: Select Standby Ignition Switch position 1 or 2 anytime during operation in flight that would require selecting Continuous Ignition. For example: heavy precipitation or Volcanic Ash.
If TAT 10°C or below, turn Nacelle Anti-ice switches ON and Disconnect Autothrottles during descent.
If TAT above 10°C, during descent disconnect Autothrottles and set a minimum of 50% N1 at or above 10,000 feet and 45% N1 below 10,000 feet (except for landing).

note.para: In heavy precipitation, engine parameter fluctuations may occur, particularly a noticeable drop in EGT. Engine parameters will return to normal immediately upon leaving the area of heavy precipitation.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "____ CON IGN SWITCH INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Nacelle Cooling Systems – Core Compartment Cooling Valves

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated valve remains open.

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Increase flight planning fuel by 0.1% for each affected engine.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ CCCV VLV INOP OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deactivate the Core Compartment Cooling Valve Open:

numlitem.para: Open the left thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Remove the lock screw from the CCCV housing.
Turn the CCCV manual override handle to the OPEN position.
Install the lock screw in the manual override handle and into the CCCV housing. This will lock the CCCV in the open position.
Close and secure left hand thrust reverser half.

remarks.para: May be inoperative open.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ ENG BORE COOLING SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.chgdesc: Revises Placard Statement.
item.title: Turbine Case Cooling Air Flow Systems

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated turbine case cooling valve remains closed.

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Increase flight planning fuel by 0.4% for each engine with inoperative Turbine Case Cooling Valve(s).

para.revision: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ TURBINE CASE COOLING – INOP CLOSED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the associated turbine clearance control (TCC) valve(s). There is one LPTCC valve and one HPTCC valve per engine. The LPTCC valve is mounted in-line with the fan discharge air duct and the HPTCC valve is mounted in-line with LPTCC manifold on the high pressure compressor stator case.

note.para: GE Block III engines and on (mid-1995 and beyond) have replaced the LPTCC valves with constant flow piping.

numlitem.para: Assure TCC valve(s) on affected engine(s) are closed.
Select "73 EPCS" EICAS maintenance page on the CMC.
Check that valves are in closed position, 0 to 10% as indicated on the EPCS page.

note.para: If valves are not closed, dispatch is not allowed. Corrective action is required, per the 71-CMCS MESSAGE INDEX for the existing HPTC/LPTC fault message(s).

numlitem.para: Open following circuit breakers on the P180 DC power distribution panel for the affected engine(s), and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE identifiers:
180J5, ENG 1 EEC PWR CH A
180J6, ENG 1 EEC PWR CH B
180F5, ENG 2 EEC PWR CH A
180F6, ENG 2 EEC PWR CH B
180G20, ENG 3 EEC PWR CH A
180G21, ENG 3 EEC PWR CH B
180D20, ENG 4 EEC PWR CH A
180D21, ENG 4 EEC PWR CH B
Open thrust reverser halves on affected engine(s) (AMM 78-31-00/201).

Disconnect the two electrical connectors from the inoperative TCC valve(s) on the affected engine(s). Cover connectors with metal foil for protection and secure cables with high temperature tape or equivalent.
Close the thrust reverser halves.
Remove DO-NOT-CLOSE-identifiers and close the circuit breakers previously opened in step B.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated turbine cooling valve remains open.

note.para: SB 75-123 has been accomplished on all engines on acft 570 - 579 and EEC software has been verified to be 8.2Q or later, therefore, no maintenance procedure other than placarding is necessary.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ ESCV

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Increase flight planning fuel by 0.1% for each affected engine.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ TURBINE COOLING AIR SYS INOP OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Valves are inoperative open, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ELEC IDG ___ VALVE

numlitem.para: Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Reduce performance limited weights for each inoperative valve by the following:
Increase flight planning fuel by 0.1% for each affected engine.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ IDG AIR/OIL HEAT EXCHANGER VALVE INOP OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deactivate the IDG Air/Oil Cooler Valve Open as follows:

numlitem.para: Open the associated P180 panel circuit breaker(s) and install DO NOT CLOSE identifier(s):
GCU 1, GCU 2, GCU 3, and/or GCU 4
GCU 1 ALT, GCU 2 ALT, GCU 3 ALT, and/or GCU 4 ALT

note.para: The GCU ALT C/Bs are not installed on all aircraft.

numlitem.para: Open right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Verify valve is open by noting position lever (on top of valve) is set to the OPEN position.
Disconnect electrical connector DV350A and DV350B from valve. Install protective closures and secure harness end.
Secure valve open by removing stowed lock screw and inserting lock screw down through hole in position lever and into threaded hole in valve plate.
Close right thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
Close circuit breaker(s) opened in step 1 and remove DO NOT CLOSE identifier(s).

remarks.para: One card may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated engine is started last,
Associated start switch is manually canceled when N2 reaches 50% (N3 for RR),
FMC is initiated with the known total fuel quantity prior to each departure, and
CMC BITE tests for ATA 21 systems are not initiated after engine start.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ SPEED CARD

numlitem.para: Start the associated engine last.
Perform engine start by manual procedure with the following exceptions:
Manually pull and hold the start switch in the start position until N2 reaches 50%.
When N2 reaches 50%, manually push the engine Start Switch in to the OFF position.
Fuel uplifted calculations are not automatically reset between flight legs and therefore, the FMC must be initiated with the known total fuel quantity prior to each departure.

The EEC ALTN Mode Switch Light (amber) for the affected engine may not illuminate with an Engine Speed Card fault. If the EEC fails to ALTN (N1) control mode as a result of a speed card fault, advisory and status messages ENG_ EEC MODE will display to indicate that a reversion to ALTN Mode has occurred. If ENG_ EEC MODE is displayed the EEC will also need to be deferred.
While in icing conditions, maintain a minimum of 70% N1 at or above 10,000 feet MSL and minimum of 55% N1 below 10,000 feet MSL on the affected engine.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ CCCV VLV INOP OPEN". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.chgdesc: Adds Not Applicable item per MMEL.

title.revision: NOT APPLICABLE

remarks.para: Two may be inoperative unless required by a maintenance program.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ VIBRATION IND - INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: For aircraft equipped with VIBROMETER AVM Signal conditioners and for aircraft equipped with ENDEVCO AVM Signal conditioners which have Boeing S/B 747-77-2083 Rev 1 (or production equivalent) or higher incorporated.
Dispatch in the reversionary (Broad Band) mode is allowed. Vibration Indication Systems in the reversionary (Broad Band) mode must be considered inoperative.

item.title: Thrust Reverser Systems and REV Unlock Indications

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated reverser is secured in the forward thrust position, and
On associated engine, both T/R Control and T/R Indication circuit breakers are opened and collared.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ REVERSER

numlitem.para: Thrust Reversers are deactivated and cannot be used. The REV amber indication may be displayed. Use Symmetrical reverse as required.

The thrust reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affected engines will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverse thrust operation.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ REVERSER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the associated Thrust Reverser:

warning.para: this deactivation procedure is mandated by faa airworthiness directive 2000-17-06 and faa airworthiness directive 2003-16-16; this procedure can not be changed unless directed by boeing, the faa and ups powerplant engineering.

DEACTIVATION OF THE THRUST REVERSER SYSTEM WILL BE PROPERLY ACCOMPLISHED WHEN ALL STEPS SHOWN IN THESE PROCEDURES ARE FOLLOWED. DEVIATIONS TO THESE PROCEDURES, OR CHANGING THE SYSTEM CONFIGURATION, MAY RESULT IN IMPROPER DEACTIVATION AND UNCOMMANDED DEPLOYMENT OF THE REVERSER.

numlitem.para: Open, collar, and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE identifiers to the P6 panel ENG START CONTROL circuit breaker and the following circuit breakers for the associated engine:
Engine 1: ENG 1 T/R IND and ENG 1 T/R CONT
Engine 2: ENG 2 T/R IND and ENG 2 T/R CONT
Engine 3: ENG 3 T/R IND and ENG 3 T/R CONT
Engine 4: ENG 4 T/R IND and ENG 4 T/R CONT
Open the fan cowl panels (Ref AMM 71-11-04/201).
Remove the two bolts securing the lockout plate over the lower CDU manual drive pad and remove the plate (two places).
Do the Thrust Reverser Electro-Mechanical Brake and Flexshaft - Adjustment/Test procedure (Ref AMM 78-34-07/501). Leave fan cowls open upon completion of test.
Stow the thrust reverser halves (Ref AMM 78-31-00/201).

(Optional procedure) Remove one, two or three red deactivation plates from the lower torque box of each reverser half. Install the plate(s) on the lock point(s) on each reverser half with bolts (two bolts per deactivation plate). It may be necessary to drive the CDUs or the angle gearboxes at the manual drive pads to align the holes in the brakes (if installed) must be manually released to drive the CDUs or angle gearboxes (Ref AMM 78-31-00/201).

note.para: The Lock points are marked with the stencil LOCK POINTS.

numlitem.para: At both CDUs, install the lockout plate with the square drive inserted into the manual drive pad. Tighten bolts to 24-27 pound-inches.
(FADEC) Verify that thrust reverser position feedback sensors (RVDTs) on both CDUs are properly installed and rigged as follows:
Apply ground test power to EEC.
Verify that thrust reverser position (T/RR, T/RL, Channels A and B) reads between -2% and +2% on the EICAS EPCS page.
If required, re-rig the RVDT (AMM 78-34-10/501).

caution.para: DO NOT DISCONNECT THE RVDT ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR FOR DISPATCH. A DISCONNECTED RVDT MAY RESULT IN UNCOMMANDED REDUCTION OF THRUST IN FLIGHT.

numlitem.para: Return the CDU brake release handles and, if installed, the elctro-mechanical brake release handles to the normal, brake engaged position (Ref AMM 78-31-00/201).
Close the fan cowl panels (Ref. AMM 71-11-04/201).

Remove collar, remove DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier, and close P6 panel ENG START CONTROL circuit breaker opened in step 1. The ENG_T/R IND and ENG_ T/R CONTR breakers associated with the deactivated thrust reverser must remain opened and collared for dispatch.
Damaged or broken drag links must be removed per AMM 78-31-15. Aluminum tape blocker doors shut.

item.title: Thrust Reverser Systems and REV Unlock Indications

remarks.para: Two may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Inoperative thrust reversers are on symmetrical engines only,
Associated reverser secured in the forward thrust position,
On associated engine, both T/R Control and T/R Indication circuit breakers are opened and collared,
Anti-skid and auto spoiler systems are operative, and
Repairs are made within three flight days.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ REVERSER

numlitem.para: Thrust Reversers are deactivated and cannot be used. The REV amber indication may be displayed. Use Symmetrical reverse as required.

The thrust reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affected engines will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverse thrust operation.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Anti-skid and auto spoiler systems are operative.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ REVERSERS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 78-31-1-1.
Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

remarks.para: May be inoperative extended or retracted.

note.para: Associated Reverse thrust is limited to idle when inoperative retracted.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
REV ___ INTERLOCK

numlitem.para: Reverse Thrust Lever Interlock Inoperative:
When selecting reverse thrust, pull all reverse levers up to the normal interlock position and apply reverse thrust as required when the operative interlocks release.

note.para: If interlock is inoperative extended (released), there will be no physical stop for that reverse thrust lever when it is pulled up to the interlock position. The EEC will still protect the engine by not letting reverse thrust increase above idle until the thrust reverser sleeves are sufficiently deployed.

numlitem.para: Reverse thrust limited to idle:

When selecting reverse thrust, pull all reverse levers up to the interlock position. When the reverse interlocks release, apply symmetrical reverse thrust as needed for stopping requirements. Full reverse thrust on three engines is available if conditions required it.

note.para: If interlock is inoperative retracted, it will not be physically possible to move the reverse thrust lever beyond reverse idle, even when the reverser sleeves are fully deployed.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ REVERSE THRUST LEVER INTERLOCK INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated reverser is secured in the forward thrust position, and
On associated engine, both T/R Control and T/R Indication circuit breakers are opened and collared.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ REVERSER
ENG ___ REV LIMTD
ENG ___ REV POS

numlitem.para: The Thrust Reverser is deactivated and cannot be used. The REV amber indication may be displayed. Use Symmetrical reverse as required.

The thrust reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affected engine will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverse thrust operation.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ REVERSER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 78-31-1-1.
Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

remarks.para: Two may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Inoperative thrust reversers are on symmetrical engines only,
Associated reversers are secured in the forward thrust position,
On associated engine, both T/R Control and T/R Indication circuit breakers are opened and collared,
Anti-skid and auto spoiler systems are operative, and
Repairs are made within three flight days.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ REVERSER
ENG ___ REV LIMTD
ENG ___ REV POS

numlitem.para: Thrust Reversers are deactivated and cannot be used. The REV amber indication may be displayed. Use Symmetrical reverse as required.

The thrust reverser deactivation will not affect control of engine idle speed during flight but the affected engines will stay in minimum idle on the ground. Therefore, EICAS message IDLE DISAGREE may be annunciated during landing when the unaffected engines are commanded to approach idle for reverse thrust operation.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Anti-skid and auto spoiler systems must be operative.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ REVERSERS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Accomplish Dispatch Maintenance Procedure 78-31-1-1.
Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided associated REV unlock indication (Amber) is operative.

note.para: Not required for an inoperative thrust reverser.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ REV POS IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

item.title: Engine Oil Filter Warning Indications – (Impending Bypass)

remarks.para: Two may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: It is verified that the malfunction is in the alerting system, and
Associated Master Chip Detector is checked for contaminants before each departure.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ OIL FILT

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ OIL FILTER IMPENDING BYPASS WARNING INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify the malfunction is in the alerting system by one of the following methods:
Use CMC input monitoring with the associated engine not running (a BIT set to one indicates the Oil Filter Differential Pressure Switch has failed):

note.para: If the advisory message ENG OIL FILT is displayed with the associated engine not running, the malfunction is in the alerting system.

numlitem.para: Perform the oil filter bypass warning system test (AMM 79-35-00/501).
Deactivate the associated Oil Filter Bypass Warning System as follows:
Open the P7 panel EIU L, EIU C and EIU R circuit breakers.
Disconnect, cap and stow electrical connector DS1583 (at the Engine Oil Filter Differential Pressure Switch, S1583).
Close the circuit breakers opened in step 2A above.

note.para: Advisory message ENG OIL FILT may remain displayed.

numlitem.para: Install a new scavenge oil filter (AMM 79-21-04/401) on the associated engine.
Prior to each departure, check that Master Chip Detector contamination is within limits (AMM 79-21-05/201).

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated oil tank filler cap is secured closed after each servicing.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ OIL FILTER IMPENDING BYPASS WARNING INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Verify oil tank filler cap is secured closed after servicing.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: It is verified before each departure that the oil tank is filled to the recommended capacity,
There is no evidence above normal oil consumption or leakage, and
Associated oil temperature and pressure indications are operative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ OIL QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Fill associated engine oil tank (AMM 12-13- 03/301).
Inspect engine exterior, including fan stream area, for evidence of oil leakage.
Check associated engine's records to ensure oil consumption is not "above normal."

note.para: Maintenance step 4 is not required provided the associated engine has been run in the last three hours and no maintenance involving the engine fuel and/or oil systems has been done since engine shutdown.

numlitem.para: For GE CF6-80C2 Engines, if General Electric Service Bulletin 72-648 has not been incorporated, prior to departure it is recommended that the associated engine oil tank is inspected for the presence of fuel as follows:

At each oil tank servicing and daily inspection, and following all engine ground runs associated with engine fuel or oil system maintenance, inspect engine oil tank to detect fuel contamination per 747-400 Maintenance Manual Subject 12-13-03. Presence of fuel in oil is not a dispatchable condition. If the presence of fuel is detected, accomplish Troubleshooting Procedure and Oil System Flushing Procedure per 747-400 Maintenance Manual Subjects 79-00-00 and 12-22-03. The following related Maintenance Manual Subjects can be referenced: 12-13-03/301 Engine - Oil Servicing 71-00-00/201 Power Plant - Maintenance Practices 71-00-44/101 Power Plant - Troubleshooting 72-00-00/601 Engine - Inspection/Check 79-00-00/101 Oil Distribution - Fault Isolation.

warning.para: WAIT A MINIMUM OF 5 MINUTES AFTER ENGINE SHUTDOWN BEFORE REMOVING THE OIL TANK FILLER CAP TO ALLOW TANK PRESSURE TO BLEED OFF. HOT OIL GUSHING FROM THE TANK COULD CAUSE SEVERE BURNS.

item.chgdesc: Adds Note in proviso for company necessity.
item.title: Engine Start Valves

remarks.para: One may be inoperative closed provided:

numlitem.para: Alternate starting procedures are established and used, and
Associated Start Valve Open Light is operative.

para.revision: If EICAS message "STARTER CUTOUT____ CAUTION" message appears then – NO TAKEOFF ALLOWED. Message can not be deferred.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
ENG ___ START VLV

numlitem.para: When ready for engine start:
Select Autostart Switch OFF.
Advise ground crew to open start valve.
Accomplish normal engine start procedure except when indicator shows 45-50% N2 advise ground crew to close start valve.
Select Autostart ON.

note.para: If inflight restart becomes necessary, starter assist will not be available. Ensure airspeed is sufficient for a windmilling start.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated START switch on the Engine Ignition and Start Control panel (P5): "ENG ___ START VALVE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

warning.para: DO NOT USE ENGINE NACELLE SERVICE INTERPHONE JACK ON ENGINE WHICH IS TO BE STARTED OR IS IN OPERATION. PERSONNEL COULD ENTER HAZARD AREA RESULTING IN SERIOUS INJURY OR LOSS OF LIFE.

caution.para: MANUAL OPENING OF THE START VALVE WITHOUT AIR PRESSURE IN START DUCT MAY DAMAGE VALVE.

numlitem.para: Establish communication with flight deck.
Insert a 3/8 inch square drive with a 36 inch (91 cm) extension through access port in thrust reverser latch access door. Engage square drive with valve override receptacle.
Upon command from the flight deck, open start valve by rotating the square drive 90° counterclockwise to the OPEN position.
After engine has started and upon command from the flight deck, close start valve by rotating square drive 90° clockwise to the CLOSED position.
Remove the square drive from the start valve override access port.

item.chgdesc: Adds Note in proviso for company necessity.
item.title: Starter Switch Systems

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided alternate start procedures are used.

para.revision: If EICAS message "STARTER CUTOUT____ CAUTION" message appears then – NO TAKEOFF ALLOWED. Message can not be deferred.

numlitem.para: Select Autostart Switch to OFF.
Perform engine start(s) by manual procedure with the following exceptions:
Manually pull and, if necessary, hold the start switch in the start position until N2 reaches 50%.
When N2 reaches 50%, manually push the engine Start Switch into the OFF position.
Select Autostart switch to ON if desired.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated START switch on the Engine Ignition and Start Control panel (P5): "AUTO CUTOUT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided Manual Start System is operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
AUTOSTART SYS ___
ENG ___ AUTOSTART

numlitem.para: For ground start, Autostart may be used on the unaffected engine(s). Manual start procedures must be used for the affected engine(s) and may be used for all engines.
Should an affected engine not start on the ground using manual procedures, perform a modified manual start procedure as follows:
Select Standby Ignition Switch to either STBY 1 or STBY 2.
Start engine(s) by manual procedures.
After engine start is confirmed, Select Standby Ignition Switch to NORM.
After all engines are started, select the Autostart switch to OFF.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated AUTOSTART switch: "AUTOSTART SYSTEM ___ INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided it is verified after engine start that the associated start valve is closed.

numlitem.para: During engine start, if EICAS caution message STARTER CUTOUT_ is displayed, comply with non-normal procedures.
If EICAS caution message STARTER CUTOUT_ is displayed after engine speed reaches 52% N2 , the start valve has failed to close. Maintenance action to replace or repair the start valve is required.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to Start Valve Open Light (P5): "START VALVE OPEN LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: Should an inoperative Start Valve Open Light remain illuminated after confirmation that the associated start valve is closed, the PRV may remain commanded closed (due to failure of a start valve closed limit switch). Under this condition it is necessary to comply with the PRV inoperative and secured closed provisions of MEL item 36-11-8-1 or 36-11-8-2.

textset.title: GENERAL
textset.para: This document contains guideline maintenance and operational procedures for dispatching 747-400's in non-standard configurations. It is not intended to replace existing Maintenance and/or Operations Manuals, but it is to be used by Line Maintenance and/or flying personnel as a ready reference to determine any procedures and/or limitations which may be imposed when invoking the provisions of the Minimum Equipment List.

Should disagreement with the procedures given herein arise, the Maintenance, Operations, Flight or other official manuals which pertain to the problems shall be considered more authoritative than these Dispatch Maintenance Procedures and shall be relied upon to provide the proper procedures.

textgrp.title: GENERAL NOTES
textgrp.para: This section contains illustrations and locations of missing items approved by the 747-400 Aircraft Flight Manual (AFM) Appendix Configuration Deviation List (CDL).

textgrp.title: GENERAL LIMITATIONS
textgrp.para: The associated limitations must be listed on a placard affixed in the cockpit in clear view of the Pilot-in-Command and other appropriate crew member(s).
Operation with those missing parts requiring a reduction of VMO /MMO is permitted only when the aircraft has the appropriate alternate VMO set prior to flight.
The Pilot-in-Command will be notified of each operation with a missing part(s) by listing the missing part(s) in the flight or dispatch release.
The operator will list in the aircraft Log an appropriate notation covering the missing part(s) on each flight.

If an additional part is lost in flight, the aircraft may not depart the airport at which it landed following this event until it again complies with CDL limitations. This, of course, does not preclude the issuance of a ferry permit to allow the aircraft to be flown to a point where the necessary repairs or replacements can be made.

No more than one part for any one sub-system may be missing unless specifically designated combinations are indicated herein. Unless otherwise specified herein, parts from different sub-systems may be missing.

textgrp.title: WEIGHT REDUCTIONS
textgrp.para: The performance decrements are cumulative. Where performance decrements are listed as negligible, no more than three negligible items may be missing without taking further decrement. For each missing item more than three, reduce the takeoff, landing and en route climb limits by 100 pounds. For items listed as not requiring any performance decrement, any accumulative number of items listed as not requiring any performance decrement may be missing without any further performance decrement.

textgrp.title: EN ROUTE FUEL MILEAGE EFFECTS
textgrp.para: The drag effects of many 747-400 CDL items are so small that en route fuel mileage changes are negligible. For items that have en route climb weight decrements listed, increase the flight planning fuel by 0.25% per 1000 lbs. of en route climb weight decrement to account for the en route drag increase.

cdlblk.title: Cabin Pressure Relief Valve Flapper Doors

remarks.para: One or both may be missing with negligible performance decrement.
Any number of louvers may be missing from the three assemblies in any combination provided performance limited weights are reduced by the following:
One may be missing provided performance limited weights are reduced by the following:

note.para: The exit louvers for the pack with the missing door must be in the full open position.

remarks.para: Any number of static dischargers at any location may be missing with no performance decrement when aircraft operations are not dependent upon use of ADF, LORAN or HF.

When aircraft operations are dependent upon use of ADF, LORAN or HF, up to 45 static dischargers may be missing without any performance decrement. A minimum of 23 static dischargers are required to be installed as follows:

numlitem.para: A minimum of 15 trailing type dischargers with 3 at any of the 6 outboard locations on each wing, 3 at any of the 5 outboard locations on each horizontal stabilizer and 3 at any of the 4 upper locations on the vertical stabilizer.
A minimum of 8 tip dischargers with 1 on each winglet tip (or wing tip on 747-400D), 2 on each horizontal stabilizer tip and 2 on the vertical stabilizer tip.

remarks.para: Any one seal from a pair may be missing with no performance decrement.

cdlblk.title: Trailing Edge Flap to Fuselage Seals

remarks.para: Any number may be missing or damaged provided performance limited weights are reduced by the following performance decrements for each missing or damaged item:

note.para: A missing seal is defined as the absence of an entire seal, or a seal that has sustained damage to both the upper and lower surfaces.
A damaged seal is defined as one which sustained damage to either the upper or lower surface, but does not allow airflow through both surfaces and allows leakage through the surfaces.
Takeoff Climb decrements are for Second Segment Climb limits.
* With a missing Fore-Flap seal, no additional Takeoff Climb Flaps 10 decrement is required for missing or damaged associated Mid-Flap and Aft-Flap seals.

remarks.para: Any number may be missing provided the performance limited weights are reduced by the following for each seal. A seal consists of multiple segments within a single spanwise location with any missing quantity.

cdlblk.title: OUTBOARD TRAILING EDGE FLAP END SEALS

remarks.para: Any number may be missing provided the performance limited weights are reduced by the following for each seal. A seal consists of multiple segments within a single spanwise location with any missing quantity.
One may be missing provided the following performance adjustments are applied:

numlitem.para: Takeoff performance (use Flaps 20 only):
Use weight limits and takeoff speeds associated with a 2% or greater speed increase.
As an alternative, the following adjustments conservatively account for a 2% speed increase:
Reduce Field Length limited weight by 30,000 lb (13,600 kg).
For airport pressure altitudes above 4000 ft., reduce Tire Speed limited weight by 57,000 lb (25,900 kg).
Increase takeoff speeds V1, VR and V2 by 4 knots.
Landing performance:
Reduce landing field length limit weight by 45,000 lb (20,412 kg).
Increase landing approach speed VREF by 6 knots.

note.para: Buffet onset will occur earlier than normal during maneuvering flight with flaps extended.

cdlblk.title: Nacelle Strut Access Doors (Includes Pylon Valve Access Doors)

remarks.para: For GE, the 14 doors listed below may be missing. The performance limited weights are reduced by the following for each affected strut:

numlitem.para: For GE:

remarks.para: Any number may be missing provided for each missing seal the performance limited weights are reduced by:
Any number may be missing. The performance decrement is negligible.
One set may be missing provided the performance limited weights are reduced by the following:

note.para: If any winglet fairing is damaged or missing, the affected winglet and all its fairings, except the leading edge wingtip fairing Part Number 188U0010 and the trailing edge wingtip fairing Part Number 118U0030, must be removed. The forward facing opening in the trailing edge wingtip fairing must be covered (e.g., speed tape).

remarks.para: One may be missing provided the performance limited weights are reduced by the following:

note.para: If a winglet is removed, the affected winglet fairings, except the leading edge wingtip fairing Part Number 118U0010 and the trailing edge wingtip fairing Part Number 118U0030, must be removed. The forward facing opening in the trailing edge wingtip fairing must be covered (e.g., speed tape).

remarks.para: Any number may be missing provided the performance limited weights are reduced by the following for each missing item:

cdlblk.title: Leading Edge Flap – Inboard Strut Seal

remarks.para: Two seals may be missing provided the performance limited weights are reduced by the following:
The aft center of gravity limit is reduced from 33% MAC to 29% MAC.

note.para: A flat plate seal must be placed on the fixed lower surface structure to ensure that the leading edge cavity is sealed when flaps are retracted.

cdlblk.title: Leading Edge Flap Folding Nose Inboard Strut Seal

remarks.para: One or both may be missing with no performance decrement or restriction.

cdlblk.title: Thrust Reverser Sleeve Actuator Access Panels

remarks.para: A maximum of sixteen (four per nacelle) in any combination may be missing provided performance limited weights are reduced by the following:

numlitem.para: For GE, one per reverser half on one engine (maximum of two total) may be missing provided the associated reverser is deactivated (refer to MEL Item 78-31-1-1) and performance limited weights are reduced by the following:
Additional Deferral Required – Thrust Reverser.
